title: ¡Primer meet-up R-Ladies Guayaquil!
description:
¡Comienza la iniciativa en la ciudad! ¡Bienvenid@s!
En esta primera reunión nos conoceremos y te diremos qué trae consigo esta maravillosa iniciativa. ¿Las mujeres participan en ciencias? ¿matemáticas? ¿tecnologías?, no sólo contestaremos estas preguntas; también explicaremos qué es R y cómo su uso es transversal en distintas áreas de aplicación.
Recuerda que todos los eventos son gratuitos.

¡Anímate a estar 15 minutos antes de la hora de inicio para el registro!

¡L@s esperamos!

title: Hierarchical Forecasting of Dengue Incidence in Sri Lanka
description:
Hello, R enthusiasts!!!
Dengue is the most rapidly growing mosquito-borne viral infection in the world. This talk presents a hierarchical approach for time series forecasting using R. This is joint work with Dr Thiyanga S. Talagala

> ? Speaker
Samudra Madushani, University of Sri Jayewardenepura, Sri Lanka
Check out his work at:
https://darecentre.org.au/portfolio_page/samudra-madushani/

> ? Who is this for
This introduction is appropriate for anyone with a general interest in R and data science.

>? Prerequisites
Prior knowledge in R programming language is recommended but not necessary.

> ?when
22 December, 2021 from 5.00 pm (Time Zone - GMT+5.30, India)

> ?where
We'll be live on Zoom.
Zoom link :

Time: Dec 22, 2021 05:00 PM India

Join Zoom Meeting
https://learn.zoom.us/j/69546828234?pwd=QTV1aG9Hdzd5bjY3dlAwQ1FrZHRNZz09

Meeting ID: 695 4682 8234
Passcode: WAK1Qv.D

> ?Agenda
- 10 Min: Meet & Greet | Networking
- 40 min: Workshop on "Hierarchical Forecasting of Dengue Incidence in Sri Lanka"
- 10 min: Discussion with the audience on questions/resources | More Networking | Wrap up

To ensure a safe, enjoyable, and friendly experience for everyone who participates, we follow the R-Ladies International Code of Conduct here: https://github.com/rladies/.github/blob/master/CODE_OF_CONDUCT.md

> ?event organizers
Thiyanga S. Talagala: https://thiyanga.netlify.app/ and
Priyanga D. Talagala: https://prital.netlify.app/

description:
Join us in celebrating the small and big events of 2021!

Who: R Ladies and friends
What: Networking and socializing over drinks and snacks (pay your own way). There will be door prizes kindly provided by Amazon Web Services.
Where: Ship Inn, Corner of Stanley & Sidon St, South Bank 4101. See map to the right.
When: Tuesday December 21st, 5:30-7:00pm

We look forward to seeing you there.

R-Ladies Brisbane

********************************************************************************
Photos, Films and all other media/recordings: Photographs and/or video/other media will be taken at events held by this community. By taking part in an R-Ladies Brisbane event you grant the community organisers full rights to use the images resulting from the photography/video filming/media, and any reproductions or adaptations of the images for publicity, fund-raising or other purposes to help achieve the community’s aims. This might include (but is not limited to), the right to use them in their printed and online publicity, social media, press releases and funding applications. If you do not wish to be recorded in these media please inform a community organiser.

Code of Conduct: R-Ladies Brisbane is dedicated to providing a welcoming and harassment-free event experience for everyone, regardless of gender, gender identity and expression, age, sexual orientation, disability, physical appearance, body size, race, ethnicity, or religion (or lack thereof). We do not tolerate harassment of event participants in any form, for any event venue, including talks, workshops, parties, Twitter and other online media.

Community Policies: Please note, cis men are welcome to join our meetups when they come as a guest of a woman participant or they bring a woman with them. We highly encourage speakers and teachers at R-Ladies Brisbane events to be of minority genders.

Find us on Twitter @rladiesbrisbane for more information on news, presentations and code!

title: Tech Holiday Party!
description:
Help R-Ladies represent at the best Tech Holiday party in town! I know we've been a bit off the grid - what better way to reconnect than over tech chat and fun! This will replace our regular monthly meetup for December. NOTE: this is an in-person event at CoverMyMeds downtown. For more information and to register to attend please visit this site.

You must register for this event. Please note vaccine requirements set forth by CoverMyMeds that MUST be complied with in order to attend.

title: R Essencial
description:
SOBRE O CURSO

Uma introdução ao R, mas nem tanto!

Sabe aquele momento que a gente olha para trás e pensa "Se eu soubesse disso antes....". Pois é! No encontro R essencial vamos tirar um tempinho para entender aspectos que vão ajudar sua vida de usuária autodidata! Vamos entender a estrutura do Rstudio e suas funcionalidades, vamos ver formas de se organizar no R (análises sem bagunça!), como encontrar o pacote para seu problema, vamos aprender onde encontrar e como pedir ajuda e conhecer alguns canais para acompanhar a comunidade R e ficar atualizada com suas
novidades.

O link para inscrição está na bio do nosso instagram @rladiesbsb

CÓDIGO DE CONDUTA

Este capítulo da organização R-Ladies tem como objetivo proporcionar uma experiência livre de assédio para todos. Não toleramos nenhuma forma de assédio aos participantes. Visamos criar um espaço seguro para minorias sociais.

Você pode ler o código de conduta disponibilizado na página do R-Ladies Goiânia (https://www.rladiesgyn.com/c%C3%B3pia-contato)

title: #30DayMapChallenge: The good, the bad and the ugly of crafting maps with ggplot2
description:
About the instructor:
Dr. Cédric Scherer is a graduated computational ecologist with a passion for design. In 2020, he combined his expertise in analyzing and visualizing large data sets in R with his passion to become an freelance data visualization specialist. Cédric has created visualizations across all disciplines, purposes, and styles and regularly teaches data visualization principles, R, and ggplot2. Due to regular participation in social data challenges, he is now well known for complex and visually appealing figures, entirely made with ggplot2, that look as if they have been created with a vector design tool.

Abstract
The #30DayMapChallenge is a daily mapping challenge happening during November aimed at the spatial data visualization community. In this seminar, Cédric Scherer gives insights in his learnings from his two participations in the first and third #30DayMapChallenge in 2019 and 2021, discussing the benefits and limitations of crafting maps in R with ggplot2 as well as learnings with regard to spatial data sources, spatial data handling in R and map design.

title: Virtual Data Science Learnathon: From Raw Data to Deployment Online!
description:
Abbiamo il piacere di annunciare un nuovo meetup in collaborazione con KNIME (knime.com).

Il (Virtual) Learnathon è un evento a metà tra un hackathon e un workshop: è un workshop perché si studia il processo di data science. Ma è anche un hackathon, perché si lavora in gruppi, attraverso esercizi, per mettere a punto la soluzione.

Durante il Learnathon sperimenteremo l’intero ciclo di un progetto di data science dall’accesso ai dati fino al deployment, passando per un paio di algoritmi di Machine Learning.

Lo strumento che utilizzeremo è KNIME Analytics Platform (https://www.knime.com/knime-analytics-platform).
KNIME Analytics Platform è open ed offre anche un ambiente di sviluppo integrato per R, Python, SQL e Spark.

Dopo un’introduzione iniziale ci divideremo in gruppi. Ciascun gruppo si focalizzerà su uno dei tre aspetti del ciclo del progetto:

Gruppo 1: ETL. Focus sull’accesso ai dati e sulla data preparation.
Gruppo 2: Machine Learning. Che modello dovrei usare? Con quali parametri?
Gruppo 3: Deployment. Dopo aver trovato un buon modello, cosa succede? Focus sulla fase di deployment.

Per via della situazione attuale non sarà possibile incontrarsi di persona. In alternative, tutti potranno scaricare il materiale del workshop qui:
https://tinyurl.com/RLadies-KNIME-2021 (slides)
https://download.knime.org/evangelism/Learnathon/From_Raw_Data_To_Deployment.knar (workflows)

Forniremo ai partecipanti i data sets, i workflow per cominciare e le soluzioni degli esercizi.
Data scientists esperti saranno a disposizione per consigli e informazioni.

Per partecipare è necessario portare il proprio laptop con KNIME Analytics Platform preinstallata e il materiale del workshop.

Per installare KNIME Analytics Platform (https://www.knime.com/downloads), seguite le istruzioni in questi video:
- Windows (https://youtu.be/yeHblDxakLk)
- Mac (https://youtu.be/1jvRWryJ220)
- Linux (https://youtu.be/wibggQYr4ZA)

Infine, se si desidera arrivare più preparati sullo strumento, è possibile seguire il corso gratuito in modalità e-learning: https://www.knime.com/knime-introductory-course

Dopo un’introduzione su Zoom mostreremo come spostarci su Gather (https://gather.town/events/to14mt18JftdcgyYOt7M) per dividerci in gruppi e comunicare informalmente su una mappa interattiva. E’ raccomandato usare Google Chrome una volta su Gather.

• 18:00 : Presentazione di Benvenuto da parte delle R Ladies (Zoom)
• 18:05 : Introduzione a KNIME Analytics Platform (Zoom)
• 18:25 : Presentazione del workshop (Zoom)
• 18:45 : Let’s work & learn! (Gather)
• 19:45 : Networking e Fine Evento (Gather)

Il Learnathon è un evento gratuito aperto a tutti.
Vi aspettiamo!

title: End-of-Year Celebration for Women and Gender Minorities
description:
[Please note: At the request of members of our community for an R-Ladies space exclusively for minority genders, this event is limited to those who identify as such (including but not limited to women, trans men, non-binary, and gender nonconforming individuals). Male allies have been great supporters of our chapter and the R-Ladies mission to promote gender diversity in the R Community -- for which we are grateful! -- and we believe the best way male allies can support us this month is by honoring the need for and benefit of such a space.]

Happy Holidays! To close out 2021, we are thrilled to host a virtual version of our annual end-of-year celebration and social! We'll utilize breakout rooms to allow participants to connect (or re-connect) with other members of our community in smaller groups.

*IMPORTANT* To RSVP for this event, you must complete and submit this Google form: https://forms.gle/3Rh6sukM2ngjfakM7
While you may RSVP via Meetup to let others know you plant to attend, Zoom link information will only be shared via email with those who register through the form.

Agenda:
7-7:10: Welcome and R-Ladies NYC Announcements
7:10-8:30: Breakout room chats (3-5 people, and we'll provide some topics to inspire conversation!)

title: RLadies Reading and the Tidyverse Universe
description:
Last Meetup of the year! Let's discuss a little bit of Tidyverse and get to know each other a little more!

Let's also think about when to meet in person before Christmas :)

title: R-Ladies SB x Central Coast Python: Data Science with R & Python
description:
Mark you calendars for a first-of-its-kind R-Ladies SB x Central Coast Python Meetup on December 15th!

Python can be a powerful alternative/complementary language to R, and while we here at R-Ladies are certainly partial to the latter, adding another language to our data science toolkit is something we are always excited for.

We have collaborated with Central Coast Python to bring you an R to Python (and vice versa) translation workshop, where we will learn to wrangle and visualize the same dataset using both languages.

This event is open to R/Python enthusiasts of all skill levels!

You may choose to follow along on our screens or download the required software and packages to code along on your own machines. If you do not already have R and Python installed, please be sure to do so before the event on December 15th. Find our installation instructions for R/RStudio, Python/Anaconda, and required packages on the event's GitHub README: https://github.com/samanthacsik/RLadiesSB-RvsPython

We will be available to help troubleshoot any setup issues on 12/07 from 5:30-6:30pm via Zoom: https://ucsb.zoom.us/j/81620992244?pwd=d2ZQTCtwZVZvU3Q4M25FN1hIM1Fxdz09.

This will be a hybrid in-person/remote event. We are excited to begin meeting/networking with our communities once again, but understand that not everyone may be comfortable attending events in person still. We will do our best to answer questions for those attending virtually, but please understand that we may be slow to respond as we navigate our first hybrid event.

PLEASE NOTE: Masks are required for in-person attendance and vaccination status will be verified at the door.

DIRECTIONS: This event will be held at the National Center for Ecological Analysis and Synthesis (NCEAS) at 1021 Anacapa St. Our offices conveniently sit at SB city lot #8. The first 75min of parking are free and $1.50 per hour after that. Street parking is also available on the surrounding streets. Please enter the first floor office space through the side door that faces the parking lot (located on the left side of the building, if your back is to Anacapa St.).

REMOTE ATTENDEES: Please join the event via Zoom https://ucsb.zoom.us/j/82671745133

Banner Image Source: https://towardsdatascience.com/is-python-faster-than-r-db06c5be5ce8

venues.name: National Center for Ecological Analysis and Synthesis

title: RLadies-Boulder #21: Ugly Plot Contest with Palmer Penguins!!
description:
It's that time of year again...the time for ugly sweaters and ugly plots! Join us Dec 14th on Zoom to create and share your most hideous plots creations. Participants are free to prepare unsightly figures ahead of time or during the meeting. Folks are also free to use their own data or to use this year's adorable (and well curated!) theme data set: Palmer Penguins! Who doesn't want to create unreadable line plots for these cute little guys? (You can install it as a package for easy plot abominations:  ).

Come join in the virtual fun! The victor gets bragging rights for a whole calendar year.

ZOOM PASSWORD WILL BE POSTED IN MEET-UP DISCUSSION DAY OF. (We promise)

title: [ONLINE] #tidytuesday Work Group
description:
Join fellow R-Ladies in exploring a #tidytuesday data set! For those craving human connection and some practice flexing your data science skills, this is the event for you! We will hold our event via Zoom, where you can meet other R-ladies, improve your R skills, and build your data science portfolio. This event is for people at all levels of R (beginner through advanced).

This will be the second part of a multipart TidyTuesday event where we will be looking at a local (!) urban heat mapping dataset brought to us by collaborators at the Museum of Life and Science (https://www.lifeandscience.org/) and the State Climate Office of NC (https://climate.ncsu.edu/). These data were collected using PocketLab temperature sensors (https://www.thepocketlab.com/store/pocketlab-weather?hsLang=en) as folks walked around Durham and Raleigh this past summer (#walkingForScience). You can read hear more about this project in this WUNC feature here (https://www.wunc.org/race-demographics/2021-08-11/urban-heat-mapping-project-durham-race-policies-climate-google).

Agenda (all times in ET):
6:30 - 6:45 pm Meet & Greet
6:45 - 7:45 pm #tidytuesday
7:45 - 8:00 pm Discussion

What is #tidytuesday?
#TidyTuesday is a weekly social data project created by the R4DS online learning community that is focused on using tidyverse packages. A new data set and accompanying article featuring an interesting plot is released on Github every Monday. The goal is to generate a copy of the original plot or create your own original approach!

For more information on #tidytuesday, check out this blog post (https://bit.ly/2HqEsdt) and the main repository page (https://github.com/rfordatascience/tidytuesday).

Who is this for?
New and experienced R users alike! Let's learn together! All are welcome, including R-Ladies RTP members and R-Ladies from around the world.

What should I bring?
You'll need a computer with videoconferencing capabilities and R. Serve yourself a beverage and a snack to fuel your evening!

Where will it take place?
**Please join us online via Zoom.** A link to join will be provided when you RSVP.

All events are intended for women as leaders, mentors, members, and attendees. We are emphatically queer and trans friendly. Men are welcomed to attend *as guests* and must be accompanied by the R-Lady who invited them. This group was created so those who identify as women have a comfortable place to learn. If you would like to attend and feel excluded, please introduce yourself to an organizer.

title: Taylor y Sailor: diagramas para comparar simulaciones frente a las observaciones
description:
Kaixo R-Ladies!

Después del parón de los últimos meses debido a la pandemia, ¡vuelve R-Ladies Bilbao con un nuevo evento!

En esta ocasión vamos a aprender a utilizar las herramientas de validación Taylor y Sailor para comparar diferentes simulaciones frente a las observaciones de la mano de Sheila Carreño.

Detalles:
Título: "Taylor y Sailor: diagramas para comparar diferentes simulaciones frente a las observaciones"
Fecha: Martes, 14 de diciembre
Hora: 18:00
Lugar: Wikitoki, Plaza La Cantera, 5-2º, Bilbao

Con el objetivo de controlar el aforo, os animamos a enviarnos un email si tenéis intención de asistir.

Qué hay que traer:
- Portátil
- R instalado (https://cloud.r-project.org/)
- RStudio instalado (https://rstudio.com/products/rstudio/download/)

Sobre Sheila Carreño-Madinabeitia (http://www.ehu.eus/eolo/sheila.html):

Sheila es profesora del departamento de Matemáticas en la Facultad de Farmacia de la UPV-EHU en Vitoria-Gasteiz. Anteriormente ha trabajado durante 10 años como investigadora en el área de meteorología del centro tecnológico Tecnalia.

Sheila es matemática de formación, tiene un máster en estadística y recientemente se ha doctorado en el programa de Física de la UPV-EHU. Su investigación se centra en el campo de la predicción meteorologíca y las energías renovables. Junto con el grupo de investigación EOLO ha desarrollado la herramienta de validación Sailor que nos presenta en este taller.

title: R-Ladies Baltimore -- Using Git and Github in RStudio (Virtual)
description:
R-Ladies Baltimore (Bmore) is the local Baltimore chapter for the larger R-Ladies global organization (rladies.org) to promote gender diversity in the R community.

The next event is Tuesday October 19, 2021 from 3-4:30pm (virtual meetup on Zoom). We will have an exciting presentation from Lisa Lendway (@lisalendway, https://lisalendway.netlify.app), Professor of statistics and data science at Macalester College and R Studio certified instructor of tidyverse. She will be talking about using Git and Github in RStudio in a hands-on session.

WHO is this for?
- If you are new to git/github & want to learn a cool thing you can do in git/github
- If you are a know git/github, but want to learn how to use it within RStudio IDE

*If any/all of this is true, this event might be for you!*

AGENDA
3:00–3:15pm Who we are | Announcements | What's next
3:15–4pm Presentation: Using git and GitHub: a hands on tutorial
4–4:30pm Networking -- Any more Qs?

Details on the location:
The Zoom information will be sent to those who RSVP the week before the event.

FAQ:
Q: Are men welcome to attend R-Ladies events?
A: Yes, men are welcome at this event. Our mission is to encourage more women and non-binary individuals to get involved in the R community. However, we ask that cis men come as guests of women and gender minorities to our events to promote a sense support and encouragement for women and gender minorities in the R community. Please help us by spreading the word about R-Ladies. Please also take the time to review our code of conduct before you attend: https://github.com/rladies/starter-kit/wiki/Code-of-Conduct

The term "women and gender minorities" is inclusive of individuals who identify as female (trans and cis), trans-men, non-binary, genderqueer, genderfluid, agender, intersex, and all minority genders).

Important to know:
- If this is your first R-Ladies event, please take a moment to review our R-Ladies Global code of conduct: https://github.com/rladies/starter-kit/wiki/Code-of-Conduct

Finally, for more information:
email: bmore@rladies.org
twitter: @RLadiesBmore
facebook: https://www.facebook.com/RLadiesBmore/
meetup: https://www.meetup.com/rladies-baltimore/

title: Intro to Bayesian Statistics with Alex Posekany
description:
We are excited to announce the December 2021 Meetup with Alexandra Posekany, who will give us an introduction into Bayesian Statistics.

The talk will walk us through the basics of the Bayesian paradigm to statistical analysis and give us an overview on employed methods.

Alex is a part-time assistant professor of computational statistics at TU Vienna and a full time mathematics and data science high-school teacher. As a teacher she has been a pioneer in bringing data science to the skill set of her students already from the school years, while as a researcher she has developed state of the art methods which are used in the field.
 We are happy to have her join us!

!!! Please note the change of time from evening to lunch time.

See you soon online!

Your R-Ladies Vienna Organizing Team

title: All you need is love...and R
description:
Michela Cameletti from the University of Bergamo talks about academic (teaching and research) activities for which R is used.

Michela Cameletti is an Associate Professor in Statistics at the Department of Economics, University of Bergamo. Previously, from 2008 to 2018, she was Assistant Professor in Statistics at University of Bergamo. In 2001 she graduated in Statistics, Demography and Social Sciences (University of Milan-Bicocca, Italy) and obtained in 2007 her PhD in Statistics from the same University. In 2007 she was research fellow at the Statistical and Applied Mathematical Sciences Institute (NC, USA), in 2011 visiting researcher at NTNU University (Trondheim, Norway), and in 2012 honorary research fellow at the MRC Centre for Environment and Health Department of Epidemiology and Biostatistics, Imperial College London (UK). She leaded the local unity of Bergamo for 2 national projects funded by MIUR (PRIN2015 “Environmental processes and human activities: capturing their interactions via statistical methods" and FIRB 2012 “Statistical modeling of environmental phenomena: pollution, meteorology, health and their interactions”).

https://twitter.com/micameletti

title: Why-R Conference 2021: Women in Data Science Panel
description:
Join R-Ladies Freiburg at this year's Why R conference! The conference will be streamed online, accessible from anywhere, and free for participants. In addition to many great talks on a variety of topics, R-Ladies Freiburg co-organizer Kyla McConnell will be speaking on the Women in Data Science panel!

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=IT5A4KhaMpM&list=PLKMUlj_pGn_kE7lNSCATqXcl2b7VQs3bk&index=1

"During the Women in Data Science discussion panel, panelists will describe their career paths in data science, machine learning, artificial intelligence and related fields. As the panelists have also contributed significantly to our community, they will share their experiences on organizing local data science groups and effective networking. The panel will start with the award ceremony of the fourth edition of the Why R? Supporting Grant for Women in Data Science."

More information about the conference here: https://2021.whyr.pl
And all talks on the Why R Youtube page: https://www.youtube.com/c/WhyRFoundationVideos

title: Git, GitHub, and RStudio
description:
How to use Git within RStudio? We'll learn about the setup, Git vocabulary, and we'll create a short version history locally and online.

To get the most of this short workshop, come with your computer with RStudio and Git installed.

Check out the installation instructions (https://git-scm.com), then create an account at GitHub. Next you will need to create an SSH key (by following the instructions at https://happygitwithr.com/ssh-keys.html#create-an-ssh-key-pair and https://happygitwithr.com/ssh-keys.html#provide-public-key-to-github). NB: choose one of the options, not all!

Reach out to R-Ladies on Slack if you get stuck!

Your work will purr when you can collaborate on Git!

title: R/Pharma Recap
description:
R-Ladies Seattle shares what they learned and liked about R/Pharma 2021!

R/Pharma is a relatively small, scientifically & industry oriented, collegial conference focused on the use of R in the development of pharmaceuticals. The 2021 Conference ran Nov. 2-4th, with workshops the week before. Learn more about the conference here: https://rinpharma.com/event/rinpharma2021/

Join us to learn what we learned!

title: Building Packages at Work
description:
This holiday season, consider treating your coworkers (and yourself!) to an R package - the gift that keeps on giving!

A series of short presentations by Alison Moss, Jess Streeter and Jake Riley on the topic of R package development and maintenance in the workplace.

1)
Alison Moss presents: dataVisEasy - seamless integration of metadata and data for easy and accurate visualizations

After getting tired of running similar lines of code over and over again to make minor adjustments to heatmaps and data visualizations, I accidentally found myself writing several functions to make all that tweaking easier, eventually turning into it into a package. Now seamlessly integrating metadata into data visualizations is nice and easy and all those minor tweaks your boss asks for don’t have to be an extra source of stress.

Alison just recently graduated with her PhD from Thomas Jefferson University and is now working at Rajant Health Inc as a Computational Biologist. She absolutely loves coding in R and gets way too much enjoyment out of writing and debugging functions to make data analysis and visualizations easy and consistent.

2)
Jess Streeter presents: Nerdify your life

Learn about Spring Health's internal package, Nerdify, and how it has streamlined several internal processes across our growing data team.

Jess is a Senior Data Scientist at Spring Health. She has spent her entire career working on issues around mental health. When she's not coding away, she enjoys spending time with her family, drinking good beer, and training Jiu Jitsu.

3)
Jake Riley presents: rocqi - simplifying workflows & reducing technical debt

Learn about one of CHOP’s internal R packages, rocqi. We built this package to improve the process for accessing, formatting, and visualizing data. Categories include quick and easy database connections, ggplot themes, Rmd/dashboard templates, internal datasets, and many helper functions for presenting data to stakeholders. In this talk I’ll discuss the types of solutions we chose to tackle and how package development has made us all better programmers.

Jake is a Senior Data Analyst at the Children’s Hospital of Philadelphia. He works with the Analytics Architecture team to provide centralized solutions for a large team of analysts. His work with rocqi has inspired the development of other R packages including: simplecolors (CRAN), shinyobjects (CRAN), headliner (beta), whereiation (dev), and codereviewr (dev). https://github.com/rjake

Please note: We are limited to 100 attendees, so make sure to join on time if you'd like to participate in the live event. The workshop will be recorded and shared on our YouTube channel shortly after the meetup event.

title: Level up your ggplot: How do I add labels, arrows and other annotations?
description:
In this workshop, we'll discuss different ways of annotating your plots. For example, we might want to highlight data points that defy the overall trend, or explain what a line or colour within the graph means, or comment on and interpret the plot.
We'll first show you how to manually draw arrows and insert text boxes in your graph. Then, we'll explore the annotation geoms the {ggforce} package offers and recreate the commented Bechdel test graph you can see at the top of the page.

---
It's important to us to ensure that R-Ladies Freiburg events are a safe space for gender minorities and especially those who are just starting out with R. All are welcome at this meetup but we specifically ask cisgender men to take a passive role in this meetup and hold comments/ questions until after others have had the chance to ask. Thank you for your support!

title: Prechristmas Drinks
description:
Dear R-Ladies

It was so wonderful to meet many of you at our first meetup this Monday!

We tought it would be nice to have a little informal get together in December so we don‘t have to wait two months until we meet again.

There will be no agenda, the plan is to get hot drinks at the Christmas market at Landesmuesum.

We are looking forward to it!

Best,
Seraphina&Luisa

title: Model tasting with Tidymodels
description:
Hi everyone!

We are back in December with a virtual talk/workshop called "Model tasting with Tidymodels" by Maria Dermit, on Thursday 2nd of December at 18:30!
You can install the tidymodels framework packages before the event (install.packages("tidymodels"))

Note that you will receive the password to connect to the event approximately one hour before the session starts.

--------

About the speaker:

Maria is a computational biologist at Bitbio (Cambridge, UK). She is a former postdoctoral research scientist in biomedicine at Queen Mary University of London. She uses data science to extract valuable information from big datasets produced in the laboratory, with the aim to advance cancer research. Starting from a biochemistry and bioinformatics background, Maria became passionate about mentoring, promoting the power of R, and using it in creative ways to connect with others.

--------

title: Introducción a R Markdown ' Informes ' Reportes y Dashboards
description:
Estimada comunidad,

En este taller se cubrirán los aspecto básico de la sintaxis Markdown, para luego unir texto con el lenguaje de programación R, generando informes y reportes que publicaremos en RPubs.

Para este taller tendrán que tener instalado en sus equipos R4.1.1, RMarkdown y tinytex para poder generar los archivos html, pdf y Microsoft Word.

Los esperamos en el taller !!!
El link de ingreso lo enviaremos a las personas registradas. :)

Fecha: 30 de Noviembre de 2021
Hora: 19:00 PM UTC-4

title: R-Ladies Irvine: Networking, Announcements, Q&A!
description:
# Schedule
Tuesday, November 30, 7:00-8:00 pm (Pacific)
7:00 - Welcome and Networking
7:40 - Announcements
7:50 - Q&A
8:00 - Meeting Adjourned

# Networking! Our last meeting was joint with SoCal R so we didn't have networking. Join us Tuesday, November 30, for a special networking, followed by announcements and your questions!

title: Data visualization in R
description:
About the speaker:
Anna Skrzydło (https://www.linkedin.com/in/anna-skrzydlo/) is an experienced programmer and IT project manager. She is currently working at the Polish tech company Appsilon (https://appsilon.com/) that provides Shiny solutions for enterprise applications.

About the talk:
Anna loves coding and has a passion for data visualization! In her talk, Anna will cover the theory and practice of building great data visualisations in R. We will learn some wondeRful tricks and actually get our hands dirty with some coding tasks.

Your plots will never be the same!

title: [2021 Nov] Azure Machine Learning的眉角
description:
[Agenda]
• 19:30 ~ 19:40 (10 mins) 入場
• 19:40 ~ 20:40 (60 mins) 主議程 : Azure Machine Learning 的眉角 @Benjamin
• 20:40 ~ 自由交流時間

[Talk Information]
• 完全沒有 R 的內容，除了自介。
• 這是自己為了幫人上課，自己自修摸索出來的 Azure Machine Learning 心得。
• 聽完之後，大概會知道一些眉角，或許對未來需要用到 AzureML 的時候，會有一點點幫助。

[Speaker Information]
• Benjamin Chen
Taiwan R User Group的成員，但為了生活，漸漸變成 python 的形狀。雖然公司給面子，給了資料科學家的頭銜，但實際上比較像救火隊，真實的情況也只是一個試著用程式解決問題的平凡人。在各種因緣際會之下，不知不覺學到一些技能，在到達財務自由之前，大概就是會一直這樣一生懸命地，一邊學習一邊前進…

[Host Information]
• Kristen Chan： 聯絡講者
• Ning：活動場地、活動主持人

[地點] 線上 -- Google Meet

[Event Tags]
#RladiesTaipei
#AzureMachineLearning

R-Ladies Taipei 第一場線上分享會!!

title: R-Ladies Baltimore -- Panel Discussion on Careers in Data Science (Virtual)
description:
R-Ladies Baltimore (Bmore) is the local Baltimore chapter for the larger R-Ladies global organization (rladies.org) to promote gender diversity in the R community.

The next event is Monday November 29, 2021 from 7-8pm ET (virtual meetup on Zoom). We will have a set of brilliant panelists who will talk about careers in data science:

- Stefanie Nickels (https://scholar.google.com/citations?user=zi1f0qUAAAAJ&hl=en), Data Scientist at Verily Life Sciences
- Anna Quaglieri (@annaquagli, ) Data Scientist at Mass Dynamics and Co-organiser of R-Ladies Melbourne

WHO is this for?
- If you are curious to know more about career opportunity in data science
- If you want to hear from some really fantastic speakers on a bit about their pursuits data science

*If any/all of this is true, this event might be for you!*

AGENDA
7:00–7:05pm Who we are | Announcements | What's next
7:05–7:50pm Presentation: Career Panel Discussion in Data Science
7:50–8:00pm Networking -- Any more Qs?

Details on the location:
The Zoom information will be sent to those who RSVP the week before the event.

FAQ:
Q: Are men welcome to attend R-Ladies events?
A: Yes, men are welcome at this event. Our mission is to encourage more women and non-binary individuals to get involved in the R community. However, we ask that cis men come as guests of women and gender minorities to our events to promote a sense support and encouragement for women and gender minorities in the R community. Please help us by spreading the word about R-Ladies. Please also take the time to review our code of conduct before you attend: https://github.com/rladies/starter-kit/wiki/Code-of-Conduct

The term "women and gender minorities" is inclusive of individuals who identify as female (trans and cis), trans-men, non-binary, genderqueer, genderfluid, agender, intersex, and all minority genders).

Important to know:
- If this is your first R-Ladies event, please take a moment to review our R-Ladies Global code of conduct: https://github.com/rladies/starter-kit/wiki/Code-of-Conduct

Finally, for more information:
email: bmore@rladies.org
twitter: @RLadiesBmore
facebook: https://www.facebook.com/RLadiesBmore/
meetup: https://www.meetup.com/rladies-baltimore/

title: Geospatial Visualization in R
description:
Our guest on this webinar is Rami Krispin. He is a Data scientist, developer, and an author. He is passionate about R for statistical analysis, time series analysis, forecasting, Machine Learning.

In this webinar, Rami will introduce us to reading, exploring, manipulating, and visualizing spatial data objects using the following packages – rnaturalearth, sf, mapview, tmap, ggplot2 and viridis. We would explore the covid19 package dataset, a package created by our speaker as well to create outstanding visual maps to represent spatial data for analysis in R.

title: Introduction to creating maps with leaflet
description:
We warmly welcome you to our last virtual meetup of the year on "Introduction to creating maps with leaflet" by Dr. Laurie Baker.

📆 November 27th, 2021 3 PM - 5 PM (GMT+3)

Our trainer➡️ Dr. Laurie is a disease ecologist and marine biologist by training. She earned her BSc and MSc in marine biology at the University of St. Andrews and Dalhousie University (MSc) respectively, and her doctorate in epidemiology at the University of Glasgow. Dr. Laurie is a certified RStudio Instructor with a keen interest in programming, data science, and the use of novel data sources in research. The core of her research focuses on spatial and temporal patterns in human and biological systems including disease spread, animal movement, and fisheries management.

We will share the zoom link and event details with the registered participants.

All are welcome!

For any queries or comments, contact us on;

Email address: nairobi@rladies.org

LinkedIn: https://www.linkedin.com/in/r-ladies-nairobi-2572841b3/

Twitter: @RLadiesNairobi

title: Forecasting using R
description:
Mariana Cubero demonstrates how to present workflow, query from a dataset, prepare and the use of different scripts.

Mariana is a data scientist in Walmart Central America, where they develop multiple data projects to answer business questions and to create value from the data. Prior to this she was an assistant researcher working in the Big Data and Data Science area at the Costa Rica National Center for High Tech. The National Center for High Technology is a multidisciplinary and inter-sectoral instance, whose scientific research focuses on materials science and engineering, biotechnology, advanced computing, environmental management, and in the areas of science, culture, and society. She got her degree in Statistics in Universidad de Costa Rica and she is currently pursuing her Master’s degree in statistics. Her work is focused on multiple applications of data from such as forecasting and data visualization.
https://twitter.com/MarianaCubero1

title: Análise de Dados com Redes em R
description:
Heey, tudo bem?

Estamos muito felizes com a sua participação.

Aproveite o curso. Aproveite essa oportunidade! Este evento foi pensado com muito carinho para você.

O que você vai aprender?

O curso Análise de Dados com Redes em R busca transmitir conhecimentos teórico-práticos sobre as etapas que envolvem a inferência e interpretação de redes a partir de dados heterogêneos na área de saúde, o que engloba desde dados biomoleculares até dados clínicos. A parte teórica envolverá medidas de correlação e dependência estatística, algoritmos de inferência de rede e avaliação de modelos gráficos. A parte prática se dará através de pacotes da linguagem de programação R exemplificando várias técnicas de inferência de redes.

Quais pacotes vão ser utilizados ?

library(igraph)

Sobre o Projeto Enigma

O projeto Enigma busca tornar visível o papel feminino na área da computação, resgatando as contribuições significativas de algumas mulheres de uma forma diferenciada, que provoque o pensamento do fruidor. Não pretende-se reproduzir as visibilidades que estas personagens já têm, mas fazer uma provocação, desacomodando o pensamento para que as invisibilidades, que ainda persistem, se tornem visíveis. As doações serão voltadas a reforma de artigos doados ao projeto como computadores, teclados e entre outros objetos do universo computacional.

Para saber mais sobre este projeto lindo acesse https://www.ufrgs.br/enigma/

E aí? Topa?

Link de inscrição: https://www.sympla.com.br/produtor/cursosonline

Dúvidas frequentes:

CERTIFICADOS! - O certificado de 4h do evento será enviado para o seu e-mail. Caso você não receba ao final do evento, escreva para goiania@rladies.org.

MATERIAIS! - Os materiais utilizados no nosso curso (apresentação, scripts) serão disponibilizados através do nosso GitHub .

Dicas importantes para melhor aproveitamento do evento

(1°) Procure conectar o seu computador no cabo de rede, evitando instabilidades na transmissão;
(2°) Pré-configure a sua câmera e microfone antes de entrar no evento pois será útil para as interações com a professora em caso de dúvidas!
(3°) Prepare seu ambiente, aquela caneca de café, garrafa de água e os fones de ouvido, melhores companheiros para se concentrar e mergulhar de cabeça nessa experiência!
(4°) Não guarde esse conhecimento apenas para você, compartilhe com seus amigos e redes sociais marcando a gente no instagram @rladiesgyn.

Você faz parte desse compromisso

Lembre-se que o Código de Conduta também se estende à versão online de nossos eventos e não será tolerada qualquer forma de assédios ou intimidações de qualquer participante, seja audiência, palestrantes, colaboradores, ou quaisquer membros da comunidade.

A gente brilha TOGETHER!

title: Unsupervised learning with K-means clustering
description:
Hi there,

I hope you all are doing well. We are very delightful to inform you all, that we are collaborating with R-ladies Chennai for virtual interaction event, tech talks to learn about "K-means clustering " from Praveena Mathews.

K-means clustering is one of the simplest and best ways to explore about data visually. It is also a very popular unsupervised machine learning algorithm.

Registration instructions : Zoom link will be emailed to those who have registered for the meetup.

R-ladies Chennai
Checkout this Meetup with R-Ladies Chennai: https://meetu.ps/e/Kzf2X/H9bJp/i

Meetup host: Praveena Mathews

title: "Unsupervised Learning with K-means Clustering"  with Praveena Mathews
description:
Come and join us at our R- Ladies Chennai virtual meetup for a fun event of networking and learning R. Newbies are welcome too! During this meetup of R-Ladies Chennai, we are excited to go through “Unsupervised Learning with K-means Clustering”.

Session title: Unsupervised Learning with K-means Clustering

About the workshop: This workshop will introduce “Unsupervised Learning with K-means Clustering” . You will learn what unsupervised learning is and how to find subgroups (i.e., structure) within a larger group of unlabeled data using k-means clustering.

The Zoom link will be emailed to those who have registered for the meetup closer to the event. In case there is a problem with attending on Zoom, please log in on https://meet.google.com/gwz-zxkc-rtr and email chennai@ladies.org immediately.

title: A jouRney: where R can take you
description:
Join us for a virtual meetup this November to hear from Emma Vitz!

Overview: Emma will be talking about her jouRney from teaching herself R as a student to using it at work and delving into data journalism using R. She'll make the case for tapping into the R community and sharing your work publicly, and will share some examples of where this has taken her, including her viral maps on the NZ housing market.

Emma's Bio: Emma Vitz is an actuarial analyst working as a consultant in the insurance industry. She also dabbles in some data journalism on the side. Emma is particularly interested in social inequity, climate risk and natural disasters, and enjoys using R across all of her work.

This meeting will be hosted on Zoom. The meeting link will be sent out to those attending closer to the meetup date.

If you have any questions or problems, don't hesitate to contact Izzy Johnson (main host) through meet-up!

As with all our meetups, please be aware of and read the Code of Conduct before attending.
https://github.com/rladies/starter-kit/wiki/Code-of-Conduct

title: Introduction to the {arrow} package
description:
Join us as Nic Crane gives us an introduction to the {arrow} package and showcases some of the packages main functionality - e.g. she will be demonstrating some of the really exciting things it brings to analysing larger than memory datasets in R.
She'll also talk a bit more generally about the Apache Arrow project and how you can learn more.

About our speaker:
Nic Crane is a software developer and a committer on the Apache Arrow project. They are passionate about developer experience, teaching R, and building cool things that super-charge data science work. Nic's been using R for over 10 years, and is currently working at Voltron Data (formerly Ursa Computing) and has previously worked as a data scientist, R educator, and Shiny developer.

title: Club de Lectura del libro "Data Feminism" (Sesión 6)
description:
¡Hola!

El próximo jueves 25 de noviembre nos reuniremos para nuestra sexta sesión del club de lectura sobre libro "Data Feminism", de Catherine D'Ignazio y Lauren F. Klein. Este libro muestra una nueva forma de abordar la ciencia de datos y la ética de datos basada en ideas del feminismo interseccional. Se puede acceder de forma gratuita en: https://data-feminism.mitpress.mit.edu/

- ¿Cómo funciona el club de lectura?
Dividiremos la lectura del libro en siete sesiones. En cada una de ellas abordaremos un capítulo del libro.
Esta sexta sesión estará a cargo de Stephanie Orellana (https://twitter.com/sporella). Steph es Ingeniera Agrónoma y Magíster en Recursos Naturales de la PUC, y trabaja en consultoría ambiental. Su área de especialización es la Ciencia de Datos Espaciales. Durante la sesión comentaremos el capítulo 6, "The Numbers Don't Speak for Themselves", en el que se presenta el sexto principio del feminismo de datos: considerar el contexto.

- ¿Qué pasa si no puedo leer en inglés?
¡Puedes participar igual! La persona encargada de cada sesión hará una síntesis de los puntos más importantes, así que incluso si no puedes revisar el libro, podrás aprender sobre este tema :)

- CÓDIGO DE CONDUCTA
Queremos que este sea un espacio de aprendizaje amable y seguro. Al inscribirte en este evento estás aceptando nuestro código de conducta: https://github.com/rladies/starter-kit/wiki/Code-of-Conduct#spanish
El evento se realizará a través de la plataforma Zoom. El día del taller compartiremos la contraseña en los comentarios del evento.

- HORA
El evento se realizará a las 18:00 horas de la zona horaria UTC-3. Puedes revisar a qué hora corresponde en tu zona en el siguiente enlace: https://everytimezone.com/s/2137585e/

¡Te esperamos!

<3

title: GRUPO 3. TALLER DE ESTUDIO LIBRO "R PARA CIENCIA DE DATOS"
description:
¡Desde RLadies Bariloche les invitamos a comenzar con el estudio en grupo del libro R para Ciencia de Datos (versión traducida al español de R for Data Science) de Hadley Wickham (el creador de Tidyverse y varios paquetes más!). El libro es de libre acceso en https://es.r4ds.hadley.nz/ ¡Está muy bueno!

• Nos juntaremos de forma virtual una vez cada 15 días para avanzar con la lectura y comprensión del libro y los scripts. Cada encuentro será guiado por uno o dos integrantes del grupo.

• En el primer encuentro discutiremos el capitulo número 3 “visualización de datos” (¡Qué bueno, empezamos con gráficos con ggplot2 ) https://es.r4ds.hadley.nz/visualizaci%C3%B3n-de-datos.html Es necesario llegar a la reunión con el capítulo previamente leído y trabajado. Quienes no leyeron la introducción del libro aún: adelante, es corta, y les dará un panorama de lo que iremos estudiando. En la reunión de organización vimos un panorama de la introducción.

• En base a la encuesta de horarios que hicimos, hemos definido tres grupos de trabajo con distintos horarios. ¡ATENCIÓN! ¡Por favor, anotarse solo en uno de los tres! AHORA ESTÁS EN EL MEETUP DEL GRUPO 3, DE JUEVES DE 18 A 20.

• ¡Importante! Ni bien se inscriban en el meetup, entren a los ajustes de su perfil y verifiquen tener activas las notificaciones, no sólo del meetup en general, sino del grupo RLadies-BRC en particular (figuran abajo del todo en notificaciones por correo electrónico) para poder recibir luego el enlace para conectarse y otras notificaciones relacionadas al evento.

• Quienes se inscriban al meetup y si aún no se sumaron, van a recibir más adelante un enlace para sumarse al espacio de trabajo de slack que es exclusivo para el estudio del libro y que será nuestra principal vía de comunicación. Si nunca lo usaron y/o necesitan ayuda para familiarizarse, escríbannos y les damos una orientación rápida.

• Necesitamos uno o dos voluntarias o voluntarios para guiar el capítulo número 3. Interesadxs nos lo pueden comunicar por el slack o al correo bariloche@rladies.org. Cuanto antes, mejor. En caso de que nadie se ofrezca, haremos un sorteo (con el comando sample() en R!!!).

• A partir del primer encuentro, cada grupo de trabajo se auto-gestionará. Por ejemplo, sorteará o decidirá quién guiará el siguiente capítulo, si verán un capítulo, medio capítulo o dos capítulos (la propuesta general es ir despacio, lento pero sin tregua), si aplicarán lo que se vió en el capítulo a otro set de datos etc. Contamos con el espacio de slack para consultarnos y compartir información en cada grupo y entre grupos.

Al anotarse, les pedimos que primero lean y acepten el código de conducta que encontrarán en la página.

Para asistir al meetup, les recomendamos poseer una cuenta de google (utilizaremos google meet). Se recomienda tener conocimientos básicos de R.

¡ATENCIÓN! por cuestiones de seguridad virtual, el enlace a la reunión se enviará unos minutos antes de la misma. Por ello les pedimos que
estén alertas al correo.

title: Writing your manuscript in R markdown
description:
*What are we going to learn:
This talk will highlight the basic knowledge required to write manuscripts in R markdown and the advantages.

*Who is going to present:
Gayathri Thillaiyampalam completed her PhD in 2020 from the University of Queensland and she is currently working as a Research Fellow at Griffith Institute for Drug Discovery. Her areas of interests are bioinformatics, immunology and drug discovery.

* When are we meeting?
The talk will start at 6:00 pm for approximately 45 mins, followed by Q&A.

We look forward to seeing you there!

title: From messy data to beautiful plot: Guided TidyTuesday
description:
Know the basics of data wrangling but want some hands-on practice? Want to learn ggplot tips and tricks to make your plots eye-catching? Seen cool visualizations on Twitter but find it hard to go from messy dataset to beautiful visualization?

In this monthly meetup, we’ll go through a Tidy Tuesday dataset together step-by-step, walking you through the entire process from coming up with an interesting question to asnwer, getting the data in the right format and finally, creating a cool visualization!

You may have heard of Tidy Tuesday -- a weekly initiative by R for Data Science which provides a new dataset every week for the community to practice wrangling and visualizing. It has a huge Twitter community and is one of the best ways to practice and develop tidyverse skills, whether you’re still reviewing the basics or have quite the repertoire. This series has something for everyone and is especially designed to be beginner friendly!

It's important to us to ensure that Guided Tidy Tuesday is a safe space for gender minorities and especially those who are just starting out with R. Studies have shown that letting gender minorities speak first promotes a welcoming and supportive atmosphere for underrepresented groups. All are welcome at this meetup but we specifically ask cisgender men to take a passive role in this meetup and hold comments / questions until after others have had the chance to ask. Thank you for your support!

title: Introduction to data wrangling with the tidyverse
description:
SPEAKER
This online workshop will be led by Dr Bodo Winter (https://bodowinter.com/). Bodo is a Senior Lecturer at the University of Birmingham, UK, and the author of the leading R book "Statistics for Linguists: An Introduction Using R".

WORKSHOP OVERVIEW
R used to be clunky, but then the tidyverse came along. This collection of packages forms a framework for doing data science that makes things so much more intuitive, and code so much more readable. In this tutorial, Bodo will give you a quick introduction about some of the core aspects of the tidyverse and how you can use it to efficiently do data carpentry. Most of this will be done via a hands-on session in R, so that we can put our knowledge to use right away. This workshop is open to beginners — everybody is welcome!

PREPARATION
All you need to bring to this workshop is RStudio with an up-to-date version of R that has the tidyverse installed, i.e., type in install.packages('tidyverse') in the console while being connected to the internet. It may be worth checking that installation was successful by loading the package: library(tidyverse). At the workshop, Bodo will distribute a dataset that we will work on.

ONLINE PROGRAMME
The workshop will be held online and will start at 17:00 (UK time). Please join us via this Zoom link:
https://us06web.zoom.us/j/88479313628?pwd=R2hDZzAzbXk1bXdlamtPM01zZWMrdz09

title: Coffee and Co-work
description:
Have an R project you're dying to work on, but just can't seem to find the time or motivation? Whether it's finally sitting down to plot all of that data you collected or getting started on that Shiny app you've been meaning to build, get it done alongside your fellow R users at our Coffee and Co-work session!

What:
A two-hour co-work session, where we'll work on independent projects in the same space and keep each other accountable.

- At the beginning we'll go around the room and tell everyone what we're planning to work on.

- After 40 mins, we'll take a 5-10 min break and discuss successes and setbacks.

- We'll work for another 40 mins, then wrap up and see how far we got.
RLEL will bring the coffee!

Where:
In-person: MSU Biomedical and Physical Sciences building (BPS) room 1425

Virtual: RSVP here and we'll send you the Zoom link.

When:
Thursday, Nov. 18, 5:10–7:00 pm

All R users are welcome! Hope to see you there!

title: Species distribution models in R
description:
Hey R-Ladies!

For this event, Dr. Lindsay Campbell, an assistant professor at the UF Florida Medical Entomology Laboratory, will be discussing her research interests and how she uses R for environmental data wrangling and species distribution models.

Should be a very nice lunch break with us! No prep needed for this meeting!

A zoom link will be sent on the day of the event to those who RSVP.

Image credit:
Campbell LP, Burkett-Cadena ND, Miqueli E, Unlu I, Sloyer KE, Medina J, Vasquez C, Petrie W, Reeves LE. Potential Distribution of Aedes (Ochlerotatus) scapularis (Diptera: Culicidae): A Vector Mosquito New to the Florida Peninsula. Insects. 2021; 12(3):213. https://doi.org/10.3390/insects12030213

title: Managing R projects with Maëlle Salmon
description:
After a long summer break we are happy to announce the November 2021 Meetup with Maëlle Salmon (https://masalmon.eu) who will give us a presentation on best practices to organize an R project and why R projects are important.

Here is Maëlle's abstract for the talk:
"A good R project organization is useful even if you do not have
collaborators as demanding as The Little Prince. how to do that? Do you put the project in some sort of box? In this talk I will present tools that are good to know: git, here, renv, targets, orderly… I’ll also report whether making an R package out of everything is always a good idea. After this presentation you will have learnt tips and tricks to apply as you like in your R projects. I hope every one of you will learn at least one new thing!"

Maëlle is a part-time research software engineer for rOpenSci (since February 2018) and an active R developer and trainer. She also serve as associate editor for rOpenSci’s Software Peer Review (peer-review system of R packages) and is the main manager of R-Ladies Global Twitter account.

!!! Please note the change of time from evening to lunch time.

We are so happy to have her contribute to our Meetup!
See you soon online!
Your R-Ladies Vienna Organizing Team

title: Funnel analyses in R - in partnership con RLadies Coventry
description:
Funnel analyses in R (con il piccolo aiuto di RSQLight)

*** Evento in partnership con R-Ladies Coventry!!! ***

Pubblicato originariamente su RLadies Coventry
https://www.meetup.com/it-IT/rladies-coventry/events/281399088/

Una Funnel Analyses è un metodo di analisi, detto a “imbuto”, utilizzato dalle aziende per comprendere i passaggi che un utente attua per arrivare al risultato voluto dall’azienda. Questo metodo è utilizzato soprattutto per l’analisi del sito web aziendale, in quanto traccia l’esperienza degli utenti sul sito e mostra le fasi che lo portano al raggiungimento di una conversione oppure di un qualche obiettivo per l’azienda, come la registrazione alla newsletter e la generazione di lead.

In questo evento, Sara spiegherà come la Funnel Analyses può aiutare a determinare il punto in cui gli utenti abbandonano la pagina e non completano il percorso che porta alla Conversione. In questo modo l’analisi può essere utilizzata come punto di partenza per capire il motivo per cui gli utenti diminuiscono tra una fase e l’altra e apportare così delle modifiche in grado di ridurre il tasso di uscita e, a sua volta, aumentare il tasso di conversione.
Useremo R-studio per le analisi, creeremo un file R-markdown per produrre un report e riceveremo un piccolo aiuto da un amico - la libreria RSQLite - in modo da poter incorporare il codice SQL nelle nostre analisi e report.

SPEAKER

Questo evento online sarà tenuto dalla (nostra co-fondatrice) dott.ssa Sara Iacozza (https://www.saraiacozza.com/). Sara è attualmente Chief Data Officer e Behavioral Insight Researcher presso Digital Attitudes a Milano. Possiede un dottorato di ricerca presso il Max Planck Institute for Psycholinguistics nei Paesi Bassi.

ENGLISH

Every time you enter a website there are many flows of events that are initiated and can be followed through by a visitor. Imagine you land on the homepage of an e-commerce or a digital academic journal. You are looking for a specific item, that can be a T-shirt or a published paper, and need to navigate through menus and sub-menus before you land on the page you were looking for. What happens most of the time is that only a small portion of visitors achieve their goal of buying the T-shirt or reading the searched paper. Funnel analysis can help you spot where visitors are leaving your website, so you can optimize it and increase conversions.

In this event, Sara will explain how you can analyze funnels to identify key traffic sources and spot significant drop-off points. You’ll also learn how to combine funnel reports with more analytics insight, so you can share strategies that can improve the experience of users. We will use R-studio for the analyses, we’ll create a R-markdown file to output a report, and we will get a little help from a friend - RSQLite library- so that we can embed SQL code in our analyses and report.

SPEAKER
This online event will be led by Dr Sara Iacozza (https://www.saraiacozza.com/). Sara is currently a Chief Data Officer and Behavioural Insight Researcher at Digital Attitudes in Milan, Italy, having previously completed her PhD at the Max Planck Institute for Psycholinguistics in The Netherlands. Sara is a data and R enthusiast who also co-founded R-Ladies Italy!

CODE OF CONDUCT
Please take a minute to read our code of conduct - we are committed to creating a safe and harassment-free environment:
https://github.com/rladies/.github/blob/master/CODE_OF_CONDUCT.md

R-Ladies events are always free and open to anyone who wants to participate as long as they follow the code of conduct. We are pro-actively inclusive of queer, trans, and all minority identities, with additional sensitivity to intersectional identities. Our priority is to provide a safe community space for anyone identifying as a minority gender who is interested in and/or working with R.

title: GRUPO 3. TALLER DE ESTUDIO LIBRO "R PARA CIENCIA DE DATOS"
description:
¡Desde RLadies Bariloche les invitamos a comenzar con el estudio en grupo del libro R para Ciencia de Datos (versión traducida al español de R for Data Science) de Hadley Wickham (el creador de Tidyverse y varios paquetes más!). El libro es de libre acceso en https://es.r4ds.hadley.nz/ ¡Está muy bueno!

• Nos juntaremos de forma virtual una vez cada 15 días para avanzar con la lectura y comprensión del libro y los scripts. Cada encuentro será guiado por uno o dos integrantes del grupo.

• En el primer encuentro discutiremos el capitulo número 3 “visualización de datos” (¡Qué bueno, empezamos con gráficos con ggplot2 ) https://es.r4ds.hadley.nz/visualizaci%C3%B3n-de-datos.html Es necesario llegar a la reunión con el capítulo previamente leído y trabajado. Quienes no leyeron la introducción del libro aún: adelante, es corta, y les dará un panorama de lo que iremos estudiando. En la reunión de organización vimos un panorama de la introducción.

• En base a la encuesta de horarios que hicimos, hemos definido tres grupos de trabajo con distintos horarios. ¡ATENCIÓN! ¡Por favor, anotarse solo en uno de los tres! AHORA ESTÁS EN EL MEETUP DEL GRUPO 3, DE JUEVES DE 18 A 20.

• ¡Importante! Ni bien se inscriban en el meetup, entren a los ajustes de su perfil y verifiquen tener activas las notificaciones, no sólo del meetup en general, sino del grupo RLadies-BRC en particular (figuran abajo del todo en notificaciones por correo electrónico) para poder recibir luego el enlace para conectarse y otras notificaciones relacionadas al evento.

• Quienes se inscriban al meetup y si aún no se sumaron, van a recibir más adelante un enlace para sumarse al espacio de trabajo de slack que es exclusivo para el estudio del libro y que será nuestra principal vía de comunicación. Si nunca lo usaron y/o necesitan ayuda para familiarizarse, escríbannos y les damos una orientación rápida.

• Necesitamos uno o dos voluntarias o voluntarios para guiar el capítulo número 3. Interesadxs nos lo pueden comunicar por el slack o al correo bariloche@rladies.org. Cuanto antes, mejor. En caso de que nadie se ofrezca, haremos un sorteo (con el comando sample() en R!!!).

• A partir del primer encuentro, cada grupo de trabajo se auto-gestionará. Por ejemplo, sorteará o decidirá quién guiará el siguiente capítulo, si verán un capítulo, medio capítulo o dos capítulos (la propuesta general es ir despacio, lento pero sin tregua), si aplicarán lo que se vió en el capítulo a otro set de datos etc. Contamos con el espacio de slack para consultarnos y compartir información en cada grupo y entre grupos.

title: Getting Started with Unit Testing in R
description:
In this workshop, we’ll discuss how to get started with unit testing in R, which is formal automated testing of functions within packages. We’ll demonstrate handy functions in `usethis` and `devtools`, strategies for writing tests, debugging techniques, and broad concepts in function writing that facilitate a smoother testing process.

This workshop will pick up exactly where we left our little `ralph` (aka R-Ladies Philly) package one year ago with “Your first R package in 1 hour: Tools that make R package development easy” (https://www.pipinghotdata.com/talks/2020-10-25-your-first-r-package-in-1-hour/). Participants will get the most out of this workshop if they review those materials in advance, or if they are already familiar with building R packages with `devtools` and `usethis`.

Materials for the workshop are available here: https://github.com/shannonpileggi/ralphGetsTested

Please install, or update, the following packages in advance of the workshop: usethis, devtools, testthat, covr, DT, broom, glue, dplyr, purrr, magrittr, and rlang (or tidyverse).

Presenters:
Shannon Pileggi
Gordon Shotwell

description:

Funnel analysis can help you spot where visitors are leaving your website, so you can optimize it and increase conversions.

In this event, Sara will explain how you can analyze funnels to identify key traffic sources and spot significant drop-off points. You’ll also learn how to combine funnel reports with more analytics insight, so you can share strategies that can improve the experience of users. We will use R-studio for the analyses, we’ll create a R-markdown file to output a report, and we will get a little help from a friend - RSQLite library- so that we can embed SQL code in our analyses and report.

PREPARATION AND RESOURCES
There is nothing to prepare in advance. The resources for the workshop will be made available nearer the time.

ONLINE PROGRAMME
The event will be held online and will start at 17:30 (GMT) / 18:30 (CET). Please join us via this Zoom link:
https://us06web.zoom.us/j/82503021020?pwd=dUlIeThyOS9DakpaTVh3ellhQThBdz09

CODE OF CONDUCT
Please take a minute to read our code of conduct - we are committed to creating a safe and harassment-free environment:
https://github.com/rladies/.github/blob/master/CODE_OF_CONDUCT.md

R-Ladies events are always free and open to anyone who wants to participate as long as they follow the code of conduct. We are pro-actively inclusive of queer, trans, and all minority identities, with additional sensitivity to intersectional identities. Our priority is to provide a safe community space for anyone identifying as a minority gender who is interested in and/or working with R.

title: Fundamentos básicos do R: aplicação na biologia
description:
EMENTA: O objetivo deste curso é oferecer um treinamento teórico-prático no uso da linguagem de programação R com aplicação na biologia marinha, no gerenciamento costeiro e na conservação da biodiversidade.

No primeiro dia do curso, teremos uma aula teórica sobre o uso do R e sua aplicação biológica utilizando exemplos dentro de três níveis de organização biológica (organismos, populações e comunidades). Também faremos uma introdução rápida ao R, apresentando os principais conceitos.

No segundo dia, teremos uma aula totalmente prática utilizando o RStudio Cloud, uma versão online que dispensa a instalação do R no computador. O objetivo desta aula será construir uma rede de interações tróficas predador-presa. Conheceremos alguns pacotes básicos do R para a visualização gráfica de redes tróficas e mutualísticas. Aprenderemos a construir matrizes de dados simétrica e assimétrica. Estudaremos alguns parâmetros estatísticos e matemáticos como o grau de conectância e as interações possíveis, a distância e a centralidade, a modularidade e o aninhamento, entre outros. Faremos a interpretação dos resultados gerados pelas análises e discutiremos as suas aplicações biológicas.

Não é necessário ter conhecimento prévio de R ou estatística.

PALESTRANTES: Francesca Belem Lopes Palmeira (https://fblpalmeira.github.io) é uma mistura de bióloga de campo e de computador, com Mestrado em Ecologia e Doutorado em Recursos Florestais, ambos pela ESALQ/USP. Cofundadora das RLadies Ribeirão Preto e consultora em modelagem ambiental aplicada para a conservação. Francesca irá oferecer as aulas teórica e prática.

Maísa Ziviani Alves bióloga, com Mestrado e Doutorado pela ESALQ/USP e pós-doutoranda da UNIFRAN. Maísa tem estudado e analisado dados de fauna, incluindo mamíferos e aves na Mata Atlântica e Cerrado. Maísa também faz parte do Programa Amigos da Onça, um programa que promove a conservação da onça-pintada na Caatinga. Coorganizadora das RLadies Ribeirão Preto e consultora ambiental. Maísa irá demonstrar como ela utilizou o R para analisar os dados de sua pesquisa de pós-doutorado "Período e sobreposição de atividade de mamíferos de médio e grande porte".

Janne Lis Heguedusch de Santis é graduanda em Ciências Biológicas pela UENF, estudo a linguagem C++ e tem interesse na linguagem R. Coorganizadora das RLadies Ribeirão Preto. Janne irá apresentar a estrutura e a missão das RLadies e o nosso código de conduta.

PÚBLICO-ALVO: Estudantes de graduação, pós-graduação e profissionais interessados em redes ecológicas.

INSCRIÇÕES: A inscrição deverá ser feita até 11/11 na página da Semana da Biologia Marinha e do Gerenciamento Costeiro (https://www.even3.com.br/xviisbmgc), um evento científico promovido pela UNESP - IB CLP, campus São Vicente.

CERTIFICADOS: O certificado será emitido pela organização do evento.

LOCAL DO EVENTO: O curso será online e o link será disponibilizado pela organização do evento.

CÓDIGO DE CONDUTA: Nós das RLadies, oferecemos treinamento e mentoria em um ambiente seguro e livre de assédio. O nosso código de conduta aplica-se a todos os espaços RLadies, tanto online como offline. Qualquer pessoa que viole este código de conduta pode ser advertida, punida ou expulsa destes espaços, conforme critérios das Membros Fundadoras. Para mais informações, leia o nosso código de conduta. (https://guide.rladies.org/about/coc/#portuguese)

SOBRE AS RLADIES: Somos uma organização sem fins lucrativos (https://rladies.org) que atua em diversos países. Nós nos encontramos [virtualmente] para aprender sobre a linguagem R. A nossa missão é promover o uso da linguagem R entre as minorias de gênero incluindo mulheres cis, mulheres trans, pessoas não-binárias, entre outros grupos subrepresentados para uma comunidade mais diversa e inclusiva.

title: R-Wars: Tidyverse vs. Base R and Writing Reports in R Markdown
description:
For our November event, we will have two guest speakers. Dorota Biedzio will discuss the advantages and disadvantages between the tidyverse and base R. Alyssa Goldberg will teach us how to batch-process reports using RMarkdown.

This event will be hosted over Zoom, and the link will be available on this Meetup page at noon on the day of the event.

Agenda (times approximate):
7:05pm - 7:10pm: R-Ladies NYC Announcements
7:10pm - 7:40pm: Dorota's talk on tidyverse vs. base R
7:40pm - 8:10pm: Alyssa's talk on using R Markdown to write reports

--- Talk Abstract ---

"Tidyverse vs. Base R"
Speaker: Dorota Biedzio

Abstract: The rivalry between base-R and the tidyverse ends now! We will discuss the pros and cons of each, and compare code snippets to finally choose a winner! Or... instead... we can have an intellectual, even-tempered discussion because we are all professionals.

Bio: Dorota is a masters-level statistician currently working as a data analyst at MDRC (a non-profit, non-partisan research organization). Dorota loves writing functions that can automate tedious data processing tasks and increase workflow efficiency.

"Batch Processing R Markdown Reports"
Speaker: Alyssa Goldberg

Abstract: I'll be showing folks how to use R and RMarkdown to batch generate several reports at once - sort of like facet_wrap() but for
Word documents.

Bio: Alyssa is the Senior Marketing Analyst at the law firm Debevoise & Plimpton LLP.

---

R-Ladies is dedicated to providing a harassment-free experience for everyone. We do not tolerate harassment of participants in any form. Please take a moment to review the R-Ladies Global code of conduct (particularly if this is your first time attending!): https://rladies.org/code-of-conduct

title: Level up your ggplot: How do I use custom fonts?
description:
In this workshop, we'll first show you a few options to preview and download custom fonts (including Google fonts). Then, we'll discuss two methods to get R to recognise and work with them using the {extrafont} and {showtext} packages. Finally, we'll incorporate our newly added fonts into our plots!

---
It's important to us to ensure that R-Ladies Freiburg events are a safe space for gender minorities and especially those who are just starting out with R. All are welcome at this meetup but we specifically ask cisgender men to take a passive role in this meetup and hold comments/ questions until after others have had the chance to ask. Thank you for your support!

title: RLadies Boulder #20: Reproducible Code & Visualization Best Practices
description: Welcome back to another edition of RLadies Boulder! This week, Lara Southard, PhD will walk us through Reproducible Code (including the Project Template library) and Visualization Best Practices. Lara is a Sr. Research Scientist at Pearson and has her PhD in Cognitive Neuroscience from CSU.

title: Filling in the Blanks: Multiply Imputing Missing Data in R
description:
This event will explore the topics around missing data and how to deal with them in your analysis. A short introduction will be given, providing an overview of the different types of missing data, ways to account for them, and which of these ways are preferred (and why). We will demonstrate the multiple imputation approach in R and allow time for the participants to practice on real data.

A big big thanks to R-Ladies RTP members, Marissa Ashner and Dr. Sarah Lotspeich, for volunteering their time to organize and lead this event!

Agenda:
6:30 pm - 6:45pm - Introductions
6:45 pm - 7:15 pm - Overview of Missing Data
7:15 pm - 8:15 pm - Examples and practice in R
8:15 pm - 8:30 pm - Wrap up

All events are intended for women as leaders, mentors, members, and attendees. We are emphatically queer and trans friendly. Men are welcomed to attend *as guests* and must be accompanied by the R-Lady who invited them (i.e., attend through the "guest" function on their host's RSVP, not as a separate RSVP). This group was created so those who identify as women have a comfortable place to learn. If you would like to attend and feel excluded, please contact the event organizer.

Who is this for?
This meetup is for beginners who have little to no experience programming in R. We will use live coding demonstrations and participates will actively engage with the instructor throughout the workshop.

**Before you join**, please install the most recent version of R **as well as** RStudio on your computer before attending this meetup event. Here are links to free downloads for R (https://cran.r-project.org/) and RStudio (https://www.rstudio.com/products/rstudio/download/#download). Downloading and installing both of these programs before this meetup will help us keep to our schedule and make sure you learn the most you can while at the meetup event.

If you have trouble installing the software, please contact Sheila (via Meetup message or at sheila@rladies.org) at least 48 hours **before the event** so we can find a time to meet and work through software installation issues.

What should I bring?
Please login to Zoom using a laptop or computer with the capabilities to run R **and** RStudio. See information above about how to install R **and** RStudio.

Where will it take place?
Please join us online via Zoom. A link to join will be provided when you RSVP.

All events are intended for women as leaders, mentors, members, and attendees. We are emphatically queer and trans friendly. Men are welcomed to attend *as guests* and must be accompanied by the R-Lady who invited them. This group was created so those who identify as women have a comfortable place to learn. If you would like to attend and feel excluded, please contact the event organizer.

title: How to Build Portfolio Website with GitHub Pages
description:
Hello, RiveRside community ;-)

Join us for a virtual meeting of networking and learning next Tuesday,
November 9th, at 12:00 PM (PST). Don't forget to RSVP in our Meetup
to get access to the meeting ID and password.

We will learn how to build a portfolio website from scratch with GitHub Pages and Jekyll. This presentation will demonstrate how to create an entirely free, easy-to-maintain, friendly, and secure website.
Please sign up for a GitHub account before the session.

At the end of the meeting, we will have time to help each other with any R-related questions.

Big thanks to UCR Library and UCR GradQuant for supporting us and our guest speaker *Daniela Cassol* from the Department of Botany and Plant Sciences at UCR!

See you soon!

PS: are you already following us at @RLadiesRiversd Twitter?

title: Taller de LatinR: Introducción al análisis de redes con R
description:
Los capítulos de R-Ladies Guayaquil y R-Ladies Galápagos les traemos el tutorial "Introducción al análisis de redes con R" a cargo de la Dra. María Cristina Ramos (@mariacramosf). Este taller es parte de los tutoriales de LatinR 2021 y se dictará el lunes 8 de noviembre a las 15h00 (hora ecuador) UTC-5.

La Dra. María Cristina Ramos, es socióloga y científica de redes. Utiliza la ciencia de las redes para estudiar una amplia gama de temas, incluidas las redes de colaboración, los sistemas socioecológicos, el análisis de textos, los contactos personales y la salud, y los modelos mentales de creencias. Ella es consultora independiente e instructora de RStudio Certificada. Puedes seguirla en Twitter, @mariacramosf o por su página web: https://mariacramos.com/

REQUISITOS:
Para aprovechar el tutorial al máximo, instala previamente los paquetes "igraph" e "igraphdata".

Para participar selecciona "Asistiré" en este evento y asegúrate de tener instalado Zoom en tu computadora (https://zoom.us/download).

Por razones de seguridad te pedimos que no compartas el link para ingresar a Zoom de manera pública, este link únicamente aparecerá a las personas que confirmaron asistencia.

title: Modelos de Equações Estruturais (SEM) no R
description:
Modelos de equações estruturais são um conjunto de técnicas usadas para representar hipóteses acerca de um estudo/conjunto de dados em termos de parâmetros estruturais e com embasamento técnico. Estas técnicas são bastante usadas em Ciências Sociais e Biológicas ou em Psicologia por meio de "path analysis" (análise de caminhos), "mediation analysis" (análise de mediação) ou "latent variable analysis" (análise de variáveis latentes). Neste tutorial, será feita uma breve introdução no tópico, junto com exemplos de estudos prévios. A pessoa participante terá a oportunidade de aprender na prática como produzir e interpretar tais modelos no R, com diferentes exercícios.
Participantes podem trazer seus próprios dados e compartilhar suas próprias experiências.

Samuel Carleai é cientista, com formação em Biologia e doutorado em Ecologia. Ele tem experiêcia em botânica, sistemática e ecologia e, atualmente, trabalha com pesquisa na área de psicologia. Ele é apaixonado por ciência e programação.

Requisitos:

- R instalado e RStudio (opcional)
- Pacotes: lavaan, semPlot, lavaanPlot, dplyr e blavaan instalados

***IMPORTANTE***
Para participar faça a inscrição neste evento e tenha o Zoom instalado em seu computador (https://zoom.us/download).

Por razões de segurança, não compartilharemos o link para entrar no evento de forma pública. No mesmo dia do evento enviaremos um e-mail através do Meetup para todas as pessoas que confirmaram presença com o link para que você possa entrar na vídeochamada.

O código de conduta de R-Ladies (https://guide.rladies.org/about/coc/#portuguese) se aplica a este espaço, assim como o de LatinR.

Esperamos que LatinR seja uma conferência livre de assédio para todos, independentemente de sexo, identidade, gênero, idade, orientação sexual, deficiência, aparência física, tamanho corporal, raça, etnia, religião (ou falta dela), ideologia ou opções tecnológicas. Não toleramos o assédio dos participantes da conferência de nenhuma forma. Linguagem e imagens sexuais não são apropriadas para nenhum lugar da conferência, incluídas conversas, workshops, festas, redes sociais e outros meios de comunicação online. Os participantes da conferência que violarem essas regras podeser ser sancionados ou expulsos da conferência sem um reembolso a critério dos organizadores da conferência.

Versão mais longa do código de conduta de LatinR em: https://latin-r.com/cdc-pt/

title: Git, GitHub, and RStudio
description:
How to use Git within RStudio? We'll learn about the setup, Git vocabulary, and we'll create a short version history locally and online.

To get the most of this short workshop, come with your computer with RStudio and Git installed.

Check out the installation instructions (https://git-scm.com), then create an account at GitHub. Next you will need to create an SSH key (by following the instructions at https://happygitwithr.com/ssh-keys.html#create-an-ssh-key-pair and https://happygitwithr.com/ssh-keys.html#provide-public-key-to-github). NB: choose one of the options, not all!

Reach out to R-Ladies on Slack if you get stuck!

Your work will purr when you can collaborate on Git!
