She is also a trainer of Data Management and Analysis, and Basic Statistics at Training Center in Communication, located at the University of Nairobi. She is the co-organiser and co-founder of R-Ladies Nairobi. Currently, a user of the R software!

title: gg+ : paquetes para extender las capacidades de ggplot2
description:
Los capítulos de R-Ladies Resistencia-Corrientes y R-Ladies Buenos Aires les traemos el tutorial "gg+ : paquetes para extender las capacidades de ggplot2" a cargo de Luis D. Verde Arregoitia (@LuisDVerde). Este taller es parte de los tutoriales de LatinR 2021 (https://latin-r.com/)y se dictará el jueves 4 a las 14hs (hora argentina) GMT-3.

Luis va a mostrarnos distintos paquetes que se suman a ggplot2 para incorporar nuevas paletas de colores, representaciones gráficas y capas (geoms), y herramientas para acomodar y rotular elementos gráficos.

Si sos fan de ggplot2 y querés conocer como extender sus funcionalidades o si estás buscando visualizar datos de forma eficiente y llamativa, ¡este tutorial es para vos!.

REQUISITOS:
Para aprovechar el tutorial al máximo, instalá previamente los paquetes dplyr, ggalt, ggridges, ggforce, patchwork, ggnewscale, scico, gghighlight, ggrepel, ggeasy, ggfx y ggh4x.

***IMPORTANTE***
Para participar selecciona "Asistiré" en este evento y asegúrate de tener instalado Zoom en tu computadora (https://zoom.us/download).

Por razones de seguridad no compartiremos el link para ingresar a Zoom de manera pública. El mismo día del evento a las 13 hs enviaremos un mail a través de Meetup a todas las personas que confirmaron asistencia con el link para que puedas unirte a la videollamada.

title: Spatial network analysis with the sfnetworks package
description:
Renate Thiede will be talking about the {sfnetworks} package. The sfnetworks package combines the power of igraph (graphs) and sf (spatial data) to handle spatial networks such as road networks. This package facilitates the easy creation of spatial networks, both from manually-defined coordinates and from road network datasets; supports data cleaning; and possesses a wealth of network data manipulation and analysis techniques, including node clustering, route analysis and distance calculations. Easy conversion to sf also allows for sophisticated visualisation of analysis results in geographical space.

About our speaker:
Renate is a PhD student in the Department of Statistics at the University of Pretoria.

title: Introducción a R para principiantes
description:
Cómo estáis, R-Ladies?

Esperamos que hayáis pasado un gran verano y hayáis podido descansar. Nosotras volvemos con lo que ya empieza a ser un clásico: una introducción a R y RStudio para no dejar a nadie atrás :) a quién no le gusta un taller de introducción?

Empezaremos desde cero, pero te recomentamos tener descargado e instalado R (https://cran.r-project.org/mirrors.html) y RStudio (https://rstudio.com/products/rstudio/). Así ganaremos ese tiempo en el taller.

Password: 000111

Agenda provisional:

- Qué es RStudio
- Qué podemos lograr con R
- Primeros pasos: tipos de datos y visualizaciones sencillas

Ponente: Elsa Toribio

Me llamo Elsa. Hace un año y medio decidí dar un giro a mi vida y embarcar en el mundo de los datos y espero que sin retorno.

Empecé a formarme en junio de 2020 en The Bridge Digital Talent Accelerator, y tras mucho esfuerzo aprendiendo a programar y requiriendo las habilidades necesarias para ser un Data Scientist, en Octubre del 2020 terminé mi formación.

title: R for Data Science Book Club (Final Meeting)
description:
R-Ladies DC will be reading R for Data Science in 8 biweekly meetings (July 15, July 29, Aug 12, Aug 26, Sept 9, Sept 23, Oct 14, Oct 28).

The selected book chapters should be read before the meeting time.

There are also exercises for each week which you should aim to complete before the meeting as well. We'll go through solutions to the exercises as a group. In most weeks, we'll also do some additional exercises from the chapters live during the meeting.

It's okay if you're not able to complete everything ahead of time, we understand that life happens. Please still attend the meeting, even if you didn't read everything or complete all the exercises.

In addition, if you have to miss a meeting time, all code will be made available after the meeting on Github: https://github.com/sctyner/r4ds-bookclub-rladiesdc

Note on the exercises: For all exercises, we will use the online version of the book. There are some differences between the online and print exercises, so we'll stick with the online ones so that everyone is doing the same exercises.

Note on meeting access: All meetings will be virtual. You must RSVP to the meeting on the R-Ladies DC Meetup page to receive the Zoom link. All meetings will take place on a Thursday from 7:00-8:30pm ET (America/New York).

Meeting 8 (October 28, 2021): Communicate

Physical book chapters (Pages)
All of Part V (421-481)

Ebook Chapters & Link
Ch. 26: Introduction https://r4ds.had.co.nz/communicate-intro.html
Ch. 27: R Markdown https://r4ds.had.co.nz/r-markdown.html
Ch. 28: Graphics for communication https://r4ds.had.co.nz/graphics-for-communication.html
Ch. 29: R Markdown formats https://r4ds.had.co.nz/r-markdown-formats.html
Ch. 30: R Markdown workflow https://r4ds.had.co.nz/r-markdown-workflow.html

Exercises (from online book chapters)
Chapter 27: Section 27.2.1 # 2
Chapter 27: Section 27.3.1 # 2
Chapter 27: Section 27.4.7 # 1
Chapter 28: Section 28.2.1 # 3 or # 2
Chapter 28: Section 28.3.1 # 3
Chapter 28: Section 28.4.4 # 3

title: ¡Jueves de hoRRoR!
description:
No podíamos dejar de hacer una reunión para celebrar el Día de MueRtos.

Este jueves les invitamos a aprender distintas maneras en las que podemos darle formato a nuestras gráficas de ggplot2. Además, tendremos un pequeño reto, y la persona que gane tendrá un ¡regalo sorpresa!

¡No se lo pierdan!

title: Club de lectura R para Ciencia de Datos (Wickham & Grolemund) - Sesión 13
description:
Las R-Ladies de Barranquilla (COL), Galápagos, Guayaquil y Milagro (ECU) nos hemos unido para traerte un club de lectura basado en el libro R para Ciencia de Datos de Wickham y Grolemund. Este libro está disponible en español gracias al esfuerzo de la comunidad R latinoamericana y puede ser accedido de manera libre aquí: https://es.r4ds.hadley.nz.

En esta sesión 13 de nuestro club de lectura, Linda Cabrera Orellana de R-Ladies Guayaquil y Denisse Fierro Arcos de R-Ladies Galápagos hablarán sobre la creación y el uso de documentos Markdown en R (Capítulos 27, 29 y 30).

Esta es la última sesión de nuestro club de lectura, la cual se llevará a cabo a través de Zoom y tendrá una duración de dos horas. Durante la sesión discutiremos y practicaremos los puntos más importantes de los capítulos relacionados a Markdown en R.

Esta sesión se llevará a cabo el jueves 28 de octubre desde las 18:00 (UTC-5, Colombia y Ecuador Continental), o si estás en Galápagos desde las 17:00 (UTC-6).

Recuerda que al participar en nuestros eventos estás aceptando nuestro código de conducta, el cual nos ayuda a crear un espacio amable y seguro para aprender: https://github.com/rladies/starter-kit/wiki/Code-of-Conduct#spanish

title: GRUPO 3. TALLER DE ESTUDIO LIBRO "R PARA CIENCIA DE DATOS"
description:
¡Desde RLadies Bariloche les invitamos a comenzar con el estudio en grupo del libro R para Ciencia de Datos (versión traducida al español de R for Data Science) de Hadley Wickham (el creador de Tidyverse y varios paquetes más!). El libro es de libre acceso en https://es.r4ds.hadley.nz/ ¡Está muy bueno!

• Nos juntaremos de forma virtual una vez cada 15 días para avanzar con la lectura y comprensión del libro y los scripts. Cada encuentro será guiado por uno o dos integrantes del grupo.

• En el primer encuentro discutiremos el capitulo número 3 “visualización de datos” (¡Qué bueno, empezamos con gráficos con ggplot2 ) https://es.r4ds.hadley.nz/visualizaci%C3%B3n-de-datos.html Es necesario llegar a la reunión con el capítulo previamente leído y trabajado. Quienes no leyeron la introducción del libro aún: adelante, es corta, y les dará un panorama de lo que iremos estudiando. En la reunión de organización vimos un panorama de la introducción.

• En base a la encuesta de horarios que hicimos, hemos definido tres grupos de trabajo con distintos horarios. ¡ATENCIÓN! ¡Por favor, anotarse solo en uno de los tres! AHORA ESTÁS EN EL MEETUP DEL GRUPO 3, DE JUEVES DE 18 A 20.

• ¡Importante! Ni bien se inscriban en el meetup, entren a los ajustes de su perfil y verifiquen tener activas las notificaciones, no sólo del meetup en general, sino del grupo RLadies-BRC en particular (figuran abajo del todo en notificaciones por correo electrónico) para poder recibir luego el enlace para conectarse y otras notificaciones relacionadas al evento.

• Quienes se inscriban al meetup y si aún no se sumaron, van a recibir más adelante un enlace para sumarse al espacio de trabajo de slack que es exclusivo para el estudio del libro y que será nuestra principal vía de comunicación. Si nunca lo usaron y/o necesitan ayuda para familiarizarse, escríbannos y les damos una orientación rápida.

• Necesitamos uno o dos voluntarias o voluntarios para guiar el capítulo número 3. Interesadxs nos lo pueden comunicar por el slack o al correo bariloche@rladies.org. Cuanto antes, mejor. En caso de que nadie se ofrezca, haremos un sorteo (con el comando sample() en R!!!).

• A partir del primer encuentro, cada grupo de trabajo se auto-gestionará. Por ejemplo, sorteará o decidirá quién guiará el siguiente capítulo, si verán un capítulo, medio capítulo o dos capítulos (la propuesta general es ir despacio, lento pero sin tregua), si aplicarán lo que se vió en el capítulo a otro set de datos etc. Contamos con el espacio de slack para consultarnos y compartir información en cada grupo y entre grupos.

Al anotarse, les pedimos que primero lean y acepten el código de conducta que encontrarán en la página.

Para asistir al meetup, les recomendamos poseer una cuenta de google (utilizaremos google meet). Se recomienda tener conocimientos básicos de R.

¡ATENCIÓN! por cuestiones de seguridad virtual, el enlace a la reunión se enviará unos minutos antes de la misma. Por ello les pedimos que
estén alertas al correo.

title: ¡Primer meet-up R-Ladies Guayaquil!
description:
¡Comienza la iniciativa en la ciudad! ¡Bienvenid@s!
En esta primera reunión nos conoceremos y te diremos qué trae consigo esta maravillosa iniciativa. ¿Las mujeres participan en ciencias? ¿matemáticas? ¿tecnologías?, no sólo contestaremos estas preguntas; también explicaremos qué es R y cómo su uso es transversal en distintas áreas de aplicación.
Recuerda que todos los eventos son gratuitos.

¡Anímate a estar 15 minutos antes de la hora de inicio para el registro!

¡L@s esperamos!

title: Around the world in a single table
description:
Isabella will be discussing tables as a format for communicating information and walking through creating a table in R using the {gt} package.

We're hoping that you will be inspired to enter the `RStudio Table Contest 2021` (https://blog.rstudio.com/2021/09/30/rstudio-table-contest-2021/).

About our speaker:
Isabella Velásquez, needs little introduction. She has a blog called `%>% dreams` (https://ivelasq.rbind.io/) but we'd argue she's well on her way to attaining her dreams :). You all, we know it's a play on our beloved %>%, but we couldn't resist a fangirl moment at her accomplishments.
Among her many accomplishments, she is a co-author of the book 'Data Science in Education Using R' (https://datascienceineducation.com/) and has recently joined RStudio as a Sr. Product Marketing Manager. Follow her on Twitter https://twitter.com/ivelasq3 to keep up with all the cool content she produces and shares.

Github Link: https://github.com/ivelasq/2021-10-27_rladies-jozi-presentation

Main Installs for following along:
install.packages("pacman")
pacman::p_load(tidygraph, maps, ggraph, igraph, tidyverse, patchwork, ggthemes, lubridate, hms)
pacman::p_load(tidyverse, gt)
pacman::p_load_gh("jthomasmock/gtExtras")

title: From messy data to beautiful plot: Guided TidyTuesday
description:
Know the basics of data wrangling but want some hands-on practice? Want to learn ggplot tips and tricks to make your plots eye-catching? Seen cool visualizations on Twitter but find it hard to go from messy dataset to beautiful visualization?

In this monthly meetup, we’ll go through a Tidy Tuesday dataset together step-by-step, walking you through the entire process from coming up with an interesting question to asnwer, getting the data in the right format and finally, creating a cool visualization!

You may have heard of Tidy Tuesday -- a weekly initiative by R for Data Science which provides a new dataset every week for the community to practice wrangling and visualizing. It has a huge Twitter community and is one of the best ways to practice and develop tidyverse skills, whether you’re still reviewing the basics or have quite the repertoire. This series has something for everyone and is especially designed to be beginner friendly!

It's important to us to ensure that Guided Tidy Tuesday is a safe space for gender minorities and especially those who are just starting out with R. Studies have shown that letting gender minorities speak first promotes a welcoming and supportive atmosphere for underrepresented groups. All are welcome at this meetup but we specifically ask cisgender men to take a passive role in this meetup and hold comments / questions until after others have had the chance to ask. Thank you for your support!

title: Club de lectura del libro "Data Feminism" (sesión 5)
description:
¡Hola !

El próximo miércoles 27 de octubre nos reuniremos para nuestra quinta sesión del club de lectura sobre libro "Data Feminism", de Catherine D'Ignazio y Lauren F. Klein. Este libro muestra una nueva forma de abordar la ciencia de datos y la ética de datos basada en ideas del feminismo interseccional. Se puede acceder de forma gratuita en: https://data-feminism.mitpress.mit.edu/

- ¿Cómo funciona el club de lectura?
Dividiremos la lectura del libro en seis sesiones. En cada una de ellas abordaremos un capítulo del libro. Cada sesión la liderará alguien de nuestra comunidad.
Esta cuarta sesión estará a cargo de Macarena Valenzuela, Doctora en Ciencia Política. Durante la sesión comentaremos el capítulo 5, "Unicorns, Janitors, Ninjas, Wizards, and Rock Stars", en el que se presenta el quinto principio del feminismo de datos: acoger el pluralismo.

- ¿Qué pasa si no puedo leer en inglés?
¡Puedes participar igual! La persona encargada de cada sesión hará una síntesis de los puntos más importantes, así que incluso si no puedes revisar el libro, podrás aprender sobre este tema :)

- CÓDIGO DE CONDUCTA
Queremos que este sea un espacio de aprendizaje amable y seguro. Al inscribirte en este evento estás aceptando nuestro código de conducta: https://github.com/rladies/starter-kit/wiki/Code-of-Conduct#spanish
El evento se realizará a través de la plataforma Zoom. El día del taller compartiremos la contraseña en los comentarios del evento.

- HORA
El evento se realizará a las 15:00 horas de la zona horaria UTC-3. Puedes revisar a qué hora corresponde en tu zona en el siguiente enlace: https://everytimezone.com/s/256c2958

¡Te esperamos!

R-Ladies <3

title: Teaching and Learning Bayesian Statistics with {bayesrules}
description:
# Schedule
Tuesday, October 26, 6:00-7:30 pm (Pacific)
We are co-hosting this with SoCal RUG https://www.meetup.com/SOCAL-RUG/events/281229303/ so there will be no networking for this event.

6:00 - Welcome
7:30 - Meeting Adjourned

# Teaching and Learning Bayesian Statistics with {bayesrules}

Speaker: Mine Dogucu
Bayesian statistics is becoming more popular in data science. Data scientists are often not trained in Bayesian statistics and if they are, it is usually part of their graduate training. During this talk, we will introduce an introductory course in Bayesian statistics for learners at the undergraduate level and comparably trained practitioners. We will share tools for teaching (and learning) the first course in Bayesian statistics, specifically the {bayesrules} package that accompanies the open-access Bayes Rules! An Introduction to Bayesian Modeling with R book. We will provide an outline of the curriculum and examples for novice learners and their instructors.

Speaker Bio:
Mine Dogucu is an Assistant Professor of Teaching and Vice-Chair of Undergraduate Studies in the Department of Statistics at the University of California Irvine. She teaches statistics and data science courses at undergraduate and graduate levels. She is interested in creating educational resources for statistics and data science that are accessible physically and cognitively.

She is a co-Principal Investigator on a project funded by the National Science Foundation’s Harnessing the Data Revolution: Data Science Corps program. Through this project, along with her colleagues, she aims to improve data science education infrastructure in Southern California institutions at UC Irvine, Cal State Fullerton, Cypress College, and beyond and tries to connect data science students with industry and research partners for real data science experiences. She is the coauthor of the book Bayes Rules! An Introduction to Bayesian Modeling with R.

title: The Art of Design: Software & Experimental Design
description:
Hi Everyone!

Join us for our October event presented by Dr. Emi Tanaka from Monash University. During this event, she will be talking about software and experimental design.

Analysing data is unimaginable without a statistical software. Anyone who requires statistical computing on a regular basis would frequently interact with a statistical software and therefore the interface design can have a radical effect on the masses. In this talk, She will dive into a range of programming paradigms with relation to the interface design of software. She will then discuss in-depth about a novel computational framework, called the "grammar of experimental design", and its implementation as the edibble R-package.

Dr. Emi Tanaka is a lecturer in statistics at Monash University whose primary interest is to develop impactful statistical methods and tools that can readily be used by practitioners. Her research area include data visualisation, mixed models and experimental designs, motivated primarily by problems in bioinformatics and agricultural sciences. She is currently the President of the Statistical Society of Australia Victorian Branch and is an avid programmer in R, HTML/CSS and other computational languages.

This will be an online event. Please connect to the zoom session at 6pm Melbourne time on the 26th of October.

We look forward to seeing everyone at the seminar!

R-Ladies Melbourne

title: Customizing R-Markdown
description:
Join us for the fourth of four workshops during our octobeR extRavaganza!

About the workshop:
For data analysis output to be reproducible, the data and code should be assembled in a way such that results (e.g. tables and figures) can be re-created. In this workshop we will demonstrate a workflow for reproducible data science with R, R Markdown and discuss how R Markdown documents of various flavours and output types can be customized to achieve a customized look and style. In addition to customization, we will also touch on using RStudio’s visual editor for authoring in R Markdown.

About the instructor:
Mine Çetinkaya-Rundel is Professor of the Practice at the Department of Statistical Science at Duke University and Data Scientist and Professional Educator at RStudio. Mine works on integrating computation into the undergraduate statistics curriculum, using reproducible research methodologies and analysis of real and complex datasets. She also organizes ASA DataFest, works on the OpenIntro project, teaches the popular Statistics with R MOOC on Coursera, and is the creator and maintainer of Data Science in a Box.

title: GRUPO 1. TALLER DE ESTUDIO LIBRO "R PARA CIENCIA DE DATOS"
description:
¡Desde RLadies Bariloche les invitamos a comenzar con el estudio en grupo del libro R para Ciencia de Datos (versión traducida al español de R for Data Science) de Hadley Wickham (el creador de Tidyverse y varios paquetes más!). El libro es de libre acceso en https://es.r4ds.hadley.nz/ ¡Está muy bueno!

• Nos juntaremos de forma virtual una vez cada 15 días para avanzar con la lectura y comprensión del libro y los scripts. Cada encuentro será guiado por uno o dos integrantes del grupo.

• En el primer encuentro discutiremos el capitulo número 3 “visualización de datos” (¡Qué bueno, empezamos con gráficos con ggplot2 ) https://es.r4ds.hadley.nz/visualizaci%C3%B3n-de-datos.html Es necesario llegar a la reunión con el capítulo previamente leído y trabajado. Quienes no leyeron la introducción del libro aún: adelante, es corta, y les dará un panorama de lo que iremos estudiando. En la reunión de organización vimos un panorama de la introducción.

• En base a la encuesta de horarios que hicimos, hemos definido tres grupos de trabajo con distintos horarios. ¡ATENCIÓN! ¡Por favor, anotarse solo en uno de los tres! AHORA ESTÁS EN EL MEETUP DEL GRUPO DE LUNES DE 9 A 11 AM.

• ¡Importante! Ni bien se inscriban en el meetup, entren a los ajustes de su perfil y verifiquen tener activas las notificaciones, no sólo del meetup en general, sino del grupo RLadies-BRC en particular (figuran abajo del todo en notificaciones por correo electrónico) para poder recibir luego el enlace para conectarse y otras notificaciones relacionadas al evento.

• Quienes se inscriban al meetup y si aún no se sumaron, van a recibir más adelante un enlace para sumarse al espacio de trabajo de slack que es exclusivo para el estudio del libro y que será nuestra principal vía de comunicación. Si nunca lo usaron y/o necesitan ayuda para familiarizarse, escríbannos y les damos una orientación rápida.

• Necesitamos uno o dos voluntarias o voluntarios para guiar el capítulo número 3. Interesadxs nos lo pueden comunicar por el slack o al correo bariloche@rladies.org. Cuanto antes, mejor. En caso de que nadie se ofrezca, haremos un sorteo (con el comando sample() en R!!!).

• A partir del primer encuentro, cada grupo de trabajo se auto-gestionará. Por ejemplo, sorteará o decidirá quién guiará el siguiente capítulo, si verán un capítulo, medio capítulo o dos capítulos (la propuesta general es ir despacio, lento pero sin tregua), si aplicarán lo que se vió en el capítulo a otro set de datos etc. Contamos con el espacio de slack para consultarnos y compartir información en cada grupo y entre grupos.

Al anotarse, les pedimos que primero lean y acepten el código de conducta que encontrarán en la página.

Para asistir al meetup, les recomendamos poseer una cuenta de google (utilizaremos google meet). Se recomienda tener conocimientos básicos de R.

¡ATENCIÓN! por cuestiones de seguridad virtual, el enlace a la reunión se enviará unos minutos antes de la misma. Por ello les pedimos que
estén alertas al correo.

title: Introducción a Rmarkdown
description:
Un nuevo meetup en formato virtual. Llega el esperado Rmarkdown! Nuestra presentadora será Claudia

R Markdown permite escribir informes reproducibles y dinámicos con R. Podés usarlo para incluir código R y resultados en presentaciones, documentos pdf, html, Word y más. Este taller está pensado desde un nivel básico-intermedio, así que no te preocupes si recién empezas con R.

Para asistir al meetup, primero por favor lean nuestro código de conducta (https://github.com/rladies/.github/blob/master/CODE_OF_CONDUCT.md#spanish). Además les recomendamos:

1- Poseer una cuenta de google (utilizaremos google meet)

2- Tener conocimiento básico de R, qué es un script, cómo llamar paquetes, establecer el directorio de trabajo y cargar un archivo de datos.

¡ATENCIÓN! por cuestiones de seguridad virtual, el enlace a la reunión se enviará unos minutos antes de la misma. Por ello les pedimos que estén alertas al correo ya que lo enviaremos desde aquí. Los datos que utilicemos y el script estarán disponibles una vez finalizada la reunión en el repositorio de github.

Abbiamo il piacere di annunciare un nuovo meetup congiunto tra R-Ladies Spagna, R-Ladies Italia e Oliver Wyman.

👩‍💻 Se stai cercando lavoro, ti consigliamo di partecipare!

Oliver Wyman è un'azienda di consulenza con una sede a Milano e molte altre distribuite globalmente che è alla ricerca di donne di talento da inserire nel mondo della data analytics.
L'evento sarà in inglese e avremo presenti anche i chapter di RLadies Madrid e Barcellona.

=============================
NOTA IMPORTANTE: per ricevere il link online, è necessario registrarsi in questo modulo (la gestione delle partecipanti viene fatta direttamente da Oliver Wyman, quindi essere registrate su MeetUp non è sufficiente!): https://owg.zoom.us/meeting/register/tJYsf-uqqTojGNQx_Xhh-vdnWyt1q8GynGVN
=============================

Il team di Digital&Analytics di Oliver Wyman ci mostrerà come ottentere progressi significativi utilizzando analitiche avanzate.
Ecco l'agenda dell'evento:

- 18:30
Apertura e presentazione del team Data&Analytics da parte di Sian Townson (direttrice)
- 18:40
Presentazione del progetto di Advanced Analytics da parte del team Data&Analytics di Oliver Wyman
- 19:10
Breve presentazione delle opportunità aperte di Oliver Wyman Data&Analytics
- 19:20
Sessione di Q&A

SPEAKERS:

**Sian Townson** è la direttrice di Data & Analytics, una divisione specializzata della parte digitale di Oliver Wyman. Ha più di 20 anni di esperienza in modelli e validazione, specializzato in machine learning. Sian ha guidato numerosi progetti di costruzione e convalida di modelli su larga scala ed è interessata in particolare alla validazione di advanced machine learning. Sta investendo molto sulla risoluzione di problemi di pregiudizio ed etica.
**Teneeka May** è una senior analist in Data & Analytics. Oltre al suo lavoro presso Oliver Wyman, Teneeka ha fondato un nuovo branch di networking tra le donne dell'azienda, il cui obiettivo è sviluppare, ispirare e creare comunità tra le donne in questo settore.
Al di fuori del lavoro, Teneeka è interessata all'impatto sociale e ha messo le sue competenze al servizio degli altri con un'organizzazione che aiuta altre ONG a estrarre conoscenza dai propri dati. Nel 2021 è stata riconosciuta come Rising Star in Digital da WeAreTheCity.

Ti aspettiamo!

title: exploratory data analysis (EDA) workflow
description:
Exploration of data is the most tedious but also the most useful part of data science. If we don't have a good understanding of our data, we won't be able to apply a correct model, include sufficient predictor variables, or even exclude erroneous entries. There is a plethora of packages that can help us with exploratory data analysis (EDA). Some are specific for a given data type, while others are more general - and it can be difficult sometimes to know where to start!

In this talk, Priyanka Gagneja (https://github.com/priyankagagneja) will present her EDA workflow that includes a combination of R packages such as {dataExplorer}, {chronicle}, {esquisse}, amongst others.

About the speaker:
Priyanka is a data science practitioner, most recently working as a data science consultant with Onpoint Insights in US where her efforts focus on quality control and reporting for a biomedical devices company. Previously she used her analytics skills in industry serving clients in retail and financial services. She graduated from Boston College with a Masters in Applied Economics and holds an MBA and Bachelor's in Computer Science from India.

We are excited to host an online version of one our most popular events - R-Ladies NYC Lightning Talks! We are extending the submission deadline to provide more support for interested speakers, and have added a speaker workshop on 9/23 to provide guidance and support. If you are interested in proposing a talk but want to brainstorm ideas, get feedback, or some encouragement, join us for the event on 9/23 and RSVP on our meetup page.

Fill out this brief form by Friday, October 1st to submit your application to be a speaker!
https://docs.google.com/forms/d/e/1FAIpQLSfauyyLjj8-S2_XOvk0KHCsy2QC93u5mtXvjRPc0Ohrzi0bzQ/viewform

Lighting talks are five minute talks. You can talk about anything R, Tech, and/or Data Science related. Looking for ideas? How about talking about a cool package you found, how you use R in your company, a favorite learning resource, your journey into Data Science, or a side project you've been working on?

We would especially love to hear from people who've never presented at a meetup or conference before and/or those who still don't feel confident speaking publicly. A lightning talk can be a great way to start out speaking, as it's quick, low-prep, and fun!

Interested in proposing a talk but want to brainstorm ideas, get feedback, or some encouragement? We're here to help! You can join the #lightningtalks channel in our slack channel or email nyc@rladies.org. We would be happy to set up a time to talk with you!

To celebrate the diversity in the R Community, we're prioritizing presenters who identify as a minority gender (including but not limited to cis/trans women, trans men, non-binary, genderqueer, agender).

Revised Important Dates
Submissions due: Friday 10/1
Notification of acceptance: Sunday 10/4
Accepted speakers confirm participation: Wednesday 10/6
Slides due to us: Sunday: 10/17
Lightning Talk Event: Tuesday 10/19

---

This event will be hosted over Zoom -- the link will be available on this Meetup page at noon on the day of the event, and the passcode will be shared via email.
---

R-Ladies is dedicated to providing a harassment-free experience for everyone. We do not tolerate harassment of participants in any form. Please take a moment to review the R-Ladies Global code of conduct (particularly if this is your first time attending!): https://rladies.org/code-of-conduct

For questions regarding accessibility, please email us at nyc@rladies.org.

description:

FAQ:
Q: Are men welcome to attend R-Ladies events?
A: Yes, men are welcome at this event. Our mission is to encourage more women and non-binary individuals to get involved in the R community. However, we ask that cis men come as guests of women and gender minorities to our events to promote a sense support and encouragement for women and gender minorities in the R community. Please help us by spreading the word about R-Ladies. Please also take the time to review our code of conduct before you attend: https://github.com/rladies/starter-kit/wiki/Code-of-Conduct

The term "women and gender minorities" is inclusive of individuals who identify as female (trans and cis), trans-men, non-binary, genderqueer, genderfluid, agender, intersex, and all minority genders).

Important to know:

title: Bayes Rules! An Introduction to Bayesian Modeling with R
description:
Bayesian statistics?! Once an obscure term, this alternative to the more ingrained frequentist philosophy is having a moment (a long one). In this workshop, we’ll explore some core principles of the Bayesian philosophy, learn to think like Bayesians, and get our hands on some Bayesian models. The workshop materials will rely on the following R packages: tidyverse, bayesrules, bayesplot, rstan, rstanarm. The rstan package in particular would be great to install in advance and works best with R version 4.0.0 or later.

About Speaker

Alicia Johnson is an associate professor of statistics at Macalester College in St Paul, Minnesota. Her research interests span Bayesian statistics, computational statistics, and statistics / data science education. Outside of statistics, she enjoys building things, snow (during the appropriate months), and vitamin D among other things.

Please note:

We are limited to 100 attendees, so make sure to join on time if you'd like to participate in the live event. The workshop will be recorded and shared on our YouTube channel shortly after the meetup event.

title: Books In Bars - The Code Breaker: Jennifer Doudna, gene editing, and the future
description:
Spend Saturday evening discussing The Code Breaker (https://www.simonandschuster.com/books/The-Code-Breaker/Walter-Isaacson/9781982115852).

The bestselling author of Leonardo da Vinci and Steve Jobs returns with a gripping account of how Nobel Prize winner Jennifer Doudna and her colleagues launched a revolution that will allow us to cure diseases, fend off viruses, and have healthier babies.

When Jennifer Doudna was in sixth grade, she came home one day to find that her dad had left a paperback titled The Double Helix on her bed. She put it aside, thinking it was one of those detective tales she loved. When she read it on a rainy Saturday, she discovered she was right, in a way. As she sped through the pages, she became enthralled by the intense drama behind the competition to discover the code of life. Even though her high school counselor told her girls didn’t become scientists, she decided she would.

Driven by a passion to understand how nature works and to turn discoveries into inventions, she would help to make what the book’s author, James Watson, told her was the most important biological advance since his co-discovery of the structure of DNA. She and her collaborators turned ​a curiosity ​of nature into an invention that will transform the human race: an easy-to-use tool that can edit DNA. Known as CRISPR, it opened a brave new world of medical miracles and moral questions.

The development of CRISPR and the race to create vaccines for coronavirus will hasten our transition to the next great innovation revolution. The past half-century has been a digital age, based on the microchip, computer, and internet. Now we are entering a life-science revolution. Children who study digital coding will be joined by those who study genetic code.

Should we use our new evolution-hacking powers to make us less susceptible to viruses? What a wonderful boon that would be! And what about preventing depression? Hmmm…Should we allow parents, if they can afford it, to enhance the height or muscles or IQ of their kids?

After helping to discover CRISPR, Doudna became a leader in wrestling with these moral issues and, with her collaborator Emmanuelle Charpentier, won the Nobel Prize in 2020. Her story is a thrilling detective tale that involves the most profound wonders of nature, from the origins of life to the future of our species.

title: Workshop: ¡Aprendiendo a crear una Shiny app!
description:
¿Quieres aprender los fundamentos para crear una Shiny app mediante el caso de uso de un problema de data science? Estás en el lugar correcto.

¡Cuarto meetup del 2021!

Es hora de reencontrarnos y estamos muy felices 😀 de contar con dos destacadas profesionales:

* Rui Su
Consultora del Global Facility for Disaster Reduction and Recovery (GFDRR) del Banco Mundial. Realiza analítica de datos y análisis geoespacial en materia de resiliencia e inclusión social, integrando los resultados en narrativas cualitativas. Tiene una Maestría en Planificación Urbana por la Universidad de Harvard y cuenta con experiencia en organización comunitaria.

* Carla Solis Uehara
Consultora de ciencia de datos en los equipos de data analytics del Global Facility for Disaster Reduction and Recovery (GFDRR) y el Grupo de Cambio Climático en el Banco Mundial, donde evalúa las respuestas en materia de gestión del riesgo de desastres y los impactos de desastres naturales en los medios de vida de las personas. Tiene una Maestría en Análisis Computacional y Políticas Públicas por la Universidad de Chicago y es Economista de la PUCP.

• Requisitos:
-Asegúrate de tener instalado Zoom.
-Tener bases de programación en R. La auto-evaluación oficial de R es la siguiente: https://shiny.rstudio.com/tutorial/quiz/. Se debería considerar tener esta base, sin embargo, esto no es estrictamente necesario si es que se quiere ver este meetup como una motivación. Para aprender la base, este es el mejor recurso por donde empezar: https://education.rstudio.com/learn/beginner/
-Recomendamos tener instalado los siguientes paquetes para que puedas replicar el código durante el taller: shiny, tidyverse, shinydashboard, shinythemes, shinywidgets, y ggplot (¡aunque este viene en tidyverse!)

***IMPORTANTE***
Para participar, dale "Asistiré" en este evento.
Por razones de seguridad no compartiremos el link para ingresar a Zoom de manera pública. Estaremos enviando un correo con el link de zoom.
Cualquier consulta nos pueden escribir por nuestras redes.

• Pregunta frecuente:
P: ¿Los chicos son bienvenidos a las reuniones de R-Ladies Lima?
R: Sí, los chicos son bienvenidos a cualquiera de nuestros eventos. Puedes revisar nuestro código de conducta global aquí: https://github.com/rladies/starter-kit/wiki/Code-of-Conduct

title: Third Meetup (Pertemuan 003) - Mengenal R dan RStudio Part I and II
description:
Dear R-Ladies,

It's time to meetup again!

Material:
1. Short Introduction to R-Ladies, R, and RStudio
2. Types of data in R
3. Import data in R
4. Index and modify data
5. Functions

Sebelum pelatihan, harap menginstall R dan RStudio di:
https://repo.bppt.go.id/cran/
https://rstudio.com/products/rstudio/download/#download
Jika ingin membuat package, ataupun install package dari "source" sehingga bisa otak atik package lain, download Rtools (Windows):
https://repo.bppt.go.id/cran/bin/windows/Rtools/
Mohon sesuaikan dengan OS dan kebutuhan.

We hope to see you there,
R-Ladies Banda Aceh Organizers

title: R for Data Science Book Club (Meeting 7)
description:
R-Ladies DC will be reading R for Data Science in 8 biweekly meetings (July 15, July 29, Aug 12, Aug 26, Sept 9, Sept 23, Oct 14, Oct 28).

The selected book chapters should be read before the meeting time.

There are also exercises for each week which you should aim to complete before the meeting as well. We'll go through solutions to the exercises as a group. In most weeks, we'll also do some additional exercises from the chapters live during the meeting.

It's okay if you're not able to complete everything ahead of time, we understand that life happens. Please still attend the meeting, even if you didn't read everything or complete all the exercises.

In addition, if you have to miss a meeting time, all code will be made available after the meeting on Github: https://github.com/sctyner/r4ds-bookclub-rladiesdc

Note on the exercises: For all exercises, we will use the online version of the book. There are some differences between the online and print exercises, so we'll stick with the online ones so that everyone is doing the same exercises.

Note on meeting access: All meetings will be virtual. You must RSVP to the meeting on the R-Ladies DC Meetup page to receive the Zoom link. All meetings will take place on a Thursday from 7:00-8:30pm ET (America/New York).

Meeting 7 (October 14, 2021): Model

Physical book chapters (Pages)
All of Part IV 341-419

Ebook Chapters & Link
Ch. 22: Introduction https://r4ds.had.co.nz/model-intro.html
Ch. 23: Model basics https://r4ds.had.co.nz/model-basics.html
Ch. 24: Model building https://r4ds.had.co.nz/model-building.html
Ch. 25: Many models https://r4ds.had.co.nz/many-models.html

Exercises (from online book chapters)
Chapter 23: Section 23.2.1 #1
Chapter 23: Section 23.3.3 #1
Chapter 23: Section 23.4.5 #1
Chapter 24: Section 24.2.3 #3
Chapter 24: Section 24.3.5 #3
Chapter 25: Section 25.2.5 #1

title: Club de lectura: R para Ciencia de Datos (Wickham & Grolemund) - Sesión 12
description:
Las R-Ladies de Barranquilla (COL), Galápagos, Guayaquil y Milagro (ECU) nos hemos unido para traerte un club de lectura basado en el libro R para Ciencia de Datos de Wickham y Grolemund. Este libro está disponible en español gracias al esfuerzo de la comunidad R latinoamericana y puede ser accedido de manera libre aquí: https://es.r4ds.hadley.nz.

En esta sesión 12 de nuestro club de lectura, Mercedes Soledispa Lucas, Naomy Vera Valero y Julissa Magallanes Baque de R-Ladies Milagro hablarán sobre la construcción de modelos estadísticos en R (Capítulos 24 y 25).

Este club de lectura incluirá varias sesiones quincenales que se llevarán a cabo a través de Zoom. Cada sesión durará dos horas durante las cuales discutiremos y practicaremos los puntos más importantes del capítulo o capítulos en el que nos enfoquemos para esa sesión.

Recuerda, las sesiones son los jueves de cada quincena empezando a las 18:00 (UTC-5, Colombia y Ecuador Continental), o si estás en Galápagos a las 17:00 (UTC-6).

Al participar en nuestros eventos recuerda que estás aceptando nuestro código de conducta, el cual nos ayuda a crear un espacio amable y seguro para aprender: https://github.com/rladies/starter-kit/wiki/Code-of-Conduct#spanish

title: [ONLINE] #tidytuesday Work Group (on a Wednesday)
description:
Join fellow R-Ladies in exploring a #tidytuesday data set! For those craving human connection and some practice flexing your data science skills, this is the event for you! We will hold our event via Zoom, where you can meet other R-ladies, improve your R skills, and build your data science portfolio. This event is for people at all levels of R (beginner through advanced).

The dataset we will explore will be posted before we meet.

Agenda (all times in ET):
6:30 - 6:45 pm Meet & Greet
6:45 - 7:45 pm #tidytuesday
7:45 - 8:00 pm Discussion

What is #tidytuesday?
#TidyTuesday is a weekly social data project created by the R4DS online learning community that is focused on using tidyverse packages. A new data set and accompanying article featuring an interesting plot is released on Github every Monday. The goal is to generate a copy of the original plot or create your own original approach!

For more information on #tidytuesday, check out this blog post (https://bit.ly/2HqEsdt) and the main repository page (https://github.com/rfordatascience/tidytuesday).

This will be the first part of a multipart TidyTuesday event where we will be looking at a local (!) urban heat mapping dataset brought to us by collaborators at the Museum of Life and Science (https://www.lifeandscience.org/) and the State Climate Office of NC (https://climate.ncsu.edu/). These data were collected using PocketLab temperature sensors (https://www.thepocketlab.com/store/pocketlab-weather?hsLang=en) as folks walked around Durham and Raleigh this past summer (#walkingForScience). You can read hear more about this project in this WUNC feature here (https://www.wunc.org/race-demographics/2021-08-11/urban-heat-mapping-project-durham-race-policies-climate-google).

Who is this for?
New and experienced R users alike! Let's learn together! All are welcome, including R-Ladies RTP members and R-Ladies from around the world.

What should I bring?
You'll need a computer with videoconferencing capabilities and R. Serve yourself a beverage and a snack to fuel your evening!

Where will it take place?
**Please join us online via Zoom.** A link to join will be provided when you RSVP.

All events are intended for women as leaders, mentors, members, and attendees. We are emphatically queer and trans friendly. Men are welcomed to attend *as guests* and must be accompanied by the R-Lady who invited them. This group was created so those who identify as women have a comfortable place to learn. If you would like to attend and feel excluded, please introduce yourself to an organizer.

title: Level up your ggplot: What is the deal with theme()?
description:
The options in ggplot's theme() are incredibly useful - they let you design every little detail of your graph. With just a couple lines of code, you can change the titles, labels, fonts, background, gridlines, and legends of your plots to customise their size, placement, colour, orientation, and more!

But these options can also feel confusing and overwhelming. Many of us struggle to use theme(), or need to consult Google every time to find the correct command...

After this workshop, you'll feel more comfortable with harnessing the power of theme(). We'll dive into text elements like titles and labels, as well as explore the options concerning axes, legends, gridlines and the plot background in a structured way so you understand just how theme() works.

This is the first in 3 "level up your ggplot" meetups -- feel free to join any or all in any order. On November 10th, we'll continue with a discussion of custom fonts and how they work with theme() too.. and more!

---
It's important to us to ensure that R-Ladies Freiburg events are a safe space for gender minorities and especially those who are just starting out with R. All are welcome at this meetup but we specifically ask cisgender men to take a passive role in this meetup and hold comments/ questions until after others have had the chance to ask. Thank you for your support!

title: Intro to Tidyverse
description:
Join us as we welcome Jess McKay, MSW, for the second of four introductory workshops in our octobeR extRavaganza!

Workshop Description:

In this workshop, we will go over the basics of how to use dplyr to make your code readable and replicable.

About the Instructor:

Jess McKay, MSW (she/her) is a Data Associate at the Financial Health Network.

How to Attend:

Please use the Zoom link posted to this Meetup event.

title: Introdução a Análise de Paisagens
description:
Heey, tudo bem?

Estamos muito felizes com a sua participação.

Aproveite o curso. Aproveite essa oportunidade! Este evento foi pensado com muito carinho para você.

O que você vai aprender?

Ler, projetar, reclassificar e recortar áreas de interesse. Identificar paisagens de interesse em uma região e analisar conectividade estrutural e funcional. Você vai aprender sobre o universo Rspatial.

Quais pacotes vão ser utilizados ?

library(sf)
library(raster)
library(landscapemetrics)

Sobre o Projeto Enigma

O projeto Enigma busca tornar visível o papel feminino na área da computação, resgatando as contribuições significativas de algumas mulheres de uma forma diferenciada, que provoque o pensamento do fruidor. Não pretende-se reproduzir as visibilidades que estas personagens já têm, mas fazer uma provocação, desacomodando o pensamento para que as invisibilidades, que ainda persistem, se tornem visíveis. As doações serão voltadas a reforma de artigos doados ao projeto como computadores, teclados e entre outros objetos do universo computacional.

Para saber mais sobre este projeto lindo acesse https://www.ufrgs.br/enigma/

E aí? Topa?

Link de inscrição: https://www.sympla.com.br/produtor/cursosonline

Dúvidas frequentes:

CERTIFICADOS! - O certificado de 4h do evento será enviado para o seu e-mail. Caso você não receba ao final do evento, escreva para goiania@rladies.org.

MATERIAIS! - Os materiais utilizados no nosso curso (apresentação, scripts) serão disponibilizados através do nosso GitHub .

Dicas importantes para melhor aproveitamento do evento

(1°) Procure conectar o seu computador no cabo de rede, evitando instabilidades na transmissão;
(2°) Pré-configure a sua câmera e microfone antes de entrar no evento pois será útil para as interações com a professora em caso de dúvidas!
(3°) Prepare seu ambiente, aquela caneca de café, garrafa de água e os fones de ouvido, melhores companheiros para se concentrar e mergulhar de cabeça nessa experiência!
(4°) Não guarde esse conhecimento apenas para você, compartilhe com seus amigos e redes sociais marcando a gente no instagram @rladiesgyn.

Você faz parte desse compromisso

Lembre-se que o Código de Conduta também se estende à versão online de nossos eventos e não será tolerada qualquer forma de assédios ou intimidações de qualquer participante, seja audiência, palestrantes, colaboradores, ou quaisquer membros da comunidade.

A gente brilha TOGETHER!

title: Cluster analysis, interpolation techniques and more using R
description:
*What are we going to learn:
We will have two short talks:
1) Cluster Analysis in R : lessons learnt from a real life problem
2) Preparation of monthly rainfall maps based on interpolation techniques using location-based and hybrid approaches

title: Introduction to R Markdown
description:
Are you tired of copy-pasting information from R into Word documents?
Are you a newbie to R markdown and want to get started?
Have you already used R markdown but want to learn some new tricks?

If you answered yes, join us for our Introduction to R markdown presentation! We'll take an introductory tour of R markdown and then explore how to customize documents with figures, tables, automated figure and table numbering, literature citations, and more.

To follow along, we recommend having R and RStudio installed on your computer, as well as the following R packages: "rmarkdown," "tinytex," and "tidyverse."

We hope you will join us with your beveRage of choice and lots of R enthusiasm.

R-Ladies Gainesville welcomes members of all R proficiency levels, whether you're a new or aspiring R user, or an experienced R programmer interested in mentoring, networking & expert upskilling.

Please RSVP to receive the Zoom link before the event.

Please note:
In line with R-Ladies’ Mission Statement to encourage participation in the R community by underrepresented genders/identities (https://rladies.org/about-us/), our events are designed for those individuals (including, but not limited to cis/trans women, trans men, non-binary, genderqueer, agender). If you have any questions, please contact the event organizers.

title: FAIR research data & citable code
description:
Did you know that Open Science is becoming the "new normal"? Join R-Ladies Bergen to learn what this new normal means. We will delve into the principles of FAIR research that enable your data to become "Findable, Accessible, Interoperable, and Reusable." How does this enhance your research? When you adhere to FAIR principles, your work becomes more accessible and visible to researchers in different institutions or even different fields. This leads to more visibility for your research, new collaborations, and more citations of your published research articles.

We are delighted to host Jenny Ostrop who will describe more fully the motivation behind FAIR principles and provide tips on how to create citable code. Jenny is a Senior Academic Librarian at the Mathematics and Natural Sciences Library. As part of the research support team, Jenny provides guidance on Open Science, Research Data and Research Data Management.

title: Developing R Packages for Yourself and Others
description:
Please join us for a presentation on creating R packages with guest speaker Reiko Okamoto. Thank you Reiko for bringing your R-Ladies Vancouver presentation to R-Ladies Seattle!

Event Description: R packages are a collection of functions, documentation, and sample data. Not only do they provide an excellent framework for organizing your code, but they also make it easier to share code with other R users. In this workshop, we’ll develop a simple R package together to gain an understanding of the key steps of package development. I’ll also reflect on my experiences creating an internal package for my team at the BC Ministry of Health. I hope to shed light on the lesser-known non-technical aspects of package development by discussing how to identify what tools your teammates need to succeed and how to encourage them to adopt your package. This workshop is geared towards (but not limited to) those who are new to developing packages and those who are thinking of creating one to share within their organization and beyond.

**This workshop assumes you know how to write a function in R and are familiar with the RStudio IDE. (See below for resources and required packages) ***

About the Speaker: Reiko is a data analyst with the Government of British Columbia. In her role, she creates various tools using R to support her team’s work in monitoring trends in population health and health inequalities in the province. When her computer is turned off, she splits her time as a recreational bassist, aspiring Star Baker, and occasional trainspotter.

General workshop information:

- Please expect a hands-on session in a friendly and laid-back atmosphere where we all encouraged to learn together.
- This workshop assumes you know how to write a function in R and are familiar with the RStudio IDE. Follow the links below for a refresher:
- Yuka Takemon's Base R functions tutorial: https://www.yukatakemon.com/post/rladies-functions/rladies-building-functions/

Software requirements:
- R (Free at https://cran.r-project.org/)
- RStudio (Free at https://www.rstudio.com/products/rstudio/download/)

Package requirements: (Install the following using
`install.packages("packageNameHere")` in your console)
- devtools
- roxygen2
- testthat
- knitr

If this is your first R-Ladies event, please take a moment to review our R-Ladies Global code of conduct: https://github.com/rladies/.github/blob/master/CODE_OF_CONDUCT.md

title: Getting Started with R
description:
Join us as we welcome David Keyes for our first of four octobeR workshops!

Workshop Description:

Some users struggle to figure out the nuts and bolts of getting started: what do you need to download (wait, there’s R and RStudio?), where do you enter code, etc. Others become overwhelmed, in a classic example of the paradox of choice, with all of the resources available online for learning R. How do you know which approach to using R (and there are many!) is best? In this workshop, you’ll learn what you need to get up and running with R, including getting R and RStudio set up, working with projects, installing and loading packages, importing and examining data, and more.

About David:

David Keyes is the CEO of R for the Rest of Us. Through online courses and custom trainings, he helps people and organizations learn R, the most powerful tool for data analysis and visualization (which also happens to be free).

In addition to training folks to use R, David does consulting work with research and evaluation organizations, foundations, and others. David's creates high-quality data visualization, helps organizations to use R to improve their workflow, and much more.

One of the main obstacles that many new R users face is simply getting started.

How to Attend:

We will add the zoom link for the workshop closer to the workshop date.

title: Panel Discussion: Working with & learning from COVID-19 data
description:
We are thrilled to host a series of experts to discuss their experiences working with different types of COVID-19 data, insights they've gleaned, and challenges they've encountered with these complex and rapidly evolving data.

Panelists:
Lucy D’Agostino McGowan is an assistant professor in the Mathematics and Statistics Department at Wake Forest University. She received her PhD in Biostatistics from Vanderbilt University and completed her postdoctoral training at Johns Hopkins University Bloomberg School of Public Health. Her research focuses on statistical communication, causal inference, data science pedagogy, and human-data interaction. Dr. D’Agostino McGowan is the 2021 chair of the American Statistical Association’s Committee on Women in Statistics and can be found online at lucymcgowan.com, blogging at livefreeordichotomize.com, on Twitter @LucyStats, and podcasting on the American Journal of Epidemiology partner podcast, Casual Inference.

Lynsie Daley is currently serving as a data and analytics supervisor at Intermountain Healthcare based in Salt Lake City. She leads a team of talented data professionals who work across the clinical spectrum supporting areas such as lab, clinical engineering, imaging, and pain. Lynsie also currently serves as Chair of the Women in Analytics group as part of HDAA (Healthcare Data and Analytics Association) and is very passionate about promoting STEM careers to young girls and women and advocating for women currently in the analytics field. She holds both a BS and an MS in statistics from Utah State University.

Kat Hoffman is a biostatistician for the Pulmonary and Critical Care team at Weill Cornell Medicine in New York City. During NYC’s spring 2020 COVID-19 surge she assisted with hospital operations work, and in the time since has transitioned primarily to COVID-19 ICU patient outcome research.

Michael Kane is an Assistant Professor of Biostatistics at Yale University and Founder of Telperian Inc., which provides strategic decision support for clinical trial programs. His research focuses on methods and tools for understanding population-level human mobility along with incorporating patient heterogeneity into clinical trial design and analysis. Dr. Kane is a member of Stanford University’s and the R Consortium’s COVID 19 Data Forum and he is a current recipient of the NSF’s Human Networks and Data Science Infrastructure grant which seeks to create a “science of human mobility” in conjunction with AT&T Labs Research. Since the pandemic started he has been trying to quantify the effect of human mobility on the spread of COVID 19.

---

This event will be hosted over Zoom; the link will be available on this page the morning of the event, and the passcode will be emailed to you.
---

R-Ladies is dedicated to providing a harassment-free experience for everyone. We do not tolerate harassment of participants in any form. Please take a moment to review the R-Ladies Global code of conduct (particularly if this is your first time attending!): https://rladies.org/code-of-conduct

For questions regarding accessibility, please email us at nyc@rladies.org.

title: Machine Learning with tidymodels
description:
Whether you are just starting out on machine learning or have years of experience with modeling, tidymodels offers a consistent, flexible framework for your work.

Our guest speaker and well-known instructor, Hamid Abdulsalam, would be taking us step by step through the tidymodels framework which is a collection of packages for modeling and machine learning using tidyverse principles.

Hamid is the Lead Data Scientist at Factual Analytics, Nigeria. His research interests include statistical inference, statistical computing, machine learning and deep learning.
Hamid received a master’s degree in Statistics from the Ahmadu Bello University, Zaria and a bachelor’s degree in Statistics from the University of Nigeria, Nsukka.
On Datasium, he blogs about data science and analytics.

title: Club de lectura R para Ciencia de Datos (Wickham & Grolemund) - Sesión 11
description:
Las R-Ladies de Barranquilla (COL), Galápagos, Guayaquil y Milagro (ECU) nos hemos unido para traerte un club de lectura basado en el libro R para Ciencia de Datos de Wickham y Grolemund. Este libro está disponible en español gracias al esfuerzo de la comunidad R latinoamericana y puede ser accedido de manera libre aquí: https://es.r4ds.hadley.nz.

En esta sesión 11 de nuestro club de lectura, Danisse y Viviana de R-Ladies Barranquilla hablarán sobre los conceptos básicos de cómo armar un modelo (Capítulo 23).

Este club de lectura incluirá varias sesiones quincenales que se llevarán a cabo a través de Zoom. Cada sesión durará dos horas durante las cuales discutiremos y practicaremos los puntos más importantes del capítulo o capítulos en el que nos enfoquemos para esa sesión.

Recuerda, las sesiones son los jueves de cada quincena empezando a las 18:00 (UTC-5, Colombia y Ecuador Continental), o si estás en Galápagos a las 17:00 (UTC-6).

Al participar en nuestros eventos recuerda que estás aceptando nuestro código de conducta, el cual nos ayuda a crear un espacio amable y seguro para aprender: https://github.com/rladies/starter-kit/wiki/Code-of-Conduct#spanish

title: GRUPO 3. TALLER DE ESTUDIO LIBRO "R PARA CIENCIA DE DATOS"
description:
¡Desde RLadies Bariloche les invitamos a comenzar con el estudio en grupo del libro R para Ciencia de Datos (versión traducida al español de R for Data Science) de Hadley Wickham (el creador de Tidyverse y varios paquetes más!). El libro es de libre acceso en https://es.r4ds.hadley.nz/ ¡Está muy bueno!

• Nos juntaremos de forma virtual una vez cada 15 días para avanzar con la lectura y comprensión del libro y los scripts. Cada encuentro será guiado por uno o dos integrantes del grupo.

• En el primer encuentro discutiremos el capitulo número 3 “visualización de datos” (¡Qué bueno, empezamos con gráficos con ggplot2 ) https://es.r4ds.hadley.nz/visualizaci%C3%B3n-de-datos.html Es necesario llegar a la reunión con el capítulo previamente leído y trabajado. Quienes no leyeron la introducción del libro aún: adelante, es corta, y les dará un panorama de lo que iremos estudiando. En la reunión de organización vimos un panorama de la introducción.

• En base a la encuesta de horarios que hicimos, hemos definido tres grupos de trabajo con distintos horarios. ¡ATENCIÓN! ¡Por favor, anotarse solo en uno de los tres! AHORA ESTÁS EN EL MEETUP DEL GRUPO 3, DE JUEVES DE 18 A 20.

• ¡Importante! Ni bien se inscriban en el meetup, entren a los ajustes de su perfil y verifiquen tener activas las notificaciones, no sólo del meetup en general, sino del grupo RLadies-BRC en particular (figuran abajo del todo en notificaciones por correo electrónico) para poder recibir luego el enlace para conectarse y otras notificaciones relacionadas al evento.

• Quienes se inscriban al meetup y si aún no se sumaron, van a recibir más adelante un enlace para sumarse al espacio de trabajo de slack que es exclusivo para el estudio del libro y que será nuestra principal vía de comunicación. Si nunca lo usaron y/o necesitan ayuda para familiarizarse, escríbannos y les damos una orientación rápida.

• Necesitamos uno o dos voluntarias o voluntarios para guiar el capítulo número 3. Interesadxs nos lo pueden comunicar por el slack o al correo bariloche@rladies.org. Cuanto antes, mejor. En caso de que nadie se ofrezca, haremos un sorteo (con el comando sample() en R!!!).

• A partir del primer encuentro, cada grupo de trabajo se auto-gestionará. Por ejemplo, sorteará o decidirá quién guiará el siguiente capítulo, si verán un capítulo, medio capítulo o dos capítulos (la propuesta general es ir despacio, lento pero sin tregua), si aplicarán lo que se vió en el capítulo a otro set de datos etc. Contamos con el espacio de slack para consultarnos y compartir información en cada grupo y entre grupos.

Al anotarse, les pedimos que primero lean y acepten el código de conducta que encontrarán en la página.

Para asistir al meetup, les recomendamos poseer una cuenta de google (utilizaremos google meet). Se recomienda tener conocimientos básicos de R.

¡ATENCIÓN! por cuestiones de seguridad virtual, el enlace a la reunión se enviará unos minutos antes de la misma. Por ello les pedimos que
estén alertas al correo.

title: Intro to Shiny Apps
description:
Want an easy way for users to interact with your data without using any html? Shiny is an R package that makes it easy to build interactive web apps straight from R. In this tutorial we'll show you how to build a basic shiny app and host it online. You'll also get to see examples of apps built by RLEL members! For a preview of the types of apps you can build with Shiny see https://shiny.rstudio.com/gallery/ .

Please fill out this form to register and receive the zoom information: https://forms.gle/6g1nQaHqgJJG2Rmy6

title: Tune xgboost with {tidymodels} 👩🏽‍💻
description:
Description: The tidymodels framework is a collection of packages for modeling and machine learning using tidyverse principles. In this meetup, we will walk through a case study from SLICED (the competitive data science streaming show) on predicting Airbnb prices in NYC, and use hands-on live coding to learn how to use tidymodels to tune xgboost models. Come with your questions as we interactively code together and learn about topics like regression modeling, resampling, and model evaluation!

Bio: Julia Silge is a data scientist and software engineer at RStudio PBC where she works on open source modeling tools. She is an author, an international keynote speaker, and a real-world practitioner focusing on data analysis and machine learning practice. Julia loves text analysis, making beautiful charts, and communicating about technical topics with diverse audiences.

title: Club de lectura del libro "Data Feminism" (sesión 4)
description:
El próximo jueves 30 de septiembre nos reuniremos para nuestra cuarta sesión del club de lectura sobre libro "Data Feminism", de Catherine D'Ignazio y Lauren F. Klein. Este libro muestra una nueva forma de abordar la ciencia de datos y la ética de datos basada en ideas del feminismo interseccional. Se puede acceder de forma gratuita en: https://data-feminism.mitpress.mit.edu/

- ¿Cómo funciona el club de lectura?
Dividiremos la lectura del libro en seis sesiones. En cada una de ellas abordaremos un capítulo del libro. Cada sesión la liderará alguien de nuestra comunidad.
Esta cuarta sesión estará a cargo de Francesca Rosales (https://www.linkedin.com/in/francesca-danae-rosales-rojas-314457b6/), cientista política y estudiante del magíster en Pensamiento Contemporáneo. Durante la sesión comentaremos el capítulo 4, "4. "What Gets Counted Counts", en el que se presenta el cuarto principio del feminismo de datos: repensar los binarismos y las jerarquías.

- ¿Qué pasa si no puedo leer en inglés?
¡Puedes participar igual! La persona encargada de cada sesión hará una síntesis de los puntos más importantes, así que incluso si no puedes revisar el libro, podrás aprender sobre este tema :)

- CÓDIGO DE CONDUCTA
Queremos que este sea un espacio de aprendizaje amable y seguro. Al inscribirte en este evento estás aceptando nuestro código de conducta: https://github.com/rladies/starter-kit/wiki/Code-of-Conduct#spanish
El evento se realizará a través de la plataforma Zoom. El día del taller compartiremos la contraseña en los comentarios del evento.

- HORA
El evento se realizará a las 17:00 horas de la zona horaria UTC-3. Puedes revisar a qué hora corresponde en tu zona en el siguiente enlace: https://everytimezone.com/s/7ac3db47

title: Club de lectura del libro "Data Feminism" (sesión 4)
description:
El próximo jueves 30 de septiembre nos reuniremos para nuestra cuarta sesión del club de lectura sobre libro "Data Feminism", de Catherine D'Ignazio y Lauren F. Klein. Este libro muestra una nueva forma de abordar la ciencia de datos y la ética de datos basada en ideas del feminismo interseccional. Se puede acceder de forma gratuita en: https://data-feminism.mitpress.mit.edu/

- ¿Cómo funciona el club de lectura?
Dividiremos la lectura del libro en seis sesiones. En cada una de ellas abordaremos un capítulo del libro. Cada sesión la liderará alguien de nuestra comunidad.
Esta cuarta sesión estará a cargo de Francesca Rosales (https://www.linkedin.com/in/francesca-danae-rosales-rojas-314457b6/), cientista política y estudiante del magíster en Pensamiento Contemporáneo. Durante la sesión comentaremos el capítulo 4, "4. "What Gets Counted Counts", en el que se presenta el cuarto principio del feminismo de datos: repensar los binarismos y las jerarquías.

- ¿Qué pasa si no puedo leer en inglés?
¡Puedes participar igual! La persona encargada de cada sesión hará una síntesis de los puntos más importantes, así que incluso si no puedes revisar el libro, podrás aprender sobre este tema :)

- CÓDIGO DE CONDUCTA
Queremos que este sea un espacio de aprendizaje amable y seguro. Al inscribirte en este evento estás aceptando nuestro código de conducta: https://github.com/rladies/starter-kit/wiki/Code-of-Conduct#spanish
El evento se realizará a través de la plataforma Zoom. El día del taller compartiremos la contraseña en los comentarios del evento.

title: Club de lectura R para Ciencia de Datos (Wickham & Grolemund) - Sesión 11
description:
Las R-Ladies de Barranquilla (COL), Galápagos, Guayaquil y Milagro (ECU) nos hemos unido para traerte un club de lectura basado en el libro R para Ciencia de Datos de Wickham y Grolemund. Este libro está disponible en español gracias al esfuerzo de la comunidad R latinoamericana y puede ser accedido de manera libre aquí: https://es.r4ds.hadley.nz.

En esta sesión 11 de nuestro club de lectura, Danisse y Viviana de R-Ladies Barranquilla hablarán sobre los conceptos básicos de cómo armar un modelo (Capítulo 23).

Este club de lectura incluirá varias sesiones quincenales que se llevarán a cabo a través de Zoom. Cada sesión durará dos horas durante las cuales discutiremos y practicaremos los puntos más importantes del capítulo o capítulos en el que nos enfoquemos para esa sesión.

Recuerda, las sesiones son los jueves de cada quincena empezando a las 18:00 (UTC-5, Colombia y Ecuador Continental), o si estás en Galápagos a las 17:00 (UTC-6).

Al participar en nuestros eventos recuerda que estás aceptando nuestro código de conducta, el cual nos ayuda a crear un espacio amable y seguro para aprender: https://github.com/rladies/starter-kit/wiki/Code-of-Conduct#spanish

title: ¡Primer meet-up R-Ladies Guayaquil!
description:
¡Comienza la iniciativa en la ciudad! ¡Bienvenid@s!
En esta primera reunión nos conoceremos y te diremos qué trae consigo esta maravillosa iniciativa. ¿Las mujeres participan en ciencias? ¿matemáticas? ¿tecnologías?, no sólo contestaremos estas preguntas; también explicaremos qué es R y cómo su uso es transversal en distintas áreas de aplicación.
Recuerda que todos los eventos son gratuitos.

¡Anímate a estar 15 minutos antes de la hora de inicio para el registro!

¡L@s esperamos!

title: Análisis y procesamiento de texto en R
description:
Prepárate porque volvemos!
Próximamente tendremos nuestro tercer encuentro del año 2021. Acompáñanos y aprende a analizar y procesar datos en R.

Recomendamos descargar previamente el contenido que utilizaremos durante la sesión, para esto puedes acceder a nuestro repositorio en Github.

Te esperamos...

Hora: 6:15 - 8:30 pm
Espacio virtual: https://udea.zoom.us/j/97186029771
Enlace contenido en Github: https://github.com/RLadiesMedellin

title: From messy data to beautiful plot: Guided TidyTuesday
description:
Know the basics of data wrangling but want some hands-on practice? Want to learn ggplot tips and tricks to make your plots eye-catching? Seen cool visualizations on Twitter but find it hard to go from messy dataset to beautiful visualization?

In this monthly meetup, we’ll go through a Tidy Tuesday dataset together step-by-step, walking you through the entire process from coming up with an interesting question to asnwer, getting the data in the right format and finally, creating a cool visualization!

You may have heard of Tidy Tuesday -- a weekly initiative by R for Data Science which provides a new dataset every week for the community to practice wrangling and visualizing. It has a huge Twitter community and is one of the best ways to practice and develop tidyverse skills, whether you’re still reviewing the basics or have quite the repertoire. This series has something for everyone and is especially designed to be beginner friendly!

It's important to us to ensure that Guided Tidy Tuesday is a safe space for gender minorities and especially those who are just starting out with R. Studies have shown that letting gender minorities speak first promotes a welcoming and supportive atmosphere for underrepresented groups. All are welcome at this meetup but we specifically ask cisgender men to take a passive role in this meetup and hold comments / questions until after others have had the chance to ask. Thank you for your support!

title: GRUPO 2. TALLER DE ESTUDIO LIBRO "R PARA CIENCIA DE DATOS"
description:
¡Desde RLadies Bariloche les invitamos a comenzar con el estudio en grupo del libro R para Ciencia de Datos (versión traducida al español de R for Data Science) de Hadley Wickham (el creador de Tidyverse y varios paquetes más!). El libro es de libre acceso en https://es.r4ds.hadley.nz/ ¡Está muy bueno!

• Nos juntaremos de forma virtual una vez cada 15 días para avanzar con la lectura y comprensión del libro y los scripts. Cada encuentro será guiado por uno o dos integrantes del grupo.

• En el primer encuentro discutiremos el capitulo número 3 “visualización de datos” (¡Qué bueno, empezamos con gráficos con ggplot2 ) https://es.r4ds.hadley.nz/visualizaci%C3%B3n-de-datos.html Es necesario llegar a la reunión con el capítulo previamente leído y trabajado. Quienes no leyeron la introducción del libro aún: adelante, es corta, y les dará un panorama de lo que iremos estudiando. En la reunión de organización vimos un panorama de la introducción.

• En base a la encuesta de horarios que hicimos, hemos definido tres grupos de trabajo con distintos horarios. ¡ATENCIÓN! ¡Por favor, anotarse solo en uno de los tres! AHORA ESTÁS EN EL MEETUP DEL GRUPO 2, DE MIÉRCOLES DE 14 A 16.

• ¡Importante! Ni bien se inscriban en el meetup, entren a los ajustes de su perfil y verifiquen tener activas las notificaciones, no sólo del meetup en general, sino del grupo RLadies-BRC en particular (figuran abajo del todo en notificaciones por correo electrónico) para poder recibir luego el enlace para conectarse y otras notificaciones relacionadas al evento.

• Quienes se inscriban al meetup y si aún no se sumaron, van a recibir más adelante un enlace para sumarse al espacio de trabajo de slack que es exclusivo para el estudio del libro y que será nuestra principal vía de comunicación. Si nunca lo usaron y/o necesitan ayuda para familiarizarse, escríbannos y les damos una orientación rápida.

• Necesitamos uno o dos voluntarias o voluntarios para guiar el capítulo número 3. Interesadxs nos lo pueden comunicar por el slack o al correo bariloche@rladies.org. Cuanto antes, mejor. En caso de que nadie se ofrezca, haremos un sorteo (con el comando sample() en R!!!).

• A partir del primer encuentro, cada grupo de trabajo se auto-gestionará. Por ejemplo, sorteará o decidirá quién guiará el siguiente capítulo, si verán un capítulo, medio capítulo o dos capítulos (la propuesta general es ir despacio, lento pero sin tregua), si aplicarán lo que se vió en el capítulo a otro set de datos etc. Contamos con el espacio de slack para consultarnos y compartir información en cada grupo y entre grupos.

Al anotarse, les pedimos que primero lean y acepten el código de conducta que encontrarán en la página.

Para asistir al meetup, les recomendamos poseer una cuenta de google (utilizaremos google meet). Se recomienda tener conocimientos básicos de R.

¡ATENCIÓN! por cuestiones de seguridad virtual, el enlace a la reunión se enviará unos minutos antes de la misma. Por ello les pedimos que
estén alertas al correo.

title: [ONLINE]- Intro to Bayesian Statistics in R
description:
Hi, everybody!
We are super excited to have Angelika Stefan with us PhD candidate at the Psychological Methods department at the University of Amsterdam, - sharing her knowledge with us Bayesian statistics with R!

DESCRIPTION
-------------------
Bayesian data analysis presents an attractive alternative to p-value hypothesis testing. In the past years, Bayesian methods have become increasingly popular because they provide several advantages to the applied researcher, such as the ability to quantify evidence and successively update it as data come in.

In this workshop, I will give an introduction to the basic concepts of Bayesian statistics, such as the prior distribution, the posterior distribution, and the Bayes factor. After a brief conceptual introduction, we will fit a simple Bayesian model using just Base-R. I will finish the workshop by giving an outlook to more complex models, and present R-packages that can be used for advanced hypothesis testing and parameter estimation in the Bayesian framework.

ABOUT ANGELIKA
---------------------

I am a PhD student in the Psychological Methods department at the University of Amsterdam. My research mostly focuses on subjective Bayesian methods and experimental design planning; that is, I investigate statistical methods that can make research in psychology more efficient and allow researchers to incorporate existing knowledge into their models. I am a member of the JASP team and a co-founder of the ReproducibiliTea Amsterdam chapter. I am passionate about making science and statistics accessible to everyone, and have given various workshops about Bayesian statistics and Open Science in the past.

title: Intermediate git & GitHub lightning talks
description:
There will be approx. 5 lightning talks (5-8 minutes) on topics ranging from pull requests to GitHub actions to security with time for questions and discussion at the end.

There is no prerequisite knowledge for attendees; however, if you are not a git user you may find it helpful to look through the materials for our Git through April workshops ahead of time https://github.com/kdillmcfarland/2021-04-02-r-ladies-seattle-online/tree/gh-pages/_episodes/R-ladies.

title: [ONLINE] #tidytuesday Work Group (on a Monday)
description:
Join fellow R-Ladies in exploring a #tidytuesday data set! For those craving human connection and some practice flexing your data science skills, this is the event for you! We will hold our event via Zoom, where you can meet other R-ladies, improve your R skills, and build your data science portfolio. This event is for people at all levels of R (beginner through advanced).

The dataset we will explore will be posted before we meet.

Agenda (all times in ET):
6:30 - 6:45 pm Meet & Greet
6:45 - 7:45 pm #tidytuesday
7:45 - 8:00 pm Discussion

What is #tidytuesday?
#TidyTuesday is a weekly social data project created by the R4DS online learning community that is focused on using tidyverse packages. A new data set and accompanying article featuring an interesting plot is released on Github every Monday. The goal is to generate a copy of the original plot or create your own original approach!

For more information on #tidytuesday, check out this blog post: https://bit.ly/2HqEsdt

For this event, we will be looking at data related to the Olympics. See https://github.com/rfordatascience/tidytuesday/blob/master/data/2021/2021-07-27/readme.md for more information.

Who is this for?
New and experienced R users alike! Let's learn together! All are welcome, including R-Ladies RTP members and R-Ladies from around the world.

What should I bring?
You'll need a computer with videoconferencing capabilities and R. Serve yourself a beverage and a snack to fuel your evening!

Where will it take place?
**Please join us online via Zoom.** A link to join will be provided when you RSVP.

All events are intended for women as leaders, mentors, members, and attendees. We are emphatically queer and trans friendly. Men are welcomed to attend *as guests* and must be accompanied by the R-Lady who invited them. This group was created so those who identify as women have a comfortable place to learn. If you would like to attend and feel excluded, please introduce yourself to an organizer.

title: ¡Por favor... Dibújame un proyecto!
description:
Felices de tener un nuevo encuentro virtual con una invitada de lujo como es Maëlle Salmon.

Resumen de la charla:

Tener organizados tus proyectos de R es útil aunque no tengas colaboradores tan exigentes como El Principito.
¿Pero cómo se logra?
¿Se pone el proyecto en algún tipo de caja?
En esta charla presentaré algunas herramientas útiles: git, here, renv, targets, orderly...
También explicaré si transformar todo en un paquete de R siempre es una buena idea.
Después de mi charla habrás oído consejos y trucos para tus proyectos en R.
¡Espero que cad@ un@ aprenda al menos una cosa nueva!
