title: Análisis de Redes con Dra. María Ramos
description:
Hola a tod@s! L@s invitamos a nuestra reunión de septiembre por Zoom. En esta ocasión nos acompañará Dra. María Ramos, es socióloga y científica de redes. Utiliza la ciencia de las redes para estudiar una amplia gama de temas, incluidas las redes de colaboración, los sistemas socioecológicos, el análisis de textos, los contactos personales y la salud, y los modelos mentales de creencias. Ella es consultora independiente y instructora de RStudio Certificada.

Dra. Maria nos impartirá una taller de análisis de redes. Puedes seguirla en Twitter, @mariacramosf o por su página de web: https://mariacramos.com/

Nuestra reunión se llevará a cabo el sábado 25 de septiembre a las 11:00 horas (GMT-6 hora de la Ciudad de México) por Zoom.

title: Programadoras Mexicanas: Segundo Encuentro Anual R-Ladies México
description:
¡ACOMPAÑANOS A ESTE SEGUNDO ENCUENTRO ANUAL!

Este año, deseamos unir fuerzas y estrechar lazos reuniendo a las y los miembros de R-Ladies de todo el país en el Segundo Encuentro Anual R-Ladies México, resaltando especialmente a las programadoras de nuestro país.

Objetivos

- Compartir experiencias y retos enfrentados.
- Escuchar la experiencia de mujeres en el desarrollo de paquetes de R.
- Empoderar a más mujeres para crear nuevos capítulos.
- Unir fuerzas para generar conferencias y talleres conjuntos que hagan crecer aún más la comunidad de usuarias y usuarios de R.

title: Programadoras Mexicanas: Segundo Encuentro Anual R-Ladies México
description:
A mediados de 2017 fue el primer encuentro de R-LadiesCDMX, el primer capítulo local en México de la organización mundial que busca cerrar la brecha de género en el lenguaje de programación de R.
Sólo cuatro años después somos más de 7,000 integrantes en 12 ciudades a lo largo de todo el país.
Creemos que la diversidad de género es muy importante en la comunidad de R y es por eso que por segundo año consecutivo volvemos a unir fuerzas y estrechamos lazos, reuniendo a las/los/les integrantes de R-Ladies en México en nuestro Segundo Encuentro Anual.

El objetivo de este año se enfoca en la visibilización de mujeres programadoras. A través de una sesión intensiva, esperamos mostrar y aplaudir el trabajo de diversas mujeres en R como desarrolladoras de paquetes dentro de la comunidad.

Sin embargo, también sabemos que estamos en crecimiento y el nivel de los usos de R varían. Por esto, estamos diseñando un programa en el que puedan participar aquellas personas que se integran de manera reciente al mundo de R. De esta manera, se podrá generar una comunidad R en México más diversa, donde se busca dar voz a aquellas personas con falta de representación y el apoyo colaborativo persista como la regla más que la excepción.

Objetivos

- Compartir experiencias y retos enfrentados.
- Escuchar la experiencia de mujeres en el desarrollo de paquetes de R.
- Empoderar a más mujeres para crear nuevos capítulos.
- Unir fuerzas para generar conferencias y talleres conjuntos que hagan crecer aún más la comunidad de usuarias y usuarios de R.

Programa

5:00-5:10 pm: ¿Quiénes somos? R-Ladies México
5:10-6:10 pm: Talleres:
Visualización de Datos en R
Desarrollo de Paquetes en R
6:10-6:20: Toma de Foto y Break
6:20-7:05: Tallerista principal
7:05-7:50: Tallerista principal
7:50-8:10 pm: ¿Cómo abrir un capítulo de R en mi ciudad?
8:10-8:40: Evento Social & Trivia

title: Programadoras mexicanas
Programadoras Mexicanas: Segundo Encuentro Anual R-Ladies México
description:
A mediados de 2017 el primer capítulo de R-Ladies en México se integró a la creciente lista de capítulos de R-Ladies alrededor del mundo. En 2021, somos más de 7,000 integrantes en R-Ladies México en 12 capítulos en diferentes ciudades a lo largo de todo el país. Creemos que la visibilización de minorías de género dentro de la comunidad de R es necesario para llegar a una representación significativa, que facilite el desarrollo individual y global en la programación.

Es por eso que por segundo año consecutivo volvemos a unir fuerzas y estrechamos lazos, reuniendo a las/los/les integrantes de R-Ladies en México en nuestro Segundo Encuentro Anual. El objetivo de este año se enfoca en la visibilización de mujeres programadoras. A través de una sesión intensiva, esperamos mostrar y aplaudir el trabajo de diversas mujeres en R como desarrolladoras de paquetes dentro de la comunidad.

Sin embargo, también sabemos que estamos en crecimiento y el nivel de los usos de R varían. Por lo anterior, estamos diseñando un programa en el que puedan participar aquellas personas que se integran de manera reciente al mundo de R. De esta manera, se podrá generar una comunidad R en México diversa, donde se busca dar voz a aquellas personas con falta de representación y el apoyo colaborativo persista como la regla más que la excepción.

Objetivos

- Compartir experiencias y retos enfrentados.
- Escuchar la experiencia de mujeres en el desarrollo de paquetes de R.
- Empoderar a más mujeres para crear nuevos capítulos.
- Unir fuerzas para generar conferencias y talleres conjuntos que hagan crecer aún más la comunidad de usuarias y usuarios de R.

Programa

5:00-5:10 pm: ¿Quiénes somos? R-Ladies México
5:10-6:10 pm: Talleres:
Visualización de Datos en R
Desarrollo de Paquetes en R
6:10-6:20: Toma de Foto y Break
6:20-7:30: Perspectivas en el Desarrollo de Paquetes en R
7:30-8:00 pm:
¿Cómo abrir un capítulo de R en mi ciudad?
Evento Social & Trivia

title: R-Ladies NYC Lightning Talks (Prep and Submission Workshop)
description:
We are excited to host an online version of one our most popular events this fall - R-Ladies NYC Lightning Talks! We are extending the submission deadline, and are holding this workshop to provide guidance and support for interested speakers. If you are interested in proposing a talk but want to brainstorm ideas, get feedback, or some encouragement, join us!

Lighting talks are five minute talks. You can talk about anything R, Tech, and/or Data Science related. Looking for ideas? How about talking about a cool package you found, how you use R in your company, a favorite learning resource, your journey into Data Science, or a side project you've been working on?

We would especially love to hear from people who've never presented at a meetup or conference before and/or those who still don't feel confident speaking publicly. A lightning talk can be a great way to start out speaking, as it's quick, low-prep, and fun!

To celebrate the diversity in the R Community, we're prioritizing presenters who identify as a minority gender (including but not limited to cis/trans women, trans men, non-binary, genderqueer, agender).

Revised Important Dates
Submissions due: Friday 10/1
Notification of acceptance: Sunday 10/4
Accepted speakers confirm participation: Wednesday 10/6
Slides due to us: Sunday 10/17
Lightning Talk Event: 10/19

title: R for Data Science Book Club (Meeting 6)
description:
R-Ladies DC will be reading R for Data Science in 8 biweekly meetings (July 15, July 29, Aug 12, Aug 26, Sept 9, Sept 23, Oct 14, Oct 28).

The selected book chapters should be read before the meeting time.

There are also exercises for each week which you should aim to complete before the meeting as well. We'll go through solutions to the exercises as a group. In most weeks, we'll also do some additional exercises from the chapters live during the meeting.

It's okay if you're not able to complete everything ahead of time, we understand that life happens. Please still attend the meeting, even if you didn't read everything or complete all the exercises.

In addition, if you have to miss a meeting time, all code will be made available after the meeting on Github: https://github.com/sctyner/r4ds-bookclub-rladiesdc

Note on the exercises: For all exercises, we will use the online version of the book. There are some differences between the online and print exercises, so we'll stick with the online ones so that everyone is doing the same exercises.

Note on meeting access: All meetings will be virtual. You must RSVP to the meeting on the R-Ladies DC Meetup page to receive the Zoom link. All meetings will take place on a Thursday from 7:00-8:30pm ET (America/New York).

Cada unx contará su experiencia de primera mano sobre cómo arrancaron en este tipo de roles, qué trabas tuvieron, qué dificultades enfrentaron, y qué herramientas consideran que les sumaron y que pueden servirle a unx egresadx que quiera inciarse en mundo de la ciencia de datos.

title: Causal Inference with R
description:
Across public health, medicine, and social and behavioral sciences, researchers aim to answer causal questions. However, inferences about causation are challenging and require several assumptions to draw unbiased causal effects from observational data. This workshop discusses the difference between association and causation and introduces various methods to infer causal effects with observational data. We will then study R packages that implement propensity score techniques to estimate an average treatment effect – such as matching, subclassification, and inverse probability weighting. The workshop also provides several implementation options depending on the data type and the target causal effects of interest.

About our speaker:

Youjin Lee is an Assistant Professor in the Department of Biostatistics at the Brown School of Public Health. Her research focuses on developing causal inference methods with complex data where standard assumptions are often violated. She published R packages for causal inference with social network data and multilevel settings. Originally from South Korea, Youjin received her Ph.D. in Biostatistics from Johns Hopkin University. Before joining Brown University, she did her postdoctoral training at the University of Pennsylvania.

Note from organizers:

We're excited to see so much enthusiasm for this topic! Please note that the zoom room is capped at 100 participants - if you would like to attend, please make sure to be on time. We will be recording the meetup, so if you aren't able to attend the live webinar, we will share the recoding on our YouTube channel after the session.

Laura Ellis is a senior technical staff member (STSM) at IBM and is the Analytics Architect for the IBM Cloud internal data platform.

Her mission is to make data science and analytics accessible to everyone in a secure and scalable manner.

Laura has worked in data science and predictive modeling, holding a variety of positions for over 15 years. She blogs at https://www.littlemissdata.com/blog and is active in the patent community and a variety of data communities.

title: Introdução a GitHub Actions
description:
Heey, tudo bem?

Estamos muito felizes com a sua participação.

Aproveite o curso. Aproveite essa oportunidade! Este evento foi pensado com muito carinho para você.

O que você vai aprender?

O GitHub Actions (GHA) permite automatizar fluxos de trabalho de desenvolvimento em R. Nessa apresentação, falaremos sobre GitHub Actions no contexto de pacotes em R, onde será mostrado dois exemplos de uso de GitHub Actions: um exemplo de checagem automática de pacotes em R, e outro que envolve a automatização de atualização de um relatório em RMarkdown.

Quais pacotes vão ser utilizados ?

library(usethis)
library(rmarkdown)

Sobre o Projeto Enigma

O projeto Enigma busca tornar visível o papel feminino na área da computação, resgatando as contribuições significativas de algumas mulheres de uma forma diferenciada, que provoque o pensamento do fruidor. Não pretende-se reproduzir as visibilidades que estas personagens já têm, mas fazer uma provocação, desacomodando o pensamento para que as invisibilidades, que ainda persistem, se tornem visíveis. As doações serão voltadas a reforma de artigos doados ao projeto como computadores, teclados e entre outros objetos do universo computacional.

Para saber mais sobre este projeto lindo acesse https://www.ufrgs.br/enigma/

E aí? Topa?

Link de inscrição: https://www.sympla.com.br/produtor/cursosonline

Dúvidas frequentes:

CERTIFICADOS! - O certificado de 4h do evento será enviado para o seu e-mail. Caso você não receba ao final do evento, escreva para goiania@rladies.org.

MATERIAIS! - Os materiais utilizados no nosso curso (apresentação, scripts) serão disponibilizados através do nosso GitHub .

Dicas importantes para melhor aproveitamento do evento

(1°) Procure conectar o seu computador no cabo de rede, evitando instabilidades na transmissão;
(2°) Pré-configure a sua câmera e microfone antes de entrar no evento pois será útil para as interações com a professora em caso de dúvidas!
(3°) Prepare seu ambiente, aquela caneca de café, garrafa de água e os fones de ouvido, melhores companheiros para se concentrar e mergulhar de cabeça nessa experiência!
(4°) Não guarde esse conhecimento apenas para você, compartilhe com seus amigos e redes sociais marcando a gente no instagram @rladiesgyn.

Você faz parte desse compromisso

Lembre-se que o Código de Conduta também se estende à versão online de nossos eventos e não será tolerada qualquer forma de assédios ou intimidações de qualquer participante, seja audiência, palestrantes, colaboradores, ou quaisquer membros da comunidade.

A gente brilha TOGETHER!

title: Club de lectura R para Ciencia de Datos (Wickham & Grolemund) - Sesión 10
description:
Las R-Ladies de Barranquilla (COL), Galápagos, Guayaquil y Milagro (ECU) nos hemos unido para traerte un club de lectura basado en el libro R para Ciencia de Datos de Wickham y Grolemund. Este libro está disponible en español gracias al esfuerzo de la comunidad R latinoamericana y puede ser accedido de manera libre aquí: https://es.r4ds.hadley.nz.

En esta octava sesión de nuestro club de lectura, Denisse Fierro Arcos de R-Ladies Galápagos hablará cómo llevar a cabo el análisis exploratorio de datos (Capítulo 7).

Este club de lectura incluirá varias sesiones quincenales que se llevarán a cabo a través de Zoom. Cada sesión durará dos horas durante las cuales discutiremos y practicaremos los puntos más importantes del capítulo o capítulos en el que nos enfoquemos para esa sesión.

Recuerda, las sesiones son los jueves de cada quincena empezando a las 18:00 (UTC-5, Colombia y Ecuador Continental), o si estás en Galápagos a las 17:00 (UTC-6).

Al participar en nuestros eventos recuerda que estás aceptando nuestro código de conducta, el cual nos ayuda a crear un espacio amable y seguro para aprender: https://github.com/rladies/starter-kit/wiki/Code-of-Conduct#spanish

title: GRUPO 3. TALLER DE ESTUDIO LIBRO "R PARA CIENCIA DE DATOS"
description:
¡Desde RLadies Bariloche les invitamos a comenzar con el estudio en grupo del libro R para Ciencia de Datos (versión traducida al español de R for Data Science) de Hadley Wickham (el creador de Tidyverse y varios paquetes más!). El libro es de libre acceso en https://es.r4ds.hadley.nz/ ¡Está muy bueno!

• Nos juntaremos de forma virtual una vez cada 15 días para avanzar con la lectura y comprensión del libro y los scripts. Cada encuentro será guiado por uno o dos integrantes del grupo.

• En el primer encuentro discutiremos el capitulo número 3 “visualización de datos” (¡Qué bueno, empezamos con gráficos con ggplot2 ) https://es.r4ds.hadley.nz/visualizaci%C3%B3n-de-datos.html Es necesario llegar a la reunión con el capítulo previamente leído y trabajado. Quienes no leyeron la introducción del libro aún: adelante, es corta, y les dará un panorama de lo que iremos estudiando. En la reunión de organización vimos un panorama de la introducción.

• En base a la encuesta de horarios que hicimos, hemos definido tres grupos de trabajo con distintos horarios. ¡ATENCIÓN! ¡Por favor, anotarse solo en uno de los tres! AHORA ESTÁS EN EL MEETUP DEL GRUPO 3, DE JUEVES DE 18 A 20.

• ¡Importante! Ni bien se inscriban en el meetup, entren a los ajustes de su perfil y verifiquen tener activas las notificaciones, no sólo del meetup en general, sino del grupo RLadies-BRC en particular (figuran abajo del todo en notificaciones por correo electrónico) para poder recibir luego el enlace para conectarse y otras notificaciones relacionadas al evento.

• Quienes se inscriban al meetup y si aún no se sumaron, van a recibir más adelante un enlace para sumarse al espacio de trabajo de slack que es exclusivo para el estudio del libro y que será nuestra principal vía de comunicación. Si nunca lo usaron y/o necesitan ayuda para familiarizarse, escríbannos y les damos una orientación rápida.

• Necesitamos uno o dos voluntarias o voluntarios para guiar el capítulo número 3. Interesadxs nos lo pueden comunicar por el slack o al correo bariloche@rladies.org. Cuanto antes, mejor. En caso de que nadie se ofrezca, haremos un sorteo (con el comando sample() en R!!!).

• A partir del primer encuentro, cada grupo de trabajo se auto-gestionará. Por ejemplo, sorteará o decidirá quién guiará el siguiente capítulo, si verán un capítulo, medio capítulo o dos capítulos (la propuesta general es ir despacio, lento pero sin tregua), si aplicarán lo que se vió en el capítulo a otro set de datos etc. Contamos con el espacio de slack para consultarnos y compartir información en cada grupo y entre grupos.

Al anotarse, les pedimos que primero lean y acepten el código de conducta que encontrarán en la página.

Para asistir al meetup, les recomendamos poseer una cuenta de google (utilizaremos google meet). Se recomienda tener conocimientos básicos de R.

¡ATENCIÓN! por cuestiones de seguridad virtual, el enlace a la reunión se enviará unos minutos antes de la misma. Por ello les pedimos que
estén alertas al correo.

title: Anomalies! You can’t escape them
description:
Hi Everyone!

This month we are excited to host Sevvandi Kandanaarachchi, who will be giving a seminar on data anomaly detection!

Why are anomalies important? Because they tell us a different story from the norm. An anomaly or an event might signify a failing heart rate of a patient, a fraudulent credit card activity, or an early indication of a tsunami. As such, it is extremely important to detect anomalies or anomalous events.

In this talk, we will give an introduction to anomaly detection. Anomalies are rare events. As a result, standard accuracy measures do not apply. But then, how do we evaluate an Anomaly Detection (AD) method? If we want to compare two or more AD methods, what kind of simple tests can we do? What are the data repositories that are available for AD?

We will also discuss an ensemble method for AD. Constructing an AD ensemble is challenging because the class labels are not known. We will look at an unusual ally from psychometrics – Item Response Theory – to help us in this construction.

Sevvandi is an applied mathematician at RMIT Mathematics working in data science and analytics. She uses statistics, mathematics and machine learning for her research. Her main research interest is anomaly and event detection. Examples of anomalies include finding alien life on a planet far, far away, or closer to home, a stock market crash. She also likes working on real world problems, especially ones that are motivated by industry.

This will be an online event. Please connect to the zoom session at 5:30pm on September 16th.

We look forward to seeing everyone at the seminar!

R-Ladies Melbourne

title: Growing into the R community
description:
The workshop is a joint event with R-Ladies Coventry (UK) and will be led by Dr Shannon Pileggi (https://www.pipinghotdata.com/about.html)! Shannon is currently a Statistician at Adelphi Research in Doylestown, PA.

"Starting something new in R can be daunting, but there are many community resources that can help! In this presentation, I’ll discuss how I crafted a job interview presentation by making modifications on publicly available TidyTuesday code. This built the technical and confidence-boosting scaffolding I needed for more open-ended projects. The success of this experience inspired me to transition from my role as a consumer and creator to contributor to give back to the R community, which has been incredibly fulfilling. Despite social distancing, I feel more connected to the R community than ever before!"

PREPARATION AND RESOURCES
There is nothing to prepare in advance. The resources for the workshop are available here: https://github.com/shannonpileggi/growing-into-r

ONLINE PROGRAMME
The event will be held online and will start at 19:00 (Netherlands time). Please join us via the Zoom link (visible to attendees)

CODE OF CONDUCT
Please take a minute to read our code of conduct - we are committed to creating a safe and harassment-free environment:
https://github.com/rladies/.github/blob/master/CODE_OF_CONDUCT.md

R-Ladies events are always free and open to anyone who wants to participate as long as they follow the code of conduct. We are pro-actively inclusive of queer, trans, and all minority identities, with additional sensitivity to intersectional identities. Our priority is to provide a safe community space for anyone identifying as a minority gender who is interested in and/or working with R.

title: Create colourful, publication-ready tables with {gt} & {gtsummary}
description:
In this workshop, we'll explore the {gt} package and create beautiful, colourful tables together. The name gt stands for "grammar of tables" because its approach is similar to that of ggplot: setting up an underlying structure which allows users to build up tables layer by layer.

We'll start by creating summary tables with our other favourite (collection of) packages - the tidyverse. Then, we'll make these tables look pretty with {gt} - add and polish the descriptions, change column widths, add a splash or two of colour. We'll also cover adding subgroups, summaries such as averages, and spanners to group columns together.

Finally, we'll take a look at the {gtsummary} package to create custom tables of descriptive statistics and learn how to export our beautiful tables in a variety of different formats.

---
It's important to us to ensure that R-Ladies Freiburg events are a safe space for gender minorities and especially those who are just starting out with R. All are welcome at this meetup but we specifically ask cisgender men to take a passive role in this meetup and hold comments/ questions until after others have had the chance to ask. Thank you for your support!

title: GRUPO 2. TALLER DE ESTUDIO LIBRO "R PARA CIENCIA DE DATOS"
description:
¡Desde RLadies Bariloche les invitamos a comenzar con el estudio en grupo del libro R para Ciencia de Datos (versión traducida al español de R for Data Science) de Hadley Wickham (el creador de Tidyverse y varios paquetes más!). El libro es de libre acceso en https://es.r4ds.hadley.nz/ ¡Está muy bueno!

• Nos juntaremos de forma virtual una vez cada 15 días para avanzar con la lectura y comprensión del libro y los scripts. Cada encuentro será guiado por uno o dos integrantes del grupo.

Quienes no leyeron la introducción del libro aún: adelante, es corta, y les dará un panorama de lo que iremos estudiando. En la reunión de organización vimos un panorama de la introducción.

• En base a la encuesta de horarios que hicimos, hemos definido tres grupos de trabajo con distintos horarios. ¡ATENCIÓN! ¡Por favor, anotarse solo en uno de los tres! AHORA ESTÁS EN EL MEETUP DEL GRUPO 2, DE MIÉRCOLES DE 14 A 16.

• ¡Importante! Ni bien se inscriban en el meetup, entren a los ajustes de su perfil y verifiquen tener activas las notificaciones, no sólo del meetup en general, sino del grupo RLadies-BRC en particular (figuran abajo del todo en notificaciones por correo electrónico) para poder recibir luego el enlace para conectarse y otras notificaciones relacionadas al evento.

• Quienes se inscriban al meetup y si aún no se sumaron, van a recibir más adelante un enlace para sumarse al espacio de trabajo de slack que es exclusivo para el estudio del libro y que será nuestra principal vía de comunicación. • A partir del primer encuentro, cada grupo de trabajo se auto-gestionará. Por ejemplo, sorteará o decidirá quién guiará el siguiente capítulo, si verán un capítulo, medio capítulo o dos capítulos (la propuesta general es ir despacio, lento pero sin tregua), si aplicarán lo que se vió en el capítulo a otro set de datos etc. Contamos con el espacio de slack para consultarnos y compartir información en cada grupo y entre grupos.

title: MACHINE LEARNING & AI MEETUP WEEK
description:
THE MIAMI MACHINE LEARNING & AI MEETUP WEEK WILL GATHER THE COMMUNITY FACE-TO-FACE FROM SEPTEMBER 13-16 TO REVIVE THE ML/AI CONVERSATION IN MIAMI AND SOUTH FL AS WE EMBARK ON NEW AND EXCITING TIMES OF HYPER GROWTH!

Join Data Science Salon, R-Ladies and Tech Hub South Florida for a week of different sessions featuring three evenings put together by local data science community leaders. Expect topics covering, R, Python, Deep Learning, Data Governance, MLOps, Data Science in the Enterprise and much more!

Connect, engage and learn from the local community during the sessions over some beer and pizza, and join the conversation at additional pop-up ML focused gatherings throughout the week, (more to be announced).

The event will be a mixture of onsite/online event.

**For the online event please register at:**
https://www.eventbrite.com/e/miami-machine-learning-ai-hybrid-meetup-week-tickets-162988772807

title: RLadies #18: Frequentist & Bayesian random effects models in R: RStan tutorial
description:
This month's guest speaker Amanda Koepke will present on random effects modeling in RStan:

A common problem in science, medicine, and other fields is the need to combine independent measurements (taken over multiple days, or at different labs, or using different measurement methods) into a consensus estimate in a way that recognizes explicitly the contributions that different sources of uncertainty (i.e., within-study uncertainties and between-study differences) make to the overall uncertainty. Many methods exist for this, and past studies have compared the performance of different estimation approaches, however little attention has been paid to Bayesian approaches. In this talk, I will briefly describe my work extending these estimator comparisons to Bayesian models and exploring which approaches are best for common data scenarios at NIST (https://www.nist.gov/). I will then give a short tutorial on how to implement this type of Bayesian analysis in R using RStan. The Hamiltonian Monte Carlo used in RStan provides a very efficient way to explore the posterior distribution and allows for the most natural definition of specialized probability distributions. However, it can be tricky to consistently obtain valid samples when trying to fit many simulated datasets with realistic simulation settings. I'll describe some of the issues I encountered and how to deal with some common RStan warnings.

title: treeheatr and pmlbr: visualizing decision trees on benchmark datasets
description:
The presentation of the decision tree with data represented as a heatmap is a new visualization that uncovers the tree's performance, the data's correlation structure, and the importance of each feature in predicting the outcome. Implemented in an easily installed package with a detailed vignette, treeheatr can be a useful teaching tool to enhance students’ understanding of a simple decision tree model before diving into more complex tree-based machine learning methods. We will apply decision tree models and visualize them on multiple benchmark machine learning datasets in pmlbr.

About our speaker:
Trang Le is a postdoctoral fellow with Jason Moore at the Computational Genetics Lab, University of Pennsylvania. She enjoys developing machine learning methods for rigorous analyses of a wide array of biomedical data. Most recently, her work focuses on investigating the long-term effect of neurological conditions in COVID-19 patients. She’s the author and maintainer of multiple R packages.

title: [Webinar] AI Inference Workloads: Solving Challenges Beyond Training Models
description:
Register here: https://info.datascience.salon/ai-inference-workloads-solving-challenges-beyond-training-models

In recent years, enterprise AI initiatives have made great strides in solving the challenges of training massive, distributed computational models. Data wrangling, experimentation management, GPU resource allocation…these challenges have spawned an ever-growing market of new tools and considerable investment. But despite all this, the ability to productize AI is still stunted in most enterprises.

In our survey of more than 200 data scientists and MLOps/IT experts, a majority of AI/ML models still aren’t making it to production. AI/ML teams are now under pressure to optimize and manage AI inference workloads in production and deliver a return on investment.

In this webinar, we will walk through the distinct characteristics of each stage in the ML lifecycle and their computational requirements. We’ll discuss solutions to improve throughput and reduce latency, and finally, we’ll show how one organization built an efficient inference platform on top of Kubernetes to support their scaling AI initiatives.

“Rapid AI development is what this is all about for us. What Run:AI helps us do is to move from a company doing pure research, to a company with results in production.”

Siddharth Sharma, Sr. Research Engineer, Wayve

Register here: https://info.datascience.salon/ai-inference-workloads-solving-challenges-beyond-training-models

title: Publishing your R or Data Science book with Chapman & Hall/CRC
description:
Together with the R-Ladies DC and Chicago chapters, we are thrilled to co-host this lunchtime presentation with editors from Chapman & Hall/CRC Press.

Abstract: In this very practical and interactive workshop, four book editors from Chapman and Hall/CRC will discuss why you should consider publishing an R or Data Science book and why you should work with CRC. The editors will go over the publishing process and provide best practices for shaping your ideas and submitting a book proposal; discuss their bestsellers and popular series as well as emerging topics and trends. The lively discussion will provide plenty of opportunities for the attendees to ask questions and discuss ideas.

Presenters:
Randi Cohen is the Publisher for Computer Science and IT. She commissions across computer science, with a focus on the areas of Data Science, AI and Machine Learning, Computational Science, and Programming.

David Grubbs is a Senior Editor in Statistics. He commissions books in all areas of statistics and data science including but not limited to statistical and machine learning, statistical software, computational and applied statistics, books in R and Python, environmental statistics, data analytics and Bayesian statistics.

Lara Spieker is an Editor for Statistics. She commissions books in all areas of data science and statistics, such as computational and applied statistics, statistical software, books on R and Python, and Bayesian Statistics.

Rob Calver is a Senior Publisher for Statistics, Mathematics and Physics. He commissions books in statistics and data science.

---

This event will be hosted over Zoom; the link will be available on this page the morning of the event, and the passcode will be emailed to you.
---

R-Ladies is dedicated to providing a harassment-free experience for everyone. We do not tolerate harassment of participants in any form. Please take a moment to review the R-Ladies Global code of conduct (particularly if this is your first time attending!): https://rladies.org/code-of-conduct

For questions regarding accessibility, please email us at nyc@rladies.org.

title: [Hackathon] - Florida Hacks with IBM
description:
Link: https://floridahackswithibm.bemyapp.com/

Be Part of the Change

Join the University of Florida and IBM in protecting environmental resources and preparing communities for the impact of climate change.
At this hackathon, you and your team will build an application in one of our challenge areas that can change the world using IBM technologies and with support by leaders in technology and climate from University of Florida, IBM, and other partner organizations.

As a hackathon participant, you will be provided with $200 in cloud credits to access to all of IBM’s services on the cloud.

Challenge #1 - Climate Change & Florida Ecosystem
Challenge #2 - Improving the Condition of Florida’s Waterways
Challenge #3 - Sustainable Fisheries
Challenge #4 - Power Consumption
Challenge #5 - Animal Agriculture
Challenge #6 - Wildcard

title: Introdução à utilização do Git e GitHub no RStudio
description:
Heey, tudo bem?

Estamos muito felizes com a sua participação.

Aproveite o curso. Aproveite essa oportunidade! Este evento foi pensado com muito carinho para você.

O que você vai aprender?

O conceito de controle de versão com Git será apresentado e também como podemos configurar o Git e o GitHub no RStudio para que seja possível versionar os projetos em R. Também aprenderemos a disponibilizar conteúdos dos projetos de forma online, através do GitHub Pages.

Quais pacotes vão ser utilizados ?

library(usethis)

Sobre o Projeto Enigma

O projeto Enigma busca tornar visível o papel feminino na área da computação, resgatando as contribuições significativas de algumas mulheres de uma forma diferenciada, que provoque o pensamento do fruidor. Não pretende-se reproduzir as visibilidades que estas personagens já têm, mas fazer uma provocação, desacomodando o pensamento para que as invisibilidades, que ainda persistem, se tornem visíveis. As doações serão voltadas a reforma de artigos doados ao projeto como computadores, teclados e entre outros objetos do universo computacional.

Para saber mais sobre este projeto lindo acesse https://www.ufrgs.br/enigma/

E aí? Topa?

Link de inscrição: https://www.sympla.com.br/produtor/cursosonline

Dúvidas frequentes:

CERTIFICADOS! - O certificado de 4h do evento será enviado para o seu e-mail. Caso você não receba ao final do evento, escreva para goiania@rladies.org.

MATERIAIS! - Os materiais utilizados no nosso curso (apresentação, scripts) serão disponibilizados através do nosso GitHub .

Dicas importantes para melhor aproveitamento do evento

(1°) Procure conectar o seu computador no cabo de rede, evitando instabilidades na transmissão;
(2°) Pré-configure a sua câmera e microfone antes de entrar no evento pois será útil para as interações com a professora em caso de dúvidas!
(3°) Prepare seu ambiente, aquela caneca de café, garrafa de água e os fones de ouvido, melhores companheiros para se concentrar e mergulhar de cabeça nessa experiência!
(4°) Não guarde esse conhecimento apenas para você, compartilhe com seus amigos e redes sociais marcando a gente no instagram @rladiesgyn.

Você faz parte desse compromisso

Lembre-se que o Código de Conduta também se estende à versão online de nossos eventos e não será tolerada qualquer forma de assédios ou intimidações de qualquer participante, seja audiência, palestrantes, colaboradores, ou quaisquer membros da comunidade.

A gente brilha TOGETHER!

title: Buenas prácticas para el flujo de trabajo en R
description:
¡Nuevo meetup de R-ladies Bariloche! ¡No te lo pierdas! ¡Vamos a trabajar en las buenas prácticas para el flujo de trabajo en R!

En esta oportunidad Gabriel Tovar nos invita a pensar que como científicos, hacemos preguntas al mundo a través de hipótesis y experimentos y el mundo nos responde con datos. Es parte del trabajo como científico traducir esos datos para que otras personas los comprendan. Gabriel nos dice: si los datos son el lenguaje de la ciencia, entonces R es la herramienta para traducir esos datos. En este meetup sobre las “Buenas prácticas para el flujo de trabajo en R” hablaremos de consideraciones a tener al momento de trabajar y programar en R. Así como aprendimos las normas de seguridad antes de entrar a un laboratorio, o las normas de conducta antes de entrar a una biblioteca, programar códigos tiene algunas normas que nos harán la vida más fácil al momento de escribir códigos o un script. Y así traducir esos datos científicos para poder comunicarlos efectivamente en una publicación académica.

El taller se realizará el viernes 10 de septiembre de 15:00 a 17 hs, en forma virtual ¡Inscribite! No te olvides de leer y aceptar el código de conducta

¡Importante! Ni bien se inscriban en el meetup, entren a los ajustes de su perfil y verifiquen tener activas las notificaciones, no sólo del meetup en general, sino del grupo RLadies-BRC en particular (figuran abajo del todo en notificaciones por correo electrónico) para poder recibir luego el enlace para conectarse y otras notificaciones relacionadas al evento.

Para asistir al meetup, les recomendamos:
1- Poseer una cuenta de google (utilizaremos google meet)

2- Tener conocimientos elementales de R, qué es un script, cómo llamar paquetes, setear el directorio de trabajo y cargar un archivo de datos.

¡ATENCIÓN! por cuestiones de seguridad virtual, el enlace a la reunión se enviará unos minutos antes de la misma. Por ello les pedimos que estén alertas al correo.
Los datos que utilicemos y el script estarán disponibles una vez finalizada la reunión en el repositorio de github.

title: R for Data Science Book Club (Meeting 5)
description:
R-Ladies DC will be reading R for Data Science in 8 biweekly meetings (July 15, July 29, Aug 12, Aug 26, Sept 9, Sept 23, Oct 14, Oct 28).

The selected book chapters should be read before the meeting time.

There are also exercises for each week which you should aim to complete before the meeting as well. We'll go through solutions to the exercises as a group. In most weeks, we'll also do some additional exercises from the chapters live during the meeting.

It's okay if you're not able to complete everything ahead of time, we understand that life happens. Please still attend the meeting, even if you didn't read everything or complete all the exercises.

In addition, if you have to miss a meeting time, all code will be made available after the meeting on Github: https://github.com/sctyner/r4ds-bookclub-rladiesdc

Note on the exercises: For all exercises, we will use the online version of the book. There are some differences between the online and print exercises, so we'll stick with the online ones so that everyone is doing the same exercises.

Note on meeting access: All meetings will be virtual. You must RSVP to the meeting on the R-Ladies DC Meetup page to receive the Zoom link. All meetings will take place on a Thursday from 7:00-8:30pm ET (America/New York).

Meeting 5 (September 9, 2021): Dealing with Special Data Types

Physical book chapters (Pages)
Ch. 11: Strings (195-222)
Ch. 12: Factors (223-236)
Ch 13: Dates and times (237-256)

title: Back to School 2021!
description:
We are back!!!

Pandemic fatigue has hit us hard, but we are ready to code again!

Join us for this 'Back to School' online event to get to know each other and once again, enjoy a Zoom call :p

R-Ladies Gainesville leadership will introduce themselves (and their favorite R packages) and we'll get to know each other over games (we look forward to mailing some stickers to the winners!).

We hope you will join us with your beveRage of choice and lots of R enthusiasm.

R-Ladies Gainesville welcomes members of all R proficiency levels, whether you're a new or aspiring R user, or an experienced R programmer interested in mentoring, networking & expert upskilling.

Please RSVP to receive the Zoom link before the event.

Please note:
In line with R-Ladies’ Mission Statement to encourage participation in the R community by underrepresented genders/identities (https://rladies.org/about-us/), our events are designed for those individuals (including, but not limited to cis/trans women, trans men, non-binary, genderqueer, agender). We therefore ask that when cis men attend our events, they are accompanied by a sponsor who identifies as an underrepresented gender. If you have any questions, please contact the event organizers.

title: Data Storytelling with Effective Data Visualization Techniques
description:
================================================
⏰ Join us on Sept 9th at 4pm PT live on our YouTube channel
➡️ Youtube Link: https://bit.ly/ai-inclusive-youtube

================================================

Data Storytelling with Effective Data Visualization Techniques

Abstract:
If a data scientist spends 80% of their time cleaning the data and 20% of their time performing analysis, where is the allocated time for the effective communication of your results? Storytelling is an integral part of conveying your findings and data visualization is a key tool for the job. In this session we will discuss data visualization guidelines, tips and tricks as well as available resources to help you tell your story with data.

• Bio:
Laura Ellis is a senior technical staff member (STSM) at IBM is the Analytics Architect for the IBM Cloud internal data platform. Her goal is to make data science and analytics accessible to everyone. Over the past 15 years, Laura has worked with teams to deliver a wide range of business solutions built on a diverse analytic stack including databases, business intelligence, data science, predictive modeling and real time event streaming. She holds a Bachelor of Engineering Science from the University of Western Ontario and a Master of Science in Predictive Analytics from Northwestern University. Laura is passionate about using data to solve business problems and helping women grow their careers.
Check out her blog: http://www.littlemissdata.com/

title: R Ladies Darwin Launch
description:
Hi R-Ladies and those that are interested in supporting gender diversity in the R community! I am thrilled to announce that R-Ladies Darwin is launching on Thursday the 9th of September!

You are all invited to give a lightning talk about ANYTHING related to R, including but not limited to:

-Your past experience of using R;
-Your favourite packages;
-Something that you want to learn but don't know where to start with;
-Useful channels to learn R;
etc. etc.

(Note you don't have to give a talk.)
These will be informal talks and we are really friendly people, so don't be stressed! I would recommend keeping your talk short and concise, 5-10 minutes will be perfect. I could always schedule your longer talks in the coming events.

Please come along to brainstorm, meet people and have some fun.

Please fill out the form below whether you are giving a lightning talk or not: https://docs.google.com/forms/d/e/1FAIpQLSeeAEF4Jsq9Pp3FUMCUW9SBX0CYCRX2DXrDY43l1skYvj_dkg/viewform?usp=sf_link

I look forward to seeing you there!

Please note, due to covid restrictions we can only accommodate 24 people on site. So please register your interest early.

Petra Kuhnert

title: R-Ladies DC Virtual Meet and Greet!
description:
Join us for a new season of R-Ladies DC! Come and introduce yourself and let us know what your R learning goals are for the year and what you hope to get out of R-Ladies DC this year.

(Photo of DC skyline from Washington Photo Safari, Wikimedia Commons https://commons.wikimedia.org/wiki/File:Washington_DC_Skyline.jpg)

title: Reproducible analysis in anthropology
description:
Talk title: Reproducible research in anthropology: Data analysis and writing papers using R Markdown, and Git version control to make research compendia

Description: Li-Ying will present how their lab uses R Markdown to combine data, manuscript text, and code for data analysis and visualization, thereby incorporating their work into a reproducible compendium. With R Markdown, we can write a manuscript that can be executed to typical document formats. Using Git version control helps us to track changes as we write our code and text. This standard compendium structure organizes our files nicely and enables other researchers to easily inspect our data and analytical processes to enhance research reproducibility in anthropology.

Li-Ying Wang (she/her) short bio:
Li-Ying Wang is a recent PhD graduate from the Department of Anthropology at the University of Washington. Her study focuses on a 14-19th century site in northeastern Taiwan during the European colonization period. She employs multiple computational methods to visualize and analyze archaeological data, including spatial analysis, shape analysis, and Bayesian network modeling using R. She is very interested in open science and reproducible research and incorporates these approaches into her analysis, writing, and teaching practices.

NOTE: If you are in Bergen, come join us for a physical meeting right before Li-Ying's talk: https://www.meetup.com/rladies-bergen/events/280261260/

title: Let's MEET and TALK again!
description:
Is it really happening? Let's try to actually meet in person and discuss how _you_ are envisioning the future of R-Ladies Bergen! This will be an informal chat with snacks served before we watch Li-Ying's talk about reproducible research practice. Come and feel the energy of our community!

P.S. There is a limit of 28 people because of the room availability. We will follow local infection guidelines and keep a min. of 1-meter distance between us. We recommend the use of face masks when entering and leaving the building. See you there!

title: R Ladies Bogor 10th Meet Up: intro to Spatial R!
description:
Halo rekan-rekan sekalian!

September ini kita akan mengadakan meet-up R Ladies Bogor yang ke-10 dengan topik utama tentang Intro to Spasial R (materi dan hands-on membuat peta sederhana). Selain itu ada sejumlah talk singkat/lightning talk dari beberapa rekan R Ladies kita:
-Menggunakan R Shiny untuk visualisasi data fenologi pohon (oleh Marsya C Sibarani)
-Penggunaan dplyr di R (oleh Pratiwi Eka Puspita)
-Pemodelan spasial distribusi spesies menggunakan sdm package (oleh Kurnia Latifiana).

Untuk meet-up ini, rencananya akan kita adakan pada hari Sabtu, 4 September 2021, pukul 13.00-15.00 WIB.

Bagi rekan-rekan yang tertarik untuk mendaftar, silakan mengisi formulir pendaftaran berikut ini ya, nanti akan saya kirimkan link zoom-nya :) [https://forms.gle/wEPgqrAd1qrKq3C87]

Silakan di-share kepada rekan-rekan lain yang mungkin juga ingin ikut hadir ya :)

Terima kasih dan sampai jumpa.
Salam,

Ulfah
Co-coordinator R Ladies Bogor/Jakarta

title: satRday Nairobi Conference 2021
description:
Greetings members!

Welcome to satRday Nairobi, organised by R-Ladies Nairobi in collaboration with NairobiR. It will be hosted virtually via zoom on 4th September 2021, from 0900hrs to 1800hrs(GMT+3). This event consists of keynotes, workshops & talks on data manipulation, data visualisation, statistical modelling, R shiny, spatial analysis and R markdown.

Please, register on the website: https://nairobi2021.satrdays.org/

We will share the zoom links and conference details with the registered participants.

All are welcome!

For any queries or comments, contact us on;

LinkedIn: https://www.linkedin.com/in/r-ladies-nairobi-2572841b3/

Twitter: @RLadiesNairobi

title: GRUPO 3. TALLER DE ESTUDIO LIBRO "R PARA CIENCIA DE DATOS"
description:
¡Desde RLadies Bariloche les invitamos a comenzar con el estudio en grupo del libro R para Ciencia de Datos (versión traducida al español de R for Data Science) de Hadley Wickham (el creador de Tidyverse y varios paquetes más!). El libro es de libre acceso en https://es.r4ds.hadley.nz/ ¡Está muy bueno!

• Nos juntaremos de forma virtual una vez cada 15 días para avanzar con la lectura y comprensión del libro y los scripts. Cada encuentro será guiado por uno o dos integrantes del grupo.

• En el primer encuentro discutiremos el capitulo número 3 “visualización de datos” (¡Qué bueno, empezamos con gráficos con ggplot2 ) https://es.r4ds.hadley.nz/visualizaci%C3%B3n-de-datos.html Es necesario llegar a la reunión con el capítulo previamente leído y trabajado. Quienes no leyeron la introducción del libro aún: adelante, es corta, y les dará un panorama de lo que iremos estudiando. En la reunión de organización vimos un panorama de la introducción.

• En base a la encuesta de horarios que hicimos, hemos definido tres grupos de trabajo con distintos horarios. ¡ATENCIÓN! ¡Por favor, anotarse solo en uno de los tres! AHORA ESTÁS EN EL MEETUP DEL GRUPO 3, DE JUEVES DE 18 A 20.

• ¡Importante! Ni bien se inscriban en el meetup, entren a los ajustes de su perfil y verifiquen tener activas las notificaciones, no sólo del meetup en general, sino del grupo RLadies-BRC en particular (figuran abajo del todo en notificaciones por correo electrónico) para poder recibir luego el enlace para conectarse y otras notificaciones relacionadas al evento.

• Quienes se inscriban al meetup y si aún no se sumaron, van a recibir más adelante un enlace para sumarse al espacio de trabajo de slack que es exclusivo para el estudio del libro y que será nuestra principal vía de comunicación. Si nunca lo usaron y/o necesitan ayuda para familiarizarse, escríbannos y les damos una orientación rápida.

• Necesitamos uno o dos voluntarias o voluntarios para guiar el capítulo número 3. Interesadxs nos lo pueden comunicar por el slack o al correo bariloche@rladies.org. Cuanto antes, mejor. En caso de que nadie se ofrezca, haremos un sorteo (con el comando sample() en R!!!).

• A partir del primer encuentro, cada grupo de trabajo se auto-gestionará. Por ejemplo, sorteará o decidirá quién guiará el siguiente capítulo, si verán un capítulo, medio capítulo o dos capítulos (la propuesta general es ir despacio, lento pero sin tregua), si aplicarán lo que se vió en el capítulo a otro set de datos etc. Contamos con el espacio de slack para consultarnos y compartir información en cada grupo y entre grupos.

Al anotarse, les pedimos que primero lean y acepten el código de conducta que encontrarán en la página.

Para asistir al meetup, les recomendamos poseer una cuenta de google (utilizaremos google meet). Se recomienda tener conocimientos básicos de R.

¡ATENCIÓN! por cuestiones de seguridad virtual, el enlace a la reunión se enviará unos minutos antes de la misma. Por ello les pedimos que
estén alertas al correo.

title: Club de lectura R para Ciencia de Datos (Wickham & Grolemund) - Sesión 9
description:
Las R-Ladies de Barranquilla (COL), Galápagos, Guayaquil y Milagro (ECU) nos hemos unido para traerte un club de lectura basado en el libro R para Ciencia de Datos de Wickham y Grolemund. Este libro está disponible en español gracias al esfuerzo de la comunidad R latinoamericana y puede ser accedido de manera libre aquí: https://es.r4ds.hadley.nz.

En esta octava sesión de nuestro club de lectura, Zulemma Bazurto Blacio y Linda Cabrera Orellana de R-Ladies Guayaquil hablarán sobre transformación de datos y flujos de trabajo que puedes aplicar para desarrollar y compartir tu código de manera más eficiente. Esto incluye los siguientes capítulos:
Capítulo 4 - Flujo de trabajo: Conocimientos básicos.
Capítulo 5 - Transformación de datos
Capítulo 6 - Flujo de trabajo: Scripts
Capítulo 8 - Flujo de trabajo: Proyectos

Este club de lectura incluirá varias sesiones quincenales que se llevarán a cabo a través de Zoom. Cada sesión durará dos horas durante las cuales discutiremos y practicaremos los puntos más importantes del capítulo o capítulos en el que nos enfoquemos para esa sesión.

Recuerda, las sesiones son los jueves de cada quincena empezando a las 18:00 (UTC-5, Colombia y Ecuador Continental), o si estás en Galápagos a las 17:00 (UTC-6).

Al participar en nuestros eventos recuerda que estás aceptando nuestro código de conducta, el cual nos ayuda a crear un espacio amable y seguro para aprender: https://github.com/rladies/starter-kit/wiki/Code-of-Conduct#spanish

title: R for Data Science Book Club (Meeting 4)
description:
R-Ladies DC will be reading R for Data Science in 8 biweekly meetings (July 15, July 29, Aug 12, Aug 26, Sept 9, Sept 23, Oct 14, Oct 28).

The selected book chapters should be read before the meeting time.

There are also exercises for each week which you should aim to complete before the meeting as well. We'll go through solutions to the exercises as a group. In most weeks, we'll also do some additional exercises from the chapters live during the meeting.

It's okay if you're not able to complete everything ahead of time, we understand that life happens. Please still attend the meeting, even if you didn't read everything or complete all the exercises.

In addition, if you have to miss a meeting time, all code will be made available after the meeting on Github: https://github.com/sctyner/r4ds-bookclub-rladiesdc

Note on the exercises: For all exercises, we will use the online version of the book. There are some differences between the online and print exercises, so we'll stick with the online ones so that everyone is doing the same exercises.

Note on meeting access: All meetings will be virtual. You must RSVP to the meeting on the R-Ladies DC Meetup page to receive the Zoom link. All meetings will take place on a Thursday from 7:00-8:30pm ET (America/New York).

Meeting 4 (August 26, 2021): Data Importing, Tidying, and Joining
Physical book chapters Pages
Ch. 8: Data Import 125-146
Ch. 9: Tidy Data 147-170
Ch. 10: Relational Data 171-194
(70 pages total)

Ebook Chapters Link
Ch. 9: Introduction (Wrangle) https://r4ds.had.co.nz/wrangle-intro.html
Ch. 11: Data Import https://r4ds.had.co.nz/data-import.html
Ch. 12: Tidy Data https://r4ds.had.co.nz/tidy-data.html
Ch. 13: Relational Data https://r4ds.had.co.nz/relational-data.html

Exercises (from online book chapters):
Chapter 11: Section 11.2.2 # 1, 2
Chapter 11: Section 11.3.5 # 2, 5, 7
Chapter 12: Section 12.2.1 # 2 (all parts)
Chapter 12: Section 12.3.3 # 1, 3
Chapter 12: Section 12.4.3 # 1, 2
Chapter 12: Section 12.5.1 # 1, 2
Chapter 12: Section 12.6.1 # 3, 4
Chapter 13: Section 13.2.1 # 1, 4
Chapter 13: Section 13.3.1 # 2 (all parts)
Chapter 13: Section 13.4.6 # 1, 2, 5
Chapter 13: Section 13.5.1 # 1, 2, 3, 5

title: Introdução ao R Markdown
¡Primer meet-up R-Ladies Guayaquil!
description:
¡Comienza la iniciativa en la ciudad! ¡Bienvenid@s!
En esta primera reunión nos conoceremos y te diremos qué trae consigo esta maravillosa iniciativa. ¿Las mujeres participan en ciencias? ¿matemáticas? ¿tecnologías?, no sólo contestaremos estas preguntas; también explicaremos qué es R y cómo su uso es transversal en distintas áreas de aplicación.
Recuerda que todos los eventos son gratuitos.

¡Anímate a estar 15 minutos antes de la hora de inicio para el registro!

¡L@s esperamos!

title: Social Network con politicxsentwitteR
description:
¡Se viene un nuevo meetup!
Nos visita la politóloga Guadalupe González para presentar su paquete politicxsentwitteR. Con este paquete podrás obtener las publicaciones de politicxs argentinxs en Twitter y desarrollar proyectos de procesamiento del lenguaje natural, análisis de redes y visualización de datos.
Guadalupe va a contarnos cómo desarrolló el paquete, sus características, y de qué maneras podemos analizar sus datos con las librerías de R igraph y visNetwork.
Si venís de las Ciencias Sociales (o no), querés profundizar en análisis de redes o te interesa el análisis de Twitter como fuente de información, este meetup es para vos.
Lxs esperamos!

***IMPORTANTE***
Para participar poné "Asistiré" en este evento y asegurate de tener también instalado Zoom en tu computadora (https://zoom.us/download).

Por razones de seguridad no compartiremos el link para ingresar a Zoom de manera pública. El mismo dia del evento a las 17:30 hs. vamos a mandar un mail a través de Meetup a todas las personas que confirmaron asistencia con el link para que puedas unirte a la videollamada.

title: Making plots to explore data using R
description:
For our August event, we are excited to host Professor Di Cook of Monash University who will be presenting strategies for making plots to explore data using R. There is an interactive component to her talk, and she has requested that attendees download packages tidyverse, plotly, forcats, and nullabor from CRAN, as well as yowie from Github using remotes::install_github("numbats/yo­wie").

This event will be hosted over Zoom, and the link will be available on this Meetup page at noon on the day of the event.

Agenda (times approximate):
7-7:05 pm: R-Ladies NYC Announcements
7:05-7:50: "Making plots to explore data using R"
7:50-8:15: Questions and wrap-up

Abstract: A recent article by Hullman and Gelman appeared in the Harvard Data Science Review (https://hdsr.mitpress.mit.edu/pub/w075glo6) arguing the need for more theoretical work to support interactive exploratory graphics. It is accompanied by six short informative commentaries. Plots have always been an instrument for data exploration, and yet it is a difficult task, to teach and to conduct. Here we will give a walk-through on organizing your work to make plots to explore data and to quantitatively check if what you see is spurious or special.

Bio: Dianne Cook is Professor of Business Analytics at Monash University in Melbourne, Australia. Her research is in the area of data visualization, especially the visualization of high-dimensional data using tours with low-dimensional projections, and projection pursuit. A current focus is on bridging the gap between exploratory graphics and statistical inference. Di utilizes technology such as virtual environments, Amazon’s Mechanical Turk, and eye-tracking in her work, and makes an effort to share her work with open-source software. Di is a Fellow of the American Statistical Association, elected member of the International Statistical Institute, past-editor of the Journal of Computational and Graphical Statistics, elected Member of the R Foundation, and current editor of the R Journal.

---

R-Ladies is dedicated to providing a harassment-free experience for everyone. We do not tolerate harassment of participants in any form. Please take a moment to review the R-Ladies Global code of conduct (particularly if this is your first time attending!): https://rladies.org/code-of-conduct

For questions regarding accessibility, please email us at nyc@rladies.org.

title: From messy data to beautiful plot: Guided TidyTuesday
description:
Know the basics of data wrangling but want some hands-on practice? Want to learn ggplot tips and tricks to make your plots eye-catching? Seen cool visualizations on Twitter but find it hard to go from messy dataset to beautiful visualization?

In this monthly meetup, we’ll go through a Tidy Tuesday dataset together step-by-step, walking you through the entire process from coming up with an interesting question to asnwer, getting the data in the right format and finally, creating a cool visualization!

You may have heard of Tidy Tuesday -- a weekly initiative by R for Data Science which provides a new dataset every week for the community to practice wrangling and visualizing. It has a huge Twitter community and is one of the best ways to practice and develop tidyverse skills, whether you’re still reviewing the basics or have quite the repertoire. This series has something for everyone and is especially designed to be beginner friendly!

It's important to us to ensure that Guided Tidy Tuesday is a safe space for gender minorities and especially those who are just starting out with R. Studies have shown that letting gender minorities speak first promotes a welcoming and supportive atmosphere for underrepresented groups. All are welcome at this meetup but we specifically ask cisgender men to take a passive role in this meetup and hold comments / questions until after others have had the chance to ask. Thank you for your support!

title: Working in R Smarter, Faster, and More Securely - Hybrid (In-person or Zoom)
description:
*What are we going to learn:
In network optimal design, much of the focus is on computational efficiency. There is a need to run multiple variants of a 'job', that is, some R script you send to a (perhaps high performance) computer with input variables. Katie will discuss her general approach to modularised coding, sending jobs to a HPC and then analyzing results.

*Who is going to present:
Katie is a PhD candidate at Queensland University of Technology (QUT). She is working on Bayesian Adaptive design in river networks, which is an optimisation framework. In the context of water quality monitoring, we use this optimization algorithm to find where, when and how many sensors to deploy across the network. Katie completed her Bachelor of Advanced Mathematics from the University of Wollongong (UOW) and worked in the financial industry for a number of years before undertaking PhD studies.

* When are we meeting?
The talk will start at 5:00 pm for a ~45 minute presentation, 15 minutes Q&A time with the potential to move to an outside venue for continued socializing and networking.

* Where are we meeting?
We will meet at QUT Gardens Point campus room Y-801 (in building Y) - this will be a hybrid event with a Zoom link available.
map: https://goo.gl/maps/4H51oEEun6JuewVn6
DIRECTIONS TO THE ROOM - Y block/building is next to River Stage in QUT Gardens Point. The elevators to the 8th floor are on the side of the building facing P block and should not require card access. Please follow the hall to the right upon exiting the elevator on floor 8 to room Y-801, the first meeting room at the end of the hall.

* COVID plan: We will continue to monitor the COVID-19 situation in Brisbane up until the event and move to online only if necessary.

* R packages: SSN

We look forward to seeing you there!

R-Ladies Brisbane

********************************************************************************
Photos, Films and all other media/recordings: Photographs and/or video/other media will be taken at events held by this community. By taking part in an R-Ladies Brisbane event you grant the community organisers full rights to use the images resulting from the photography/video filming/media, and any reproductions or adaptations of the images for publicity, fund-raising or other purposes to help achieve the community’s aims. This might include (but is not limited to), the right to use them in their printed and online publicity, social media, press releases and funding applications. If you do not wish to be recorded in these media please inform a community organiser.

Code of Conduct: R-Ladies Brisbane is dedicated to providing a welcoming and harassment-free event experience for everyone, regardless of gender, gender identity and expression, age, sexual orientation, disability, physical appearance, body size, race, ethnicity, or religion (or lack thereof). We do not tolerate harassment of event participants in any form, for any event venue, including talks, workshops, parties, Twitter and other online media.

Community Policies: Please note, cis men are welcome to join our meetups when they come as a guest of a woman participant or they bring a woman with them. We highly encourage speakers and teachers at R-Ladies Brisbane events to be of minority genders.

Find us on Twitter @rladiesbrisbane for more information on news, presentations and code!

title: My Stat1 Project With RStudio
description:
"My Stat1 Project with RStudio" is designed to share beginners' experiences in using RStudio. Iman Al-Hasani, a lecturer at the department of statistics at Sultan Qaboos University (SQU) and co-organizer of R-Ladies Muscat introduced RStudio for an introductory Statistics course. She asked students to conduct group-based mini projects and analyze data in RStudio.

In this meeting, groups of her students are going to share their experiences in basic data analysis using RStudio. The objective of this meet-up is to sensitize the public about role of stat and RStudio in research promotion.

Four projects will be presented and are titled as follows :
- Cancer around the world.
- The relation between the hours spent on Social Media and universities students GPA during Fall 2020.
- Study the impact of the Corona crisis on small shops.
- The relation between communication companies' packages and promotional advertisements.

This meeting is organized jointly with the Data Science Analysis Lab (DSAL) and the Statistics Students Group (Stat Group) in SQU.

PREPARATION AND RESOURCE
There is nothing to prepare in advance.

ONLINE PROGRAMME
The event will be held online and will start at 17:00 (Oman time). Please join us via google meet link:
https://meet.google.com/xyx-jkgi-xyu

title: R Ladies Bogor 9th Meet Up: intro to Github!
description:
Dear all,

Setelah cukup lama absen, R Ladies Bogor akan mengadakan kembali meet-up, kali ini online via zoom. Untuk tema kali ini, kami mengundang mas Aswan Syahputra untuk memberikan pengenalan tentang cara men-setup dan menggunakan GitHub untuk meng-optimalisasi pemakaian R rekan-rekan sekalian.

Kali ini juga akan ada beberapa rekan R Ladies yang akan menyampaikan lightning talk dengan tema terkait R, jadi ayo ikut mendaftar dan hadir ya!

Untuk mendapatkan zoom linknya, mohon mengisi formulir berikut ini:

https://forms.gle/wwP2iyg3uWStktkR9

Kegiatan ini akan dilaksanakan pada:
Hari/tanggal: Sabtu, 21 Agustus 2021
Waktu: 13.00-15.00 WIB

Silakan di-share kepada rekan-rekan lain yang mungkin juga ingin ikut hadir ya :)

Terima kasih dan sampai jumpa.
Salam,

Ulfah
Co-coordinator R Ladies Bogor/Jakarta

title: Club de lectura R para Ciencia de Datos (Wickham & Grolemund) - Sesión 8
description:
Las R-Ladies de Barranquilla (COL), Galápagos, Guayaquil y Milagro (ECU) nos hemos unido para traerte un club de lectura basado en el libro R para Ciencia de Datos de Wickham y Grolemund. Este libro está disponible en español gracias al esfuerzo de la comunidad R latinoamericana y puede ser accedido de manera libre aquí: https://es.r4ds.hadley.nz.

En esta octava sesión de nuestro club de lectura, Linda Cabrera Orellana (R-Ladies Guayaquil) hablará sobre las herramientas necesarias para crear buenos gráficos utilizando los paquetes ggplot2, ggrepel y viridis. Esto incluye al capítulo 28 (Comunicar con gráficos).

Este club de lectura incluirá varias sesiones quincenales que se llevarán a cabo a través de Zoom. Cada sesión durará dos horas durante las cuales discutiremos y practicaremos los puntos más importantes del capítulo o capítulos en el que nos enfoquemos para esa sesión.

Recuerda, las sesiones son los jueves de cada quincena empezando a las 18:00 (UTC-5, Colombia y Ecuador Continental), o si estás en Galápagos a las 17:00 (UTC-6).

Al participar en nuestros eventos recuerda que estás aceptando nuestro código de conducta, el cual nos ayuda a crear un espacio amable y seguro para aprender: https://github.com/rladies/starter-kit/wiki/Code-of-Conduct#spanish

title: GRUPO 3. TALLER DE ESTUDIO LIBRO "R PARA CIENCIA DE DATOS"
description:
¡Desde RLadies Bariloche les invitamos a comenzar con el estudio en grupo del libro R para Ciencia de Datos (versión traducida al español de R for Data Science) de Hadley Wickham (el creador de Tidyverse y varios paquetes más!). El libro es de libre acceso en https://es.r4ds.hadley.nz/ ¡Está muy bueno!

• Nos juntaremos de forma virtual una vez cada 15 días para avanzar con la lectura y comprensión del libro y los scripts. Cada encuentro será guiado por uno o dos integrantes del grupo.

• En el primer encuentro discutiremos el capitulo número 3 “visualización de datos” (¡Qué bueno, empezamos con gráficos con ggplot2 ) https://es.r4ds.hadley.nz/visualizaci%C3%B3n-de-datos.html Es necesario llegar a la reunión con el capítulo previamente leído y trabajado. Quienes no leyeron la introducción del libro aún: adelante, es corta, y les dará un panorama de lo que iremos estudiando. En la reunión de organización vimos un panorama de la introducción.

• En base a la encuesta de horarios que hicimos, hemos definido tres grupos de trabajo con distintos horarios. ¡ATENCIÓN! ¡Por favor, anotarse solo en uno de los tres! AHORA ESTÁS EN EL MEETUP DEL GRUPO 3, DE JUEVES DE 18 A 20.

• ¡Importante! Ni bien se inscriban en el meetup, entren a los ajustes de su perfil y verifiquen tener activas las notificaciones, no sólo del meetup en general, sino del grupo RLadies-BRC en particular (figuran abajo del todo en notificaciones por correo electrónico) para poder recibir luego el enlace para conectarse y otras notificaciones relacionadas al evento.

• Quienes se inscriban al meetup y si aún no se sumaron, van a recibir más adelante un enlace para sumarse al espacio de trabajo de slack que es exclusivo para el estudio del libro y que será nuestra principal vía de comunicación. Si nunca lo usaron y/o necesitan ayuda para familiarizarse, escríbannos y les damos una orientación rápida.

• Necesitamos uno o dos voluntarias o voluntarios para guiar el capítulo número 3. Interesadxs nos lo pueden comunicar por el slack o al correo bariloche@rladies.org. Cuanto antes, mejor. En caso de que nadie se ofrezca, haremos un sorteo (con el comando sample() en R!!!).

• A partir del primer encuentro, cada grupo de trabajo se auto-gestionará. Por ejemplo, sorteará o decidirá quién guiará el siguiente capítulo, si verán un capítulo, medio capítulo o dos capítulos (la propuesta general es ir despacio, lento pero sin tregua), si aplicarán lo que se vió en el capítulo a otro set de datos etc. Contamos con el espacio de slack para consultarnos y compartir información en cada grupo y entre grupos.

Al anotarse, les pedimos que primero lean y acepten el código de conducta que encontrarán en la página.

Para asistir al meetup, les recomendamos poseer una cuenta de google (utilizaremos google meet). Se recomienda tener conocimientos básicos de R.

¡ATENCIÓN! por cuestiones de seguridad virtual, el enlace a la reunión se enviará unos minutos antes de la misma. Por ello les pedimos que
estén alertas al correo.

title: R básico aplicado a Sistemas de Información Geográfico en Google Colab
description:
Comunidad, les esperamos en nuestro próximo evento donde Daniela O. Falcon nos introducirá a los paquetes especializados en Sistemas de Información Geográfica (SIG) en Google Colab.

Paqueterías a utilizar:
library("rgdal")
library("raster")
library("rgeos")

Martes 17 agosto 2021.
18:00 hrs.

Material del evento ya disponible: https://github.com/R-LadiesGDL/MEETUP-match-rstudio-colab-SIG

Evento vía zoom.

title: IN PERSON Happy Hour
description:
Join us for our first in-person outdoor happy hour in over a year! It'll be refreshing to see everyone in person (seeing everyone's lovely faces on zoom is nice, but just not the same :) ), and we'll all be in the same boat as we navigate the return to in-person social interaction.

Since the pandemic is not over yet, we have a few requests in order to keep everyone safe:

- please do not come if you are not fully vaccinated (we look forward to seeing you in person as soon as it is safe for everyone to resume normal activities, though!)
- please follow CDC and Philadelphia guidelines on COVID safety
- bring a mask with you (and wear it as you feel comfortable, or as is
required by the location)

Getting there:
- Sunset Social @ Cira Green is on the roof of 129 S 30th Street
- Take the elevator to the 11th floor (elevators are located in the parking garage connected to the FMC Tower)
- $6 Parking validation is offered after 5PM
- 2 blocks south of the 30th Street train station
- More info here https://sunsetsocialphl.com/ and here http://ciragreen.com/

title: R-Ladies Book Club
description:
For our August book club, we'll be discussing "Algorithms of Oppression: How Search Engines Reinforce Racism" by Safiya Umoja Noble.

---

**Important Update**: While this month's Book Club was originally scheduled to be in person, in light of oppressive heat this week in NYC and expected thunderstorms throughout the afternoon of Saturday, August 14th, this will now be an online event. The zoom link will be available on this page Saturday morning, and a message with the meeting passcode will go out at that time.

---

R-Ladies is dedicated to providing a harassment-free experience for everyone. We do not tolerate harassment of participants in any form. Please take a moment to review the R-Ladies Global code of conduct (particularly if this is your first time attending!): https://rladies.org/code-of-conduct

title: Data Analysis using R
description:
Analyzing data in R usually starts with importing data, cleaning and manipulating data, then running functions to visualize and model the data.

Our guest instructor, Ogunyemi Olakunle Joshua (MNIM), would taking us through R's powerful functions that covers the entire process going from raw data to communicating insights from the data.

Olakunle is a seasoned data analyst and an R instructor with a global impact on young people across the world. He is also the founder of TAG NG, a leadership organisation poised at adding fragrance to the lives of young people in the area of leadership, data science and entrepreneurship.

He holds a master's degree in Forest Biometrics and Information System from the premier University of Ibadan and he is the author of the first book on R in Nigeria with the title, "Basic Statistics for Undergraduate Students Using R".

title: R for Data Science Book Club (Meeting 3)
description:
R-Ladies DC will be reading R for Data Science in 8 biweekly meetings (July 15, July 29, Aug 12, Aug 26, Sept 9, Sept 23, Oct 14, Oct 28).

The selected book chapters should be read before the meeting time.

There are also exercises for each week which you should aim to complete before the meeting as well. We'll go through solutions to the exercises as a group. In most weeks, we'll also do some additional exercises from the chapters live during the meeting.

It's okay if you're not able to complete everything ahead of time, we understand that life happens. Please still attend the meeting, even if you didn't read everything or complete all the exercises.

In addition, if you have to miss a meeting time, all code will be made available after the meeting on Github: https://github.com/sctyner/r4ds-bookclub-rladiesdc

Note on the exercises: For all exercises, we will use the online version of the book. There are some differences between the online and print exercises, so we'll stick with the online ones so that everyone is doing the same exercises.

Note on meeting access: All meetings will be virtual. You must RSVP to the meeting on the R-Ladies DC Meetup page to receive the Zoom link. All meetings will take place on a Thursday from 7:00-8:30pm ET (America/New York).

Meeting 3 (August 12, 2021): Data Transformation & Exploratory Data Analysis

Physical book chapters Pages
Ch. 14: Pipes 261-268
Ch. 3: Data Transformation 43-76
Ch. 5: Exploratory Data Analysis 81-110
(72 pages total)

Ebook Chapters Link
Ch. 18: Pipes https://r4ds.had.co.nz/pipes.html
Ch. 5: Data Transformation https://r4ds.had.co.nz/transform.html
Ch. 7: Exploratory Data Analysis https://r4ds.had.co.nz/exploratory-data-analysis.html

Exercises (from online book chapters)
Chapter 5: Section 5.2.4 # 1 (odd-numbered sub-parts only), # 2 - 4
Chapter 5: Section 5.3.1 # 1, 3, 4
Chapter 5: Section 5.4.1 # 1 - 4
Chapter 5: Section 5.5.2 # 1, 3, 5
Chapter 5: Section 5.6.7 # 2 - 6
Chapter 5: Section 5.7.1 # 2, 4, 6, 8
Chapter 7: Section 7.3.4 # 2 - 4
Chapter 7: Section 7.4.1 # 1, 2
Chapter 7: Section 7.5. Do the first 2 problems of each section 7.5.1.1, 7.5.2.1, and 7.5.3.1
BONUS: Follow the style of this tweet to "translate" some of your favorite song lyrics into {tidyverse}-style code https://twitter.com/hadleywickham/status/1359852563726819332?s=20

title: DIY R package!
description:
Do you have a few custom functions on heavy rotation? Perhaps you have a piece of code that you regularly share with colleagues? Maybe you want to include your analysis code alongside a publication? Why not put it all in an R package?! This interactive workshop will equip you with the basic skills to create an R package of your own! Participants should have 1) a Github account; 2) the most recent version of R and RStudio installed; 3) the following package(s) and their dependencies installed: devtools, testthat, knitr.

Bio: Fonti is a postdoctoral research fellow at University of New South Wales, Sydney, Australia. She is an evolutionary biologist at heart but is currently working as an R package developer. Fonti works alongside researchers to develop R software tools for the research community. Her interests include biostatistics, reproducible science, learning about the latest coding practices and teaching others to enjoy using R. She is the founder of UNSWcodeRs - a university R user community where students and staff can learn new skills and find coding support.

title: RLadies Boulder Meetup #17: From csv to slippy map - intro to spatial data in R
description:
Hi Boulder UseRs! Join us for this month's virtual R Ladies Meetup! This month, Anna Spiers will be giving us an introduction to spatial data and map-making in R!

From Anna: Working with spatial data can feel as finicky as caring for your favorite houseplant - your attempts to help are rejected despite following instructions, and you look longingly at friends' and colleagues' masterpieces (i.e., maps/plants). This talk will introduce spatial data broadly, and cover some of the basic workflows and troubleshooting steps in R. Specifically, we will work with vector data, focus on the `sp` and `sf` libraries, and produce an interactive map in R. Example data and code will be provided.

We will be meeting over Zoom (Meeting link visible when you RSVP). Join us to connect with other R users in the Boulder area and learn some new techniques to apply in your work!

We hope you'll also join our local Slack workspace to keep the R help and conversation flowing! To get access to the Slack workspace, please fill out this short Google form: https://forms.gle/j36YGxuNwN6zZ8nW7.

title: Club de lectura: R para Ciencia de Datos (Wickham & Grolemund)
description:
Las R-Ladies de Barranquilla (COL), Galápagos, Guayaquil y Milagro (ECU) nos hemos unido para traerte un club de lectura basado en el libro R para Ciencia de Datos de Wickham y Grolemund. Este libro está disponible en español gracias a él esfuerzo de la comunidad R latinoamericana y puede ser accedido de manera libre aquí: https://es.r4ds.hadley.nz
En esta septima sesión de nuestro club de lectura, Denisse Fierro Arcos (R-Ladies Galàpagos) e Isabel Vásquez (R-Ladies Barranquilla) hablaran sobre como crear gráficos utilizando el paquete ggplot2 esto incluye el capítulo 3 ( Visualización de datos).
Este club de lectura incluirá varias sesiones quincenales que se llevarán a cabo a través de Zoom. Cada sesión durará dos horas durante las cuales discutiremos y practicaremos los puntos más importantes del capítulo en el que nos enfoquemos para esa sesión. Recuerda, las sesiones son los jueves de cada quincena empiezando a las 18:00(UTC-5, Colombia y Ecuador Continental), o si estás en Galápagos a las 17:00(UTC-6). Al participar en nuestros eventos recuerda que estás aceptando nuestro código de conducta, el cual nos ayuda a crear un espacio amable y seguro para aprender:

https://github.com/rladies/starter-kit/wiki/Code-of-Conduct#spanish
