title: Colour your ggplots beautiful!
description:
Struggling with boring black and white plots? Sick of R's default colours? We've got your back! In this meetup, we'll show you how to colour your ggplots beautiful.

We'll cover:
- how to use any custom colour(s) you fancy (and how to find colours that match perfectly)
- commonly used colour palettes like viridis and RColorBrewer, but also lesser-known options that are based on e.g. Wes Anderson films, US National Park posters, or classic rock album covers
- things to consider when creating data visualisations, such as how to make sure your graphs are accessible and don't perpetuate (gender) stereotypes

So join us to play with color in ggplot and never have a bland plot again!

It's important to us to ensure that R-Ladies Freiburg events are a safe space for gender minorities and especially those who are just starting out with R. All are welcome at this meetup but we specifically ask cisgender men to take a passive role in this meetup and hold comments / questions until after others have had the chance to ask. Thank you for your support!

title: A remote glimpse into the useR! 2021 conference
description:
Hi Everyone!

Recently the useR! 2021 conference was held. useR! is the main annual R conference where R users, developers, or simply R lovers from any level of experience come together to share new packages and ideas. If you missed out this years useR! conference, or have never had the chance to attend, then this event will be for you! Our very own Anna Quaglieri will give a seminar about her experiences at useR! 2021!

Officially, useR! 2021 was held in Zürich, but due to the ongoing pandemic it was run completely online. In this talk, Anna is going to share her conference experience and highlights that she could follow from the comfort of her Melbourne bedroom. The talk will cover a broad range of topics, from new packages for data visualization, discussions and methods to allow R in production, package testing, highlights from keynotes talks, and more!

Anna has an academic background in Statistics, completed between the universities of Bologna, Glasgow and Melbourne. Once in Melbourne, she joined the WEHI where she did her Masters research in Population Genetics, and PhD in Cancer Genomics. She then worked for 1.5 years as a Data Scientist for the AI consulting company Eliiza. Two months ago she joined the Melbourne based startup Mass Dynamics where she is working as a Bioinformatics Data Scientist. At Mass Dynamics Anna develops workflows for the analysis of mass spectrometry data, with the aim of helping more life scientists transform proteomics data to knowledge.

Due to the current COVID restrictions in Melbourne, this event will be held online. Please be sure to connect at 5:30pm (AEST). The passcode for the Zoom session is 000111.

We look forward to seeing everyone at the seminar!

R-Ladies Melbourne

title: Club de lectura del libro "Data Feminism" (sesión 3)
description:
El próximo jueves 29 de julio nos reuniremos para nuestra tercera sesión del club de lectura sobre libro "Data Feminism", de Catherine D'Ignazio y Lauren F. Klein. Este libro muestra una nueva forma de abordar la ciencia de datos y la ética de datos basada en ideas del feminismo interseccional. Se puede acceder de forma gratuita en: https://data-feminism.mitpress.mit.edu/
- ¿Cómo funciona el club de lectura?
Dividiremos la lectura del libro en seis sesiones. En cada una de ellas abordaremos un capítulo del libro. Cada sesión la liderará alguien de nuestra comunidad.
Esta primera sesión estará a cargo de Francisca Ortiz (https://twitter.com/FranciscaOrtizR), candidata a Doctora en Sociología por la Universidad de Manchester. Durante la sesión comentaremos el capítulo 3, "3. On Rational, Scientific, Objective Viewpoints from Mythical, Imaginary, Impossible Standpoints", en el que se presenta el segundo principio del feminismo de datos: elevar la emoción y la corporalidad (embodiment).
- ¿Qué pasa si no puedo leer en inglés?
¡Puedes participar igual! La persona encargada de cada sesión hará una síntesis de los puntos más importantes, así que incluso si no puedes revisar el libro, podrás aprender sobre este tema :)
- CÓDIGO DE CONDUCTA
Queremos que este sea un espacio de aprendizaje amable y seguro. Al inscribirte en este evento estás aceptando nuestro código de conducta: https://github.com/rladies/starter-kit/wiki/Code-of-Conduct#spanish
El evento se realizará a través de la plataforma Zoom. El día del taller compartiremos la contraseña en los comentarios del evento.
- HORA
El evento se realizará a las 16:00 horas de la zona horaria UTC-4. Puedes revisar a qué hora corresponde en tu zona en el siguiente enlace: https://everytimezone.com/s/7cb284f2

title: ¡Primer meet-up R-Ladies Guayaquil!
description:
¡Comienza la iniciativa en la ciudad! ¡Bienvenid@s!
En esta primera reunión nos conoceremos y te diremos qué trae consigo esta maravillosa iniciativa. ¿Las mujeres participan en ciencias? ¿matemáticas? ¿tecnologías?, no sólo contestaremos estas preguntas; también explicaremos qué es R y cómo su uso es transversal en distintas áreas de aplicación.
Recuerda que todos los eventos son gratuitos.

¡Anímate a estar 15 minutos antes de la hora de inicio para el registro!

¡L@s esperamos!

title: Making Web-Ready Maps
description:
Greetings members!

title: Strategies to Manage Projects
description:
Hi Everyone!

This month we are excited to have Dr. Kathryn Robson with us! Kathryn will be presenting a seminar on project management strategies!

In her seminar, Kathryn will discuss concepts required for successful project management. She is a retired lecturer from RMIT who specialises in business, management, and property subjects.

Given the current COVID situation in Melbourne, this will be on online event. Please connect at 5:30pm (AEST) for a prompt start.

We look forward seeing everyone at the event!

R-Ladies Melbourne

title: "Journey through the tidyverse" with Dr. Che Smith
description:
For the July 28 edition of our R-Ladies Dallas webinar series, we are excited to welcome Dr. Che Smith as our guest speaker. Dr. Smith will introduce the packages in the tidyverse!

~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
Session title: Journey through the tidyverse
~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~

Abstract: In a (recent) former life, I taught Data Science and Statistics at Davidson College with R and RStudio as my primary tools. Join me as I reflect on the wins and challenges of using RStudio to teach R applied to data science and statistics, framed in topics related to social justice, inequity, and community.

Bio: Che Smith is a data enthusiast whose career has spanned several industries and specialties. She is currently a Senior Analytics Engineer at Netflix, helping to continuously improve content performance metrics for titles launching on the streaming service. Prior to Netflix, Che taught data science and statistics at Davidson College and also directed a consulting and tutoring lab for the college. By training, Che is a biostatistician, and spent several years working with state and local health departments on using data in innovative ways. A long time R user, Che’s favorite super-package is tidyverse, and she loves to find datasets to wrangle, visualize, and draw insights from.

Twitter: @DrCheSmith

LinkedIn: https://www.linkedin.com/in/chesmith1/

Website:

*************************************************************************

You are encouraged to click the link below to keep up with the group project and to join the Slack community. Slack is a messaging platform where we will share open job opportunities, free or low-cost online training materials, and R-Ladies group projects that will help you practice your R programming skills and develop a portfolio that could be used to showcase your skills to hiring managers.

Slack sign-up: https://docs.google.com/forms/d/e/1FAIpQLSdJhvSg-YrNYOrmju1yrXvYhFM7xMey1WpDq1NSGIp6x41VaA/viewform

*************************************************************************

We expect all attendees to abide & be governed by our community code of conduct. Please take a moment to review our R-Ladies Global code of conduct (particularly if this is your first time attending!): https://github.com/rladies/starter-kit/wiki/Code-of-Conduct.

title: CallToAction: DEVELOPER SURVEY 2021
description:
Buongiorno a tutt*
avete qualche minuto? Vorrei invitarvi a partecipare a questo sondaggio globale per sviluppatori, appassionati e tutti coloro che sono coinvolti nel settore tech!
Condividi ciò che ti piace e non ti piace degli strumenti e delle piattaforme più diffusi e crea un impatto sull'ecosistema tech. Il sondaggio è aperto a tutti e copre 13 aree, tra cui: Web, Mobile, Desktop, Cloud, Industrial IoT, Consumer Electronics, Embedded software, AR & VR, Apps/extensions per 3rd-party ecosystems, Games, Machine Learning & AI, e Data science.
Come ricompensa, riceverai una serie di risorse di coding gratuite, oltre alla possibilità di vincere un MacBook Pro 2021 da 13 pollici, un Samsung Galaxy S21+ Plus, $ 200 per acquistare strumenti/licenze a tua scelta, un monitor portatile, una scrivania e altri premi tramite estrazioni a sorteggio.
Il sondaggio è disponibile in 9 lingue, quindi scegli quella che preferisci. Ci vogliono circa 20 minuti ma puoi mettere in pausa per salvare le tue risposte e finire più tardi.
Concludi il sondaggio prima della chiusura del 4 agosto.

La community RLadies Italy è partner del sondaggio, rispondendo utilizzando il nostro link ci aiuterete a 'guadagnare' risposte e reinvestire il guadagno nella community, e quindi su di voi!

Link:
https://developereconomics.net?member_id=rladies_italy&lang=en&locale=en

title: R4DS – Importing and Tidying data (chapters 11 and 12)
description:
Our second session will focus on chapters 11 and 12, which are on data import functions and tidy data principles and functions.
Similar to the first session, the first half hour will focus on the concepts and the second half will be a hands-on group exercise using real data.

You do not need to read anything in advance to participate, but you can view the chapters using the link below.

https://r4ds.had.co.nz/index.html

When?
July 13 at 5:30 pm MST

Where?
Zoom Link: https://udenver.zoom.us/j/82342507197

Remember to RSVP to the event, and we look forward to seeing you there!

title: Virtual event- Tidy Tuesday!
description:
*What are we going to do?
Tidy Tuesday (https://github.com/rfordatascience/tidytuesday) is a social weekly event where you can practice you data wrangling and visualisation skills using real-world data in a safe and supportive forum! Every Tuesday a new dataset is released.

*Who is going to present?
This is not a presentation. Please expect a hands-on session in a friendly and laid-back atmosphere where we are all encouraged to learn together. On the night, we will use the dataset released on Tuesday July 27th, divide into groups, and work and learn together to produce interesting visualisations. This will be an opportunity to work on real-world data in a collaborative environment, as well as to practice sharing your code on GitHub and with the online Twitter community.

* When are we meeting?
The hands-on will start at 5:30 pm for 1.5 hour. Please arrive on time! After the coding part we can have a social event for the last 30 minutes, and show each other what we achieved. End time 7:30 pm.

* Where are we meeting?
We will meet virtually using Zoom, the link will be visible to people who RSVP.

* What else is needed?
**Feel free to download and start working on the dataset prior to the event!**
The data for each week is available on the Tidy Tuesday website: https://github.com/rfordatascience/tidytuesday/tree/master/data/2021 Week 31.
Software requirements:
- R (Free at https://cran.r-project.org/)
- RStudio (Free at https://www.rstudio.com/products/rstudio/download/)

Resources:
Data Visualization https://clauswilke.com/dataviz/
Wrangle your data with dplyr - https://allisonhorst.shinyapps.io/dplyr-learnr/

Colour Palettes:
Wes Anderson Colour Palette https://github.com/karthik/wesanderson
Studio Ghibli Colour Palette https://ewenme.github.io/ghibli/
Calecopal (inspired by different California ecosystems and created by An Bui!) https://github.com/an-bui/calecopal
Sci-Fi Themed Colour Palette https://cran.r-project.org/web/packages/ggsci/vignettes/ggsci.html

Inspiration:
Collection of best tidy tuesday plots https://www.cedricscherer.com/2019/12/30/best-tidytuesday-2019/
https://twitter.com/hashtag/TidyTuesday

Looking forward to data wrangling with you!

title: July 2021 Coder_RLadies Meeting
description: Let's talk and demo all things R

title: Trabajando con pipes y stringr
description:
Bienvenidxs! Este meetup está dirigido a personas con conocimientos básicos de R que deseen aprender a utilizar el paquete stringr.

REQUERIMIENTOS DE SOFTWARE
+ Tener instalado R >= 4.0
+ Tener instalado RStudio >= 1.4
+ Instalar los paquetes de R: dplyr y stringr

Puedes usar este comando para su instalación:
install.packages("dplyr", dependencies = TRUE)
install.packages("stringr", dependencies = TRUE)

CÓDIGO DE CONDUCTA
Recuerda leer y atender nuestro código de conducta disponible en https://rladies.org/code-of-conduct/ o https://rladiesmx.netlify.app/codigo_de_conducta/

PATROCINADORES
Agradecemos a nuestros patrocinadores: Red Mexicana de Bioinformática

title: DIY R Package
description:
Do you have a few custom functions on heavy rotation? Perhaps you have a piece of code that you regularly share with colleagues? Maybe you want to include your analysis code alongside a publication? Why not put it all in an R package?!

This interactive workshop will equip you with the basic skills to create an R package of your own!

Participants should have
1) a Github account;
2) the most recent version of R and RStudio installed;
3) the following package(s) and their dependencies installed: devtools, testthat, knitr.

Bio: Fonti is a postdoctoral research fellow at University of New South Wales, Sydney, Australia. She is an evolutionary biologist at heart but is currently working as an R package developer. Fonti works alongside researchers to develop R software tools for the research community. Her interests include biostatistics, reproducible science, learning about the latest coding practices and teaching others to enjoy using R. She is the founder of UNSWcodeRs - a university R user community where students and staff can learn new skills and find coding support.

title: Meetup 10 - Research Software Engineering and Academia
description:
This is a retelecast of the UseR2021 Keynote by Dr Heidi Seibold. Heidi works at the intersection of open science, data science and health research and is a fan of science communication. She has been involved in the development of R packages including partykit, model4you, and OpenML. She co-founded the Zurich R User Group and co-organized useR! 2020.

***** THE SPEAKER WILL NOT BE SPEAKING LIVE IN THIS EVENT *****

title: Workshop: Mineração de texto com R
description:
Esse mês temos mais um encontro imperdível! Inscrição por link na bio!

Dessa vez vamos aprender sobre manipulação de dados textuais e a aplicação da técnica de mineração de texto!

Então, se você quer conhecer formas de lidar com strings, obter e analisar dados textuais da internet esse é o seu momento. Esse workshop vai ser ministrado pela feríssima Suzana Lima que é bacharel em Estatística formada pela UFBA. Atualmente está cursando seu mestrado em Matemática com foco em Estatística também na UFBA e trabalha como Engenheira de Dados no Instituto de Saúde Coletiva da UFBA.

Temos muito o que aprender com ela e esperamos vocês nesse nosso primeiro workshop!

O link para inscrição está na bio do nosso instagram @rladiesbsb

title: Gráficos animados en R con datos de Netflix
description:
Hola a tod@s! L@s invitamos a nuestra reunión de julio por Zoom. En esta ocasión nos acompañará Dra. Ariadna Angulo-Burnet, es
doctora en Psicología por la Universitat Autònoma de Barcelona. Profesora Lectora en Universitat Oberta de Catalunya en los Estudios de Psicologia y Ciencias de la Educación y profesora asociada en Universitat Autònoma de Barcelona en Psicometría y Modelos Estadísticos y Psicométricos. Sus principales intereses de investigación están relacionados con la aplicación de psicometría en diversos contextos aplicados (psicología de los medios, psicología de la salud).

Dra. Ariadna nos impartirá una taller de gráficos animados con datos de Netflix. Puedes seguirla en Twitter, @AnguloBrunet o por su página de GitHub: https://github.com/angulob.

Nuestra reunión se llevará a cabo el sábado 24 de julio a las 12:00 horas (GMT-6 hora de la Ciudad de México) por Zoom.

title: DemocRacia con R: Conteos Rápidos 2021
description:
DemocRacia con R: Conteos Rápidos 2021
Acompáñanos a conocer más sobre los Conteos Rápidos, de la mano de María Teresa Ortíz, integrante del Comité Técnico Asesor de los Conteos Rápidos 2021.

«Platicaremos de los retos que surjen en un conteo rápido, y porque R es una herramienta ideal para afrontar muchos de ellos. Además hablaremos de la importancia de tener un flujo de trabajo robusto (control de versiones, contenedores, peer review, etc.), y el porqué en nuestro equipo decidimos desarrollar un paquete de R para organizar el código» -MTO

¿Que es el Conteo Rápido?
Es un procedimiento estadístico para informar a la ciudadanía sobre la estimación de las tendencias de los resultados la misma noche de la elección y el objetivo general es contribuir a dar certidumbre, confianza y transparencia en el proceso electoral, siendo un ejercicio cuya fuente única de información son los votos emitidos en las casillas por la ciudadanía.

Más sobre María Teresa Ortíz -> https://tereom.netlify.app

Repositorio COTECORA
https://github.com/cotecora-team-2

Datos de acceso
La liga está disponible en los datos de este evento. Favor de ingresar con su nombre completo, para identificarles correctamente y permitirles el acceso.

title: Club de lectura R para Ciencia de Datos (Wickham & Grolemund) - Sesión 6
description:
Las R-Ladies de Barranquilla (COL), Galápagos, Guayaquil y Milagro (ECU) nos hemos unido para traerte un club de lectura basado en el libro R para Ciencia de Datos de Wickham y Grolemund. Este libro está disponible en español gracias al esfuerzo de la comunidad R latinoamericana y puede ser accedido de manera libre aquí: https://es.r4ds.hadley.nz.

En esta cuarta sesión de nuestro club de lectura, María Isabel Arrieta y Viviana Florez Camacho (R-Ladies Barranquilla) hablarán sobre diferentes tipos de datos. Esto incluye a los capítulos 12 (Datos ordenados) y 13 (Datos relacionales).

Este club de lectura incluirá varias sesiones quincenales que se llevarán a cabo a través de Zoom. Cada sesión durará dos horas durante las cuales discutiremos y practicaremos los puntos más importantes del capítulo o capítulos en el que nos enfoquemos para esa sesión.

Recuerda, las sesiones son los jueves de cada quincena empezando a las 18:00 (UTC-5, Colombia y Ecuador Continental), o si estás en Galápagos a las 17:00 (UTC-6).

Al participar en nuestros eventos recuerda que estás aceptando nuestro código de conducta, el cual nos ayuda a crear un espacio amable y seguro para aprender: https://github.com/rladies/starter-kit/wiki/Code-of-Conduct#spanish

title: Reunión organizativa del grupo de estudio del libro "R para ciencia de datos"
description:
¡Desde RLadies Bariloche les invitamos a participar del grupo de estudio del libro R para Ciencia de Datos (versión traducida al español de R for Data Science) de Hadley Wickham (el creador de Tidyverse y varios paquetes más!). El libro es de libre acceso y pueden consultarlo en https://es.r4ds.hadley.nz/
La propuesta es juntarnos de forma virtual una vez cada 15 días (en horario a convenir) para avanzar con la lectura y comprensión del libro y los scripts. Cada encuentro será guiado por una o un integrante del grupo. ¡El libro está muy bueno! ¡No se pierdan la oportunidad de trabajarlo en grupo!
Para organizarnos, haremos un breve meetup, a fin de concretar días y horarios, y forma de trabajo. Este meetup organizativo (no es el horario definitivo del grupo) se realizará el próximo viernes a las 14:30hs de manera virtual.
Para asistir al meetup, les recomendamos poseer una cuenta de google (utilizaremos google meet).

title: Practicing Data Science: a Collection of Case Studies
description:
Practicing Data Science: a Collection of Case Studies

In questo workshop vedremo alcuni dei progetti di analisi dei dati (o di intelligenza artificiale) a cui Rosaria Silipo, principal Data Scientist @KNIME, ha lavorato nel corso degli anni. Partendo dalla sua tesi di laurea a inizio anni 90 sull’analisi dei battiti cardiaci nell’ECG con reti neurali feedforward fino alla creazione di rap songs con reti neurali basate su LSTMs di qualche anno fa; da un classico churn prediction con un decision tree di fine anni 90 ai recommendation engines degli anni 2000; dalla soluzione di un problema di demand prediction con analisi di serie temporali all’analisi dei testi da social media; inseme ripercorrereremo l’evoluzione del data science nel tempo. Tutta l'esperienza che Rosaria ha riciclato via via, sviluppato di nuovo con KNIME, descritto in vari articoli, raccolto all’interno di un libro sarà condivisa nella community RLadies Italy.

Aneddoti? Forse qualcuno … ci dice Rosaria!
Non vediamo l'ora!

SPEAKER
Rosaria Silipo | PhD, principal Data Scientist @KNIME

Rosaria Silipo, PhD, principal data scientist ora in KNIME, amava i dati prima che diventassero 'big & deep data'. Ha trascorso oltre 25 anni lavorando nell'AI, nell'analisi predittiva e nell'apprendimento automatico presso Siemens, Viseca, Nuance Communications e consulenza privata. Condividendo la sua esperienza pratica in un'ampia gamma di settori e implementazioni, tra cui IoT, customer intelligence, servizi finanziari, social media e sicurezza informatica, Rosaria è autrice di oltre 50 pubblicazioni tecniche, inclusi i suoi libri più recenti: "Guide to Intelligent Data Science" (Springer ) e "Codeless Deep Learning with KNIME" (Packt).

Rosaria Silipo, PhD, principal data scientist now at KNIME, loved data before it was big and learning before it was deep. She has spent 25+ years in applied AI, predictive analytics and machine learning at Siemens, Viseca, Nuance Communications, and private consulting. Sharing her practical experience in a broad range of industries and deployments, including IoT, customer intelligence, financial services, social media, and cybersecurity, Rosaria has authored 50+ technical publications, including her recent books: "Guide to Intelligent Data Science" (Springer) and "Codeless Deep Learning with KNIME" (Packt).

title: Pandemics, Graphics, and Perception of Log Scales
description:
Abstract:
In 2020, there was suddenly worldwide interest in graphics on a level we don't normally see - people were checking news sites daily looking for graphs, maps, and any information about how the COVID pandemic was progressing over time. Along with this, there were some very novel forms of graphics, some of which worked and many of which did not. As the pandemic continued, however, most news organizations seemed to settle on certain categories of graphics for displaying COVID case counts, hospitalizations, and deaths. Watching the pandemic and the graphics explosion that resulted, I found relatively little research into how people perceive exponential growth, and even less research into the effectiveness of log scales for conveying information. I'll talk about a series of experiments that are currently under development to explore these two topics, as well as the evolution of graphics over the course of the pandemic.

Bio: Susan Vanderplas is an assistant professor in the Statistics Department at University of Nebraska, Lincoln, researching the perception of statistical charts and graphs. She also works with the Center for Statistical Applications in Forensic Evidence (CSAFE) at Iowa State University, developing statistical methods for examination of bullets, cartridges, and footwear.

In her spare time (hah) she likes to sew, cross-stitch mildly off-color sayings, and bake things (usually badly).

title: Creating model en mass with workflowsets
description:
For our second July event, we are excited to host Max Kuhn of RStudio who will be presenting on the workflowsets package.

This event will be hosted over Zoom, and the link will be available on this Meetup page at noon on the day of the event.

Agenda (times approximate):
7-7:05 pm: R-Ladies NYC Announcements
7:05-7:50: "Creating model en mass with workflowsets"
7:50-8:15: Questions and wrap-up

Abstract: The tidymodels packages allow users to create and optimize models and their pre-processing steps (e.g. PCA, feature encodings, etc). With new data, it is common to try a variety of models to determine what works best. The workflowsets package enables users to easily evaluate, rank, and even combine (with the stacks package) myriad combinations of models and pre-processors.

Bio: Max Kuhn is a software engineer at RStudio. He is currently working on improving R's modeling capabilities. He was a Senior Director of Nonclinical Statistics at Pfizer Global R&D in Connecticut. He was applying models in the pharmaceutical and diagnostic industries for over 18 years. Max has a Ph.D. in Biostatistics.

Max is the author of R packages for techniques in machine learning and reproducible research. He, and Kjell Johnson, wrote the book Applied Predictive Modeling, which won the Ziegel award from the American Statistical Association, which recognizes the best book reviewed in Technometrics in 2015. Their latest book, Feature Engineering and Selection, was published in 2019.
---

R-Ladies is dedicated to providing a harassment-free experience for everyone. We do not tolerate harassment of participants in any form. Please take a moment to review the R-Ladies Global code of conduct (particularly if this is your first time attending!): https://rladies.org/code-of-conduct

For questions regarding accessibility, please email us at nyc@rladies.org.

title: Focus on Content: Create Enterprise-Worthy Shiny Applications with Periscope
description:
The periscope R package is a framework that you can use to significantly speed up your shiny development – whether you are just writing your first collaborative application or taking on a bigger project that will be deployed to many users. Periscope can significantly "up" your Shiny game by jump-starting development in a way that is flexible and robust. This lets you focus on the content of your application, as opposed to the mechanics (and those insidious pitfalls!) of building a shiny application for multiple users.

Speaker Bio:
Dr. Connie Brett is the CEO, Founder, and Principal Data Scientist of Aggregate Genius Inc. located in BC, Canada. She is experienced in using many types of models and algorithms as well as architecting cutting-edge big-data analytics-integrated platforms. She has submitted publications and patents; contributes to and maintains R packages and frameworks (such as periscope) in the open-source community; and attends and speaks at industry events. With over 20 years spent focusing on producing solid analytical models, software and visualization tools – as well as custom IT solutions architecture – she continues to carry forward her passion for helping clients realize true business insights from analytics.

Workshop details:
Date and time: July 21, 2021 at 6:00pm
Webinar link: RSVP to view link
Note: Meeting password is embedded in the link after the ?
If you have trouble getting into the meeting, please message Jasmine

See you there!

Yuka, Jasmine, Lisa, and Sayemin

**********************IMPORTANT************************

1. Have your computer and a steady internet connection ready

2. If this is your first R-Ladies event, please take a moment to review our R-Ladies Global code of conduct: https://github.com/rladies/.github/blob/master/CODE_OF_CONDUCT.md

3. Who is allowed to attend the workshop?
Everyone is welcome to join us at our events and to be a part of our mission to empower gender minorities with the skills and knowledge to code in one of the top programming languages in data science, which is R.

To fulfill this mission we do ask participants to respect a focus on the encouragement and support for women and non-binary people during our events.

***
General workshop information:

-This will be more of an open ended talk-style workshop with less of an emphasis on the hands-on coding. Please feel free to ask any shiny questions!

Requirements:
A basic knowledge of shiny is helpful, but not required.

title: First steps on Git using R-Studio and Github
description:
During this workshop we will introduce the concept of version control using Git, RStudio and GiHub. We will learn the basic Git commands and how to use them directly from R-Studio. I will show how to link your R-Projects with GitHub to create online repositories to share your work and how it can be used for collaboration. At the end I will do a short demo on uploading a small WebPage to Github such as the one from R-Ladies Seattle

https://github.com/rladies-seattle/rladies-seattle-organizing

If you have some time to prepare before the Meetup I would recommend you to:

· create a GitHub account (if you do not have one yet) on https://github.com/

· download and install Git from https://git-scm.com/

For the last part of the meetup some very basic knowledge or markdown/Rmarkdown in recommended, but not mandatory, we will also go through it. If you want, you can have a look to the first 35 minutes of this video about RMarkdown: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=H91WSwALx1A

title: Dimensionality Reduction Tutorial: PCA & UMAP
description:
Please join us for a lunchtime R-Ladies meetup with Anabel Ruggiero. Anabel will guide us through a tutorial on dimensionality reduction. Dimensionality reduction is a useful technique for data visualization and as an initial layer of a model. This makes it a powerful tool in a data scientist's arsenal.

Anabel will go over the basics of the math and algorithms behind PCA, and UMAP. Most of the time will be devoted to an R example implementing these algorithms.

-- About Anabel --

Anabel Ruggiero is an unaffiliated researcher whose interests lie in the intersection of applied mathematics and software engineering. She received her doctorate in Chemical Engineering at Oklahoma State University, where she did research in the field of computational biosystems. Her current project is NNDescent.cpp, a reimplementation of and iteration upon PyNNDescent. This project is an entry in The Billion-Scale Approximate Nearest Neighbor Search Challenge hosted by NeurIPS 2021.

LinkedIn: https://www.linkedin.com/in/anabel-ruggiero-138372114/
Github: https://github.com/AnabelSMRuggiero

-- How to follow Anabel’s tutorial --

Please find the presentation and associated GitHub repo here. **If you want to follow the full tutorial, please fork the repo and be ready to run the code**:
https://github.com/AnabelSMRuggiero/Dimensionality-Reduction-Tutorial

This tutorial will require the uwot and ggplot2 packages to be installed in R.
uwot: https://github.com/jlmelville/uwot
ggplot2: https://github.com/tidyverse/ggplot2

If you want to watch the presentation and not run the code in real time, that is also fine.

Please reach out if you have any questions (email: seattle@rladies.org).

-- Additional resources --

Principal Component Analysis: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Principal_component_analysis
How UMAP Works: https://umap-learn.readthedocs.io/en/latest/how_umap_works.html
TSNE vs UMAP: https://towardsdatascience.com/tsne-vs-umap-global-structure-4d8045acba17
UMAP: Uniform Manifold Approximation and Projection for Dimension Reduction: https://arxiv.org/abs/1802.03426
Matrix Computations: http://math.ecnu.edu.cn/~jypan/Teaching/books/2013%20Matrix%20Computations%204th.pdf

title: Análise e visualização de dados de biodiversidade no R
description:
EMENTA: Este curso tem como objetivo oferecer um treinamento prático no uso da linguagem de programação R com a finalidade de: i) analisar dados de biodiversidade; ii) gerar modelos ecológicos dentro de três níveis de organização biológica (organismos/indivíduos, populações e comunidades); iii) visualizar dados construindo figuras e gráficos de alto impacto visual; iv) interpretar os resultados; e, v) discutir as aplicações biológicas das análises e dos modelos.

O conteúdo programático inclui a: i) realização de análises exploratórias, ii) introdução à diferentes famílias de modelos ecológicos aplicados a armadilhas de captura, armadilhamento fotográfico, transectos lineares, coleta de fezes, coleta de animais mortos (predados ou atropelados), telemetria, dados de museu, pontos de contagem, parcelas de amostragens, entre outros métodos de coleta; iii) preparação de dados (input) específica para cada análise e modelo; iv) seleção e o ajuste de cada modelo utilizando as inferências da Estimativa da Máxima Verossimilhança (MLE – Maximum Likelihood Estimation) e Bayesiana; e, v) visualização gráfica de dados, interpretação dos resultados (output) e suas aplicações biológicas.

Para a realização dos exercícios práticos, é recomendável que cada participante utilize um computador (desktop ou laptop) ao invés de um celular. Não será necessário fazer a instalação do R no computador uma vez que utilizaremos o RStudio Cloud, uma versão online. Não é necessário ter conhecimento prévio de R ou estatística. Será oferecido um tutorial com o passo a passo de todos os exercícios realizados durante o curso.

PALESTRANTE: Francesca Belem Lopes Palmeira (https://fblpalmeira.github.io) é uma mistura de bióloga de campo e de computador, com Mestrado em Ecologia e Doutorado em Recursos Florestais, ambos pela ESALQ/USP. Cofundadora das RLadies Ribeirão Preto e consultora em modelagem ambiental aplicada para a conservação.

PÚBLICO-ALVO: Estudantes de graduação, pós-graduação e profissionais com interesse em análise e visualização de dados de biodiversidade.

INSCRIÇÕES: A inscrição é gratuita e deverá ser feita na página da Semana da Biologia da UFABC até 13/06. (https://docs.google.com/forms/d/e/1FAIpQLSclxl7T3ii83J_iivS60KAurZaZ5aGj5IsD7YvmenChlw7lmg/viewform)

CERTIFICADOS: A UFABC emitirá um certificado para aqueles que tiverem mais de 75% de presença no curso.

LOCAL DO EVENTO: O curso será online e o link será disponibilizado posteriormente.

CÓDIGO DE CONDUTA: Nós das RLadies, oferecemos treinamento e mentoria em um ambiente seguro e livre de assédio. O nosso código de conduta aplica-se a todos os espaços RLadies, tanto online como offline. Qualquer pessoa que viole este código de conduta pode ser advertida, punida ou expulsa destes espaços, conforme critérios das Membros Fundadoras. Para mais informações, leia o nosso código de conduta. (https://guide.rladies.org/about/coc/#portuguese)

SOBRE AS RLADIES: Somos uma organização sem fins lucrativos (https://rladies.org) que atua em diversos países. Nós nos encontramos [virtualmente] para aprender sobre a linguagem R. A nossa missão é promover o uso da linguagem R entre as minorias de gênero incluindo mulheres cis, mulheres trans, pessoas não-binárias, entre outros grupos subrepresentados para uma comunidade mais diversa e inclusiva.

title: Post-useR!2021 Chit Chat
description:
This meetup will be a very informal discussion over Zoom to catch up and chat about the useR!2021 virtual conference that took place from July 5 - 9. You can see more details here: https://user2021.r-project.org/. Maybe we'll even do some R trivia!

Who is this for?
R-Ladies RTP members are welcome to pop in for however long they'd like. If you didn't attend useR!2021, that's ok! You can learn more about the conference and see if you'd like to attend for 2022.

What should I bring?
You'll need a computer with videoconferencing capabilities. We won't be using R but will chat about it.

Where will it take place?
**Please join us online via Zoom.** A link to join will be provided when you RSVP.

All events are intended for women as leaders, mentors, members, and attendees. We are emphatically queer and trans friendly. Men are welcomed to attend *as guests* and must be accompanied by the R-Lady who invited them. This group was created so those who identify as women have a comfortable place to learn. If you would like to attend and feel excluded, please introduce yourself to an organizer.

title: Bookclub - Chapter 13: Relational Data
description:
R-Ladies Tbilisi bookclub is continuing its meetings on Hadley Wickham's and Garret Grolemund's "R for Data Science" (https://r4ds.had.co.nz/).

On July 15, Lika Zhvania will present the book's Chapter 13 on relational data https://r4ds.had.co.nz/relational-data.html

Please read the chapter before the meeting to be better prepared for the session and exercises. We will go through the exercises together. We start at 19.30 Tbilisi time!

Please RSVP on Meetup or sign up at this link (even if you want to attend as a listener only):
https://docs.google.com/forms/d/1lufZ5eKEeNyinYbPqytVchdbkx5SwS6eKVfnIvEoqXk/

title: R for Data Science Book Club (Meeting 1)
description:
R-Ladies DC will be reading R for Data Science in 8 biweekly meetings (July 15, July 29, Aug 12, Aug 26, Sept 9, Sept 23, Oct 14, Oct 28).

The selected book chapters should be read before the meeting time.

There are also exercises for each week which you should aim to complete before the meeting as well. We'll go through solutions to the exercises as a group. In most weeks, we'll also do some additional exercises from the chapters live during the meeting.

It's okay if you're not able to complete everything ahead of time, we understand that life happens. Please still attend the meeting, even if you didn't read everything or complete all the exercises.

In addition, if you have to miss a meeting time, all code will be made available after the meeting on Github: https://github.com/sctyner/r4ds-bookclub-rladiesdc

Note on the exercises: For all exercises, we will use the online version of the book. There are some differences between the online and print exercises, so we'll stick with the online ones so that everyone is doing the same exercises.

Note on meeting access: All meetings will be virtual. You must RSVP to the meeting on the R-Ladies DC Meetup page to receive the Zoom link. All meetings will take place on a Thursday from 7:00-8:30pm ET (America/New York).

Meeting 1 (July 15, 2021): Introductions to one another and to R & RStudio

Chapters to read:
Physical book chapters: Preface, Ch. 2: Workflow Basics, Ch. 4: Workflow Scripts, Ch. 6: Workflow Projects
Online book chapters: Welcome (https://r4ds.had.co.nz/index.html), Ch 1: Introduction (https://r4ds.had.co.nz/introduction.html), Ch. 4: Workflow: basics (https://r4ds.had.co.nz/workflow-basics.html), Ch. 6: Workflow: scripts (https://r4ds.had.co.nz/workflow-scripts.html), Ch. 8: Workflow: projects (https://r4ds.had.co.nz/workflow-projects.html)

Exercises (from online book chapters):
Chapter 4: Section 4.4 #1-3
Chapter 6: Section 6.3 #1-2

title: R para Humanidades - sesión 2: de PDF a texto plano
description:
Este jueves 15 de julio es el segundo episodio de nuestra serie de talleres sobre R para Humanidades que organizaremos de forma colaborativa los capítulos de RLadies de Ciudad de México, Santiago, Valparaíso, Concepción y Talca. La sesión estará a cargo de Silvia Gutiérrez (https://twitter.com/espejolento) y Riva Quiroga (https://twitter.com/rivaquiroga)
Esta vez nos reuniremos para aprender sobre procesamiento de archivos en pdf. Específicamente, veremos como extraer y limpiar datos en documentos de este tipo.
- ¿Qué necesito para participar?
Podrás aprovechar mejor este taller si ya tienes un conocimiento básico de R: sabes cómo crear un script, cómo ejecutar el código, cómo instalar paquetes.
Además de una versión reciente de R y RStudio, necesitas tener los siguientes paquetes (todos disponibles en CRAN):
- tidyverse
- pdftools
- tesseract
- Horario
El evento se realizará a las 11:00 horas de la zona horaria UTC-4. Puedes revisar a qué hora corresponde en tu zona en el siguiente enlace: https://everytimezone.com/s/10c85ce4
- Código de conducta
Queremos que este sea un espacio de aprendizaje amable y seguro. Al inscribirte en este evento estás aceptando nuestro código de conducta: https://github.com/rladies/starter-kit/wiki/Code-of-Conduct#spanish
El evento se realizará a través de la plataforma Zoom. El día del taller compartiremos la contraseña en los comentarios del evento.

title: July Workshop: Mapping COVID-19 Vaccination Across the US
description:
The goal of this workshop is to provide a hands-on introduction on how to display your data onto relevant geographic locations in a map (e.g. continent, state) using the ggplot2 package in R. Attendees will learn to create a mapped visualization of current up-to-date vaccination rates across states in the US.

Attendees with all skill levels are welcome to attend! We recommend that participants actively follow along on their computers. This will require having R and RStudio installed and basic knowledge of R commands and the RStudio IDE (https://www.rstudio.com/products/rstudio/download/). Several packages are required. Please install the following packages ahead of time or sign up for an RStudio Cloud account (https://login.rstudio.cloud/register). Packages that will be used: "tidyverse", "ggplot2", "reader", "maps", "viridis", "choroplethr", and "choroplethrMaps".

About the Speaker:
Michelle is a graduate student in the Cognition and Neuroscience PhD Program at Temple University. She received her bachelor’s degree in Cognitive Neuroscience from Johns Hopkins University in 2014 and continued to earn her master’s degree in Human Development at Cornell University in 2017. Her research broadly looks at digital media and risky decision making using a behavioral and neuroimaging approach. In her free time, she enjoys exploring the Philly food scene and practicing yoga!

title: RLadies Boulder Meetup #16: Happy Hour at Sanitas Brewing
description:
Hi Boulder UseRs! Join us for this month's *in person* R Ladies Boulder Meet-up! We are hosting an informal happy hour get-together at Sanitas Brewing in Boulder. This is our first in-person event post pandemic and we would love to see all of you!

We will be outdoors on the Sanitas patio with R Ladies name tags so you can find us! This is a friendly group of people and the more the merrier so please join us if you feel comfortable. All are welcome!

We hope you'll also join our local Slack workspace to keep the R help and conversation flowing! To get access to the Slack workspace, please fill out this short Google form: https://forms.gle/j36YGxuNwN6zZ8nW7.

title: Dr. Pratheepa Jeganathan: R/Bioconductor for Molecular microbial data analysis
description:
For the July 12 edition of our R-Ladies Dallas webinar series, we are excited to welcome Dr. Pratheepa Jeganathan as our guest speaker. Dr. Jeganathan will share how she is using R and Bioconductor packages for molecular microbial data analysis.

~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
Session title: Molecular microbial data analysis
~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~

Abstract: High-throughput sequencing generates massive molecular microbial datasets that pose several statistical challenges. As a result, statistical methods have been developed to address contamination sequences from reagents, unequal sampling, unbounded and undetected taxa, sparsity, and heterogeneity. I will talk about some of the statistical methods in molecular microbial data analysis and demonstrate the methods using a plant microbiome dataset and R/Bioconductor packages. This talk is based on A Statistical Perspective on the Challenges in Molecular Microbial Biology published in Jeganathan and Holmes (2021). The workﬂow is available at https://pratheepaj.github.io/diﬀTop/.

Bio:
Dr. Pratheepa Jeganathan is an Assistant Professor in the Department of Mathematics and Statistics at McMaster University. Pratheepa's research focuses on addressing challenges in multi-domain data analysis. Her research team uses, extends, and develops statistical methods and computational tools to analyze microbiome multi-omic and spatial multi-omic data in R/Bioconductor, including topic analysis, hierarchical modeling, Bayesian statistics, multivariate statistics, bootstrap method, spatial statistics, and approximation theory in statistics. Currently, Pratheepa teaches undergraduate and graduate courses in statistics and data science.

Before joining McMaster University, Pratheepa completed postdoctoral training in the Department of Statistics at Stanford University.
She received a Ph.D. in Mathematics with an emphasis in Statistics and MS in Statistics from Texas Tech University. While completing her Ph.D., she interned at the Research and Testing Laboratory in Lubbock and the Clinical Research Institute at Texas Tech Health Sciences Center. She received a B.Sc.in Statistics and Operations Research from the University of Peradeniya in Sri Lanka. She taught undergraduate courses at Stanford University, Texas Tech University, and the University of Peradeniya in Sri Lanka.

Twitter: https://twitter.com/PratheepaJ

Website: https://pratheepaj.github.io/

*************************************************************************

You are encouraged to click the link below to keep up with the group project and to join the Slack community. Slack is a messaging platform where we will share open job opportunities, free or low-cost online training materials, and R-Ladies group projects that will help you practice your R programming skills and develop a portfolio that could be used to showcase your skills to hiring managers.

Slack sign-up: https://join.slack.com/t/rladiesdallas/shared_invite/zt-4dz4suhi-5QU8oB4_rsDQe2ZmoKDxXg

*************************************************************************

We expect all attendees to abide & be governed by our community code of conduct. Please take a moment to review our R-Ladies Global code of conduct (particularly if this is your first time attending!): https://github.com/rladies/starter-kit/wiki/Code-of-Conduct.

title: SARS-CoV-2 y minería de datos en bioinformática
description:
Les esperamos en el próximo evento con Cynthia Elizabeth Castillo en el cual nos guiará en la limpieza y procesamientos de datos de la proteína Spike del virus SARS-CoV-2 y cómo es que la multidisciplinariedad nos ayuda a tener una mejor comprensión de una problemática, en este caso global, utilizando la paquetería seqinr en R.

¡Nos vemos!

title: The Epidemiologist R Handbook
description:
For our July event, we are excited to host authors Neale Batra, Aminata Ndiaye, and Paula Blomquist, who will present the Epidemiologist R Handbook, a free new code reference book targeted to R users working in applied epidemiology and public health, but handy for anyone.

This event will be hosted over Zoom, and the link will be available on this Meetup page at noon on the day of the event.

Agenda (times approximate):
7-7:05 pm: R-Ladies NYC Announcements
7:05-7:50: "The Epidemiologist R Handbook - a new resource for public health practitioners (and everyone else)"
7:50-8:15: Questions and wrap-up

Abstract: Amidst the COVID-19 pandemic, 50 epidemiologists from across the world joined forces seeking to improve access to R and elevate the quality of analytics in public health. Writing in their spare time, they produced The Epidemiologist R Handbook (epiRhandbook.com), a free new code reference book targeted to R users working in applied epidemiology and public health, but handy for anyone. The "Epi R Handbook" is full of code snippets and tutorials addressing day-to-day data cleaning, analysis, visualization, reporting, and collaboration challenges. The handbook also comes in an offline version for use in settings with low internet connectivity. Since its launch, the handbook has been used 200,000 times by 36,000 people in 203 countries/territories. In this session, founder Neale Batra is joined by co-authors Paula Blomquist and Aminata Ndiaye to discuss the handbook's utility for you, the intersection of R and public health, the project's next steps, and the editorial and technical challenges they faced creating this resource for the community.

Bio:
Neale Batra is the founder and editor of the Epidemiologist R Handbook project. As an applied epidemiologist, he tries to leverage R to better inform decision-making in health emergencies. Currently he works for the COVID-19 analytics team at the World Health Organization (Geneva), but has previously worked internationally for Doctors without Borders and in the US for the public health departments of Philadelphia and Santa Clara County. He loves teaching, and in his spare time enjoys guiding rock climbing and backpacking trips.

Paula Blomquist is an epidemiologist in Public Health England, where she works on the national surveillance of COVID-19. She spends much of her day job creating data visualisations and R markdown reports to monitor variants, with a particular fondness of {patchwork} and {flextable}. Paula has also used R for analyses in international deployments, most recently with the UK Emergency Medical Team to Samoa during the 2019 measles epidemic. Paula is a contributor to the Epidemiologist R Handbook, and excited to encourage more people in public health to learn to code.

Aminata NDIAYE is a Biostatistician at Epicentre Research Department-MSF (Doctors without Borders). She graduated from Paris Descartes University School of Medicine in Public health and from Paris Saclay University School of Sciences in Bioinformatics and Biostatistics. She previously worked at World Health Organization (WHO) as an analyst during the 10th Ebola virus disease (EVD) outbreak in the Democratic Republic of the Congo (DRC) and at Karolinska Institute’s department of medical epidemiology and biostatistics as a Research assistant. She is co-organizer and member of the R-ladies Stockholm group since its creation, in 2018.
---

R-Ladies is dedicated to providing a harassment-free experience for everyone. We do not tolerate harassment of participants in any form. Please take a moment to review the R-Ladies Global code of conduct (particularly if this is your first time attending!): https://rladies.org/code-of-conduct

For questions regarding accessibility, please email us at nyc@rladies.org.

title: Club de lectura: R para Ciencia de Datos (Wickham & Grolemund) - Sesión 5
description:
Las R-Ladies de Barranquilla (COL), Galápagos, Guayaquil y Milagro (ECU) nos hemos unido para traerte un club de lectura basado en el libro R para Ciencia de Datos de Wickham y Grolemund. Este libro está disponible en español gracias al esfuerzo de la comunidad R latinoamericana y puede ser accedido de manera libre aquí: https://es.r4ds.hadley.nz.

title: My Favorite ggplot2 Extension Packages
description:
We are delighted to invite you to our next meetup. We will be organizing a new meetup about Cédric'favorite ggplot2 extension Packages.

Date/Time: Wednesday, July, 8th 2021 from 6 PM to 7 PM (GMT+1)
Place: Zoom

▶️ Invited trainer: Cédric Scherer

▶️ About Cédric Scherer :

Cédric is a trained researcher in ecology, evolution and nature conservation with a focus on computational biology. After his PhD, he combined his expertise in analysing and visualizing large data sets in R with his passion for design to create visualizations across all disciplines, purposes, and styles to become a freelance data visualization specialist. In his spare time, Cédric is contributing regularly to the #TidyTuesday challenge and other data visualization contests and is hosting the #30DayChartChallenge together with Dominic Royé that took place for the first time this year.

▶️ About the workshop:

Abstract: ggplot2 is a graphics library for R which comes with many geometries that allow you to build numerous and highly customized data visualizations. In this talk, I am going to present the most exciting extension packages to create various chart types within the ggplot2 framework but that are not part of the ggplot2 package itself. We are going to cover popular chart types such as bump graphs and ridgeline plots but also less common variants, for example stream graphs, moon plots, and geofacets.

In order to attend the event, please fill out this form 👉
https://tinyurl.com/ypu3wt79

We will send you the zoom link a few hours before the training session. Please check out your email later.

We look forward to welcoming you!

Evento online vía zoom.

title: From messy data to beautiful plot: Guided TidyTuesday
description:
Know the basics of data wrangling but want some hands-on practice? Want to learn ggplot tips and tricks to make your plots eye-catching? Seen cool visualizations on Twitter but find it hard to go from messy dataset to beautiful visualization?

In this monthly meetup, we’ll go through a Tidy Tuesday dataset together step-by-step, walking you through the entire process from coming up with an interesting question to asnwer, getting the data in the right format and finally, creating a cool visualization!

You may have heard of Tidy Tuesday -- a weekly initiative by R for Data Science which provides a new dataset every week for the community to practice wrangling and visualizing. It has a huge Twitter community and is one of the best ways to practice and develop tidyverse skills, whether you’re still reviewing the basics or have quite the repertoire. This series has something for everyone and is especially designed to be beginner friendly!

It's important to us to ensure that Guided Tidy Tuesday is a safe space for gender minorities and especially those who are just starting out with R. Studies have shown that letting gender minorities speak first promotes a welcoming and supportive atmosphere for underrepresented groups. All are welcome at this meetup but we specifically ask cisgender men to take a passive role in this meetup and hold comments / questions until after others have had the chance to ask. Thank you for your support!

title: Bookclub - Chapter 12: Tidy Data
description:
Date changed!
R-Ladies Tbilisi bookclub is continuing its meetings on Hadley Wickham's and Garret Grolemund's "R for Data Science" (https://r4ds.had.co.nz/).

On July 4, Mariam Asatiani will present the book's Chapter 12 on tidy data: https://r4ds.had.co.nz/tidy-data.html

Please read the chapter before the meeting to be better prepared for the session and exercises. We will go through the exercises together. We start at 20.00 am Tbilisi time!

The previous chapter 11 on data import (https://r4ds.had.co.nz/data-import.html) is quite short - please work this through independently.

Please RSVP on Meetup or sign up at this link (even if you want to attend as a listener only):
https://docs.google.com/forms/d/1lufZ5eKEeNyinYbPqytVchdbkx5SwS6eKVfnIvEoqXk/

title: How to make web-ready maps - A beginner's perspective
description:
Asmae Toumi is going to be teaching us a bit about mapping :). She will describe some workflows to get us up and running in making fast, web-ready maps.

Asmae Toumi is the Director of Analytics and Research at PursueCare, a telehealth company specializing in treating substance use disorder. By night, she is the editor-in-chief of Hockey-Graphs, a hockey sports analytics blog. When she's not antique or thrift shopping, you can find her on Twitter trying to dismantle systems of oppression and making #rstats content, most of it unfortunately not that funny, but mostly always cute. Consider giving her a follow at: https://twitter.com/asmae_toumi

title: Serie de talleres sobre R para humanidades: Sesión 1: Web scraping
description:
¡Hola!

Este viernes 2 de julio comienza una serie de talleres sobre R para Humanidades que organizaremos de forma colaborativa los capítulos de RLadies de Ciudad de México, Santiago, Valparaíso, Concepción y Talca. Las sesiones estarán a cargo de Riva Quiroga (https://twitter.com/rivaquiroga) y Silvia Gutiérrez (https://twitter.com/espejolento).

En esta primera sesión aprenderemos a hacer "web scraping" ("raspado web") utilizando el paquete {rvest}. Durante el taller introduciremos esta técnica y mostraremos paso a paso cómo implementarla.

- ¿Qué necesito para participar?
Podrás aprovechar mejor este taller si ya tienes un conocimiento básico de R: sabes cómo crear un script, cómo ejecutar el código, cómo instalar paquetes.

Además de una versión reciente de R y RStudio, necesitas tener los siguientes paquetes (todos disponibles en CRAN):
- tidyverse
- robotstxt
- janitor

- Horario
El evento se realizará a las 11:00 horas de la zona horaria UTC-4. Puedes revisar a qué hora corresponde en tu zona en el siguiente enlace: https://everytimezone.com/s/6eb97481

- Código de conducta
Queremos que este sea un espacio de aprendizaje amable y seguro. Al inscribirte en este evento estás aceptando nuestro código de conducta: https://github.com/rladies/starter-kit/wiki/Code-of-Conduct#spanish
El evento se realizará a través de la plataforma Zoom. El día del taller compartiremos la contraseña en los comentarios del evento.

¡Te esperamos!

RLadies de Ciudad de México, Santiago, Valparaíso, Concepción y Talca.

title: Club de Lectura del libro "Data Feminism" (Sesión 2)
description:
El próximo jueves 1 de julio nos reuniremos para nuestra segunda sesión del club de lectura sobre libro "Data Feminism", de Catherine D'Ignazio y Lauren F. Klein. Este libro muestra una nueva forma de abordar la ciencia de datos y la ética de datos basada en ideas del feminismo interseccional. Se puede acceder de forma gratuita en: https://data-feminism.mitpress.mit.edu/
¿Cómo funciona el club de lectura?
Dividiremos la lectura del libro en seis sesiones. En cada una de ellas abordaremos un capítulo del libro. Cada sesión la liderará alguien de nuestra comunidad.
Esta primera sesión estará a cargo de Sara Acevedo (https://twitter.com/saryace), candidata a Doctora en Ciencias de la Ingeniería. Durante la sesión comentaremos el capítulo 2, "Collect, Analyze, Imagine, Teach", en el que se presenta el segundo principio del feminismo de datos: desafiar al poder.
- ¿Qué pasa si no puedo leer en inglés?
¡Puedes participar igual! La persona encargada de cada sesión hará una síntesis de los puntos más importantes, así que incluso si no puedes revisar el libro, podrás aprender sobre este tema :)
- CÓDIGO DE CONDUCTA
Queremos que este sea un espacio de aprendizaje amable y seguro. Al inscribirte en este evento estás aceptando nuestro código de conducta: https://github.com/rladies/starter-kit/wiki/Code-of-Conduct#spanish
El evento se realizará a través de la plataforma Zoom. El día del taller compartiremos la contraseña en los comentarios del evento.
- HORA
El evento se realizará a las 16:00 horas de la zona horaria UTC-4. Puedes revisar a qué hora corresponde en tu zona en el siguiente enlace: https://everytimezone.com/s/50ee54a0

El evento se realizará a las 16:00 horas de la zona horaria UTC-4. Puedes revisar a qué hora corresponde en tu zona en el siguiente enlace: https://everytimezone.com/s/50ee54a0

title: ¡Primer meet-up R-Ladies Guayaquil!
description:
¡Comienza la iniciativa en la ciudad! ¡Bienvenid@s!
En esta primera reunión nos conoceremos y te diremos qué trae consigo esta maravillosa iniciativa. ¿Las mujeres participan en ciencias? ¿matemáticas? ¿tecnologías?, no sólo contestaremos estas preguntas; también explicaremos qué es R y cómo su uso es transversal en distintas áreas de aplicación.
Recuerda que todos los eventos son gratuitos.

¡Anímate a estar 15 minutos antes de la hora de inicio para el registro!

¡L@s esperamos!

title: We're back! Let's catch-up with a fun meet and greet.
description:
Hey everyone,

Now that everything is reopening and San Diego is seen good rates of vaccination we've decided to bring back the in person meetings for R-Ladies San Diego.

Let's start by just getting together and catching up. We'd love to know how you've been doing and we miss seeing all of you in person.

Please keep in mind that this is an in person event at a coffee shop / restaurant where a lot of people won't be wearing masks. So if you're not yet fully vaccinated against COVID-19, you might want to give this event a pass.

We look forward to seeing you,

Your R-Ladies organizers

title: Artificial Neural Network - introduzione e applicazione [Workshop]
description:
Durante quest'evento Anna Griego (Data Scientist e community member storica di RLadies Bari) ci farà scoprire cosa c'è dietro i famosi Artificial Neural Networks (AANs) 😎😎

Inizieremo dalle basi, definendo i principi di un modello neuronale, le funzioni di attivazione, le architetture di rete e le modalità di apprendimento.
Poi ci focalizzeremo sulle principali applicazioni di questi modelli, cercando di capire quando è bene usarli, e quando invece è preferibile evitare.
Finiremo con una sessione pratica lavorando su uno use case molto "inebriante" dove utilizzeremo gli AANs per classificare un dataset su vini 🍷🍷 in base alle loro proprietà enologiche.

Reminder: per seguire in live il workshop mettendo le mani in pasta sul codice dovrai aver installato sul tuo PC R & Rstudio.

SPEAKER: ANNA GRIECO 🚀
Neolaureata in Scienze Statistiche e studentessa nel Master in Data Science, con l’obiettivo di potenziare la mia formazione in ambito Machine Learning e Artificial Intelligence.
Appassionata di innovazione, tecnologia e sport. Ciò che più mi stimola è la risoluzione di problemi e scenari sempre diversi. Prediligo il gioco di squadra perché mi incoraggia a guardare quello che mi circonda da una nuova prospettiva.

title: Paseo aleatorio por la programación (en femenino) + El ingenio (in)visible
description:
¡Bienvenidas al meetup virtual de junio! En esta ocasión tenemos dos charlas por Natàlia Vilor-Tejedor y Núria Salán. No nos hablarán de R, sino de mujeres cientificas!

"Paseo aleatorio por la programación (en femenino)" por Natàlia Vilor Tejedor (@natvilortejedor): ~ 15 minutos

"El ingenio (in)visible" Núria Salán (@nuriasalann): ~ 45 minutos

*Recordad que para acceder a la charla necesitaréis una contraseña que os enviaremos 1 hora antes del evento.

A continuación os dejamos la descripción de las charlas y las biografías de las speakers. ¡Nos vemos pronto!

--------------------------------------
Natàlia Vilor Tejedor (@natvilortejedor): "Paseo aleatorio por la programación (en femenino)" ~ 15 minutos

Biografía:
"
Natalia Vilor-Tejedor is a Postdoctoral Research Scientist at BarcelonaBeta Brain Research Center (BBRC), the Center for Genomic Regulation (CRG) and the Erasmus University Medical Center (EMC). Moreover, Natalia collaborates in teaching activities as an Assistant Professor in the Department of Mathematics at the Autonomous University of Barcelona (UAB), and in the Department of Systems Biology at the University of Vic (UVIC-UCC). She conducted her PhD thesis in the Biomedicine program of Pompeu Fabra University (UPF) at the Barcelona Institute of Global Health (ISGlobal). Her main interests include statistical methods and analytical strategies in Neurogenetics and Imaging Genetics.
LinkedIn: https://www.linkedin.com/in/nat%C3%A0lia-vilor-tejedor-47aa0a66/
"

----------------------------------------
Núria Salán (@nuriasalann): "El ingenio (in)visible" ~ 45 minutos

Inventoras que no salen en los libros de texto, nombres de mujeres que han hecho, consus inventos y descubrimientos, que nuestra vida sea más fácil, más cómoda, más amable... pero siguen siendo desconocidas. En cambio, los nombres de los inventores salen en los libros y son visibles. Charla para dar visibilidad a todas esas ingeniosas/ingenieras/inventoras desconocidas pero que forman parte de nuestra historia.

Biografía:
"
Profesora de metalurgia en la ESEIAAT (UPC-Terrassa), y presidenta de la Societat Catalana de Tecnología, he dedicado las dos últimas décadas a rescatar nombres y viencias de mujeres de todas las épocas y lugares para hacerlas visibles y que puedan tener el reconocimiento que merecen. Así, aunque mantengo mi perfil técnico, mi actividad personal y profesional, últimamente, está más relacionada con mostrar la cara más humana (y femenina) de la tecnología. Curiosidades sobre mi: soy forjadora aficinada, pastelera aficionada y novelista aficionada. Y con aficionada quiero decir que lo hago (creo) bien, pero no me dedico profesionalmente.
"

title: [MeetUp Online]  Conhecendo o ggplot2: criando gráficos com R
description:
• CONTEÚDO
O objetivo do MeetUp é apresentar como funciona o pacote ggplot2 de maneira introdutória. Veremos um pouco sobre os tipos de gráficos que podem ser feitos, como montar um gráfico simples e como montar um gráfico juntando diversas informações. Além disso, vamos dar uma olhada em como personalizá-los também!

• PALESTRANTE
Letícia Thomaz é formada em Estatística pelo IME-USP e tem pós em Análise de Big Data pela FIA.
"Apesar de ter visto o R nos tempos de faculdade, passei a usá-lo muito quando comecei a trabalhar. E nesse tempo, também conheci a comunidade das RLadies. Hoje sou uma super defensora do R."
_____________________________________________
Por favor leia todas as informações abaixo!

• PÚBLICO-ALVO
Pessoas que se identificam como minoria de gênero (mulher trans ou cis, homem trans, pessoa não-binária, queer).

• LOCAL DO EVENTO:
Canal das R-Ladies São Paulo no Youtube
https://www.youtube.com/c/RLadiesSãoPaulo/featured

• CÓDIGO DE CONDUTA
Disponível aqui: https://github.com/rladies/.github/blob/master/CODE_OF_CONDUCT.md#Portuguese

Qualquer pessoa que violar ou houver previamente violado o código de conduta desta comunidade terá sua entrada proibida, será expulsa/o e/ou estará sujeita/o à ação que a pessoa organizadora achar mais apropriada, independente de inscrição no evento, ser membro do MeetUp ou qualquer outra condição.

_____________________________________________
• SOBRE AS R-LADIES
R-Ladies é uma organização que promove a diversidade de gênero na comunidade da linguagem R. Nosso principal objetivo é promover a linguagem computacional estatística R compartilhando conhecimento, assim, quem tiver interesse na linguagem será bem-vinda, independente do nível de conhecimento. Nosso principal público-alvo são as pessoas que se identificam com o gênero feminino, portanto, mulheres cis, mulheres trans, bem como pessoas não-binárias e queer.

_____________________________________________
O evento é gratuito, e organizado com muito carinho, ajude a espalhar a palavra, compartilhe com outras ladies :)

title: Club de lectura R para Ciencia de Datos (Wickham & Grolemund) - Sesión 4
description:
Las R-Ladies de Barranquilla (COL), Galápagos, Guayaquil y Milagro (ECU) nos hemos unido para traerte un club de lectura basado en el libro R para Ciencia de Datos de Wickham y Grolemund. Este libro está disponible en español gracias al esfuerzo de la comunidad R latinoamericana y puede ser accedido de manera libre aquí: https://es.r4ds.hadley.nz.

En esta cuarta sesión de nuestro club de lectura, Denisse (R-Ladies Galápagos) hablará sobre cómo escribir funciones para automatizar flujos de trabajo. Esto incluye al capítulo 21 (Iteración).

Este club de lectura incluirá varias sesiones quincenales que se llevarán a cabo a través de Zoom. Cada sesión durará dos horas durante las cuales discutiremos y practicaremos los puntos más importantes del capítulo o capítulos en el que nos enfoquemos para esa sesión.

Recuerda, las sesiones son los jueves de cada quincena empezando a las 18:00 (UTC-5, Colombia y Ecuador Continental), o si estás en Galápagos a las 17:00 (UTC-6).

Al participar en nuestros eventos recuerda que estás aceptando nuestro código de conducta, el cual nos ayuda a crear un espacio amable y seguro para aprender: https://github.com/rladies/starter-kit/wiki/Code-of-Conduct#spanish

title: Large scale time series forecasting
description:
About the speaker:
Thiyanga Talagala has a Ph.D. in statistics from Monash Univ., Australia, and currently holds a senior lecturer position at the University of Sri Jayewardenepura, Sri Lanka. She is interested in the theory, implementation, and application of machine learning methods to time-series datasets, as well as visualization of the results. She uses R in her research and has created or contributed to many R packages (https://github.com/thiyangt).

Thiyanga enjoys teaching and is involved in organizing the R-Ladies Colombo chapter! Visit her website to learn more about her R packages, her projects, workshops, and teaching activities. Her blog offers many statistical insights in an accessible style. (https://thiyanga.netlify.app/)

About the talk:
Many applications require data from a large number of time series to be forecast. However, large-scale time-series data present numerous challenges in modeling and implementation due to high dimensionality. Thiyanga´s talk will present three feature-based algorithms for large-scale time-series forecasting.

Welcome!

title: Georgia election discussion
description:
This talk will be encompassing the two roles that I had working in Georgia in 2020; the first as the state’s data director during the general election and the second as the states data advisor during the Senate Runoff Election. I will go over the way in which data interacts with other departments at the state level and how it helps measure the health of a campaign and chart a roadmap for victory.

Bio; Chelsea Jones is originally from Miami, Florida. She worked three election cycles as a Field Organizer, including the 2016 presidential election in Florida, before moving into political data. She joined the Biden Campaign in 2019 as his Data Director in Nevada for the primary and then went on to become the Data Director for Georgia for the November election and then stayed on as a Data & Analytics Advisor for the runoff election. She currently works as a Solution Architect for Civis Analytics

title: Improve your Data Science pipelines with JavaScript
description:
We are delighted to invite you to our next meetup. We will be organizing a new workshop about using JavaScript to improve data science pipelines.

Date/Time: Wednesday, June 23rd, 2021 from 6 PM to 7 PM (GMT+1)
Place: Zoom

▶️ Invited trainer: John Coene

▶️ About John Coene :
John Coene has worked for 5 years in tech companies in China, then, after 3 years at the World Economic Forum in Geneva, he set up his own company (https://opifex.org) He also works with Impact Lab Finance (https://impactlab-finance.com). He is the author of packages such as {echarts4r} https://echarts4r.john-coene.com/, {waiter} https://shiny.john-coene.com/waiter/, {packer} https://packer.john-coene.com/#/, (and more), as well as the book JavaScript for R forthcoming on CRC Press.

▶️ About the workshop:

A brief introduction to using JavaScript with R. No prior knowledge of JavaScript is required.
R has been propelled into web browsers with package such as Rmarkdown and Shiny; combining JavaScript with R is now possible and immensely useful!
This aims to be an elevator pitch to demystify JavaScript and encourage R users to explore it: surprisingly little knowledge of the language brings amazing rewards.

In order to attend the event, please fill out this form 👉
https://tinyurl.com/4mvwby7r

We will send you the zoom link a few hours before the training session. Please check out your email later.

We look forward to welcoming you!

title: [ONLINE]- R in Production
description:
Hi, everybody!
We are super excited to have Veerle van Leemput with us, Managing Director and Head of Data Science from Analytic Health- sharing her knowledge with us on how to run R in production!

DESCRIPTION
-------------------
We often hear that R can’t be used for production, but is this true? Isn’t the statement that R is ‘just a research-only language mainly used by academia’ outdated?

Spoiler alert: you definitely can use R in production. From ETL to (Shiny) web applications to machine learning models: some of the main business processes at Analytic Health are powered by R. During this talk, Veerle will dive into what “production” means and how you can use R in a context outside of academia. By showing how R is being used at Analytic Health and how processes and applications are deployed and managed we hope to show you that R can do more than statistics only. This talk will inspire you to take R one step further, and by providing pointers to which tools you can use to build robust processes you’ll leave this talk ready to use R in production yourself!

ABOUT VEERLE
---------------------

Veerle is an entrepreneur and Data Scientist who gets excited about data and programming. She is Managing Director and Head of Data Science at Analytic Health, a UK-based company that develops intelligent and accessible technology which gives organisations the tools they need to accelerate innovation in healthcare. She is a R developer with a Master’s Degree in Data Science and multiple years of experience in the pharmaceutical market. Besides programming in R (and Shiny) she also develops multiple web applications for healthcare organisations using Vue.js and Node.

title: R-Ladies SB x R-Ladies Vancouver Tidy Tuesday Collab!
description:
Join us for an exciting Tidy Tuesday collab with our neighbors to the north, R-Ladies Vancouver (Twitter: @RLadiesVan), on June 22nd!

Tidy Tuesday is an ongoing project by the R4DS Online Learning Community where a new dataset is posted each week aimed at helping learners practice their wrangling and visualization skills -- you can read more about it here: https://github.com/rfordatascience/tidytuesday

Don’t know where to start? At the the beginning of the meeting we will review the dataset and provide some code to get your plots started. We have also included a few resources below to help provide some inspiration.

Come out and meet some R-Ladies from Vancouver and try out a few new data visualization skills with us!

See you there!

Sam, An, & Juliette

NOTE: If asked for a password, you can find it embedded in the zoom link (available upon RSVP) following the "?"

**********************IMPORTANT EVENT INFO************************

1. You can expect a hands-on session in a friendly and laid-back atmosphere where we are all encouraged to learn together. Have your computer and a steady internet connection ready. You can find detailed instructions for downloading R/RStudio on our GitHub README (https://github.com/rladies/meetup-presentations_santabarbara)

2. If this is your first R-Ladies event, please take a moment to review our R-Ladies Global code of conduct: https://github.com/rladies/.github/blob/master/CODE_OF_CONDUCT.md

3. Who is allowed to attend the workshop?
Everyone is welcome to join us at our events and to be a part of our mission to empower gender minorities with the skills and knowledge to code in one of the top programming languages in data science, which is R.

To fulfill this mission we do ask participants to respect a focus on the encouragement and support for women and non-binary people during our events.

************************DATA VIZ RESOURCES************************

General Data Viz Resources:
- Data Visualization https://clauswilke.com/dataviz/
- Wrangle your data with dplyr - https://allisonhorst.shinyapps.io/dplyr-learnr/
- RLadies SB Data Viz Workshop: https://docs.google.com/presentation/d/1sU2H89F5e409WpYilRqYAqu7DdXSAivccEa4y44xZ7c/edit?usp=sharing

Fun:
- Emoji font: https://cran.r-project.org/web/packages/emojifont/vignettes/emojifont.html

Color Palettes:
- Wes Anderson Colour Palette: https://github.com/karthik/wesanderson
- Studio Ghibli Colour Palette: https://ewenme.github.io/ghibli/
- Calecopal (inspired by different California ecosystems and created by our very own An Bui!): https://github.com/an-bui/calecopal

Inspiration:
- Collection of best Tidy Tuesday plots: https://www.cedricscherer.com/2019/12/30/best-tidytuesday-2019/
- #TidyTuesday on Twitter: https://twitter.com/hashtag/TidyTuesday?src=hashtag_click
- Ijeamaka Anyene's (past R-Ladies SB speaker!) Tidy Tuesday plots: https://github.com/Ijeamakaanyene/tidytuesday
