title: Taller: "Introducción a targets"
description:
¡Bienvenidas al meetup virtual de mayo! En esta ocasión tenemos preparado un taller:

"Introducción a targets", por Irene Cruz (@irene_cruzgomez)

*Recordad que para acceder a la charla necesitaréis una contraseña que os enviaremos 1 hora antes del evento.

A continuación os dejamos la descripción del taller. ¡Nos vemos pronto!

-------------------------------------

Descripción del taller:

En este taller se hace una presentación de las estrategias de canalización de flujos de trabajo (workflow pipelines) usando el paquete targets.

En la primera parte del taller se explica cómo la estructuración del código en pipelines es el mejor modo de garantizar la reproducibilidad de nuestros resultados y de aliviar la carga mental que supone la organización de un proyecto complejo con diversas piezas interdependientes. Esta metodología de trabajo nos va a permitir reproducir el código sin repetir los pasos ya completados, ejecutar cálculos con computación paralela cuando sea necesario, y guardar un registro ordenado de los distintos objetos creados.

En la segunda parte del taller se realizará un ejemplo guiado del uso de targets y se presentarán algunos tips para sacarle el máximo partido, como usar branching, introducir revisiones automáticas de resultados, o estrategias para depurar código.

Requisitos: el taller supone cierta familiaridad previa con el código de R y con la definición de funciones.

-------------------------------------

Sobre Irene Cruz:

Hola! Me llamo Irene Cruz, soy doctora en Sociología por la UAB. Trabajo como metodóloga en el IERMB y como profesora asociada de métodos y técnicas de investigación en la UAB.

title: R4DS – Dabbling in dplyr (chapters 2 and 5)
description:
Hello Denver R-Ladies,

You are cordially invited to the May meeting of Denver R-Ladies, the focus of which will be on learning and practicing the basic functions of dplyr. The first half hour will be an overview of common dplyr functions, and the second half will be a hands-on group exercise using real data! The overview will be grounded in chapters 2 and 5 of Hadley Wickham’s “R for Data Science” (R4DS), but you do not need to read anything in advance to participate fully. We hope to see you there!

Date/time: May 25 at 5:30 p.m. MDT

Location: Virtual, on Zoom

Note: You can access R4DS for free here: https://r4ds.had.co.nz/index.html

RStudio overview of dyplr: https://dplyr.tidyverse.org/

title: Graficando en ggplot2
description:
En este meetup aprenderemos la sintaxis de ggplot2 para generar diferentes tipos de gráficos. El nivel al que será presentado será: Nivel básico, por lo tanto el único requisito es tener instalado RStudio y ggplot2.
Este evento será presentado por la Dra. Tina Godoy Lozano, aquí su semblanza:
Egresada de la carrera de Químico Farmaco-Biólogo de la facultad de Ciencias Químicas de la Universidad Autónoma de San Luis Potosí. Realizó su maestría en Ciencias Biomédicas Básicas en la facultad de medicina de la Universidad Autónoma de San Luis Potosí. Cuenta con el Doctorado en Ciencias en la Salud Pública con área de concentración en Enfermedades Infecciosas del Instituto Nacional de Salud Pública. Durante el doctorado realizó una estancia pre-Doctoral en la compañía Integral Molecular ubicada en Filadelfia, USA. Y como parte de su tesis doctoral estuvo involucrada en la creación de un software bioinformático capaz de analizar secuencias de anticuerpos obtenidas por medio de secuenciación masiva (Secuencias de 454 FLX Titanium y de Illumina Miseq).
Al finalizar el doctorado trabajó en el Centro Nacional de Servicios de Constatación en Salud Animal (CENAPA) del Servicio Nacional de Sanidad, Inocuidad y Calidad Agroalimentaria de SAGARPA, para coordinar el análisis bioinformático de secuencias generadas por métodos de secuenciación masiva de alta resolución de enfermedades que afectan la salud animal, acuícola y pesquera e inocuidad agroalimentaria para la caracterización genética e investigación de organismos patógenos.
Realizó una estancia post-doctoral en el Instituto de Biotecnología de la Universidad Nacional Autónoma de México en el Consorcio de Investigación del Golfo de México (CIGoM), en donde se encargaba de la comparación y desarrollo de métodos de asignación taxonómica basados en amplicones del gen ribosomal 16S y datos de secuenciación Whole Metagenome Shotgun, anotación taxonómica y funcional de metagenomas y de genomas de cepas puras, desarrollo de software para la implementación de un pipeline de ensamble y anotación taxonómica de genomas de aislados bacterianos y de la administración del cluster de CIGoM.
Cuenta con varias publicaciones a nivel internacional y actualmente es SNI-1 y es la jefa de la unidad de Bioinformática en Enfermedades Infecciosas que de apoyo transversal al Centro de Investigación Sobre Enfermedades Infecciosas.

title: Omics Integration and Supervised Machine Learning - PART2
description:
We are delighted to get back to the R4Bioinfo series that we've launched in September 2020. We will be organizing a serie of two workshops about Omics integration and Supervised Machine Learning.

Date/Time: Saturday, May 22th, 2021 from 5 PM to 7:15 PM (GMT+1)
Place: ZOOM

▶️ Invited trainer: Dr. Nickolay Oskolkov

▶️ About Dr. Nickolay Oskolkov
Dr. Nikolay Oskolkov is an analyst doing bioinformatics, data science and statistical analysis. He has a background in theoretical physics, PhD 2007, and he moved to Life Sciences in 2012 where he was working in Computational Biology and Biomedicine. He is currently employed as a bioinformatician within the SciLifeLab bioinformatics platform NBIS. His range of interest includes genomics, transcriptomics, microbiome, ancient DNA, single cell, machine learning, image analysis and evolutionary science.

▶️ About the workshop:
This workshop will divided in two parts. During these two parts you'll learn about:

- Peculiarities of OMICs Integration
- Definition and evaluation of OMICs Integration
- Protocol of OMICs Integration
- OMICs Integration in Single Cell
- Selection of the Method of Integration
- Machine Learning view of Omics integration
- Feature Selection and Supervised Omics integration
- Live demo : Practical example of Feature Selection and Supervised OMICs Integration

By the end of this serie, you will be able to integrate Omics datasets and apply feature selection and supervised machine learning to it.

In order to attend the event, please fill out this form 👉 https://tinyurl.com/48ys8ykf

We will send you the ZOOM link a few hours before the training session. Please check out your email later.

We look forward to welcoming you!

title: R do Zero: para iniciantes
Rescuing Coral Reefs with Data Science and Art: Future Pacific
description:
Join us on Thursday for an exclusive presentation and Q&A session with Dr. Nyssa Silbiger on her latest project combining Data Science and Art to rescue coral reefs: Future Pacific. Dr. Silbiger will present the project implementation along with insights on how to perform a scientific study in times of COVID. Furthermore, Dr Silbiger will recount how they translated the study results into an art installation in collaboration with artist Lauren Shapiro.

About the speaker:

Dr. Nyssa Silbiger is currently an Assistant Professor in the Biology Department at California State University, Northridge. She teaches marine ecology, computer modeling and R.

Dr. Nyssa Silbiger uses a diverse set of laboratory, field, and quantitative techniques in her research to understand the impact of climate stressors on organisms, communities, and ecosystem processes in the context of natural variability. To date, she has worked mostly in coastal ecosystems including coral reefs and temperate rocky shores.

You can follow Dr. Silbiger's work at https://nyssasilbiger.com/ and njsilbiger.github.io​.

title: R-Ladies Meeting: TBC
description:
Please come with the most updated version of R and RStudio installed on your laptop. Please see our github page for more details on current and past events, including materials and code! https://github.com/rladies/meetup-presentations_montreal

As usual, snacks and drinks will be provided!!

Happy coding :-)

title: Text mining e data analisi con Twitter
description:
Text mining e data analisi con Twitter: casi pratici di estrazione e trattamento dati

Nel corso del workshop parleremo di come estrarre e analizzare dati testuali da Twitter per l'analisi.
Partiremo dalle basi dell'analisi dei dati non strutturati, per capire quali casistiche di analisi sono adatte ai dati di tipo testuale.
Scopriremo come creare un account Twitter per l'estrazione dati, come creare un' app e utilizzare le chiavi d'identificazione per estrarre i dati con R.
Una volta esaurita la parte di estrazione e storing dei dati, analizzeremo i dati in un'ottica di sentiment analysis.

Il workshop durerà circa due ore e prevede mezzora dedicata alle domande

Orario 18:00 - 20:30

PIATTAFORMA

Sarà utilizzato RStudio Cloud

SPEAKER
Valentina Porcu | Data Scientist

Appassionata di informatica, data science e ricerca, con un dottorato di ricerca in comunicazione e sistemi complessi e anni di esperienza nell'insegnamento nelle università in Italia, Francia e Marocco, e online, ovviamente!

Lavora come consulente nel campo della data science, AI e Machine Learning e le piace scrivere di nuove tecnologie e data mining.

Ha trascorso gli ultimi 12 anni lavorando come freelance e ricercatrice nel campo dell'analisi dei social media, analisi di benchmark e web scraping per la creazione di database, in particolare nel campo della buzz analysis e dell'analisi del sentiment per università, startup e web agency in tutto il Regno Unito, Francia , Stati Uniti e Italia.

title: Taller: datos geoespaciales en R
description:
Felices de anunciar nuestro primer encuentro del año!
El jueves 20 de Mayo a las 18:00 hs. Taller: Datos geoespaciales en R a cargo de María Teresa Ortíz .
En este taller aprenderemos a graficar datos geoespaciales, haremos mapas estáticos e interactivos. Además, revisaremos algunos conceptos básicos de datos geoespaciales vectoriales.

Esperamos puedan participar
RSVP en: rladies.uy/meetup

title: Statistrikk - Hard facts in soft materials
description:
Can the corona virus R number be crocheted? Can bias in research on women's health be knitted?
Of course it can! But why?
Statistician and associate professor at NMBU, Kathrine Frey Frøslie, has dedicated a significant amount of her time to the translation of important research results and statistical concepts, to beautiful or strange knitting designs. Get a backstage glimpse into Statistrikk.no, (to the best of our knowledge) the world's only popular science statistical knitting blog.

title: {Part 5: More Wrangling & ggplot} From Zero to (s)Hero: Multi-part intro to R
description:
Just getting involved with R or want to level up your skills? Have you used base-R but are still trying to wrap your head around the tidyverse "pipe" (%>%)? Have a messy dataset and don't know where to start? Seen beautiful visualizations on Twitter and want to make your own?

If you’ve answered ‘yes’ to at least one of these questions, fear no more! In this monthly workshop series, we will walk you through the fundamental uses of tidyverse and ggplot at your own pace with the help of hands-on exercises. Tidyverse and ggplot are a classic combination of R packages that allow you to "wrangle" your unwieldy data into whatever shape you need and creative beautiful and informative visualizations.

Over the course of this series, you will learn the most useful features of R Studio and R Markdown, how to read in and explore data, and transform it into a shape that's easy to work with. You will be able to create new columns and summary tables, subset interesting rows or columns, and combine and reshape dataframes. We will also dive into ggplot, one of the best tools for creating great-looking bar charts, scatterplots, and more!

This is (currently) a five-part series, aimed at total beginners and/or people with some experience in base-R or tidyverse who are looking to freshen up or expand their skills. Feel free to join at any point, we will briefly review the previous topic at the beginning of each session.

January 20th {Part 1}: The R & R-Studio ABCs (packages, files, data types & basic data exploration)
February 17th {Part 2}: Tidy data & introduction to data wrangling (tibbles, renaming, reordering, subsetting)
March 17th {Part 3}: Data wrangling with dplyr (new columns, if-else statements, summary tables, joining dataframes)
April 21st {Part 4}: Introduction to visualizations with ggplot (line graphs, bar charts, scatterplots, histograms, and more!)
May 19th {Part 5}: Advanced topics in wrangling and ggplot (pivoting, ggplot style options, etc.)

Please install R and R-Studio before joining: https://rstudio-education.github.io/hopr/starting.html

Image by the amazing @allison_horst: https://github.com/allisonhorst/stats-illustrations

title: Create and publish your personal website with Blogdown
description:
Having a personal website to show your projects and experiences is an easy way to stand out in a crowd of job applications.

At our event this month, R-Ladies Melbourne organiser Danyang Dai will give a workshop demonstrating how to create and publish a website using Blogdown in R! And we are excited to announce that this workshop will be given in person!!

Danyang's workshop is designed for beginners, and does not require prior experience in web languages such as HTML, CSS or JavaScript - only a bit of R Markdown is needed! She will guide you through creating the website from beginning to end, and at the completion of the workshop we will show you how to publish your website online with Netlify, so that anyone can visit your new personal site.

Danyang is a committee member of R-Ladies Melbourne who graduated from Melbourne Uni with a Master's degree in Applied Econometrics. She is a self-taught programmer and is passionate about programming in R.

Danyang created her first personal website using Blogdown in 2018 before she know how to program in any language. She is particularly passionate about using R to visualise and present data using R Markdown. Danyang has taught R programming workshops at Monash Uni for the Data Visualisation and Analytics course. She is now pursuing data analytic careers in Melbourne.

What to bring:
As this is a WORKSHOP, please bring your laptop with RStudio and the Blogdown package installed (https://github.com/rstudio/blogdown). This is enough to set up a website locally, but if you'd like to publish the website for all to see you will also need a GitHub account.

This workshop will be held in PERSON, and will not be streamed online. It will only be available for 35 people, so be sure to register to attend!

This event will be hosted by our fantastic sponsor Nous Group. Please arrive from 5:30pm, the workshop will start at 6pm sharp! Pizza and drinks will be provided for the evening.

We look forward to seeing everyone at our first in person event in over a year!

R-Ladies Melbourne

title: Improving your data visualisations in R
description:
TOPIC
This event will be led by Dr Sophie Hardy (https://sophiehardy.co.uk/). Sophie is a postdoctoral research fellow at the University of Warwick and is one of the co-founders of R-Ladies Coventry!

Clear and transparent data visualisation is essential for the effective interpretation and communication of science, and is a topic that Sophie is passionate about! The talk will begin with a brief overview of the common pitfalls of typical data visualisation methods (e.g., bar plots). Following this, Sophie will show three different types of data visualisations that are effective at showing off the full story of your dataset, and walk you through the code for making these plots in R.

PREPARATION AND RESOURCES
There is nothing to prepare in advance. The resources for the workshop (including PowerPoint slides, a R markdown html file and the original R code used to create the tutorial) are freely available to download here: https://osf.io/e63br/

ONLINE PROGRAMME
The event will be held online and will start at 17:00 (UK time). Please join us via this Zoom link:
https://us06web.zoom.us/j/86518733370?pwd=eDNmM2R1UUlFTXRyRmltRXRxNUdmdz09

CODE OF CONDUCT
Please take a minute to read our code of conduct - we are committed to creating a safe and harassment-free environment:
https://github.com/rladies/.github/blob/master/CODE_OF_CONDUCT.md

R-Ladies events are always free and open to anyone who wants to participate as long as they follow the code of conduct. We are pro-actively inclusive of queer, trans, and all minority identities, with additional sensitivity to intersectional identities. Our priority is to provide a safe community space for anyone identifying as a minority gender who is interested in and/or working with R.

title: Introduction to {reticulate}
description:
Details
We are delighted to invite you to our next meetup in collaboration with TBS Data Science Club. We will be organizing a new workshop introduction to {reticulate} by Tiffany Timbers.

Date/Time: Wednesday, May 17th, 2021 from 7 PM to 9 PM (GMT+1)
Place: Zoom

▶️ Invited trainer: Tiffany Timbers

▶️ About Tiffany Timbers :
Tiffany Timbers is an Assistant Professor of Teaching in the Department of Statistics and an Co-Director for the Master of Data Science program (Vancouver Option) at the University of British Columbia. In these roles she teaches and develops curriculum around the responsible application of Data Science to solve real-world problems. One of her favorite courses she teaches is a graduate course on collaborative software development, which focuses on teaching how to create R and Python packages using modern tools and workflows.

▶️ About the workshop:
Reticulate RStudio and your R code with Python! In this short work-shop we will show you how to configure your system so that you can use Python inside RStudio at the repl/console, in a script and inside R Markdown. As well as how to bring Python packages and functions into your R code! To do this we will be relying on the {reticulate} R package.

In order to attend the event, please fill out this form 👉 https://tinyurl.com/ybckz363

We will send you the zoom link a few hours before the training session. Please check out your email later.

We look forward to welcoming you!

title: Shiny: Construindo aplicativos web interativos
description:
Heey, tudo bem?

Estamos muito felizes com a sua participação.

Aproveite o curso. Aproveite essa oportunidade! Este evento foi pensado com muito carinho para você.

O que você vai aprender?

Em construção.

Quais pacotes vão ser utilizados ?

library(tidyverse)
library(shiny)

Sobre o Projeto Enigma

O projeto Enigma busca tornar visível o papel feminino na área da computação, resgatando as contribuições significativas de algumas mulheres de uma forma diferenciada, que provoque o pensamento do fruidor. Não pretende-se reproduzir as visibilidades que estas personagens já têm, mas fazer uma provocação, desacomodando o pensamento para que as invisibilidades, que ainda persistem, se tornem visíveis. As doações serão voltadas a reforma de artigos doados ao projeto como computadores, teclados e entre outros objetos do universo computacional.

Para saber mais sobre este projeto lindo acesse https://www.ufrgs.br/enigma/

E aí? Topa?

Link de inscrição: https://www.sympla.com.br/produtor/cursosonline

Dúvidas frequentes:

CERTIFICADOS! - O certificado de 4h do evento será enviado para o seu e-mail. Caso você não receba ao final do evento, escreva para goiania@rladies.org.

MATERIAIS! - Os materiais utilizados no nosso curso (apresentação, scripts) serão disponibilizados através do nosso GitHub .

Dicas importantes para melhor aproveitamento do evento

(1°) Procure conectar o seu computador no cabo de rede, evitando instabilidades na transmissão;
(2°) Pré-configure a sua câmera e microfone antes de entrar no evento pois será útil para as interações com a professora em caso de dúvidas!
(3°) Prepare seu ambiente, aquela caneca de café, garrafa de água e os fones de ouvido, melhores companheiros para se concentrar e mergulhar de cabeça nessa experiência!
(4°) Não guarde esse conhecimento apenas para você, compartilhe com seus amigos e redes sociais marcando a gente no instagram @rladiesgyn.

Você faz parte desse compromisso

Lembre-se que o Código de Conduta também se estende à versão online de nossos eventos e não será tolerada qualquer forma de assédios ou intimidações de qualquer participante, seja audiência, palestrantes, colaboradores, ou quaisquer membros da comunidade.

A gente brilha TOGETHER!

title: Deploying Energy Theft Detection Model with tidymodels and RESTful API
description:
Deploying Energy Theft Detection Model with tidymodels and RESTful API by Tams George.

Tams is an analytics developer with interest in strategy and technology with relevant experience.

He has in-depth knowledge of the power sector and he's keen on building efficient data products for the sector.

title: Text Analysis with Wendy Martinez
description:
Wendy Martinez has been serving as the Director of the Mathematical Statistics Research Center at the Bureau of Labor Statistics (BLS) for over eight years. Prior to this, she served in several research positions throughout the Department of Defense. She held the position of Science and Technology Program Officer at the Office of Naval Research, where she established a research portfolio comprised of academia and industry performers developing data science products for the future Navy and Marine Corps. Her areas of interest include computational statistics, exploratory data analysis (to include visualization), and text analysis. She is the lead author of three books on MATLAB and statistics. Dr. Martinez was elected as a Fellow of the American Statistical Association (ASA) in 2006 and is an elected member of the International Statistical Institute. She is also proud and grateful to have served as the 2020 ASA President.

Talk Abstract: The Bureau of Labor Statistics (BLS) is one of thirteen principal federal statistical agencies and is responsible for collecting data and producing several well-known economic indicators. Examples include the consumer price index and the monthly jobs report. BLS conducts surveys and censuses in areas related to productivity, prices, worker conditions, pay and benefits, and employment. In this talk, I will describe some applications in text analysis I’ve been involved with during my time at the BLS.

title: Club de lectura: R para Ciencia de Datos (Wickham & Grolemund)
description:
Las R-Ladies de Barranquilla (COL), Galápagos, Guayaquil y Milagro (ECU) nos hemos unido para traerte un club de lectura basado en el libro R para Ciencia de Datos de Wickham y Grolemund. Este libro está disponible en español gracias a él esfuerzo de la comunidad R latinoamericana y puede ser accedido de manera libre aquí: https://es.r4ds.hadley.nz Estamos felices de crear este grupo de lectura y aprender sobre cómo hacer ciencia de datos a R, manipular su estructura y transformarlos, hasta visualizarlos e incluso crear modelos y comunicar resultados. Este club de lectura incluirá varias sesiones quincenales que se llevarán a cabo los jueves empezando el 13 de mayo a través de Zoom. Cada sesión durará dos horas durante las cuales discutiremos y practicaremos los puntos más importantes del capítulo en el que nos enfoquemos para esa sesión. Durante esta primera sesión Danisse Carrascal y Mary Jane Rivero (R-Ladies Barranquilla) hablarán sobre los tipos de datos y estructuras que utilizaremos en R. Esto incluye capítulo 14 (Cadena de Caracteres), capítulo 15 (Factores), y el capítulo 20 (Vectores). Recuerda, las sesiones son los jueves de cada quincena desde el 13 de mayo y empieza a las 18:00(UTC-5, Colombia y Ecuador Continental), o si estás en Galápagos a las 17:00(UTC-6). Al participar en nuestros eventos recuerda que estás aceptando nuestro código de conducta, el cual nos ayuda a crear un espacio amable y seguro para aprender:

https://github.com/rladies/starter-kit/wiki/Code-of-Conduct#spanish

Recuerda, las sesiones son los jueves de cada quincena desde el xx de mayo, y empiezan a las 18:00 (UTC-5, Colombia y Ecuador Continental), o si estás en Galápagos a las 17:00 (UTC-6). Al participar en nuestros eventos recuerda que estás aceptando nuestro código de conducta, el cual nos ayuda a crear un espacio amable y seguro para aprender: https://github.com/rladies/starter-kit/wiki/Code-of-Conduct#spanish

title: Club de lectura: R para Ciencia de Datos (Wickham & Grolemund)
description:
Las R-Ladies de Barranquilla (COL), Galápagos, Guayaquil y Milagro (ECU) nos hemos unido para traerte un club de lectura basado en el libro R para Ciencia de Datos de Wickham y Grolemund. Este libro está disponible en español gracias al esfuerzo de la comunidad R latinoamericana y puede ser accedido de manera libre aquí: https://es.r4ds.hadley.nz.

Estamos felices de crear este grupo de lectura y aprender sobre cómo hacer ciencia de datos, lo cual incluye desde la importación de datos a R, manipular su estructura y transformarlos, hasta visualizarlos e incluso crear modelos y comunicar resultados.

Este club de lectura incluirá varias sesiones quincenales que se llevarán a cabo los jueves empezando el 13 de mayo a través de Zoom. Cada sesión durará dos horas durante las cuales discutiremos y practicaremos los puntos más importantes del capítulo en el que nos enfoquemos para esa sesión.

Durante esta primera sesión Danisse Carrascal y Mary Jane Rivero (R-Ladies Barranquilla) hablarán sobre los tipos de datos y estructuras que utilizaremos en R. Esto incluye al capítulo 14 (Cadenas de caracteres), capítulo 15 (Factores), y el capítulo 20 (Vectores).

Recuerda, las sesiones son los jueves de cada quincena desde el 13 de mayo, y empiezan a las 18:00 (UTC-5, Colombia y Ecuador Continental), o si estás en Galápagos a las 17:00 (UTC-6). Al participar en nuestros eventos recuerda que estás aceptando nuestro código de conducta, el cual nos ayuda a crear un espacio amable y seguro para aprender: https://github.com/rladies/starter-kit/wiki/Code-of-Conduct#spanish

title: Developing R packages for yourself and others
description:
Hello R-Ladies!

Join us on May 12th for a workshop on developing R packages!

Event Description: R packages are a collection of functions, documentation, and sample data. Not only do they provide an excellent framework for organizing your code, but they also make it easier to share code with other R users. In this workshop, we’ll develop a simple R package together to gain an understanding of the key steps of package development. I’ll also reflect on my experiences creating an internal package for my team at the BC Ministry of Health. I hope to shed light on the lesser-known non-technical aspects of package development by discussing how to identify what tools your teammates need to succeed and how to encourage them to adopt your package. This workshop is geared towards (but not limited to) those who are new to developing packages and those who are thinking of creating one to share within their organization and beyond.

**This workshop assumes you know how to write a function in R and are familiar with the RStudio IDE. (See below for resources and required packages) ***

About the Speaker: Reiko is a data analyst with the Government of British Columbia. In her role, she creates various tools using R to support her team’s work in monitoring trends in population health and health inequalities in the province. When her computer is turned off, she splits her time as a recreational bassist, aspiring Star Baker, and occasional trainspotter.

Workshop details:
Date and time: May 12th, 2021 at 6:00pm
Webinar link: RSVP to view link
Note: Meeting password is embedded in the link after the ?
If you have trouble getting into the meeting, please message Jasmine

***
General workshop information:

-Please expect a hands-on session in a friendly and laid-back atmosphere where we all encouraged to learn together.
- This workshop assumes you know how to write a function in R and are familiar with the RStudio IDE. Follow the links below for a refresher:
- Yuka Takemon's Base R functions tutorial: https://www.yukatakemon.com/post/rladies-functions/rladies-building-functions/

Software requirements:
- R (Free at https://cran.r-project.org/)
- RStudio (Free at https://www.rstudio.com/products/rstudio/download/)

Package requirements: (Install the following using
`install.packages("packageNameHere")` in your console)
- devtools
- roxygen2
- testthat
- knitr

**********************IMPORTANT************************

1. Have your computer and a steady internet connection ready

2. If this is your first R-Ladies event, please take a moment to review our R-Ladies Global code of conduct: https://github.com/rladies/.github/blob/master/CODE_OF_CONDUCT.md

3. Who is this allowed to attend the workshop?
Everyone is welcome to join us at our events and to be a part of our mission to empower gender minorities with the skills and knowledge to code in one of the top programming language in data science, which is R.

To fulfill this mission we do ask participants to respect a focus on the encouragement and support for women and non-binary people during our events.

See you there!

Yuka, Jasmine, Lisa, and Sayemin

title: {R-Ladies Toolbox Series} Part 5: Panel discussion on women in science
description:
R-Ladies Toolbox Series - Essentials for women and minority genders in academia, science and data analysis presents:
Panel discussion on women in science

To finish this series about women in science we will discuss about the inequities and problems that women and gender minorities find in academia. We will talk about systemic issues, non-visible barriers and work, family and care. What problems do we face? Are politics to increase gender equality effective? Is there data to support these measurements and decisions? We count with a grate panel of women and we invite you too to share your own perspectives!

Panellists:

Daloha Rodriguez-Molina
comes from Venezuela. She studied medicine and practiced as a primary care, emergency, and occupational physician. She has been involved in research activities since 2008 as part of the Student Society for the Promotion of Research in Endocrine and Metabolic Diseases, of which she was President in 2011. She obtained a Master's degree in Epidemiology from the University of Munich (LMU) in 2016. Currently, she is an occupational and environmental epidemiologist and pursuing a PhD degree in Epidemiology at the LMU under the supervision of Prof. Dr. Katja Radon. She has been involved in teaching activities at the LMU Munich, the Virtual University of Baviera, and the Center for International Health of the LMU . She is a co-founder of the R-Ladies Munich group.

Ivana Feldfeber
is a feminist activist from Buenos Aires living in Bariloche. She holds two degrees in Education and Social Pedagogy, and is completing a postgraduate diploma in "Data Science: Machine Learning and its Applications" at the University of Córdoba, Argentina. She teaches programming and robotics for children and teenagers. She worked as a data scientist at an online platform, analysing data from a social and educational point of view. She attended many conferences regarding data in Latin America and realized that no one was talking about gender bias, gender data and feminism. So Ivana decided to create "DataGénero" a gender data Observatory, the first in the region with a group of scientists, activists and people from different disciplines and countries. https://datagenero.org

Kamila Benadrouche
holds a master’s degree in operational research: optimization and strategic management. Economic studies engineer at sonatrach. Previously teaching programming tools and R language at the university of Boumerdes, Algeria. Founder of R-Ladies Algiers and organizer of the meetups for the promotion of R. And freelance trainer of Office-Tools (Word, Excel…).

Liili Abuladze
is a social demography PhD researcher at Tallinn University, Estonia. Her research interests include population ageing outcomes, fertility and family formation, and data quality. In 2020, she was awarded with the European Association for Population Studies Outreach Award for communication activities in demography. She is also the initiator and co-organiser of the R-Ladies Tbilisi community.

Masani Mahadik
Majoring in econometrics and completing post graduate programs in statistics, and business management, Manasi has been applying R in an academic setting across a variety of disciplines. She has worked in advanced analytics consulting at Nielsen for a couple of years where she comprehensively used R to conduct a range of data play and visualisations in order to deliver insights for Top FMCG clients across the South Asia region. She is currently pursuing a fellowship in Artificial Intelligence and Machine Learning and aims to make the next move in the social sector — using data for good! She leads the R-Ladies Mumbai chapter, and blogs about her explorations with data. You can connect with her: https://www.linkedin.com/in/manasi-mahadik-a66b26146/

This series is funded by the “Pädagogische Hochschule Freiburg”, the University of Education in Freiburg. Everyone is welcome to join and we hope for a warm exchange between students, researchers and R-Ladies.

title: Zhoosh up your ggplots!
description:
In our May 2021 meetup we're joined by Athanasia Monika Mowinckel. Athanasia is a researcher at the Center for Lifespan Changes in Brain and Cognition, organiser for R-Ladies Oslo, and is a member of the R-Ladies Global team.

Zhoosh up your ggplots!

In this talk Athanasia will share with us her tips and tricks for enhancing (zhooshing up!) your data visualisations made with ggplot2.

Password for the Zoom session will be sent out on the day of the event.

--

R-Ladies is a worldwide organization whose mission is to promote gender diversity in the R community.

A question we often get is "Are men welcome to attend this event?"

As a diversity initiative, the mission of R-Ladies is to achieve proportionate representation by encouraging, inspiring, and empowering people of genders currently underrepresented in the R community. R-Ladies’ primary focus, therefore, is on supporting minority gender R enthusiasts to achieve their programming potential, by building a collaborative global network of R leaders, mentors, learners, and developers to facilitate individual and collective progress worldwide.

**As such, we strongly encourage cis-men who attend this event to come as guests of R-Ladies who are minority genders (including but not limited to cis/trans women, trans men, non-binary, genderqueer, agender).**

All attendees are strongly encouraged to review the R-Ladies Code of Conduct (https://rladies.org/code-of-conduct) and must abide by it.

title: R Ladies Boulder Meetup #14: RStudio 2021 Conference Talk Watch Party
description:
Hi Boulder UseRs! Join us for this month's virtual R Ladies Meetup! We are having an RStudio 2021 Conference talk watch party with four different video options (see below). You choose your video adventure! We will use breakout groups to watch and discuss each video in small groups. This allows for a tailored R Ladies experience and is also a great chance to network with others interested in the same topic!

The videos we will be watching are:
(1) Always Look on the Bright Side of Plots by Kara Woo
(2) Humanitarian Data Science with R by Ahmadou Dicko
(3) The Dynamic Duo: SQL & R by Irene Steves
(4) Art Lessons: Art Lessons: One Year as RStudio’s Artist-in-Residence by Allison Horst

We will be meeting over Zoom (Meeting link visible when you RSVP). Join us to connect with other R users in the Boulder area and learn some new techniques to apply in your work!

We hope you'll also join our local Slack workspace to keep the R help and conversation flowing! To get access to the Slack workspace, please fill out this short Google form: https://forms.gle/j36YGxuNwN6zZ8nW7.

title: Implementando Redes Neuronales en R
description:
En este meetup descubriremos en primer lugar, qué es una red neuronal, pero también, qué tiene que ver una de nuestras neuronas con las redes neuronales de las que posiblemente hayas oído hablar. Hablaremos de las redes neuronales más famosas y por supuesto, de los principales usos que se les da hoy en día. Una vez que conozcamos esos usos, vamos a implementar una red neuronal en R, ¿vamos? sí, ya verás que no es tan difícil. Las redes neuronales aprenden a través de ejemplos, como tú y yo, y ahí está la clave.

En esta ocasión contamos con la crack Clara Piniella, donde nos ha dejado esta bonita biografía para que conozcáis más sobre su trayectoria:

Me presento, soy Clara Piniella Martínez, y podría resumirlo todo con que soy graduada en Administración y Dirección de Empresas por la Universidad de Málaga, pero, eso es solo el principio. Mi pasión por entender aquello que hace únicas a las personas, y cómo poder hacer esto un valor añadido para la empresa me llevó hasta Australia, Melbourne, donde tras 12 meses obtuve el Diploma de Liderazgo y Dirección. Conocimientos que durante un año y medio pude poner en práctica en el departamento de Recursos Humanos de la empresa LeasePlan. Es aquí donde descubro que estas personas, tú y yo, somos una fuente imparable de datos que bien gestionados pueden no quitarnos poder, sino dárnoslo. Por este motivo en octubre de 2019 decidí embarcarme en esta aventura del análisis de datos, el machine learning. Acabo de llegar, pero cada día tengo más claro que he llegado para quedarme, para aprender, para compartir lo que sé y para participar en esta, la revolución del siglo XXI.

¡Os esperamos el 11 de mayo!

title: Show and Tell your R Code
description:
Kicking off 2021 with a Show and Tell event series. Join us on the 2nd Tuesday of the month to share your code. It might be code that you are particularly proud of. Or maybe it is code that is driving you crazy. Either way we would love to see it.

Come along to this online event and share your triumph and/or frustration. Who knows what each session will bring but I ALWAYS walk away with a new tip/trick in my back pocket.

This event will be via Zoom.

Check out some of the cool things we have shared at Show and Tell events last year at our blog https://rladiessydney.org/post/

title: Modelling workflows in R and the R-INLA package - Hybrid(In-person or Zoom)
description:
*What are we going to learn:
Do you use statistical models in R or want to learn? Learn how to best structure your model workflows including reading in data, checking the data, performing analyses, and plotting. The presentation will also go into more advanced topics discussing the R-INLA package for modelling spatio-temporal data. R-INLA is a powerful method that uses integrated nested Laplace approximation (INLA) to create complex models with various types of random effects such as spatial and temporal autocorrelation and run them very fast (https://www.r-inla.org/home). In this talk, we will specially focus on how to model spatial autocorrelation using coral recovery data. Best for those who are comfortable with R but all are welcome.

*Who is going to present:
Dr. Julie Vercelloni is a quantitative ecologist that studied Marine Ecology during her undergraduate and postgraduate degrees and statistics applied to coral reef ecology for her PhD. She is now an Associate Investigator at the Queensland University of Technology node of the Australian Centre of Excellence for Mathematical and Statistical Frontiers and works mostly with the Australian Institute of Marine Science.
Julie is doing research on diverse projects that look at combining state-of-the-art technologies including machine learning and virtual reality, and modern statistical modelling methods to help understanding complex problems related to coral reef conservation. She is also a citizen science advocate, working on new types of monitoring for the Great Barrier Reef and Pacific countries.

* When are we meeting?
The talk will start at 5:30 pm for a ~45 minute presentation, 15 minutes Q&A time with the potential to move to an outside venue for continued socializing and networking.

* Where are we meeting?
We will meet at QUT Gardens Point campus room Y-801 (in building Y) - this will be a hybrid event with a Zoom link available.
map: https://goo.gl/maps/4H51oEEun6JuewVn6
DIRECTIONS TO THE ROOM - Y block/building is next to River Stage in QUT Gardens Point. The elevators to the 8th floor are on the side of the building facing P block and should not require card access. Please follow the hall to the right upon exiting the elevator on floor 8 to room Y-801, the first meeting room at the end of the hall.

We look forward to seeing you there!

R-Ladies Brisbane

********************************************************************************

By taking part in an R-Ladies Brisbane event you grant the community organisers full rights to use the images resulting from the photography/video filming/media, and any reproductions or adaptations of the images for publicity, fund-raising or other purposes to help achieve the community’s aims. If you do not wish to be recorded in these media please inform a community organiser.

Code of Conduct: R-Ladies Brisbane is dedicated to providing a welcoming and harassment-free event experience for everyone, regardless of gender, gender identity and expression, age, sexual orientation, disability, physical appearance, body size, race, ethnicity, or religion (or lack thereof). We do not tolerate harassment of event participants in any form, for any event venue, including talks, workshops, parties, Twitter and other online media.

Community Policies: Please note, cis men are welcome to join our meetups when they come as a guest of a woman participant or they bring a woman with them. We highly encourage speakers and teachers at R-Ladies Brisbane events to be of minority genders.

title: "Flexible reproducibility in data workflows" with Brooke Watson Madubuonwu
description:
For the May 11th edition of our R-Ladies Dallas webinar series, we are excited to welcome Brooke Watson Madubuonwu as our guest speaker. Brooke will discuss "Flexible reproducibility in data workflows".

~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
Session title: Flexible reproducibility in data workflows
~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~

Abstract: Sometimes, when data collected for an analysis doesn’t change, the process of tidying is a one-time investment. Other times, raw data changes by the hour or minute, requiring automated systems of extraction, transformation, and loading. But what of the case in the middle? How should analysts and data scientists handle the system changes, the month-over-month tweaks, and data sources that involve a human in the loop?

This talk will cover strategies and tactics for creating resilient and flexible reproducibility in data workflows. I’ll discuss real-world examples, explore mistakes I've made along the way, and share R packages and functions that help navigate the space between customization and automation.

Bio: Brooke Madubuonwu is the Director of Legal Analytics & Quantitative Research at the American Civil Liberties Union, where she & her team use data science & statistics to advance civil rights through advocacy, legislative support, and litigation. Her work ranges from the measurement of racial and gender disparities in housing, education, and criminal justice, to the analysis of gerrymandered voting districts throughout the US. Before joining the ACLU, she trained as an epidemiologist at the London School of Hygiene and Tropical Medicine, and studied zoonotic viruses as a research scientist at the NY-based nonprofit, EcoHealth Alliance. She completed her undergraduate studies in biology at the University of Tennessee, and hails from Memphis, TN.

Twitter: https://twitter.com/brookLYNevery1

Website:

*************************************************************************

You are encouraged to click the link below to keep up with the group project and to join the Slack community. Slack is a messaging platform where we will share open job opportunities, free or low-cost online training materials, and R-Ladies group projects that will help you practice your R programming skills and develop a portfolio that could be used to showcase your skills to hiring managers.

Slack sign-up: https://docs.google.com/forms/d/e/1FAIpQLSdJhvSg-YrNYOrmju1yrXvYhFM7xMey1WpDq1NSGIp6x41VaA/viewform

*************************************************************************

We expect all attendees to abide & be governed by our community code of conduct. Please take a moment to review our R-Ladies Global code of conduct (particularly if this is your first time attending!): https://github.com/rladies/starter-kit/wiki/Code-of-Conduct.

title: Bayesian statistics
description:
Federica Giardina is a public health researcher currently working as an assistant professor in Biostatistics at Radboud University Medical Center (Radboud UMC) in Nijmegen (the Netherlands). She uses Bayesian methods to answer questions in infectious disease epidemiology. Bayesian statistics allows the user to specify prior information to the chosen model. This method is useful, for example, when working with datasets with partially missing data, as is often the case in public health records.

Federica will introduce the Stan programming language (https://mc-stan.org/) with examples of modeling performed with the rstan package.

It's a short introduction, a sweet taste if you like, of a very broad topic that we have been anxious to learn about. Please join us!

title: [ONLINE] Meetup 4: Lightning Talks
description:
Hello All! This is a lightning talks session with 3 speakers presenting their talks. All speakers will present their talk for 15-minutes followed by a 5-minute question-answer session with the audience.

The Zoom link for this event will be available only to those who RSVP.

Our Speakers:

Janani Ravi, PhD is an Assistant Professor at the Department of Pathobiology and Diagnostic Investigation, Michigan State University. She is also the founder of R-Ladies East Lansing.
In her talk, Janani will discuss "Making cool publication-quality tables" in R. She will be giving a snapshot of making elegant and interactive tables with knitr, DT, and GT!
GitHub Username: jananiravi

Kewalin Samart, is an undergraduate student majoring in Computational Mathematics with a minor in Computational Math, Science, and Engineering at Michigan State University. She uses R to perform data analysis in her research project.
In her talk, Kewalin will provide "A sneak peek at Distill-flavored R Markdown for scientific manuscripts". She will be giving a quick snapshot of how to prepare scientific manuscripts using Distill-flavored R Markdown and how to publish the finished articles using GitHub.
GitHub Username: KewalinSamart

Praveena Mathews, teaches R and Statistics. She is also the Organizer of R-Ladies Chennai.
In her talk, Praveena will discuss how to conduct "Principal Component Analysis in R". She will talk about how to do Principal Component Analysis (PCA) in R and visualize the results of the analysis.
GitHub Username: pjmathews

If you are interested, please RSVP for this event. We welcome participants from all experience levels with R.

All participants in this event should strictly observe the code of conduct mentioned here: https://rladies.org/code-of-conduct/

For any queries/suggestions, you can write an e-mail to us at pune@rladies.org

Event announcements are also made at our Twitter account: @RladiesPune

title: Bookclub - Chapter 5: Data Transformation
description:
R-Ladies Tbilisi bookclub is continuing its meetings on Hadley Wickham's and Garret Grolemund's "R for Data Science" (https://r4ds.had.co.nz/).

On May 9, Ana Makharadze will present the book's Chapter 5 on data transformation: https://r4ds.had.co.nz/transform.html

Please read the chapter before the meeting to be better prepared for the session and exercises. We will go through the exercises together. We start at noon Tbilisi time!

The previous chapter 4 on work flow basics (https://r4ds.had.co.nz/workflow-basics.html) is quite short - please work this through independently.

Please RSVP on Meetup or sign up at this link (even if you want to attend as a listener only):
https://docs.google.com/forms/d/1lufZ5eKEeNyinYbPqytVchdbkx5SwS6eKVfnIvEoqXk/

title: R in geoscience - working with oil and gas data
description:
In this workshop, you will learn how to preprocess, analyze and (quickly!) visualize oil and gas production data from .csv and .shp files. This will include merging data frames, creating new variables, filtering, and many others.
You will see how R can help to manipulate datasets in different formats and explore the capabilities of dyplyr and ggplot2 - two most widely used R libraries for data analysis and visualization.

Paulina Wozniakowska is working on her PhD in Geophysics with Dr. David Eaton at the University of Calgary. She received her MSc in Applied Geophysics at the AGH University of Science and Technology in Krakow, Poland. Paulina’s current research focuses on geospatial analysis of induced seismicity in Canada. She decided to learn R to have more flexibility in daily data processing and understand all the hype around ggplot.

title: Omics Integration and Supervised Machine Learning - PART1
description:
We are delighted to get back to the R4Bioinfo series that we've launched in September 2020. We will be organizing a serie of two workshops about Omics integration and Supervised Machine Learning.

Date/Time: Saturday, May 8th, 2021 from 5 PM to 7:15 PM (GMT+1)
Place: ZOOM

▶️ Invited trainer: Dr. Nickolay Oskolkov

▶️ About Dr. Nickolay Oskolkov
Dr. Nikolay Oskolkov is an analyst doing bioinformatics, data science and statistical analysis. He has a background in theoretical physics, PhD 2007, and he moved to Life Sciences in 2012 where he was working in Computational Biology and Biomedicine. He is currently employed as a bioinformatician within the SciLifeLab bioinformatics platform NBIS. His range of interest includes genomics, transcriptomics, microbiome, ancient DNA, single cell, machine learning, image analysis and evolutionary science.

▶️ About the workshop:
This workshop will divided in two parts. During these two parts you'll learn about:

- Peculiarities of OMICs Integration
- Definition and evaluation of OMICs Integration
- Protocol of OMICs Integration
- OMICs Integration in Single Cell
- Selection of the Method of Integration
- Machine Learning view of Omics integration
- Feature Selection and Supervised Omics integration
- Live demo : Practical example of Feature Selection and Supervised OMICs Integration

By the end of this serie, you will be able to integrate Omics datasets and apply feature selection and supervised machine learning to it.

In order to attend the event, please fill out this form 👉 https://tinyurl.com/5ymyradc

We will send you the ZOOM link a few hours before the training session. Please check out your email later.

We look forward to welcoming you!

title: Fundamentos de R desde Cero - Sesión 7
description:
Fundamentos de R desde Cero - Sesión 7

Gracias a las personas que se registraron en nuestro formulario de Facebook!
El curso esta habilitado a todas las personas que ya se registraron.
Difundiremos por este medio la grabación del curso para aquellas personas que no pudieron registrarse.

title: [MeetUp Online] Tidymodels: Estruturando o processo de Machine Learning
description:
• CONTEÚDO
Tidymodels é uma coleção de pacotes para modelagem estatística e machine learning que utiliza os princípios do tidyverse. Você aprenderá o framework completo, desde a preparação dos dados até a calibração e comparação de modelos através da aplicação em um problema de classificação.

• PALESTRANTE
Viviane Sanchez é formada em Engenharia Química, mas desenvolveu sua carreira no mercado financeiro com trading de commodities e moeda. Atualmente atua em tesouraria e faz pós graduação em Ciência de Dados, onde teve seu primeiro contato com R.

_____________________________________________
Por favor leia todas as informações abaixo!

• PÚBLICO-ALVO
Pessoas que se identificam como minoria de gênero (mulher trans ou cis, homem trans, pessoa não-binária, queer).

• LOCAL DO EVENTO:
Canal das R-Ladies São Paulo no Youtube
https://www.youtube.com/c/RLadiesS%C3%A3oPaulo/featured

• CÓDIGO DE CONDUTA
Disponível aqui: https://github.com/rladies/.github/blob/master/CODE_OF_CONDUCT.md#Portuguese

Qualquer pessoa que violar ou houver previamente violado o código de conduta desta comunidade terá sua entrada proibida, será expulsa/o e/ou estará sujeita/o à ação que a pessoa organizadora achar mais apropriada, independente de inscrição no evento, ser membro do MeetUp ou qualquer outra condição.

_____________________________________________
• SOBRE AS R-LADIES
R-Ladies é uma organização que promove a diversidade de gênero na comunidade da linguagem R. Nosso principal objetivo é promover a linguagem computacional estatística R compartilhando conhecimento, assim, quem tiver interesse na linguagem será bem-vinda, independente do nível de conhecimento. Nosso principal público-alvo são as pessoas que se identificam com o gênero feminino, portanto, mulheres cis, mulheres trans, bem como pessoas não-binárias e queer.

_____________________________________________
O evento é gratuito, e organizado com muito carinho, ajude a espalhar a palavra, compartilhe com outras ladies :)

title: Taller Introductorio de Rmarkdown
description:
Hola a tod@s! L@s invitamos a nuestra reunión de mayo por Zoom. En esta ocasión nos acompañará María Paula, es economista, utilizadora e instructora certificada de R. Tiene experiencia usando R y Shiny para analizar datos, automatizar flujos de trabajo y producir reportes sobre diferentes temas de economía y políticas públicas. Trabaja actualmente como analista de políticas públicas en la OCDE, después de un par de años trabajando en como consultora en el sector privado. Originaria de Colombia, nos acompaña virtualmente el 8 de mayo desde Paris, Francia.

María Paula nos impartirá una taller introductorio de R-Markdown. Puedes seguirla en Twitter, @mapaulacaldas o por su página web mpaulacaldas.com

Nuestra reunión se llevará a cabo el sábado 8 de mayo a las 11:00 horas (GMT-6 hora de la Ciudad de México) por Zoom.

title: R for Official Statistics
description:
Greetings members!
We are pleased to invite you to the tutorial on "R for Official Statistics" scheduled for Saturday, 8th May, 11:00 a.m. - 1:00 p.m. GMT+3.

Our trainer: Ngugi Mwenda, Statistician - Sampling Standards and Methods, Kenya National Bureau of Statistics

Bibliography: Ngugi Mwenda holds a Bachelor of Science in Statistics and a Master of Science in Applied Statistics from Jomo Kenyatta University of Technology (JKUAT). He is currently pursuing another Masters of Science in health economics from the University of Nairobi (set to graduate in December) and is finalising his PhD in Biostatistics from Moi University (set to graduate in June). Ngugi has worked in Kenya National Bureau of Statistics (KNBS) from 2012 up to date as a statistician within different departments and in various capacities.

We will share a zoom link and the event details with the registered participants before the meetup.

We look forward to e-meeting you!

For any queries or comments, reach us on;

Email address: nairobi@rladies.org

LinkedIn: https://www.linkedin.com/in/r-ladies-nairobi-2572841b3/

Twitter: @RLadiesNairobi

title: R'da Renk Teorisi ve Uygulamaları
description:
Mimar Sinan Güzel Sanatlar Üniversitesi, İstatistik Bölümü öğretim üyelerinden Dr. Öğr. üyesi Özge Özdamar ile Renk Teorisine ilişkin uygulamalı bir webinarımız olacaktır. Katılmanızı çok isteriz!!! (passcode: 000111)

Dahası için web sitemizi ziyaret ediniz: www.rladieseskisehir.org

title: Cómo modelar sistemas sociales en R
description:
En este encuentro virtual, Cami Bohórquez nos va a dar una charla sobre el uso de los computadores para modelar y simular sistemas sociales. Esta charla cuenta con una parte teórica introductoria y luego se presentarán ejemplo de sistemas sociales simulados usando R. En el fondo del taller está la pregunta por la representación, la emulación vs la simulación y los límites de la ciencia frente a sistemas complejos donde se premia la anticipación sobre la predicción.

Cami Bohórquez es Ingeniera Industrial (2003) con maestría en ingeniería industrial de la Universidad de los Andes (2006), y con un doctorado en ingeniería de la Universidad de los Andes (2012). Actualmente trabaja con la Fundación CEIBA como Directora de Proyectos. Se especializa en la ingeniería de los sistemas sociales desde la nueva ciencia de la complejidad. En especial se ha interesado por los problemas estructurales de Colombia que nacen de su diversidad que surge por su fragmentación étnica, geográfica, ecológica y económica; su violencia, su inequidad y su ignorancia.

title: Club de lectura: Advanced R
description:
¡Continuamos leyendo el libro de Advanced R!

En esta sesión veremos el capítulo 8 sobre condiciones.

https://adv-r.hadley.nz/conditions.html

Este capítulo te servirá para aprender a mandar warnings, detener la ejecución de código por medio de stops y saltar procesos que fallaron sin romper toda tu pipeline.

Será a las 17:30 hora del Centro de la Ciudad de México y tendrá duración de 1 hora.

¡No faltes!

title: Introdução ao GitHub com aplicações em R
description: Neste Meetup do R-Ladies Lavras daremos um curso de introdução ao Github. Serão apresentadas as principais funcionalidades, vantagens e os primeiros passos para a utilização da plataforma.

title: Reportando resultados estadísticos con 'report'
description:
En esta sesión aprenderemos a automatizar los resultados de un análisis estadístico en R para crear reportes estandarizados y que a su vez sean fáciles de entender. Para esto, utilizaremos el paquete report. Este es un paquete perteneciente al easyverse que fue creado para enlazar los resultados de los análisis obtenidos en R con un manuscrito. Nuestro invitado es Carlos A. Torres Cubilla, científico de datos en el área bancaria con experiencia en lenguajes de programación como R y Python y con conocimientos en estadística, big data y machine learning .

CONOCIMIENTOS PREVIOS REQUERIDOS:
Este meetup está dirigido a personas con conocimientos básicos de R y estadística.

TEMARIO:
¿Qué es report? ¿Para qué sirve?
Reportes no estadísticos
Reportes estadísticos
Aplicación real de report en un informe

REQUERIMIENTOS DE SOFTWARE:
R >= 3.5 y R Studio preferiblemente en versión 1.4 (más actual)
Paquetes de R: report, palmerpenguins, dplyr, ggplot2, rmarkdown
Puedes usar los siguientes comandos para su instalación:
packages <- c("report", "palmerpenguins", "dplyr", "ggplot2", "rmarkdown") # Paquetes
installed_packages <- packages %in% rownames(installed.packages()) # Check de los paquetes
if (any(installed_packages == FALSE)) {
install.packages(packages[!installed_packages], dependencies = TRUE) # Instalación
}

title: WOMEN WILL | STRUMENTI DI LEADERSHIP IN PILLOLE
description:
Siamo condizionati da tantissimi fattori, quelli con cui siamo cresciute e contro cui combattiamo ogni giorno, con i colleghi, i fornitori, i clienti ma anche dentro noi stesse e con le donne con cui collaboriamo e interagiamo.

Questo webinar ha l'obiettivo di farci prendere confidenza con alcuni temi importanti, come i pregiudizi di genere o i doppi standard, e comprendere come possiamo adattare al nostro mondo professionale alcuni modelli e tips legati al concetto di "influenza" e alla gestione dei conflitti.

Quali sono i pregiudizi e gli squilibri di genere?
Quali sono i doppi standard e i bias cognitivi e comportamentali a cui siamo esposte costantemente nella quotidianità (dal linguaggio che utilizziamo alle differenze di salario e di raggiungimento di posizioni apicali nel mondo del lavoro)?
Come evitare per noi e per chi lavora al nostro fianco il sovraccarico cognitivo e aggirare l'ego depletion?
E ancora, come poter applicare alla nostra vita di tutti i giorni la teoria dei nudge?
Infine, quali sono le tipologie di conflitto in cui ci imbattiamo più spesso nel mondo lavorativo (e non solo)?

Imparare a riconoscere molti di questi aspetti ed esserne consapevoli è il primo passo per imparare a lavorarci personalmente e capire come contrastarli e superarli.

SPEAKER

Laura Nacci | Direttrice scientifica @ SheTech Master School e docente e consulente di Personal Branding su Instagram e Leadership Femminile.

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Progetta e realizza percorsi formativi che abilitano manager, professionisti e imprenditori allo sviluppo di contenuti e strategie di social media management per la loro professione e per il business che rappresentano: dalla overview sull'utilizzo delle varie piattaforme all'approfondimento del personal branding e del professional networking su Instagram.
In parallelo, da anni, porta avanti studi e docenze sul tema della leadership femminile, fornendo alle partecipanti strumenti e tips per una maggior consapevolezza degli automatismi individuali e delle dinamiche relazionali che sottostanno al proprio modus operandi e che spesso non consentono lo sviluppo di una leadership personalizzata, empatica e in cui il dialogo, le emozioni e l'autostima siano liberi di giocare un ruolo fondamentale.
È direttrice scientifica di SheTech Master School e lavora come consulente e docente per altre Business School e aziende, forte di un'esperienza imprenditoriale decennale durante la quale ha sperimentato, sin dagli esordi, l’uso dei social network e dei piani comunicativi transmediali per diversi contesti corporate.

title: Tidyverse: reorganizando datos con TidyR
description:
¡Iniciamos la temporada 2021 de Rladies Buenos Aires!

¿Necesitás ordenar tus datos? En esta ocasión aprenderemos a remodelar datos con algunas funciones de TidyR y haremos un pequeño recorrido en tidyverse & ciencia de datos.

Para este meetup es necesario que tengas R & Rstudio en tu computadora con los paquetes Tidyverse y datos ya instalados.

***IMPORTANTE***
Para participar poné "Asistiré" en este evento y asegurate de tener también instalado Zoom en tu computadora (https://zoom.us/download).

Por razones de seguridad no compartiremos el link para ingresar a Zoom de manera pública. El mismo martes a las 17:30 hs. vamos a mandar un mail a través de Meetup a todas las personas que confirmaron asistencia con el link para que puedas unirte a la videollamada.

title: Building your Data Science portfolio using GitHub
description:
Building your Data Science portfolio using GitHub.

Join us on May 1st at 11 am PT live on our YouTube channel ⏰

➡️ Youtube Link: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=-NMliYUeC9s

➡️ GitHub Event Repository: https://github.com/ai-inclusive/build-your-data-science-portfolio

🔴 Subscribe to our channel for more updates.

👩‍💻 Event Hosts:

➡ Gabriela de Queiroz - https://www.linkedin.com/in/gabrieladequeiroz/

➡ Saishruthi Swaminathan - https://www.linkedin.com/in/saishruthi-swaminathan

Saishruthi Swaminathan is a technical lead and data scientist in the IBM CODAIT team whose main focus is to democratize data and AI through open source technologies. She has a Masters in Electrical Engineering specializing in Data Science and a Bachelor degree in Electronics and Instrumentation. Her passion is to dive deep into the ocean of data, extract insights, and use AI for social good. Previously, she was working as a Software Developer. On a mission to spread the knowledge and experience, she acquired in her learning process. She also leads the education for rural children initiative and organizing meetups focussing on women empowerment.

📝 What you will learn:

- What is GitHub?
- What is a repository and how do I create one?
- Where to develop your project
- README tips
- Share your projects on social media (LinkedIn, Medium, Dev.to…)
- And more!

title: RLadies Brisbane & Women in Economics Networking
description:

Feel free to browse their website at https://esawen.org.au or follow them via twitter https://twitter.com/WomenEconAU

Find us on Twitter @rladiesbrisbane for more information on news, presentations and code!

title: Funciones de R que hacen nuestra vida más simple
description:
Este viernes 30 de abril nos volvemos a juntar, ahora para hablar de algunas funciones que amamaos porque hacen nuestra vida más fácil. Durante la sesión, Sara Acevedo, Stephanie Orellana, Javiera Riffo, Alejandra Tapia Silva y Riva Quiroga nos presentarán algunas funciones no tan conocidas que las ayudan en su trabajo diario. Nos enseñarán a utilizarlas y nos mostrarán algunos casos en los que podrían ser útiles.
Además, hablaremos sobre el llamado a presentación de trabajos de LatinR (https://latin-r.com/), la conferencia latinoamericana sobre R que este año se realizará en modalidad virtual. Revisaremos cuáles son los formatos de presentación y los temas, y resolveremos dudas sobre el proceso de envío de propuestas.

- SOBRE LA ESTRUCTURA DE LA SESIÓN

Esta sesión está organizada en torno a "charlas relámpago" en las que se presentarán las distintas funciones. Los materiales utilizados en cada una de las demostraciones quedará disponible en nuestra cuenta de GitHub una vez terminado el meetup: https://github.com/rladieschile.
Este evento se realizará a las 17:00 (UTC-4) a través de la plataforma Zoom. Unos minutos antes de la reunión compartiremos la clave de acceso.

- CÓDIGO DE CONDUCTA

Queremos que este sea un espacio de aprendizaje amable y seguro. Al inscribirte en este evento estás aceptando nuestro código de conducta: https://github.com/rladies/starter-kit/wiki/Code-of-Conduct#spanish
Esta es una actividad conjunta de los capítulos de RLadies de Chile (Santiago, Valparaíso, Concepción y Talca).
¡Te esperamos!

title: "Build your portfolio website with R+Shiny"
description:
¡Bienvenidas al meetup virtual de abril! En esta ocasión tenemos preparado un taller:

"Build your portfolio website with R+Shiny", por Xisca Pericàs (@XiscaPericas).

*Recordad que para acceder a la charla necesitaréis una contraseña que os enviaremos 1 hora antes del evento.

A continuación os dejamos la descripción del taller. ¡Nos vemos pronto!

> "Build your portfolio website with R+Shiny"
The aim of the talk is to give an overview on how R+Shiny can be used to build your own webpage (or any other app).
The talk is splitted in two parts:
The first one will be focused on reviewing the basics of Shiny development, sharing resources that I have used to build my own website (and others app) and discussing methods to deploy the apps we build.
The second part of the talk is a small demo where we will be building a simple Shiny App (using R+Shiny) and we will deployed it using shinyapps.io
If you want to do the practical part, you should have RStudio and the {shiny} package installed

> Sobre Xisca Pericàs
Hi there! I'm Xisca Pe and I'm a Senior Data Scientist from Mallorca (Spain). Currently I'm working as a product researcher in a software company, but I have also been involved in projects related with e-commerce and consultancy.
During the past five years I have joined several data/hackathons around Spain focused on a wide variety of topics such as building a recommender for banks environment or weather prediction.
Beyond my data-projects, I love books, music and cats.

title: Cross selling analytic model with sparklyr
description:
Dear all,

It is our pleasure to announce our speaker for April’s Meetup, Dr Carin Ludeña, who will be giving us insights into a sparklyr use-case for increasing bank revenue.

Carin is a mathematician, statistician, and data scientist who worked for many years as a university professor doing research on mathematical statistics, statistical learning, spatial statistics as well as graph and text analytics. Moreover, she acted as statistical advisor for an Election Monitoring ONG, a community (social and environmental) risk assessment project and lately in a large scale education monitoring process in Venezuela. As a data scientist, she advised and consulted in many projects ranging from statistical and mathematical models in oil production, to text analytics for automatic economic activity classification. Her current position, as data science leader in Matrix CPM, involves designing, developing and implementing solutions based on data and statistical/mathematical models, working hand in hand with data engineers.

Looking forward to the interesting presentation and discussion and to seeing you soon (even though still in an online format)!

All the best,
R-Ladies Vienna Organising Team

title: R-Ladies+ feat. useR! meetup
description:
This year useR! (https://user2021.r-project.org/) will be a global and entirely remote conference. One of the main goals is to encourage the participation of diverse people (considering diversity in all its forms and all its intersectionalities). The useR! global team is committed to providing inclusive and accessible spaces during the conference, along with extensive waivers, events in different languages (English, Spanish, and French), real-time English captions, and events across different time zones.

In this meetup, you will have the opportunity to meet R-Ladies+ from all over the globe. Our panelists will share their useR! experiences to inspire people with different backgrounds, occupations, and paths to participate in this year’s conference. The meetup will be trilingual with a few spots per organizing chapter.

Come join us!

Panel discussion with

See you soon at useR!

title: Programming with Tidyverse functions
description:
Hello R-Ladies!

Join us on April 28th for a workshop on Tidyverse functions!

Event Description: Tidyverse functions were designed for their ease of use by humans, and are best known and used in interactive R coding, or as part of a literate code document (e.g., R Markdown) or script, where they are run in the global environment (i.e., not inside a function). Here they feel easy to use and powerful, as you can access things like column names as if they were available to you as objects themselves. However, this ease of use by humans is a trade off for “more work required” when you want to start programming with these. For example, when using them inside functions. In this short workshop, we will introduce what makes programming with Tidyverse functions challenging and how we can rise up to meet these challenges.

**This workshop assumes you have used 2-3 Tidyverse functions and know how to write a function in R. (See below for resources) ***

About the Speaker: Dr. Tiffany Timbers is an Assistant Professor of Teaching in the Department of Statistics and a Co-Director for the Master of Data Science program (Vancouver Option) at the University of British Columbia. In these roles, she teaches and develops curriculum around the responsible application of Data Science to solve real-world problems. One of her favourite courses she teaches is a graduate course on collaborative software development, which focuses on teaching how to create R and Python packages using modern tools and workflows.

Workshop details:
Date and time: April 28th, 2021 at 6:00pm
Webinar link: RSVP to view link
Note: Meeting password is embedded in the link after ?pwd
If you have trouble getting into the meeting, please message Jasmine

***
General workshop information:

-Please expect a hands-on session in a friendly and laid-back atmosphere where we all encouraged to learn together.
- This workshop assumes you have used 2-3 Tidyverse functions and know how to write a function in R. Follow the links below for a refresher:
- Yuka Takemon's Base R functions tutorial: https://www.yukatakemon.com/post/rladies-functions/rladies-building-functions/
- Alison Horst's dplyr tutorial: https://allisonhorst.shinyapps.io/dplyr-learnr/

**********************IMPORTANT************************

1. Have your computer and a steady internet connection ready

2. If this is your first R-Ladies event, please take a moment to review our R-Ladies Global code of conduct: https://github.com/rladies/.github/blob/master/CODE_OF_CONDUCT.md

3. Who is this allowed to attend the workshop?
Everyone is welcome to join us at our events and to be a part of our mission to empower gender minorities with the skills and knowledge to code in one of the top programming language in data science, which is R.

To fulfill this mission we do ask participants to respect a focus on the encouragement and support for women and non-binary people during our events.

See you there!

Yuka, Jasmine, Lisa, and Sayemin

title: 2021 Datathon Conclusion: Exploring Judicial Patterns
description:
The 2021 RLadies Philly hackathon is focused on exploring judicial patterns in Philadelphia courts. Our partner, the Judge Accountability Table (JAT), has provided a subset of deidentified data related to public court dockets for defendants in Philadelphia County, Pennsylvania, to enable participants to hone thier data science skills by:

- Exploring and describing this rich, messy data more completely
- Stratifying data (e.g., comparing simple, low-severity charges with one another and complex, violent crime allegations with one another)
- Answering specific questions, or discovering what additional work or information would be required to be able to answer these questions
- Analyzing sparsity / missingness and discovering what the public interest is in ensuring freedom of information
- Understanding predictive factors in carceral outcomes (e.g. does age / sex / race correlate with bail amount?)

At this meetup, groups will present their results and discuss their experiences.

title: Meetup R-Ladies+ convida useR!
description:
De antemão, para quem não conhece, a useR! é uma conferência sem fins lucrativos organizada por voluntários da comunidade R para a comunidade R e apoiada pela R Foundation. Ela ocorre de maneira regular e tem como participantes desde desenvolvedores R a estudantes.

Neste ano useR! (https://user2021.r-project.org/) será global e totalmente remota. Um dos grandes objetivos é fomentar a participação de pessoas diversas (considerando diversidade de todas as formas e todas suas interseccionalidades). Para isso, além de uma equipe global comprometida em proporcionar espaços inclusivos e acessíveis, teremos facilidades como isenção de inscrição, eventos em diferentes idiomas (inglês, espanhol e francês), legendas em inglês em tempo real e eventos em diferentes fusos horários.

Em particular, neste meetup do dia 28/04 você terá a oportunidade de conhecer RLadies+ de vários cantos do mundo que irão compartilhar suas experiências em seus capítulos locais e na conferência useR!. Esperamos inspirar pessoas com diferentes origens, ocupações e experiências a fazer parte da conferência deste ano. O meetup será trilíngue e conta com algumas vagas por capítulo organizador.

CRONOGRAMA
• Boas vindas
• Painel com: Janani Ravi (East Lansing), Jonelle Villar (Bergen), Haifa Ben Messaoud (Tunis), Beatriz Milz (São Paulo), Zulemma Bazurto Blacio (Guayaquil)
• Perguntas pré-preparadas
• Perguntas do público
• Nos vemos em breve no useR!

CAPÍTULOS CO-ORGANIZADORES
• RLadies+ Vitória (Brasil)
• RLadies+ Bangalore (Índia)
• RLadies+ Tunis (Tunísia)
• RLadies+ East Lansing (EUA)
• RLadies+ Guayaquil (Equador)
• RLadies+ Santa Rosa (Argentina)
• RLadies+ Cuernavaca (México)
• RLadies+ Den Bosch (Países Baixos)

Ah, e não se esqueça de ler o Código de Conduta, se ainda não o fez. Ele pode ser encontrado em: https://github.com/rladies/starter-kit/wiki/Code-of-Conduct#portuguese.

Venha participar!

title: ტურიზმის მონაცემების ვიზუალიზაცია ggplot2 და shiny გამოყენებით
description:
შეხვედრის ფარგლებში განხილული იქნება ggplot2, shiny და plotly::ggploty პაკეტები.

ტურიზმის ეროვნული ადმინისტრაციის მონაცემების მაგალითზე ნაჩვენები იქნება ggplot2 პაკეტით შექმნილი დიაგრამების გამოყენებით ინტერაქტიული ვიზუალიზაციისა და აპლიკაციის შექმნის ნაბიჯები. დეტალურად იქნება განხილული მონაცემების მომზადება, ggplot2 პაკეტით დიაგრამის შექმნა და მისი გამოყენება shiny-ისა და plotly::ggploty პაკეტებში.

სპიკერი: თემურ გუგუშვილი
დოქტორობის კანდიდატი, სოციოლოგიის პროგრამა, თბილისი სახელმწიფო უნივერსიტეტი;
კვლევისა და სერვისების დეპარტამენტის უფროსი, დანაშაულის პრევენციისა და პრობაციის ეროვნული სააგენტო;
თემური აქტიურად იყენებს R-ს მონაცემთა ანალიზისა და ვიზუალიზაციისთვის.

მონაცემთა წყარო:
https://gnta.ge/statistics/
https://temurgugushvili.shinyapps.io/tourism_data/

title: Carrots are good for vision, models are good for visualising discrete data
description:
Join us and the SSA NSW branch for this talk by Dr Gordana Popovic (UNSW). You can come to University of Sydney in person (location: F10A.01.024.Law Annex Lecture Theatre 024). Or join via zoom.

Data sometimes have artefacts which obscure the patterns we are interested in visualising. You may have come across this when trying to interpret a residual plot from a logistic regression. For discrete data, these are not really artefacts, they are properties of the distribution of the data, like mean-variance relationships and lots of zeros. Generalised linear models and their extensions model the distribution of the data, including these properties, and so are a good way to remove them, to better see the patterns we are actually interested in. I will talk though some concepts and lots of examples of how we can use models to get the best out of our visualisations of discrete multivariate data in R.

Biography
Gordana is a statistical consultant and research fellow at UNSW Sydney, with research interests in modelling and visualising multivariate discrete data in ecology. In her spare time, Gordana can be found hiking or ocean swimming (poorly but enthusiastically).

title: Être un·e utilisateur·rice de R résilient·e, by Maëlle Salmon
description:
Bonjour à tou·te·s !

A l'occasion de ce 1er meetup RLadies de 2021, nous avons la chance de recevoir Maëlle Salmon qui nous présentera : " Être un·e utilisateur·rice de R résilient·e "

Résumé :

Apprendre R est une excellente idée pour réaliser différentes tâches au travail. Cependant, même une fois passé·e au-delà de “Bonjour Monde”, vous continuerez régulièrement à avoir des problèmes dans R… Triste constat ? Non, car vous apprendrez aussi à devenir un·e utilisateur·rice de R résilient·e !
Dans cette présentation je partagerai des astuces à cet effet : comment suivre les nouveautés de R sans se sentir submergé·e ; et comment et où demander de l’aide efficacement. J’espère que chacun·e repartira avec quelques clés de plus pour une utilisation joyeuse de R !

L'oratrice :

Maëlle Salmon est actuellement Research Software Engineer chez rOpenSci. Mais ce n'est pas tout ! Maëlle est également très impliquée dans la communauté R puisqu'elle travaille sur beaucoup d'autres projets en tant que developpeuse et/ou formatrice en R. Pour ne citer qu'eux : elle a notamment contribué à la création du livre "HTTP testing in R", est à l'origine du blog R-hub et assure la gestion du compte twitter R-Ladies Global. Nous sommes donc ravi·e·s de l'avoir parmi nous pour ce premier meet up de l'année 2021.

title: Introduction to Tidyverse - Part 2
description:
