title: Dazzling HTML Reports
description:
Use R to combine documentation, analysis, and presentation into one highly efficient reporting mechanism! You'll never want to go back to the old ways of doing things once you see how simple it is to set up a reporting template. Lindsey D. will provide some essential packages, tips, and tricks based on her experience in this space.

You can find the materials for the talk here: https://github.com/iamaspacecoyote/rladies_dazzling_reports

title: 2021 Datathon Kickoff: Exploring Judicial Patterns
description:
Join us for a 6-week datathon focused on exploring judicial patterns in Philadelphia courts! We have partnered with the Judge Accountability Table (JAT; https://judgeaccountabilitytable.org/about/) to help them explore, stratify, and visualize a complex dataset related to public court dockets for defendants in Philadelphia County, Pennsylvania. We will be working on a deidentified subset of these data in order to:

- better understand the judicial system through data
- hone our data science and R skills (there will be ways to contribute for people of all levels of experience with R)
- get our hands dirty and our heads spinning with rich and messy real-world data (spoiler alert: we will not be analyzing sepal.length and petal.width)
- work together, network, and make (new) friends in the data world!
- have fun nerding out together over data :)

The repository for the datathon can be found here:
https://github.com/rladiesPHL/2021_datathon

Approximate Agenda:

6:10 - 6:55: Introduction to R-Ladies Philly and our datathons; JAT presentation to contextualize the problem and the research needs; Q&A with JAT
6:55 - 7:00 Break
7:00 - 7:20 Logistics & Data Overview
7:20 - 8:00 Breakout into rooms, work kickoff

How to prepare:

- make sure you have Zoom version 5.3 or higher (required for breakout rooms!)
- install R & Rstudio (https://rstudio-education.github.io/hopr/starting.html)
- set up a GitHub account (https://github.com/join) and familiarize yourself with Git concepts (https://happygitwithr.com/index.html)
- join the R-Ladies Philly slack (https://bit.ly/join-rladies-slack-2020) and then join the #2021_datathon channel

See you there!

title: {Part 3: Wrangling} From Zero to (s)Hero: Multi-part intro to R
description:
Just getting involved with R or want to level up your skills? Have you used base-R but are still trying to wrap your head around the tidyverse "pipe" (%>%)? Have a messy dataset and don't know where to start? Seen beautiful visualizations on Twitter and want to make your own?

If you’ve answered ‘yes’ to at least one of these questions, fear no more! In this monthly workshop series, we will walk you through the fundamental uses of tidyverse and ggplot at your own pace with the help of hands-on exercises. Tidyverse and ggplot are a classic combination of R packages that allow you to "wrangle" your unwieldy data into whatever shape you need and creative beautiful and informative visualizations.

Over the course of this series, you will learn the most useful features of R Studio and R Markdown, how to read in and explore data, and transform it into a shape that's easy to work with. You will be able to create new columns and summary tables, subset interesting rows or columns, and combine and reshape dataframes. We will also dive into ggplot, one of the best tools for creating great-looking bar charts, scatterplots, and more!

This is (currently) a five-part series, aimed at total beginners and/or people with some experience in base-R or tidyverse who are looking to freshen up or expand their skills. Feel free to join at any point, we will briefly review the previous topic at the beginning of each session.

January 20th {Part 1}: The R & R-Studio ABCs (packages, files, data types & basic data exploration)
February 17th {Part 2}: Tidy data & introduction to data wrangling (tibbles, renaming, reordering, subsetting)
March 17th {Part 3}: Data wrangling with dplyr (new columns, if-else statements, summary tables, joining dataframes)
April 21st {Part 4}: Introduction to visualizations with ggplot (line graphs, bar charts, scatterplots, histograms, and more!)
May 19th {Part 5}: Advanced topics in wrangling and ggplot (pivoting, ggplot style options, etc.)

Please install R and R-Studio before joining: https://rstudio-education.github.io/hopr/starting.html

Image by the amazing @allison_horst: https://github.com/allisonhorst/stats-illustrations

title: Cómo hacer mapas con Highcharter
description:
En esta sesión de R Ladies, hablaremos sobre como realizar de forma simple y rápida mapas geográficos con la librería de visualización Highcharter y con el wrapper de Hgchmagic.

Prerrequisitos: Instalar R, Rstudio y tener descargados: devtools, Tidyverse y Highcharter.

Formulario de inscripción para enviar link de zoom: https://docs.google.com/forms/d/15ND1T_rBzLP1MqR-nanqoN0kiat5XXFZ_5VJzN1EkMg/viewform?edit_requested=true

title: Undergraduate Research with Graduate Topics & Experimental Design with Tidyverse
description:
# Schedule
Tuesday, March 16, 6:30-8:00 pm (Pacific)
6:30 - Welcome and Networking
6:55 - Announcements
7:00 - Undergraduate Research with Graduate Level Topics
7:25 - Q&A
7:30 - Modernizing Design of Experiment Output with Tidyverse
7:55 - Q&A
8:00 - Meeting Adjourned

# Undergraduate Research with Graduate Level Topics
Speaker: Jessica Jaynes, PhD
Assistant Professor of Statistics, Department of Mathematics, CSU Fullerton

Bio: Dr. Jessica Jaynes is an Assistant Professor of Statistics in the Department of Mathematics at California State University, Fullerton. She received her Ph.D. in Statistics from the University of California, Los Angeles. Her area of expertise includes design of experiments, statistical methods and applications, survey methods, and discrete choice experiments. Her recent projects include the development of a new class of experimental designs that provide higher efficiency, more in-depth analyses, and require a shorter time to run. This research has led to multiple interdisciplinary funded projects.

Abstract: As science and technology progress, this often calls for innovation in methodological and theoretical development of statistical experimental design, an essential aspect for research in any discipline. This research concentrates on the close connection between statistics and medicine, and the development of novel experiments to maximize efficiency, while minimizing time and costs. The focus of this talk will be on an application of an undergraduate research project using a novel experimental design known as an Orthogonal Array Composite Design (OACD) with applications to KB oral cancer. In particular, this talk will highlight the methods and applications that undergraduate students contributed to. Furthermore, various takeaways will be presented in terms of tips, challenges, and benefits in working with undergraduate students. sources.

# Modernizing Design of Experiment Output with Tidyverse
Speaker: Jose Toledo
Graduate Student, Statistics Dept, CSU Fullerton

Bio: Jose is currently in his last semester in the Master’s in statistics program at California State University, Fullerton (CSUF), where he is also a teaching associate. Additionally, he is a part-time data analyst at Southern California Coast Water Project. His research interest is in the field of Design of Experiments, where he has worked on projects such as drug combination treatments for KB oral cancer and recently in tuberculosis. During his summer breaks he enjoys mentoring undergraduate students in local community colleges and providing them research opportunities early in their education.

Abstract: Most Design of Experiment (DoE) experts will agree that using FrF2 is the most comprehensive R package for generating two-level factorial designs as well as Plackett-Burman type screening designs. Similarly, for sequential optimization with first order and second order response surface models, that offer optimization approaches like steepest ascent and visualization of the response function for linear model objects, the package rsm is highly recommended. However, their graphical outputs are limited and can benefit from the current “trends” in R such as implementing graphics using ggplot2. This talk will focus on the development of an R package, ggDoE, which focuses on the visualization of DoE using ggplot2. Examples will be taken from a TB drug combination experiment and demonstrate the output of commonly used methods in DoE. These methods include but are not limited to: factorial effect plots, half-normal plots, Lenth’s method, fitting second-order models and their corresponding contour plots.

# Meeting Materials
All meeting materials will be sent to registered attendees after the event.

title: Writing Presentations in R
description:
Come learn how to make beautiful slides with {xaringan} and deploy them! Silvia Canelón and Katie Jolly will be presenting.

If you're new to R-Ladies Seattle, please review the R-Ladies code of conduct:

The leadership, mentoring & teaching roles within this Community are held exclusively by minority genders (majority gender speakers may be allowed/invited as one-off guests in exceptional circumstances at the leadership team's discretion). Due to unexpected demand, we have opened learning participation to all genders, dependent on initial and on-going vetting by the leadership team. However, the stated priority of the R-Ladies communities is the development & support specifically of those identifying as a minority gender, and we, therefore, reserve the right to guard this interest through whatever measures the leadership team deem appropriate. Anyone involved with R-Ladies Seattle is expected to fully respect each other, the mandate of this community, and the goodwill on which R-Ladies is founded, or face expulsion/a penalty of any form, at the discretion of the leadership team. Full community guidelines are found here: https://github.com/rladies/starter-kit/wiki ...

title: Data Storytelling with Amber Thomas
description:
For the March 16th edition of our R-Ladies Dallas webinar series, we are excited to welcome Amber Thomas as our guest speaker. Amber will introduce the topic of data storytelling.

~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
Session title: Telling Data Stories at The Pudding
~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~

Abstract: At The Pudding, we create data-driven, visual essays. But how do we go from a basic idea all the way to a finished, interactive experience? In this talk, I'll cover where our ideas come from, how we choose which ones to pursue, and our entire process from idea to completion.

Bio: Amber is a Senior Journalist Engineer at The Pudding, where her work focuses primarily on communicating complex topics and ideas, designing and developing data visualizations for the web, and improving the accessibility of information for a general audience. Before starting at The Pudding in 2017, Amber was a marine biologist and a research scientist.

Twitter: twitter.com/ProQuesAsker

Website: amber.rbind.io

*************************************************************************

You are encouraged to click the link below to keep up with the group project and to join the Slack community. Slack is a messaging platform where we will share open job opportunities, free or low-cost online training materials, and R-Ladies group projects that will help you practice your R programming skills and develop a portfolio that could be used to showcase your skills to hiring managers.

Slack sign-up: https://docs.google.com/forms/d/e/1FAIpQLSdJhvSg-YrNYOrmju1yrXvYhFM7xMey1WpDq1NSGIp6x41VaA/viewform

*************************************************************************

We expect all attendees to abide & be governed by our community code of conduct. Please take a moment to review our R-Ladies Global code of conduct (particularly if this is your first time attending!): https://github.com/rladies/starter-kit/wiki/Code-of-Conduct.

title: Taller: analiza datos espaciales con raster
description:
¡Quinto taller online de R-Ladies Madrid!

¡En marzo nos vamos de viaje espacial con Stephanie Orellana! Hemos aprendido los básicos de R, cómo manejar y visualizar datos, y cómo reportar con RMarkdown. Pero vamos en este taller vamos a introducirnos en una especialización: manejar datos de tipo espacial. ¿Qué tienen de particular y cómo analizarlos?

Los requisitos de este taller son tener instaladas las siguientes librerías: {sf}, {raster}, {tidyverse}, {mapview}

Índice de contenidos: introducción al análisis de datos espaciales
- Vectores / Rasters
- Proyección
- Resolución y extensión

- Datos espaciales con R
- Importar vectores y rasters
- Consultar y cambiar proyección
- Cortes y Máscaras
- Visualización

- Ejemplos prácticos

STEPHANIE ORELLANA
Stephanie es Ingeniera Agrónoma y Magíster en Recursos Naturales con mención en Cambio Global. Trabaja como científica de datos enfocada en datos espaciales y recursos naturales. Le gustan los mapas, la visualización de datos, la programación y enseñar. Es parte de RLadies Santiago y es instructora de tidyverse certificada por RStudio.

GitHub: https://github.com/sporella
Twitter: https://twitter.com/sporella

Estad atentas el día del meetup a los comentarios de esta página, donde pondremos el enlace al evento.

title: Modelo de Predicción de Pase de Pedido en consultoras de belleza
description:
¡Primer meetup del 2021! y estamos muy emocionadas :D de contar con una súper R Lady.

Nuestra expositora será Karin Rodríguez, Senior Data Scientist en Belcorp, empresa del rubro de venta directa. Karin es egresada de Ingeniería Estadística de la Universidad Nacional de Ingeniería y viene realizando un MBA(c) en la Universidad del Pacífico.

• Lo que haremos:
Karin nos enseñará como abordar un problema de ciencia de datos, el proyecto que nos mostrará busca predecir al conjunto de consultoras que no pasarán pedido en una determinada campaña, esto con el objetivo de accionar con el equipo de ventas las campañas focalizadas que ayuden a incrementar los ingresos por cada campaña.

• Requisitos:
Asegúrate de tener instalado Zoom.

***IMPORTANTE***
Para participar, dale "Asistiré" en este evento.
Por razones de seguridad no compartiremos el link para ingresar a Zoom de manera pública. Estaremos enviando un correo con el link de zoom.

• Pregunta frecuente:
P: ¿Los chicos son bienvenidos a las reuniones de R-Ladies Lima?
R: Sí, los chicos son bienvenidos a cualquiera de nuestros eventos. Puedes revisar nuestro código de conducta global aquí: https://github.com/rladies/starter-kit/wiki/Code-of-Conduct

title: Introducción a Tidymodels
description:
Si tienes un manejo básico de R y tidyverse, y quieres comenzar a generar modelos predictivos de regresión o clasificación, este taller es para ti. Veremos las funciones principales del paquete tidymodels y desarrollaremos un modelo lineal de regresión. Esta primera sesión estará a cargo de Sara Acevedo (https://twitter.com/saryace), estudiante de Doctorado en Ciencias de la Ingeniería.

- REQUERIMIENTOS
Antes del taller es necesario que instales los paquetes {tidyverse} y {tidymodels}, junto con sus dependencias:
> install.packages(c("tidyverse", "tidymodels")), dependencies = TRUE)
Asimismo, es necesario tener los paquetes {remotes} y {ggsignif}, junto con sus dependencias:
> install.packages(c("remotes", "ggsignif")), dependencies = TRUE)
Además, debes instalar desde GitHub los paquete {datos} y {corrr} (ojo que tienes que tener instalado el paquete {remotes} para que funcionen las siguientes líneas de código):
> remotes::install_github("cienciadedatos/datos")
> remotes::install_github("tidymodels/corrr")

- CÓDIGO DE CONDUCTA
Queremos que este sea un espacio de aprendizaje amable y seguro. Al inscribirte en este evento estás aceptando nuestro código de conducta: https://github.com/rladies/starter-kit/wiki/Code-of-Conduct#spanish

¡Te esperamos!

title: Introduction to Data in Base R (Zoom Password: 798832)
description:
Hello all!

This will be the first, more formal, session of the R Ladies Glasgow chapter, so we decided that it should be something relatively basic.

For this session, we will be looking at a quick introduction to data management using Base R. We will look at basic ideas around data structure, before moving into plotting different types of data.

Though there are a lot of different ways to go about looking at these areas, we felt like base R would be a good introduction for our members who has slightly less experience using R.

The session material will be sent around in advance to the session so make sure you're signed up!

Hope to see you all there.

title: Manipulating text in R: effective use of Regular Expressions (regex)
description:
String manipulation is a key tool in data wrangling and yet one that is not often discussed or mentioned. Regular expressions or regex allow us to create patterns that help us find or modify strings/text. Don't you think that such a tool is very valuable?!! Do you want to learn how to use regex effectively in R?

In this meet-up Barbara Vreede and Tessa Pronk will be introducing us to the use of regular expressions in R and organizing some nice activities where we can practice!

The program will look like this:

19:30 - Welcome and introduction to regex
20:00 - Breakout rooms 1: crossword
20:10 - Discussion of crossword, solution and lessons
20:20 - Breakout rooms 2: webscrapping
20:40 - results and lessons
20:50 - Closing remarks

REQUIREMENTS:

- Basic knowledge in R is assumed.
- Preferentially having R and RStudio installed and ready to use so you can follow along with the activities.

ABOUT THE PRESENTERS:

- Barbara Vreede: https://www.linkedin.com/in/barbara-vreede-69986a1b/?originalSubdomain=nl

- Tessa Pronk: https://www.kwrwater.nl/experts-expertises/experts/tessa-pronk/

title: Club de lectura: Advanced R, "Subsetting" (capítulo 4)
description:

Como iniciativa de los diversos capítulos que se encuentra en México, se organiza cada 15 días una sesión en línea donde se dialoga el contenido presentado en el libro "Advance R" esto con la finalidad de aprender y compartir conocimiento.

¡Lxs esperamos!

title: Les réseaux bayésiens pour la modélisation des toxicités aiguës
description:
Les réseaux bayésiens pour la modélisation des toxicités aiguës dans le cadre du traitement par radiothérapie du cancer du sein.

Ces dernières décennies, l'augmentation considérable du volume de données médicales a fait naître, chez les structures hospitalières, le besoin de s'inscrire dans une démarche Big Data, afin de stocker leurs données mais également d'intégrer leur exploitation au sein des différents projets de recherches qu'elles supportent. À ce titre, la Data Science a fait son entrée dans le monde médical par l'intermédiaire d'algorithmes de Machine Learning et de Deep Learning ainsi que des méthodes d'analyse statistique. Un réseau bayésien est un modèle probabiliste utilisé pour représenter les relations de dépendance conditionnelle (et dans certains cas de causalité) entre différentes variables. Souvent oubliée par la communauté scientifique lors de l'analyse de données, cette méthode présente pourtant de nombreux avantages qui peuvent se révéler être des atouts de taille pour l'analyse de données médicales

title: [ONLINE] #tidytuesday Work Group
description:
Join fellow R-Ladies in exploring a #tidytuesday data set! For those craving human connection and some practice flexing your data science skills, this is the event for you! We will hold our event via Zoom, where you can meet other R-ladies, improve your R skills, and build your data science portfolio. This event is for people at all levels of R (beginner through advanced).

The dataset we will explore will be posted before we meet.

Agenda:
7:00 - 7:15 pm Meet & Greet
7:15 - 8:30 pm #tidytuesday
8:30 - 9:00 pm Discussion

What is #tidytuesday?
#TidyTuesday is a weekly social data project created by the R4DS online learning community that is focused on using tidyverse packages. A new data set and accompanying article featuring an interesting plot is released on Github every Monday. The goal is to generate a copy of the original plot or create your own original approach!

For more information on #tidytuesday, check out this blog post: https://bit.ly/2HqEsdt

For this week, we will be looking at data related to the Bechdel Test. See https://github.com/rfordatascience/tidytuesday/blob/master/data/2021/2021-03-09/readme.md

Who is this for?
New and experienced R users alike! Let's learn together! All are welcome, including R-Ladies RTP members and R-Ladies from around the world.

What should I bring?
You'll need a computer with videoconferencing capabilities and R. Serve yourself a cozy beverage and a snack to fuel your evening!

Where will it take place?
**Please join us online via Zoom.** A link to join will be provided when you RSVP.

All events are intended for women as leaders, mentors, members, and attendees. We are emphatically queer and trans friendly. Men are welcomed to attend *as guests* and must be accompanied by the R-Lady who invited them. This group was created so those who identify as women have a comfortable place to learn. If you would like to attend and feel excluded, please introduce yourself to an organizer.

title: SELF LEADERSHIP: PER ESSERE UN VERO LEADER PRIMA BISOGNA CONOSCERSI [Workshop]
description:
Eccoci con il nuovo meetup #RLadiesItaly!

Il nuovo evento sarà con Nancy Cooklin. A partire da una lunga e approfondita esperienza di lavoro a stretto contatto con le persone, in piccoli e grandi gruppi e organizzazioni, e dalle diverse culture e generazioni, Nancy Cooklin, coach, counselor e formatrice, ha creato un modello chiamato “Human Leadership”.

In questo momento più che mai l’aspetto “Human” è diventato centrale sia nella vita professionale che in quella personale. La chiave sta nell'essere focalizzati e forti emotivamente. In questo modello ci sono 4 aree tra le quali Nancy ci guiderà: consapevolezza, creatività, coraggio e pensiero sistemico.
Avere chiarezza su chi siamo e cosa ci guida accresce la nostra autostima e ci permette di relazionarci in modo autentico e coerente con chi siamo e cosa vogliamo.

Dopo questo workshop:

- Ti sentirai più allineata o concentrata così da saper prendere decisioni più facilmente.
- Prederai consapevolezza delle leve che ti portano ad agire
- Capirai come funziona il meccanismo del cambiamento e perché a volte cambiare è più difficile che non cambiare
- Riconoscerai l’importanza della tua storia per andare verso il futuro più libera di fare le tue scelte
- Saprai comunicare con gli altri in modo efficace
- Capirai l’importanza dell’autenticità nel mondo di oggi, sia a livello personale che professionale

Le persone ti scelgono per quello che sei, non per quello che fai!

Ci vediamo presto!

title: Plotting vaccination intention: An intro to data viz in R with ggplot2
description:
Please join R-Ladies St. Louis in welcoming Zoey Dlott (left) and Megan Richard (right) for an introduction to creating data visualizations with ggplot2. Zoey and Megan will demonstrate the basics of ggplot2 using some very timely survey data measuring intention to get the covid vaccine.

Zoey is an advanced standing MSW student at Washington University, is interested in healthcare accessibility and in her free time enjoys baking and exploring coffee shops. Megan is a first year MPH student at Washington University who is passionate about the environment and sweet tea.

More details forthcoming closer to the event date.

title: An introduction to R Markdown
description:
TOPIC
Our speaker for this event will be Thea Knowles (https://theaknowles.com). She is currently an assistant professor in the Department of Communicative Disorders & Sciences at the University at Buffalo.

In this talk, she will introduce RMarkdown, a powerful set of tools to combine code and writing. This hands-on tutorial will walk through the process of using RMarkdown to share results with others, some tricks & tips, and common roadblocks and how to overcome them. She will also briefly show other ways to scale up your use of RMarkdown, for example to write journal articles, dissertations/books, and websites.

PREPARATION
1. ​​Have R and RStudio installed

In the console, install the "tidyverse" package if you don't already have it by entering: install.packages("tidyverse"). The "rmarkdown" and "knitr" packages are automatically included in RStudio downloads, so no need to install anything else.

2. Consider updating RStudio

If you haven't updated RStudio in a few months you may wish to do so, since new integrations have made using RMarkdown even better.

​If you have an older version installed that's okay too - you'll still be able to follow along.

If you're not sure, or are nervous about updating, you can also use RStudio cloud (https://rstudio.cloud/projects)!

3. Download the materials we'll be using:

https://drive.google.com/file/d/1XGtZdakWU7_2gN5NAgCE0RjqvyTszdco/view?usp=sharing

​Note: we will be using simulated data from Politzer-Ahles & Piccinini 2018​

ONLINE PROGRAMME
The event will be held online and will start at 16:00 (UK time). You can use the following link to join the session: https://zoom.us/j/97481982744?pwd=NnRFYlhKY283R2lpN1pJRGpUZk1Hdz09

CODE OF CONDUCT
Please take a minute to read our code of conduct -- we are committed to creating a safe and harassment-free environment
https://github.com/rladies/starter-kit/wiki/Code-of-Conduct

R-Ladies events are always free and open to anyone who wants to participate as long as they follow the code of conduct. We are pro-actively inclusive of queer, trans, and all minority identities, with additional sensitivity to intersectional identities. Our priority is to provide a safe community space for anyone identifying as a minority gender who is interested in and/or working with R.

title: R-Ladies Baltimore -- An intro to tidymodels for tidy machine learning (Virtual)
description:
R-Ladies Baltimore (Bmore) is the local Baltimore chapter for the larger R-Ladies global organization (rladies.org) to promote gender diversity in the R community.

The next event is Tuesday March 9, 2021 from 3-4:30pm (virtual meetup on Zoom). We will have an exciting presentation from Rebecca Barter (http://www.rebeccabarter.com) currently a Postdoctoral Fellow at UC Berkeley! She will give an introduction to tidymodels (https://www.tidymodels.org) for tidy machine learning! This is an incredibly cool topic and the tidymodels package is a very powerful tool to build and implement machine learning algorithms in R in a tidy way.

WHO is this for?
- If you are new to R & want to learn about an incredibly powerful package!
- If you know about machine learning, and want to learn how to do it in R in a tidy way!
- If you know about tidy data, and want to know about machine learning in R!

*If any/all of this is true, this event might be for you!*

AGENDA
3:00–3:15pm Who we are | Announcements | What's next
3:15–4pm Presentation: An introduction to tidymodels for tidy machine learning
4–4:30pm Networking -- Any more Qs?

Details on the location:
The Zoom information will be sent to those who RSVP the week before the event.

FAQ:
Q: Are men welcome to attend R-Ladies events?
A: Yes, men are welcome at this event. Our mission is to encourage more women and non-binary individuals to get involved in the R community. However, we ask that cis men come as guests of women and gender minorities to our events to promote a sense support and encouragement for women and gender minorities in the R community. Please help us by spreading the word about R-Ladies. Please also take the time to review our code of conduct before you attend: https://github.com/rladies/starter-kit/wiki/Code-of-Conduct

The term "women and gender minorities" is inclusive of individuals who identify as female (trans and cis), trans-men, non-binary, genderqueer, genderfluid, agender, intersex, and all minority genders).

Important to know:
- If this is your first R-Ladies event, please take a moment to review our R-Ladies Global code of conduct: https://github.com/rladies/starter-kit/wiki/Code-of-Conduct

Finally, for more information:

title: cReating visualizations and a book!
description:
What is the story of your data? Communicating what you see in your data is a real challenge for many. Do you expect the audience to understand your approach? Truly, effective vizualisation seems to require a new perspective, perhaps even a secret recipe. :)

Come listen to Shirley Wu and Nadieh Bremer shed light on their collaborative efforts to present data, at the same time allowing for creative expression and thoughtful design. They show that visualization can be both useful, inspirational and engagingly beautiful.

During the talk Shirley and Nadieh´s will present their first book together, “Data Sketches”. https://www.datasketch.es The book reflects their journey from concept to messy data to polished final visualization, including the tools and techniques they used.

Do you know how to tell the story of your data? Let´s celebrate Shirley and Nadieh´s story on March 8th, International Women´s Day. A day to be inspired.

title: International Women's Day Celebration: Data science for social equality
description:
Abstract: Our society remains profoundly unequal. This talk presents vignettes about how data science can be used to combat inequality, focusing on public health and healthcare as application areas.

Bio: Emma Pierson is a senior researcher at Microsoft Research and an incoming assistant professor of computer science at Cornell Tech. She develops data science and machine learning methods to study inequality and healthcare. Her work has been recognized by a Rhodes Scholarship, Hertz Fellowship, Rising Star in EECS, and Forbes 30 Under 30 in Science. She has written for The New York Times, FiveThirtyEight, The Atlantic, The Washington Post, Wired, and various other publications.

title: R Intermediário
description:
Heey, tudo bem?

Estamos muito felizes com a sua participação.

Aproveite o curso. Aproveite essa oportunidade! Este evento foi pensado com muito carinho para você.

O que você vai aprender?

Em construção.

Quais pacotes vão ser utilizados ?

Em construção.

Sobre o Projeto Enigma

O projeto Enigma busca tornar visível o papel feminino na área da computação, resgatando as contribuições significativas de algumas mulheres de uma forma diferenciada, que provoque o pensamento do fruidor. Não pretende-se reproduzir as visibilidades que estas personagens já têm, mas fazer uma provocação, desacomodando o pensamento para que as invisibilidades, que ainda persistem, se tornem visíveis. As doações serão voltadas a reforma de artigos doados ao projeto como computadores, teclados e entre outros objetos do universo computacional.

Para saber mais sobre este projeto lindo acesse https://www.ufrgs.br/enigma/

E aí? Topa?

Link de inscrição: https://www.sympla.com.br/introducao-ao-r__1136808

Dúvidas frequentes:

CERTIFICADOS! - O certificado de 4h do evento será enviado para o seu e-mail. Caso você não receba ao final do evento, escreva para goiania@rladies.org.

MATERIAIS! - Os materiais utilizados no nosso curso (apresentação, scripts) serão disponibilizados através do nosso GitHub .

Dicas importantes para melhor aproveitamento do evento

(1°) Procure conectar o seu computador no cabo de rede, evitando instabilidades na transmissão;
(2°) Pré-configure a sua câmera e microfone antes de entrar no evento pois será útil para as interações com a professora em caso de dúvidas!
(3°) Prepare seu ambiente, aquela caneca de café, garrafa de água e os fones de ouvido, melhores companheiros para se concentrar e mergulhar de cabeça nessa experiência!
(4°) Não guarde esse conhecimento apenas para você, compartilhe com seus amigos e redes sociais marcando a gente no instagram @rladiesgyn.

Você faz parte desse compromisso

Lembre-se que o Código de Conduta também se estende à versão online de nossos eventos e não será tolerada qualquer forma de assédios ou intimidações de qualquer participante, seja audiência, palestrantes, colaboradores, ou quaisquer membros da comunidade.

A gente brilha TOGETHER!

title: Connecting Bioconductor to other bioinformatics tools using Rcwl
description:
We are delighted to get back to the R4Bioinfo series that we've launched in September 2020. We will be organizing a new workshop about connecting Bioconductor to other bioinformatics tools using Rcwl: Application in sc-RNAseqdata.

Date/Time: Saturday, March 5, 2021 from 5:30 PM to 7:45 PM (GMT+1)
Place: Zoom https://zoom.us/download

▶️ Invited trainer: Dr. Qian Liu
▶️ About Dr. Qian Liu:
Dr. Qian Liu joined the Department of Biostatistics & Bioinformatics faculty at Roswell Park Comprehensive Cancer Center as an Assistant Professor of Oncology in October 2019. Prior to that, she was a post-doc affiliate supervised by Dr. Martin Morgan, in the Bioconductor Core Team. She has earned her PhD in Biostatistics, Master in Biostistics, and Biochemistry & Molecular Biology, and BA in BioEngineering. Dr. Liu is currently a CTSI scholar funded by the Buffalo Translational Consortium (BTC) Scholar Program.

The workshop (https://liubuntu.github.io/Bioc2020RCWL/) will use real scRNA-seq data to demonstrate the usage of Rcwl and RcwlPipelines in doing the pre-processing and touch some downstream statistical analysis of scRNA-seq data.

In order to attend the event, please fill out this form 👉 https://tinyurl.com/y8ymbk3j

We will send you the Zoom link and the enter passcode a few hours before the training session. Please check out your email later.

Don't forget to add the meetup to your calendar so that you get a reminder about it.

We look forward to welcoming you!

title: Conoce DATA MEXICO
description:
El equipo de la plataforma datamexico.org nos acompañará para explicarnos cómo podemos utilizar la plataforma para nuestros proyectos e iniciativas.
Acompáñanos y conoce acerca del Desafío Data México 2021: datos con perspectiva de género y cómo puedes participar.
Las participantes de la edición anterior del desafío nos acompañarán para relatar su experiencia.

Nuestras ponentes:

Daniela Jiménez Lara
Jr. Data Scientist en la Oficina de Naciones Unidas contra la Droga y el Delito. Daniela estudió Ciencia Política y Relaciones Internacionales en el Centro de Investigación y Docencia Económicas. Participó en proyectos con contrapartes nacionales e internacionales en el Laboratorio Nacional de Políticas Públicas y actualmente trabaja en temas de justicia penal en UNODC. Su gusto por los datos ha crecido continuamente al enfrentarse con problemáticas sociales que pueden beneficiarse del análisis de datos y de una mejor estructura de su información.

Raquel Yunoen Badillo Salas es economista egresada del Centro de Investigación y Docencia Económicas y El Colegio de México. Actualmente trabaja en Banco de México, con líneas de investigación de economía laboral. Ella considera que la rigurosa evaluación y análisis de datos mejora la toma de decisiones para solucionar problemáticas sociales.

¡¡¡¡ LOS ESPERAMOS !!!!

title: {R-Ladies Toolbox Series} Part 3: Reproducibility
description:
R-Ladies Toolbox Series - Essentials for women and minority genders in academia, science and data analysis presents:

Reproducibility by Charles Grey (R-Ladies Remote)

Talk Abstract:
As scientists, it's desirable to demonstrate to others (including our future selves) that our computational scientific work validates the claims we make in published research. Being able to reproduce the work is a key component of easily validating an analysis, as well as extending the work. Reproducibility is not as simple, however, as sharing the code and data that produced our analysis. We must consider how our data and algorithms are understood, variables defined, etc. Our code needs to be accessible and interoperable. There is much guidance about best practice, but this is often overwhelming for those of us who are not from formal computer science training. In this talk I share the story of how I attempted good enough practice in my doctoral thesis, and found even this was simply too much to achieve. Indeed, despite failing to achieve good enough scientific practice in any aspect of reproducibility, I discovered a delightful world of scientific workflows in R that make every day just that bit easier now. Failing at reproducible science in R is the best we can aim for; we will never achieve best practice in every aspect of reproducibility, and if we failed, then we tried. Through this process we discover useful tools to make the next time easier.

BIO:
Charles T. Gray is a postdoc with the evidence synthesis lab at Newcastle University. She is currently specialising in Bayesian network meta-analysis in Cochrane intervention reviews. She has three degrees: arts, music, and mathematics. None of these prepared her for her interdisciplinary computational metascience doctoral thesis in R.

Calling all students, academics, and women in science! R-Ladies Freiburg presents a five-part guest series aimed at women and gender minorities in academia, science and data analysis, from first semester students to tenured researchers. Leading R-Ladies from around the world will lead us through the most fundamental steps to studying and working in academia, from analyzing results, to presenting them clearly, ensuring their reproducibility, and keeping track of all your changes. The series will close with a panel discussion from women around the world, who will speak about their experiences with science.

This series is funded by the “Pädagogische Hochschule Freiburg”, the University of Education in Freiburg.

Participants who take part in all five meetups can receive a certificate of participation.

Everyone is welcome to join and we hope for a warm exchange between students and researchers, as well as R-Ladies from the wider community.

description:
Welcome back to 2021. We will kick start our 2021 R-Ladies Canberra series with a joint meeting with SSA Canberra. Please register as per below to receive the Zoom link.

Time: 5:30pm – 6:00pm AEDT : Zoom meeting opens for pre-seminar mingling
6:00pm – 6:45pm AEDT : Presentation

RSVP: Please register in advance for this meeting at https://anu.zoom.us/meeting/register/tZErfu2ppjguG90C-xLADEVg1bvoYnEd_4WU. After registering, you will receive a confirmation email containing information about how to join the meeting. If you have any questions, please feel free to contact ssacanberra@gmail.com.

1. Enter your details here: https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1tQgomRy2VN7q-VD6oKVey2W-APzqRcs7qFB_o6JtqN4/edit?usp=sharing
2. Reply to this email (warren.muller@csiro.au) to confirm

Talk details
Speaker: Gordana Popovic, University of New South Wales

Topic: How to see the forest from the trees: Removing pesky artefacts from discrete data for better visualisation

Abstract: Data sometimes have artefacts which obscure the patterns we are interested in visualising. You may have come across this when trying to interpret a residual plot from a logistic regression. For discrete data, these are not really artefacts, they are properties of the distribution of the data, like mean-variance relationships and lots of zeros. Generalised linear models and their extensions model the distribution of the data, including these properties, and so are a good way to remove them, to better see the patterns we are actually interested in. I will talk though some concepts and lots of examples of how we can use models to get the best out of our visualisations of discrete multivariate data in R.

Biography: Gordana is a statistical consultant and research fellow at UNSW Sydney, with research interests in modelling and visualising multivariate discrete data in ecology. In her spare time, Gordana can be found hiking or ocean swimming (poorly but enthusiastically).

Website link: https://statsoc.org.au/event-4144562?CalendarViewType=1&SelectedDate=2/15/2021

title: "Creating gorgeous tables using the gt package" with Pavitra Chakravarty
description:
For the March 1st edition of our R-Ladies Dallas webinar series, we are excited to welcome our very own Pavitra Chakravarty as our guest speaker. Pavitra will introduce the gt package and show how you can easily create beautiful, presentation-ready tables with a few simple lines of code. As a bonus. we will kick off the event with an informative lightning talk about classification and regression trees given by Praveena Matthews!

~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
Lightning talk title: Classification and Regression Trees
~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~

Praveena Mathews teaches R for GraduateTutor.com. She is also the founder of R-Ladies Chennai.

~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
Session title: Using the `gt` package to create presentation-ready tables
~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~

Abstract: Tables are sometimes treated like the step-children of the Vizworld. An after-thought or as place-holders for numbers. For me, tables are the sexiest visualizations in the Viz world; a good table conveys more to me through its simplicity than the sometimes confusing array of colors, shapes and sizes of a plot.

Bio: I am a data engineer at Converging Health who is a also a bench-trained PhD scientist. I use enterprise tools in my day job; don’t hold that against me. Open source is where my heart is at.

Twitter: @genomixgmailcom

title: R Interface to Python via the reticulate package
description:
The reticulate package provides a comprehensive set of tools for interoperability between Python and R. The package includes facilities for:

- Calling Python from R in a variety of ways including R Markdown, sourcing Python scripts, importing Python modules, and using Python interactively within an R session.

- Translation between R and Python objects (for example, between R and Pandas data frames, or between R matrices and NumPy arrays).

- Flexible binding to different versions of Python including virtual environments and Conda environments.

More at - https://rstudio.github.io/reticulate/

This workshop will be a hands on exploration of the package in R!

Sobre o Projeto Enigma

O projeto Enigma busca tornar visível o papel feminino na área da computação, resgatando as contribuições significativas de algumas mulheres de uma forma diferenciada, que provoque o pensamento do fruidor. title: Integrating gene expression and DNA-binding data using R/Bioconductor
description:
We are delighted to get back to the R4Bioinfo series that we've launched in September 2020. We will be organizing a new workshop which will serve as an overview of the integrating gene expression and DNA-binding data using R/Bioconductor.

Date/Time : Saturday, February 27, 2021 from 2 PM to 4:15 PM (GMT+1)
Place : Zoom https://zoom.us/download

▶️ Invited trainer : Dr. Mahmoud Shaaban
▶️ About Dr. Mahmoud Shaaban :
Dr. Mahmoud Shaaban graduated from medical school, Cairo University, Egypt, in 2015. He received his master's and PhD from Gyeongsang National University, Korea, in 2021, where he studied the role of autophagy in development and disease. He used R/Bioconductor to analyze gene expression and transcription data from mice models. He wrote open-source R packages to distribute the data, methods, and code of my research

Description of the workshop :
Researchers use ChIP binding data to identify potential transcription factor binding sites. They use gene expression data from sequencing or microarrays to quantify the effect of the factor over-expression or knockdown on its targets. The integration of the binding and expression data therefore can be used to improve the understanding of a transcription factor function. In this workshop, I present a complete workflow for integrating the gene expression (microarray/RNA-seq) and DNA-binding data (ChIP-seq) to predict the combined function of two transcription factors using R/Bioconductor. The example we will be using in the workshop is from real datasets of two functionally and evolutionary related transcription factors YY1 and YY2 in HeLa cells. We will try to identify the factor-specific and the shared targets of the factors in this particular cell line. Then we will use a technique find out the aggregate functions of the factors on their individual (inducer or repressor) and common targets (cooperative or competitive).

More details about the workshop are provided through this link https://mahshaaban.github.io/IntegratingDataBioc/

In order to attend the event, please fill out this form 👉 https://tinyurl.com/y7kzasq7

He’s an evidence-based practitioner with an extensive background in Mathematics, Statistical Programming, Machine Learning and Artificial Intelligence. He’s passionate about open source knowledge.

title: Writing R functions (w/ RL-Chicago)
description:
Stephanie Kirmer will be giving a workshop about writing functions. We'll discuss when you need to write a function, how they're written, documenting and writing tests for your functions.

Speaker Info:
Stephanie Kirmer is a Senior Data Scientist at Saturn Cloud, a company making large scale Python easy and accessible to the data community using Dask. She has used R as well as Python for machine learning and data science throughout her career, including as a DS Tech Lead at a travel data startup, and as a Senior Data Scientist at Uptake, an industrial data science company. She holds Master's degrees in sociology and education and was formerly an adjunct faculty member at DePaul University in Chicago.
https://skirmer.github.io

======================================
Register to receive the event Zoom link
======================================
Spring 2021 RLEL/RLC event registration link:
https://forms.gle/ZLo6XEUVrz9eCLrQ8

========
AGENDA
========
Introduction
- from RL
- from Speaker, Stephanie Kirmer

Overview
- What we’re going to discuss today

Why Functions?
- What purpose do they serve?
- When do you need to use one?

Basic Structure
- Share an example and talk through the pieces

[* hands-on, beginner: take the example and run it, see what it does, and make sure you know why it does that
* hands-on, advanced: take a snippet of code you have used in the past that produces a result, and wrap it up to be a function without any input or return just yet.]

What Goes In
- How you shape inputs to functions, knowing what objects and types you want to accept
- Accepting lists of objects
* hands-on, beginner: take a new example, try passing in a single obj versus a list
* hands-on, advanced: add an input argument to your new function, decide what it should be, and see how it works.

What Comes Out
- What to return, what types and objects you can give back
- Giving back lists of objects

[* hands-on, beginner: change the example so it returns a list
* hands-on, advanced: decide what kind of result your function should return, and add this element]

Setting Guardrails
- Documentation
- Typing
- Testing inputs and returning errors
- Writing tests for your functions

[* hands-on, beginner: given an example function, write your own docstring
* hands-on, beginner: given an example function, write your own test
* hands-on, advanced: add a docstring to your function
* hands-on, advanced: add a chunk of code to your function to test an attribute of the input]

Combining Functions
- Multiple functions to get to the end result
Conclusions

More Info: https://nicercode.github.io/guides/functions/

=====
TIME
=====
https://www.timeanddate.com/worldclock/fixedtime.html?msg=RLC+%26+RLEL%3A+Writing+R+Functions&iso=20210226T13&p1=77&ah=2

title: Take a Sad Plot & Make It Better
description:
Alison Hill (I think her unofficial nickname is RMarkdown Whisperer) is going to talk to us on another of her strengths. Making things beautiful, and informative. She's going to do her "Take a Sad Plot & Make it Better" talk, for us. In this talk, Alison will discuss one plot’s life cycle, from a sad Powerpoint slide to the finished product made with the ggplot2 package in R, and what she learnt from it.

Alison doesn't need much introduction, she'll be the main search result if you're looking for RMarkdown info, xaringan inspiration, blogging and teaching online using R, among many other topics! Read about her here: https://alison.rbind.io/about/. If you're on Twitter, you'd learn a lot by following https://twitter.com/apreshill.

Aside: Also have a look at Hugo Apéro, for some inspiration on building a presence online (https://hugo-apero.netlify.app/).

title: Virtual Kickoff 2021

title: Club de lectura
description:
¡Primer club de lectura de RLadies Mx!

Nos entusiasma mucho crear este espacio de lectura, ¡esperamos verles!

El libro que leeremos será Advanced R de Hadley Wickham (https://adv-r.hadley.nz).

Este libro es ideal si te interesa saber porqué R funciona de la manera que funciona.

En cada sesión haremos énfasis en los puntos importantes del capítulo en turno, resolveremos algunos ejercicios de este, y entre todxs aclararemos dudas.

Las sesiones serán cada dos semanas, Jueves a las 6:30pm hora central de México.

En la siguiente sesión, el 25 de febrero, revisaremos el capítulo de vectores con Ana Betty!

title: Tidy Tuesday!
description:
Happy New Year everyone!

Join us on Thursday, 25th of February for our first event of 2021 where we will work together on a Tidy Tuesday dataset.

Tidy Tuesday (https://github.com/rfordatascience/tidytuesday) is a social weekly event where you can practice you data wrangling and visualisation skills using real-world data in a safe and supportive forum! Every Tuesday a new dataset is realised.

On the night, we will use the dataset released on Tuesday 23th, divide into groups, and work and learn together to produce interesting visualisations. This will be an opportunity to work on real-world data in a collaborative environment, as well as to practice sharing your code on GitHub and with the online Twitter community.

**Feel free to download and start working on the dataset prior to the event!**

The data for each week is available on the Tidy Tuesday website: https://github.com/rfordatascience/tidytuesday/tree/master/data/2021

Looking forward to data wrangling with you!

R-Ladies Melbourne

title: Putting the FUN in functions!
description:
Hi R-Ladies SB and beyond,

Use functions in R, but feeling like they don’t do exactly what you want? Come join us and learn how to write your own! For our next workshop “Putting the fun in FUNctions”, An Bui will be leading us through the construction of functions in R, going over the basics and moving into writing, laying the groundwork for you to write your own functions!

If you’d like to code along with us, please install R and RStudio (instructions are at the bottom of the page on our group’s README and linked here: https://docs.google.com/document/d/1KLYC_GcDLYeczSjJmZ5h4y525XILJbbL6r2-MxGCdtw/edit). Materials will be provided to you closer to the event date!

Hope to see you there!

R-Ladies SB Organizers (Sam, An, Juliette)

title: ggplot Basics
description:
Details
This workshop event will focus on the basics of data visualization using the ggplot R package. We will explore general ggplot syntax, common graph types, and editing graphs to improve visualization effectiveness. This event is intended for beginner R users who have not worked with ggplot before or would like to refresh their skills in the basics of ggplot syntax.

All events are intended for women as leaders, mentors, members, and attendees. We are emphatically queer and trans friendly. Men are welcomed to attend *as guests* and must be accompanied by the R-Lady who invited them (i.e., attend through the "guest" function on host's RSVP, not as a separate RSVP). This group was created so those who identify as women have a comfortable place to learn. If you would like to attend and feel excluded, please contact the event organizer.

Agenda:
• 7:00pm - 7:15pm - Introductions
• 7:15pm - 8:00pm - Guided workshop
• 7:30pm - 7:50pm - Test your skills with a new example
• 8:20m - 8:30pm - Wrap up

**Before you join**, please install the most recent version of R **as well as** RStudio on your computer before attending this meetup event. Here are links to free downloads for R (https://cran.r-project.org/) and RStudio (https://www.rstudio.com/products/rstudio/download/#download). Downloading and installing both of these programs before this meetup will help us keep to our schedule and make sure you learn the most you can while at the meetup event.

If you have trouble installing the software, please contact Sheila at sheila@rladies.org at least 48 hours **before the event** so we can find a time to meet and work through software installation issues.

What should I bring?
Please login to Zoom using a laptop or computer with the capabilities to run R **and** RStudio. See information above about how to install R **and** RStudio.

Where will it take place?
Please join us online via Zoom. A link to join will be provided when you RSVP.

title: A statistician´s story of learning and teaching with R and R Markdown
description:
We continue to learn from the best! In February, we will hear how R is used in everyday research and teaching activities by Mette Langaas, an enthusiastic R-Lady from Trondheim, Norway. The talk will take ca. 45 minutes, followed by ca. 15 minutes of discussion. If you've ever wanted to improve and automate your work, come hear this expert´s tips!

About Mette´s talk:
Every workday for 30 years the language S – and later R – has been a central part of my scientific life. I code, I analyse, I do research, I supervise, and I teach with the help of R. In the last years, R Markdown and Git have become important ingredients for reproducibility in my research, as well as for writing and distributing learning materials for open science. In this presentation, I will give examples of how I use R and R Markdown in my teaching and learning.

About the speaker:
Mette Langaas is a statistician at NTNU and NR, with (probably) above average interest in teaching and communicating statistics. Her field of research is biostatistics/genomics/medical statistics and her methodological focus is on statistical inference and learning.

https://www.ntnu.edu/employees/mette.langaas
https://www.nr.no/user-info?query=langaas

Twitter: @mettelang
Github: @mettelang

title: Code-RLadies February 2021 Lightning Talk & Workshop - Virtual!
description:
Join us via Zoom: (link will show to all who RSVP)
Our Lighting Talk: Graphing in 30 Days with Maggie

Our Workshop Focus: Deep Dive into Sweave for Publication with Ellen Fitzsimmons

======

What are Lightning talks? Lightning talks are quick, 5-minute mini-presentations that are showing the art of the possible. They increase awareness and excitement about possibilities. If you want to present a future Lightning Talk, contact us!

What are Workshops? Our workshops help Code-RLadies gather together, network, and learn from each other. Our workshops cover the bulk of the meeting. We believe in being hands-on! Are you interested in leading or participating in a workshop? Contact us!

title: Around the world in 30 minutes (Map Creation with R)
description:
Hello, R enthusiasts!!!

Would you like to explore and communicate the geographic distribution of your data? Let's do it with choropleths and alternative map creation in R !!!

Come join us in our upcoming meet-up "Around the world in 30 minutes"

> ? Speaker
Stephanie Kobakian
Queensland University of Technology and Monash University, Australia
Check out her work at: https://srk.netlify.app/

> ? Who is this for
This introduction is appropriate for anyone with a general interest in R and map creation.

> ? Prerequisites
Prior knowledge in R programming language is recommended but not necessary. Attendees are expected to have the most recent version of R and RStudio installed on their own computers, along with the following packages and their dependencies.

Here are links to free downloads for R (https://cran.r-project.org/) and RStudio (https://www.rstudio.com/products/rstudio/download/#download).

title: [2021 Feb] Voice of Data 如何為你手中的數據發聲
description:
[Code of Conduct]
基本上這是一個女性學習社群，因此若你不是女性，但出現在我們的實體聚會的話，你很可能被要求以下行為：
• 座位請優先保留給女生
• 必須對 R-Ladies Taipei 有貢獻，例如：提供高品質的 3分鐘技術閃電秀
• 發言的機會請優先留給女生
※ 2021 年起嚴格實施 !!!!!!!!!!!!! (因為我們缺講者...)

[因應疫情相關措施]
• 活動期間請全程戴口罩
• 視疫情狀況, 必要時將採實名制參加
※ 若無法配合將無法進入活動場地

[Agenda]
• 19:30 ~ 19:40 (10 mins) 入場
• 19:40 ~ 20:40 (60 mins) 主議程: Voice of Data @Sally
• 20:40 ~ 21:10 (30 mins) 與 Rladies 們聊聊天 -- 讓我們一起規劃未來的 Meetup
• 21:10 ~ 自由交流時間

[Talk Information]
• Voice of Data 如何為你手中的數據發聲
不管是數據分析師、工程師或科學家，在數據團隊建立或轉職初期，甚至是在安插在其他部門內的數據分析工作者，都將面臨來自四面八方的期待，期待你透過分析工具及模型來「點石成金」。但真實情況是你會面臨數據缺失、老闆非技術研究出身、上台報告時台下聽不懂、研究開發資源不到位、講了建議後執行團隊不理你等等情況。
這個演講將融匯 Sally 在美國及中國遇到文化衝擊的小故事及解決方案，希望帶給在職場上為數據發聲的工作者，能更有勇氣與影響力。

• 與 Rladies 們聊聊天 -- 讓我們一起規劃未來的 Meetup
2020 因為疫情我們休息了一整年, 2021 我們決定重出江湖
但我們想藉由久違付出的這次, 跟大家一起討論未來 Meetup 的方向和形式
希望有大家的參與可以讓舊朋友和新朋友們都可以更融入 R-Ladies Taipei

[Speaker Information]
• Sally
從百貨採購轉跳成數據分析師與科學家的 Sally，在數據職涯中歷經美國與中國企業文化，橫跨金融、醫藥、音樂娛樂與數位教育等產業，做過分析及建置數據產品開發團隊。
目前在台灣美商 Viewsonic 做數據科學家。

[Host Information]
• Kristen Chan： 活動主持人、聯絡講者
• Summit Suen：聯絡講者、活動場地
• Agie：活動場地
• Sylvia：活動場地

[地點] Dcard
地址: 臺北市大安區光復南路 102 號 14 樓
(在 Dcard 14F 辦公室 不要走錯!!!!)

[Event Tags]
#RladiesTaipei

venues.name: Dcard
venues.address: 華聲里 Guangfu S Rd, 102號

title: Analysis and visualizing population trends and spatial mapping.
description:
About the instructor: She is a global change ecologist pursuing her PhD from the University of Edinburgh. Her research includes determining what are the sources of the complex patterns of population and biodiversity change observed over time around the world. She is also the founder of Our coding club, an amazing online resource on data science for ecologists. She is also the recipient of the Anne Keymer Student Talk Prize (Overall winner 2020) – British Ecological Society Festival of Ecology -2020 (online).

About the meet-up: Analysing and visualising population trends and Spatial Mapping.

title: Using R and a Raspberry Pi to automate social media data collection
description:
We are pleased to invite you to our next meetup : Using R and a Raspberry Pi to automate social media data collection.

Date/Time : Saturday, February 20, 2021 from 6 PM to 7 PM (GMT+1)
Place : Zoom https://zoom.us/download

▶️ Invited speaker : Friedrike Preu
▶️ About Friedrike Preu :
Frie is a data4gooder, data scientist and IT person. Right now, she is working full-time for Data4Good network CorrelAid for which she has been volunteering since its beginnings in 2015. There, she is responsible for the coordination of the skilled-volunteering data science projects which are at the core of CorrelAid’s work. In addition, she organizes educational events and workshops.
Frie has a background in social science but transitioned to data science after her Bachelor’s degree and worked in IT consulting for two years. She loves to juggle and visualize data in R and likes to automate all kinds of things using her other programming skills.

Abstract :
Often when collecting data, we want to do so on a recurring basis. But how? Especially when starting out with (R) programming, this can be a complex challenge as sentences like "just set up a EC2 instance" are thrown at you without much context. In my talk, I will take you along my personal learning journey over the course of the past 3.5 years and three solution approaches: from a hacky R script on a Raspberry Pi (a mini computer) to a Python-solution in "the cloud" back to an improved R/Raspberry Pi version. In the process, I'll cycle back to fundamental tools/concepts like CRON that are central to automation.

In order to attend the event, please fill out this form 👉 https://tinyurl.com/y4rbgau2
We will send you the Zoom link and the enter passcode a few hours before the meetup. Please check out your email later.

Don't forget to add the meetup to your calendar so that you get a reminder about it.

We look forward to welcoming you!

If you have any questions, please don't hesitate to contact us ⬇️

▪️ Email : tunis@rladies.org
▪️ LinkedIn : https://tinyurl.com/y8hlt5np
▪️ Meetup : https://www.meetup.com/rladies-tunis/
▪️ Twitter : https://twitter.com/RLadiesTunis
▪️ Instagram : https://www.instagram.com/rladiestunis/
▪️ YouTube_Channel : https://tinyurl.com/ycm48c6w
▪️ Github : https://github.com/rladiestunis
▪️ Facebook : https://www.facebook.com/RLadiesTunis/

title: RStudio e suas funcionalidades
description:
Heey, tudo bem?

Estamos muito felizes com a sua participação.

Aproveite o curso. Aproveite essa oportunidade! Este evento foi pensado com muito carinho para você.

O que você vai aprender?

Os atalhos e as funcionalidades do layout do R serão abordados. Você vai aprender o que cada botãozinho do R faz e entender quando utilizar cada um deles.

Quais pacotes vão ser utilizados ?

library(tidyverse)

Sobre o Projeto Enigma

O projeto Enigma busca tornar visível o papel feminino na área da computação, resgatando as contribuições significativas de algumas mulheres de uma forma diferenciada, que provoque o pensamento do fruidor. Não pretende-se reproduzir as visibilidades que estas personagens já têm, mas fazer uma provocação, desacomodando o pensamento para que as invisibilidades, que ainda persistem, se tornem visíveis. As doações serão voltadas a reforma de artigos doados ao projeto como computadores, teclados e entre outros objetos do universo computacional.

Para saber mais sobre este projeto lindo acesse https://www.ufrgs.br/enigma/

E aí? Topa?

Link de inscrição: https://www.sympla.com.br/rstudio-e-suas-funcionalidades__1120390

Dúvidas frequentes:

CERTIFICADOS! - O certificado de 4h do evento será enviado para o seu e-mail. Caso você não receba ao final do evento, escreva para goiania@rladies.org.

MATERIAIS! - Os materiais utilizados no nosso curso (apresentação, scripts) serão disponibilizados através do nosso GitHub .

Dicas importantes para melhor aproveitamento do evento

(1°) Procure conectar o seu computador no cabo de rede, evitando instabilidades na transmissão;
(2°) Pré-configure a sua câmera e microfone antes de entrar no evento pois será útil para as interações com a professora em caso de dúvidas!
(3°) Prepare seu ambiente, aquela caneca de café, garrafa de água e os fones de ouvido, melhores companheiros para se concentrar e mergulhar de cabeça nessa experiência!
(4°) Não guarde esse conhecimento apenas para você, compartilhe com seus amigos e redes sociais marcando a gente no instagram @rladiesgyn.

Você faz parte desse compromisso

Lembre-se que o Código de Conduta também se estende à versão online de nossos eventos e não será tolerada qualquer forma de assédios ou intimidações de qualquer participante, seja audiência, palestrantes, colaboradores, ou quaisquer membros da comunidade.

A gente brilha TOGETHER!

title: ¡Expresiones regulares para la limpieza y transformación de datos!
description:
¡Hola!

Este viernes 19 de febrero realizaremos la segunda sesión del taller "Expresiones regulares para la limpieza y transformación de datos". El taller estará a cargo de Stephanie Orellana (https://twitter.com/sporella) y Riva Quiroga (https://twitter.com/rivaquiroga).

- SOBRE EL TALLER
Este taller tiene por objetivo que sus participantes se familiaricen con el uso de expresiones regulares (conocidas también como "regex"). Específicamente, abordaremos el potencial que tienen como parte del proceso de limpieza y transformación de datos usando paquetes del Tidyverse.
En esta segunda sesión, profundizaremos en los contenidos vistos en la primera sesión y además veremos cómo podemos utilizar expresiones regulares para limpiar un archivo PDF.

- REQUERIMIENTOS
Si no participaste en la primera parte del taller, te sugerimos revisar el video y los materiales, ya que los ejercicios que realizaremos son una continuación de lo visto en esa sesión: https://github.com/rladieschile/taller-regex-2021/blob/main/README.md
Para este taller es necesario tener una versión de R igual o superior a 3.6 y tener instalados RStudio y los paquetes {tidyverse}, {pdftools}, {janitor} y la versión en desarrollo de {datos}. Esta última se puede instalar desde GitHub con: remotes::install_github("cienciadedatos/datos").
El taller se dictará a través de la plataforma Zoom. Media hora antes del evento enviaremos la clave de acceso a la reunión.

- CÓDIGO DE CONDUCTA
Queremos que este sea un espacio de aprendizaje amable y seguro. Al inscribirte en este evento estás aceptando nuestro código de conducta: https://github.com/rladies/starter-kit/wiki/Code-of-Conduct#spanish

¡Te esperamos!

R-Ladies Talca

title: From learn-R to teach-R: An expert panel on effective R instruction
description:
DESCRIPTION:

This panel and discussion event will be focused on R instruction and education. As a learner, what are some recommended resources for developing my R skills? As an instructor, how can I make my materials and presentations more effective? What does data science education look like in 2021? What types of careers are out there in R education? How can I gain experience teaching R?

Our expert panelists will share their perspectives on R education.

Please note that the virtual meeting can support up to 100 attendees. While we won't cap the number of RSVPs, we encourage you to be on time to secure a spot. The meeting will be recorded.

AGENDA:

6.00-6.10pm: Arrivals
6.10-6.20pm: Introduction
6.20-6.50pm: Panel presentations
6.55-7.40pm: Discussion and Q&A

ABOUT OUR PANELISTS:

Ama Nyame-Mensah is a Postdoctoral Fellow and Research Associate in the School of Social Policy & Practice and the Graduate School of Education at the University of Pennsylvania. Her current work rethinks whether and how quantitative and computational methods can contribute to a more equitable understanding of marginalized children's and families' learning and development. Ama is passionate about empowering people to use data for social analysis and critique data and data technologies. When not working, Ama can be found tinkering with data and designing visualizations.
Website: www.anyamemensah.com

Cass Wilkinson Saldaña helps learners, researchers, and communities to engage meaningfully (and critically) with data. They currently work as a Data Instructional Specialist at the Children’s Hospital of Philadelphia’s Research Institute, and teach introduction to R courses at Yeshiva University. Previously, Cass worked as the Social Science and Geospatial Data Librarian at Cornell University.
As a data educator and data librarian, Cass participates and collaborates in open source ecosystems, especially in the domains of open science, digital scholarship, and civic data. They also strive to advocate for justice in worker and learner communities.
Website: https://cassws.net/

Silvia Canelón is a postdoctoral research scientist in biomedical informatics at the University of Pennsylvania in Philadelphia. She uses data science in the public and population health fields and is particularly interested in leveraging electronic health record data to study reproductive health outcomes. Silvia is formally trained as a biomedical engineer and an RStudio Certified Tidyverse Instructor. She loves community organizing and is passionate about R education as a way to help build power in her communities.
Website: https://silvia.rbind.io/

title: RLadies Bogotá: Agrupamiento de datos (Clustering)
description:
En esta sesión de RLadies hablaremos sobre agrupamiento de datos (clustering) que básicamente consiste en encontrar sub-grupos o patrones no tan evidentes en un conjunto de datos. Los métodos de agrupamiento son ampliamente usados en áreas como la medicina, el marketing, el análisis de redes, la psicología, entre otras.
La mayoría de los métodos convencionales de agrupamiento parten de una definición de distancia (o similitud) entre observaciones, pero ¿existe una única manera de comparar observaciones? ¿Cómo podemos elegir el método de agrupamiento más apropiado? ¿Cómo saber en cuántos grupos dividir nuestros datos?

En esta sesión abordaremos estas preguntas, mientras exploramos diferentes librerías en R que nos pueden iluminar el camino para encontrar las respuestas.

Prerrequisitos: Tener instalado RStudio y estas librerías: dplyr, ggplot2, NbClust, factoextra

Imparte: Diana Giraldo
Matemática y magíster en Ingeniería biomédica
Día: Jueves 18 de febrero de 5:30 a 7:30 pm

Link de inscripción para enviarles el link de zoom: https://docs.google.com/forms/d/1FgMZ5rBBGQkl1VLxZWkGbWm29-dpnFwpA4ShjaEbg5E/viewform?edit_requested=true

title: Introdução ao R - RLadies Belo Horizonte
description:
Inscrições em: https://www.sympla.com.br/introducao-ao-r---rladies-belo-horizonte__1129323

Objetivo do curso:

Ensinar a você os conceitos básicos do R, uma linguagem de programação popular para análise de dados.

NÍVEL DE HABILIDADE: INICIANTE

Como vai funcionar ?

Desta vez nosso curso está com um formato diferente. Nossas aulas estão gravadas no Youtube e vamos disponibilizar todos os dias um conteúdo e exercícios para o curso. Serão 5 dias com aulas de aproximadamente 40 minutos mais exercícios. No decorrer do curso vamos monitorar os comentários do Youtube para verificar dúvidas e no último dia, vamos fazer uma live para discuti-las. As instruções serão enviadas por e-mail juntamente com o link das aulas e os exercícios propostos.

O que você vai aprender neste curso?

• Introdução a Linguagem e ambiente de programação R
• Explorando o RStudio
• Definindo o diretório de Trabalho
• Primeiros passos na Linguagem R
• Instalando e carregando pacotes no R
• Como obter ajuda na Linguagem R
• Operadores Básicos, Relacionais e Lógicos
• Tipos de variáveis
• Vetores
• Matrizes
• Dataframes
• Listas
• Funções
• Loops

Este curso é para você?

Se você é mulher (cis ou trans) e quer aprender a programar, de forma simples e, principalmente, com uma facilitadora mulher, vem miga que este curso é para você <3

Precisa ter algum conhecimento prévio?

Não, o curso é para iniciantes, inclusive para quem nunca teve experiência com programação.

Vai ter certificado?

Vai sim, todo mundo que responder o formulário final terá direito a um certificado de 6h. O formulário será enviado ao final do curso.

Quem é a facilitadora?

Larissa Sayuri

Carga horária:
6 horas.

Quando?
17 até 24 de Fevereiro , de 19h às 20h00.

O curso é gratuito?
Sim.

Ficou alguma dúvida?
É só enviar para rladiesbh@gmail.com ;)

Programação:

Aula 1 ( 53 minutos) - 17/02
Vantagens e Desvantagens do R
Explorando R e RStudio
Instalando R e o RStudio

Aula 2 (40 minutos) - 18/02
Definindo diretório de trabalho no R
Instalando pacotes
Exercícios 1

Aula 3 (50 minutos) - 19/02
Operadores básicos
Explicação operadores lógicos
Tipos de variáveis
Exercícios 2
Respostas dos exercicios aula 1

Aula 4 (56 minutos) - 22/02
Vetores
Matrizes
Listas
Exercícios 3
Respostas dos exercicios aula 2

Aula 5 (30 minutos) - 23/02
Data frames
Funções e estruturas de condições
Loop
Desafio
Enceramento
Respostas dos exercicios aula 3

Live de dúvidas 1 hora e meia de duração - 24/02 - 19hs até as 20:30hs

title: [ONLINE] #tidytuesday Work Group
description:
Join fellow R-Ladies in exploring a #tidytuesday data set! For those craving human connection and some practice flexing your data science skills, this is the event for you! We will hold our event via Zoom, where you can meet other R-ladies, improve your R skills, and build your data science portfolio. This event is for people at all levels of R (beginner through advanced).

This month we will be analyzing data from the Kenya Census which is brought to us by Shelmith Kariuki, a co-organizer of NairobiR. https://github.com/rfordatascience/tidytuesday/blob/master/data/2021/2021-01-19/readme.md

Agenda:
7:00 - 7:15 pm Meet & Greet
7:15 - 8:30 pm #tidytuesday
8:30 - 9:00 pm Discussion

What is #tidytuesday?
#TidyTuesday is a weekly social data project created by the R4DS online learning community that is focused on using tidyverse packages. A new data set and accompanying article featuring an interesting plot is released on Github every Monday. The goal is to generate a copy of the original plot or create your own original approach!

For more information on #tidytuesday, check out this blog post: https://bit.ly/2HqEsdt

Who is this for?
New and experienced R users alike! Let's learn together! All are welcome, including R-Ladies RTP members and R-Ladies from around the world.

What should I bring?
You'll need a computer with videoconferencing capabilities and R. Serve yourself a cozy beverage and a snack to fuel your evening!

Where will it take place?
**Please join us online via Zoom.** A link to join will be provided when you RSVP.

All events are intended for women as leaders, mentors, members, and attendees. We are emphatically queer and trans friendly. Men are welcomed to attend *as guests* and must be accompanied by the R-Lady who invited them. This group was created so those who identify as women have a comfortable place to learn. If you would like to attend and feel excluded, please introduce yourself to an organizer.

title: {Part 2: Tidy data} From Zero to (s)Hero: Multi-part intro to R
description:
Just getting involved with R or want to level up your skills? Have you used base-R but are still trying to wrap your head around the tidyverse "pipe" (%>%)? Have a messy dataset and don't know where to start? Seen beautiful visualizations on Twitter and want to make your own?

If you’ve answered ‘yes’ to at least one of these questions, fear no more! In this monthly workshop series, we will walk you through the fundamental uses of tidyverse and ggplot at your own pace with the help of hands-on exercises. Tidyverse and ggplot are a classic combination of R packages that allow you to "wrangle" your unwieldy data into whatever shape you need and creative beautiful and informative visualizations.

Over the course of this series, you will learn the most useful features of R Studio and R Markdown, how to read in and explore data, and transform it into a shape that's easy to work with. You will be able to create new columns and summary tables, subset interesting rows or columns, and combine and reshape dataframes. We will also dive into ggplot, one of the best tools for creating great-looking bar charts, scatterplots, and more!

This is (currently) a five-part series, aimed at total beginners and/or people with some experience in base-R or tidyverse who are looking to freshen up or expand their skills. Feel free to join at any point, we will briefly review the previous topic at the beginning of each session.

January 20th {Part 1}: The R & R-Studio ABCs (packages, files, data types & basic data exploration)
Watch here: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=NO6ikdBxSwg&t=291s

February 17th {Part 2}: Tidy data & introduction to data wrangling (tibbles, renaming, reordering, subsetting)
March 17th {Part 3}: Data wrangling with dplyr (new columns, if-else statements, summary tables, joining dataframes)
April 21st {Part 4}: Introduction to visualizations with ggplot (line graphs, bar charts, scatterplots, histograms, and more!)
May 19th {Part 5}: Advanced topics in wrangling and ggplot (pivoting, ggplot style options, etc.)

Please install R and R-Studio before joining: https://rstudio-education.github.io/hopr/starting.html
AND if you're new to R, catch up on Session 1 with our recorded Meetup: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=NO6ikdBxSwg&t=291s

Image by the amazing @allison_horst: https://github.com/allisonhorst/stats-illustrations

title: The ABC of ABC
description:
In our February 2021 meetup we're joined by Isabella Deutsch. Bella is a PhD student in Statistics at the University of Edinburgh.

The ABC of ABC: Workflows and Challenges of Approximate Bayesian Computation

After a brief introduction to approximate Bayesian computation (ABC), we take a look at practical examples and discuss how to implement them. Special attention will be given to potential hurdles, illustrated through my current research on self-exciting point processes.

Password for the Zoom session will be sent out on the day of the event.

--

R-Ladies is a worldwide organization whose mission is to promote gender diversity in the R community.

A question we often get is "Are men welcome to attend this event?"

As a diversity initiative, the mission of R-Ladies is to achieve proportionate representation by encouraging, inspiring, and empowering people of genders currently underrepresented in the R community. R-Ladies’ primary focus, therefore, is on supporting minority gender R enthusiasts to achieve their programming potential, by building a collaborative global network of R leaders, mentors, learners, and developers to facilitate individual and collective progress worldwide.

**As such, we strongly encourage cis-men who attend this event to come as guests of R-Ladies who are minority genders (including but not limited to cis/trans women, trans men, non-binary, genderqueer, agender).**

All attendees are strongly encouraged to review the R-Ladies Code of Conduct (https://rladies.org/code-of-conduct) and must abide by it.

title: R-Ladies Bucharest #15: How to use Digital Analytics for tracking using R
description:
Happy new year, 2021! Speram mai bogat în întâlniri offline!

Până atunci, pentru februarie avem pregatită o temă pe digital analytics!

How to use Digital Analytics for tracking using R, speaker Simona Grădinaru, R blogger http://thescienceofdating.rbind.io/ și Data Scientist.

Organizatorice 🙂. Ca de obicei, înregistrarea este gratuită, dar obligatorie prin meetup. Evenimentul va fi găzduit pe platforma zoom, iar link-ul de access va fi încărcat în ziua evenimentului ( urmat de o notificare pe email cu PIN-ul de intrare cu ~ 2h inaintea inceperii evenimentului).
